Title: Mud House Chilean Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Central Valley
Description: This label might look familiar, as Mud House are behind one of our most-popular Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs. Title: Bouvet Ladubay Saumur RosÃ© Brut

Title: RosÃ© Classics 6 Bottle Wine Case

Title: Chosen by Majestic Picpoul de Pinet 2022

Title: ChÃ¢teau MÃ©aume Bordeaux SupÃ©rieur 2019/20

Title: Maison Alexandre Gauvin Gevrey-Chambertin 2017/19

It's a must-try wine for anyone curious about just how good Pinot Noir can get. Itâ€™s intensely fruity with flavours of black cherry, blackberry and notes of liquorice and leather. Title: Definition White Burgundy 2021/22
Description:

Title: Domaine la Troupe â€˜CuvÃ©e Marieâ€™ VirÃ©-ClessÃ© 2020/21

Title: Primo Rosso Appassimento 2021/22, Puglia

Itâ€™s made using the appassimento method, which has been a distinctly northern Italian style of winemaking for centuries. Primoâ€™s winemaker, Alessandro Michelon, was the first outside of Veneto to adopt the method. This stops them from ripening further and allows them to dry in the wind, resulting in a concentrated and complex wine. Just like a Valpolicella, itâ€™s big, plush and velvety, with ripe flavours of cherry, raspberry and redcurrant. A rich, meaty stew makes the perfect partner to its bold, fruity character.

Title: Capaia One 2019/20, Tygerberg
Description: The Capaia estate lies in the village of Philadelphia, part of the Tygerberg district, just a short distance north of Cape Town. Here, vineyards bask in a suntrap under the shelter of the Koeberg hills. Itâ€™s made with just as much precision as the best Bordeaux chÃ¢teaux. Grapes from each vineyard are fermented separately in oak barrels before being blended. You'll find it robust yet balanced, with flavours of blackberry, plum and mocha. Its firm tannins and a hint of smoke make it an excellent match for hearty game dishes.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Merlot

Title: Barista Pinotage 2021/22, Western Cape

Heâ€™s nicknamed â€˜Starbucksâ€™ for his exceptional skill in drawing out the coffee-like aromas of South Africa's signature grape. And it shows here. Title: Men in White Coats Viognier 2022, Western Cape
Description: The Gabb family were instrumental in putting South Africa on the wine map. Rollo Gabb believes in low intervention winemaking, treating his workers well and supporting the community. Everything else is focussed on making fantastic wine. And you'll find the benefits in this Viognier. This is an elegant, fragrant Viognier, with notes of apricot and white peach. Try this with Thai green curry.

Title: Definition Viognier 2020/21, Languedoc
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. And when it came to finding a Viognier worthy of the label, there was only one producer we wanted to work with. Languedoc producer Abbotts & Delaunay were thrilled to find the perfect fruit to make this wine truly the Definition of great Viognier. Several months of lees-ageing adds body, texture and moreish creaminess. It's classically fresh and aromatic, with lush notes of white peach, apple and delicate almond. The ripe-fruit flavours make this a delicious choice for spicy dishes.

Title: Alluria Organic Pinot Grigio 2021/22, Sicily
Description: Pinot Grigio only came to Sicily in the past couple of decades. Itâ€™s usually thought of as a northern Italian grape â€“ but itâ€™s taken to its new island home like a duck to water. This organic Pinot Grigio was lovingly made by Frederico â€˜Fedeâ€™ Stella â€“ a gentle giant who knows how to coax the very best from his grapes. The grapes come from twenty-five-year-old vines, and each and every one is handpicked in the cool of dawn to make sure as many of the aromatics are preserved as possible. All that work pays off. Itâ€™s a deliciously crisp wine, full of citrusy zing. But thanks to Sicilyâ€™s warm climate, it also has riper, peachy flavours and fragrant, herby aromas. Delicious with freshly caught seafood.

Title: Pringle Bay Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Western Cape
Description:
Winemakers Duncan Savage and Thys Louw are Sauvignon specialists with the toolkit to rival the freshest Marlborough Sauvignon. They source most of their grapes from coastal vineyards in the Western Cape that are cooled by Atlantic breezes, helping grapes develop crisp and herbaceous aromas. The rest come from Paardeberg, an area renowned for producing wines with delicious tropical-fruit flavours. The result? A perfect balance of freshness and fruitiness. It's wonderfully vibrant with notes of pineapple, passionfruit and grapefruit and a long, refreshing finish. A perfect wine to enjoy with Friday night fish and chips.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Gooseberry, Grapefruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Tropical Fruit

Title: Taittinger Prestige Brut RosÃ© Champagne
Description:
The first time Pierre Taittinger visited Champagne was as an injured officer during WWI. He promised himself that he would return and buy an estate for his family. In 1932 he did just that. And the rest is history. The winemaking team certainly doesn't cut corners when it comes to their pink fizz. This blend contains a small amount of the finest Pinot Noir, which creates its unmistakable deep pink colour. Lively, fresh and full of raspberry, cherry and blackcurrant flavours.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Bouvet Ladubay 'Blanc de Blancs' CrÃ©mant de Loire 2020/21
Description: Throughout its 169 years of history, Bouvet has been endorsed by Napoleon III and chosen as official supplier to the House of Lords. This, its 100% Chardonnay vintage fizz, rivals some of the finest French fizz. You'll find delightful hints of pear, apple and white flowers in a refined mousse. Possibly the best value sparkling wine you'll find.

Title: Brio de Cantenac Brown 2015, Margaux

From a vintage with ideal conditions, this is a balance between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with a small amount of Cabernet Franc â€“ designed to be enjoyed earlier than their top wine. Expect smooth tannins and a fresh acidity, with ripe red-fruit flavours and spicy hints â€“ ideal with roast meats.

Title: GÃ©rard Bertrand 'CÃ´te des Roses' RosÃ© 2021/22, Languedoc

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award

Title: AimÃ© Arnoux CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne Blanc 2022

Title: ViÃ±alba 'Gran Reservado' Malbec 2019/20, Mendoza

We think this wine is a fitting tribute. It's a rich Cabernet-dominated blend, with a dash of Petit Verdot and Syrah for good measure. Title: Yalumba Y Series Viognier 2021/22, Australia

Louisa Rose is one of Australia's most respected winemakers, and she's been chief winemaker here for more than 20 years. She certainly knows a thing or two about the Viognier grape. Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Apricot, Ginger, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Honey, Melon, Peach, Pear, Pineapple

Title: ChÃ¢teau Coufran Cru Bourgeois SupÃ©rieur 2007, Haut-MÃ©doc

Youâ€™ll find it rich and opulent with flavours of cherry, plum and red berries, plus notes of cedar and forest floor. Its smooth, velvety texture and firm tannins make it an ideal pairing for roasted red meats or hard cheeses.

Title: Boekenhoutskloof â€˜The Wolftrapâ€™ Shiraz 2021, South Africa
Description: Love big, bold reds? Then youâ€™ve likely heard of The Chocolate Block â€“ an iconic fine wine known the world over. Boekenhoutskloof is the brilliant winery behind it, and their â€˜Wolftrapâ€™ range is another fantastic way to enjoy their talents â€“ at a wallet-friendly price. Their Shiraz vines thrive in the Mediterranean climate of the Cape Winelands. Here, warm and dry growing conditions lend themselves to a distinctive style of Shiraz with bright fruit flavours. Expect intense aromas of rich dark fruit and savoury notes of spice and black pepper. Its velvety fruit character is balanced by a vibrant acidity. Best enjoyed with roasted or barbecued dishes.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Cranberry, Savoury, Spice

Title: Chronic Cellars 'Purple Paradise' 2019/20, Paso Robles
Description: Jake and Josh Beckett grew up in Paso Robles wine country. So it was no coincidence that the pair would found Chronic Cellars together back in 2004. â€˜Chronicâ€™ is the brothersâ€™ shorthand for â€˜awesomeâ€™, as, with thanks to their close contacts with the best grape growers, these wines are made from the finest grapes. It certainly shows in this Zinfandel-based blend which really does taste â€˜purpleâ€™. Rich. Ripe. Bold. Itâ€™s full of plum, black fruit, lush vanilla and chocolate spice. Soft and approachable â€“ it's the perfect wine to share with friends over barbecue pulled pork.

Title: Bruce Jack Wines Reserve Collection â€˜Stream of Consciousnessâ€™ 2021, Western Cape
Description: Bruce Jack is one of the biggest names in South African wine. Named amongst the 50 Most Admired Wine Brands in the World by Drinks International Magazine, his Western Cape winery embodies all thatâ€™s great about the country, bringing quality and value together to create internationally celebrated wines. His Reserve Collection consists of premium, small volume wines using hand-picked fruit from carefully managed vineyards. And this bold blend of Cinsault, Shiraz and Grenache is testimony to the effort and hard work which goes into each and every bottle. Expect spicy, rich aromas â€“ notes of vanilla, Indian spices and white pepper â€“ with flavours of plum and red forest fruits. Match its bold flavour with rich pasta dishes.
Characteristics: Chocolate, Forest Floor, Red Plum, Spice, White Pepper

Title: Feudi di San Gregorio Greco di Tufo DOCG 2021/22
Description: Feudi di San Gregorio was founded in 1986, after a devastating earthquake destroyed much of the local area. Itâ€™s since become a beacon for the wine renaissance of Southern Italy. Greco di Tufo is one of the regionâ€™s most prestigious white wines where it thrives on volcanic soils, developing a delicious minerality. During the winemaking, the wine is left to rest on the spent yeast cells, or lees, for eight months to add extra texture. Expect an elegant, bright and citrusy wine with hints of almond. Its ripe flavours and freshness make it an excellent pairing for a simple spaghetti alle vongole.
Characteristics: Grapefruit, Honey, Lemon, Peach, Red Apple

Title: Les Grandes Serres â€˜Hommage du RhÃ´neâ€™ ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape 2022
Description: ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape is widely regarded as the king of RhÃ´ne wines. And as Les Grandes Serres are Southern RhÃ´ne specialists, you can be sure that they know the celebrated style inside out. This complex and silky red combines four traditional grape varieties which are each fermented separately to preserve their individual characteristics, before being expertly blended. The wine is then partially aged in oak for up to 18 months, giving it a smooth texture and soft, supple tannins. Expect sumptuous flavours of black fruits, red cherry, wild herbs, sweet spice and peppery hints. Its elegant, savoury character makes it an ideal match for roasted red meats.

Title: Les Caveau du PrieurÃ© Vinsobres 2020
Description: Founded in 1967, U.V.C.D.R, or Union of Winemakers of CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne, is a collaboration of over 2000 vignerons who have been making wine for several generations. Today itâ€™s the largest producer in the southern RhÃ´ne with over 12,000 hectares covering all the crus and villages. And they not only make great wines â€“ they ensure that care and attention goes back into the vineyards. With approximately 10% of their vineyards certified as organic, itâ€™s one of the largest organic producers in France. Vinsobres was classified as CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne Villages before it was upgraded to cru status in 2006. Itâ€™s the most northerly of the Southern RhÃ´ne crus and its slightly higher latitude combined with the effects of the famous mistral wind ensures its wines have great freshness and acidity. And this wine is a case in point. Itâ€™s proof that you can find delicious wine that delivers flavour far beyond its price tag â€“ if you know where to look. Expect concentrated notes of red and black fruits with hints of vanilla and spice. Enjoy its balance of savoury and fruity flavours with grilled lamb chops for an ideal pairing.

Title: Alain Jaume â€˜Les Champauvinsâ€™ Organic CÃ´tes Du RhÃ´ne 2020
Description: The Jaume family have been producing distinctive wines in the RhÃ´ne Valley since 1826. And you can taste their expertise in this bold and fruity red. Itâ€™s sourced from a vineyard just a stone's throw from the northern edge of ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape. Here, gnarled vines grow on sunbaked pebbles, sharing near-identical growing conditions to its iconic neighbour. Awarded an impressive 92 points by wine critic James Suckling, this is your chance to pick up an outstanding RhÃ´ne blend for less. Its full body and soft tannins will complement the rich flavours of red meats, truffles or mushrooms.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Black Pepper, Blackcurrant, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Errazuriz Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Casablanca Valley
Description: Errazuriz was founded back in 1870 by Don Maximiano ErrÃ¡zuriz. From the start, theyâ€™ve been dedicated to excellence and innovation â€“ values that are still at their core today. The team are constantly improving their winemaking techniques, and theyâ€™re exploring new appellations in the Aconcagua Valley, one of Chileâ€™s best-known wine regions. This Sauvignon is made with grapes from Aconcagua Costa, where cool Pacific Ocean breezes help retain high levels of refreshing acidity and keep the flavours crisp and bright. Discover notes of green apple, gooseberry, pineapple and fresh-cut grass that pair perfectly with fish dishes like trout or salmon.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Grass, Green Apple

Title: Langlois-Chateau 'Classique' CrÃ©mant de Loire Brut RosÃ©
Description: Founded in 1887 and now owned by the prestigious Bollinger family of Champagne, Langlois-Chateau is one of the most established names in CrÃ©mant de Loire. And this, a traditional method rosÃ© fizz, shows off just what they can do with Cabernet Franc. Handpicked in small batches from chalky-clay soils, the grapes are gently pressed then aged for a minimum of 18 months on lees once in bottle. A sip reveals fine bubbles, a full body and generous raspberry and blackcurrant flavours.

Title: DomÃ¤ne Wachau 'WeingÃ¤rten Weissenkirchen' GrÃ¼ner Veltliner Federspiel 2021/22, Wachau
Description: The Wachau region of Austria comprises of a 33 kilometer long gorge overlooking the Danube river. Produced from vines grown around the Weissenkirchen parish including the hamlets of Joching and WÃ¶sendorf. GrÃ¼ner Veltliner is an aromatic variety primarily from Austria. The colour of fresh straw, an alluring nose of gooseberries with a hint of green apple and flowers. Well balanced acidity and citrus fruits leading to a spicy, lively wine of minerality and elegance. Drinkable at any time over the next six years. An excellent accompaniment for prosciutto, seared scallops or bisques.

Title: Remy Ferbras Gigondas 2020/21
Description: Les Grandes Serres winery specialises in wines from the picturesque Southern RhÃ´ne Valley, particularly ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape, Gigondas and Vacqueyas. With a new and enthusiastic team, modern cellars and careful maturation practises, Les Grandes Serres make internationally renowned wines that showcase the best of the region. Often seen as the second-most famous RhÃ´ne cru behind ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape, Gigondas is known for producing wines with an excellent balance of concentrated fruit flavours and elegant character. More wallet-friendly than its well-known neighbour, itâ€™s the ideal wine for lovers of rich, bold reds. Expect concentrated flavours of red and black fruits with a long finish. Its notes of garrigue herbs and spice make it a great pairing for roast lamb.

Title: Les Saules Vacqueyras 2021
Description: Love ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape but want something a bit more wallet-friendly? Vacqueyras is where to look. The region used to be one of the CÃ´tes du RhÃ´nes Villages, but the consistently high quality of its elegant red blends saw it gain Cru status in 1990. These wines are classically bold, rich and peppery â€“ and youâ€™ll find all of those qualities in this exclusive bottling. Itâ€™s made by the Union des Vignerons des CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne, the largest cooperative in the Southern RhÃ´ne, who are dedicated to sustainability. Discover jammy black-fruit flavours and spicy notes, with smooth, supple tannins that pair perfectly with hard cheeses or roasted poultry.

Title: Boekenhoutskloof â€˜The Wolftrapâ€™ Grenache Blanc 2022, South Africa
Description: Boekenhoutskloof are the winery behind the world-famous fine wine, The Chocolate Block. Their â€˜Wolftrapâ€™ range is another way to enjoy their talents â€“ at a wallet-friendly price. And this expressive white is proof that their skill stretches beyond big, bold reds. Bright aromas of apple and lemon are followed by vibrant flavours of gooseberry, white peach and subtle spices. Best paired with aromatic dishes such as chicken tagine.
Characteristics: Gooseberry, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Spice

Title: Moillard-Thomas Bourgogne AligotÃ© 2022
Description: Moillard-Thomas is one of the oldest wine merchants originating from Burgundyâ€™s Nuits-Saint-Georges. They have generations of winemaking heritage and extensive knowledge of the best vineyards across the region. AligotÃ© is a delicious, but often overlooked, grape thatâ€™s slowly making a resurgence â€“ and Moillard-Thomas are the ideal producer to showcase just why itâ€™s so special. When itâ€™s in the right hands, it produces bright, lively and characterful wines â€“ a must-try wine for lovers of French whites. Expect floral notes of and a refreshing flavours of ripe citrus fruits. Its fresh flavours and crisp acidity makes it a great pairing for seafood dishes.

Title: Three Choirs Stonebrook 2020/21, Gloucestershire
Description: Soft, fruity and aromatic with expressive hints of lychee and grapefruit this delicate and refreshing English wine makes an ideal accompaniment to lightly spiced dishes. Lots of floral orange blossom, rose and elderflower, supported by some zingy grapefruit and lime with softer peach and lychee tones. There is a touch of white pepper, and this wine is ever so slightly off-dry. Matches nicely with a sweeter curry or summer salad.

Title: Herdade de Gambia 2021/22, Portugal
Description: The grapes for Herdade de GÃ¢mbia have been plucked from vines near Portugal's Sado river, just south of Lisboa. The vines are a magnificent backdrop to one of Portugal's most well-protected wildlife reserves. The wine is delicious proof that a harmonious ecosystem contributes to flavour-packed grapes and flourishing vines. Each sip of Herdade de GÃ¢mbia ripples with intense notes of plum, dark cherry and subtle spice.

Title: Pegasus Bay 'Main Divide' Riesling 2019/20, Canterbury
Description: This wine is named in honour of New Zealand's Southern Alps, known locally as the Main Divide. This striking landscape is where Pegasus Bay's vines call home. They're blessed by excellent soil quality and sea breezes from the Pacific. This Riesling is slightly off-dry in style. It has notes of honeysuckle, ripe apricot and lime, with a mineral undercurrent and zippy acidity. Some grapes affected by botrytis were added to provide a honeyed richness. Try it with duck.

Title: Clos de Luz 'Arao' CarmÃ©nÃ¨re Red Blend 2018/19, Chile
Description: Gabriel Edwards' grandmother planted CarmÃ©nÃ¨re vines in 1945. His grandparents sold the delicious grapes to top wineries for years. That's until Gabriel returned from Burgundy determined to make his own fantastic Chilean wine. With the help of the rest of his family, he's smashed the target since. Gabriel's winemaking practices are a real rebuttal to what you might expect from Chilean wine. His minimal intervention winemaking gives the wine amazing aromatic intensity and freshness. Containing a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this is so much more than just a big, oaky red blend. It has notes of plum, blueberry, cherry, liquorice and chocolate that partner mushroom ravioli perfectly.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Plum, Blackberry, Chocolate, Green Bell Pepper, Spice

Title: Waimea Estates AlbariÃ±o 2021/22, Nelson
Description: The Waimea takes best of Spanish AlbariÃ±o and adds an extra level of New Zealand exuberance. Lifted aromas of white peach, orange blossom and ocean spray spill from the glass. They are matched by fresh, vibrant acidity with ripe stone fruit and citrus peel before a chalky minerality at the finish.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Peach, Stone Fruit

Title: Stag's Leap 'Hands of Time' Chardonnay 2019/20, Napa Valley
Description: Stagâ€™s Leap shocked the world and beat the finest Bordeaux in the legendary Judgment of Paris in 1976. Ever since, theirs have become some of the most collected wines in the world. The Hands of Time is your chance to taste what all the fuss is about at a smaller sum. This is a medium-bodied, soft Chardonnay with hints of pear, pineapple, orange blossom, and a touch of oak on the finish. Itâ€™s exceptional with buttery pasta.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Stone Fruit

Title: Nyetimber 'CuvÃ©e ChÃ©rie' Demi-Sec, Sussex
Description: This superb sparkling wine is the first of its kind: a truly English interpretation of the classic off-dry Champagne style. Made in small quantities from Nyetimber's 100% estate-grown Chardonnay, bottled with extra dosage. Treading a fine tightrope between sweetness and freshness, this wine is at once crisp, citric, elegant, refreshing and satisfyingly rich, with heady brioche aromas perfectly complementing the palate. A great aperitif or accompaniment for light desserts, this is perfect for either end of a fine dining experience.

Title: Piccini Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2018
Description: Piccini are one of Italyâ€™s most dynamic and innovative producers. Now in their fourth generation of family ownership, they have over 140 years of expertise behind them. Their roots lie in Tuscany â€“ and today theyâ€™re considered one of the regionâ€™s leading wineries. So you can expect great things from this. A Tuscan icon, Brunello di Montalcino is one of the finest expressions of the Sangiovese grape, famed for its bold, complex and full-bodied character. Piccini capture all those qualities here â€“ and the stunning 2018 vintage won them a gold medal at The Drinks Business's 2023 Global Sangiovese Masters awards. Discover intense flavours of black cherry, blueberry, spice and liquorice, with silk-smooth tannins and a long, elegant finish. Its excellent structure makes it a fantastic pairing for rich game meats or mature cheeses.

Title: Torre Mora â€˜Cauruâ€™ Etna Rosso DOC 2020/21
Description: Mount Etna is an iconic feature of the Sicilian landscape. Itâ€™s one of the worldâ€™s most active volcanoes and has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2013. Discover vibrant notes of raspberry and violet, with jammy cherry flavours and fine, silky tannins. You can also expect a distinct savoury character that makes this an ideal accompaniment to richer poultry, mushroom-based dishes and mature cheeses.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Date, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Violet, Pomegranate

Title: Chosen By Majestic Rioja Crianza 2020
Description: We sent our award-winning buying team all around the world on an exciting new mission: to curate a new collection showcasing the best examples of key regions and core grape varietals â€“ at great prices. From a winery founded in 1985, this wine is made from grapes grown in the clay-rich soils of Rioja Alta and the limestone-clay soils of Rioja Alavesa. The average age of the vines here is over 30 years â€“ and this results in a concentrated and complex wine that over delivers on flavour. Aged in American oak casks for 12-16 months, this is smooth, fruity, and a must-try bottle for any Rioja fan. Expect flavours of red fruits and oaky notes with hints of vanilla. Itâ€™s soft and supple, and an ideal, easy-drinking pairing for grilled meats or cheese boards.

Title: Domaine Jean-Max Roger â€˜CuvÃ©e GenÃ¨seâ€™ Sancerre RosÃ© 2022
Description: Winemaking has been in the Roger family for generations â€“ as far back as the 17th century. Based in BuÃ©, one of Sancerreâ€™s most renowned villages, theyâ€™re dedicated to crafting wines that fully express the unique terroir of the region. This rosÃ© is made with Pinot Noir grapes from the estateâ€™s sustainably managed vineyards. Winemaker Thibault Roger ferments it at low temperatures to preserve the delicate floral aromas, and a period of lees ageing adds texture and subtle complexity. Youâ€™ll find it fresh and delicate with vibrant red-berry notes. Its long, elegant finish will match beautifully with light fish dishes like sushi or sashimi.

Title: Villa Maria 'Cellar Selection' Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description:
It took a lot of guts back in 1962, when George Fistonich â€“ now Sir George â€“ told his father he was quitting carpentry to try his hand at making wine. But his gamble paid off. His estate is now not just a household name, but New Zealandâ€™s most-awarded winery. Georgeâ€™s Cellar Selection is a delicious step up from the ever popular Private Bin. In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Grapefruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

Title: Cave de Lugny 'Les Pierres Blanches' MÃ¢con-Villages 2021/22
Description: Cave de Lugny are true specialists. Theyâ€™re the biggest Chardonnay producer in Burgundy, but they donâ€™t rest on their laurels. Their mission is to make standout white Burgundy which is affordable and delicious. This is made using grapes from 30-year-old vines. Older vines produce more intensely-flavoured grapes and the team dial up this fruitiness by leaving it unoaked. Itâ€™s fruity, juicy and refreshing â€“ think citrus, green melon and a touch of honey. The wine spends some time resting on its lees, which gives the texture a delicious creaminess. Itâ€™s fantastic with roast chicken.

Title: Graham Beck Brut RosÃ©, South Africa
Description: Since being founded in 1983, Graham Beck winery has won countless awards for producing some of South Africaâ€™s finest sparkling wines â€“ some of which have been sipped by the likes of Nelson Mandela and Barack Obama. This Brut RosÃ© is made using the same laborious method as Champagne. But because it's from South Africa, you pay a fraction of the price. Elegant. Fruity. Fresh. Expect creamy red-fruit aromas, a rich mousse and a brioche-laden finish.

Title: Tutiac 'Lion & The Lily' RosÃ© 2021/22, Bordeaux
Description: Thereâ€™s more to Bordeaux than claret. If you like refreshing, fruity and aromatic rosÃ©, it pays to try something different here. This is made purely from Merlot grapes with a unique approach by the biggest rosÃ© producer in the region. It really sets the bar for Bordeaux pink. Title: Nero Oro Riserva 2018/19, Sicily

Title: Catena Malbec 2020/21, Mendoza
Description: NicolÃ¡s Catena was the first South American winemaker to ever be named â€˜Decanterâ€™s Man of the Yearâ€™. No wonder when he pioneered high-altitude Malbec in the Argentine Andes. Before that, Argentina was only seen as a producer of cheap bulk wine. The Catenaâ€™s changed all that. NicolÃ¡sâ€™ great-grandfather, Nicola, planted his first Malbec vines in 1902. Since then, the family have amassed a collection of Malbec varietals which are exclusive to them. It makes the Catenaâ€™s wines completely distinct from other Argentine Malbecs. Bold. Ripe. Fruity. Itâ€™s a big wine with lots of flavour â€“ and a lovely plush texture. Itâ€™s crying out for grilled meats â€“ think barbecued steak with a punchy chimichurri sauce. Delicious.

Title: La Belle AngÃ¨le RosÃ© 2021/22, France
Description: La Belle AngÃ¨le is Provence-style rosÃ© at a snip of the usual asking price. Expect bursts of of stone fruit, raspberry, strawberry and aromas of white flowers.

Title: Haut Vol RosÃ© 2021/22, France
Description: Haut Vol translates to 'top flight' in French. And if you ever get to visit their vineyards, you'll see why. Their grapes are grown on a hilly Languedoc vineyard, where they benefit from plenty of sunlight and cool Mediterranean breezes. It's a blend of Grenache and Carignan, two grapes that flourish in this type of climate. Expect light and fruity notes of strawberry and raspberry. These fresh flavours would pair with something equally vibrant, like a green salad.

Title: Vieux ChÃ¢teau Landon 2012, MÃ©doc
Description: Founded in 1607, Vieux ChÃ¢teau Landon has belonged to numerous generations of winegrowers over the centuries. The winemaking team, led by the talented James Servat, uses traditional Bordeaux grape varieties to craft their elegant wines. You'll find it smooth and aromatic with complex notes of ripe red fruits, woody spice and leather. The high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives the wine an excellent structure, making it an ideal pairing for red meats or hard cheeses.

Title: Pasqua '11 Minutes' RosÃ© 2021/22, Veneto
Description: This complex Italian rosÃ© first hit our shelves in small, limited supply. Our customers loved it so much, we soon went back for more. Itâ€™s made by Pasqua, a historic family-run winery who are behind some of our best-selling bottles. So you can be sure youâ€™re in for something delicious. Itâ€™s made from Corvina, Trebbiano, Syrah and CarmÃ©nÃ¨re grapes, which all thrive in Pasquaâ€™s beautiful Veneto-based vineyards. Its name comes from the length of time the juice is left on the grape skins â€“ exactly 11 minutes, the perfect amount of time to give the wine its delicate rosy colour. It's elegant and subtly spicy, with plenty of red-fruit flavours. Transport yourself to Italy by pairing it with baked white fish, olives and tomatoes.

Title: Nals Margreid 'Stella Alpina' Pinot Grigio 2021/22, Alto Adige DOC
Description: Alto Adige is in the far North of Italy, with vineyards lining either side of the valley formed by the River Adige. The reputation for quality, particularly from its aromatic white wine, is typified by this high end Pinot Grigio from one of the region's better producers. This is in a different league to entry-level Italian Pinot Grigio, balancing a rich, pure palate of peach, melon and pear fruit with the crispest of finishes. This wine will marry well with fresh tomato salads and seafood dishes such as grilled sea bass or barbecued king prawns.

Title: ViÃ±a Pomal Rioja Reserva 2015/16
Description: ViÃ±a Pomal began in Haro, Rioja, in 1904. In its rich history, it's built a long list of admirers, and it was reportedly the choice bodega of Winston Churchill. Today, it continues with its innovative ways, and this Reserva wows the critics seemingly with every vintage. It has flavours of red fruits and toasty oak. Try it with red meat and grilled vegetables.

Title: Tommasi 'Le Fornaci' RosÃ© 2021/22, Lugana DOC
Description: Family-owned Tommasi has significant vineyard holdings in Valpolicella Classico but also in Lugana, on the shores of Lake Garda. This rosÃ©, a blend of gently pressed Turbiana and Rondinella grapes, hails from the latter.
