The flavour is equally vibrant, with a fresh, citrussy acidity and a persistent finish. Try it as an aperitif with canapes or (what else?) a pizza.

Title: Wynns Coonawarra Estate Shiraz 2020/21, Coonawarra
Description: Coonawarra's cool climate and famous terra rossa soils are now rightfully celebrated the world over. This region's reds are seen amongst Australia's greatest. Much of this is down to Samuel Wynn and his son, David, who bought an almost desolate vineyard in 1951 with no expectations of making a profit. Today, the Wynns Coonawarra Estate label is one of the most recognisable in Australia. This Shiraz has upheld the great reputation for more than half a century. Bright. Fresh. Silky. It's medium-bodied, with juicy notes of red fruits, blackberry and spicy black pepper. Try it with beef or veggie dumplings and a spiced yoghurt dressing.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Cloves, Sweet Spice, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: ChÃ¢teau d'Esclans 'Rock Angel' RosÃ© 2020/21, CÃ´tes de Provence
Description: If you enjoy Provence rosÃ©, you've almost certainly heard of Whispering Angel, which is the star of social-media feeds through the summer. This is the next step up, made by the same winery and winemaker. It's more structured, complex and rich, thanks to some oak influence. It has a full body and flavours of roses, strawberry, raspberry and nectarine. Expect a fine minerality which pairs beautifully with shellfish.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Cream, Floral, Grapefruit, Herbaceous, Peach, Raspberry

Title: Vergelegen â€˜Mill Raceâ€™ Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Stellenbosch
Description: Vergelegen Estate is the third-oldest wine producing estate in South Africa. Established in 1700, this heritage estate is known for crafting wines of exceptional quality. Grapes are meticulously picked by hand and crafted in their innovative gravity-flow winery. They're all about purity of fruit, and youâ€™ll certainly taste it in this elegant bottle. Expect vibrant flavours of guava, passionfruit lime blossom and quince.
Characteristics: Blossom, Gooseberry, Lime, Passionfruit, Quince, White Pepper

Title: Vergelegen â€˜Mill Raceâ€™ Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot 2019, Stellenbosch
Description: Vergelegen Estate is the third-oldest wine producing estate in South Africa. Established in 1700, this heritage estate is known for crafting wines of exceptional quality. Grapes are meticulously picked by hand and crafted in their innovative gravity-flow winery. This Bordeaux-style blend spends 18 months in oak before it's released, developing complex flavours and softening tannins. Discover rich notes of ripe red fruits, cassis and cedar.
Characteristics: Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Spice

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Pennautier RosÃ© 2021/22, CabardÃ¨s
Description: ChÃ¢teau de Pennautier sits just six kilometres away from the 13th-century fortress town of Carcassonne and itâ€™s the oldest winemaking estate in the Languedoc. Itâ€™s still family-run and is now in the expert hands of the tenth-generation. Since they know their high-altitude terrain inside out, this delicious rosÃ© is the first point of call in discovering full-flavoured wines from CabardÃ¨s. It's a rich and juicy Merlot blend. Notes of raspberry, strawberry and citrus are followed by a fresh hint of liquorice. Try it with goat's cheese tartlets.

Title: Pasqua 'Y by 11 Minutes' RosÃ© 2020, Italy
Description: Pasqua are behind a number of our best-selling wines. We stocked their '11 Minutes' rosÃ© a few years ago, and it was immensely popular with Majestic customers. They've just made it even better. So it was a no-brainer for our rosÃ© buyer, to pick this up. It's made from Corvina, Trebbiano and CarmÃ©nÃ¨re grapes and partially fermented in oak. Sounds familiar? Not to many. But this is a recipe for something remarkably complex, fresh, structured and elegant. Try its flavours of red fruits, citrus and vanilla with grilled fish.

Title: Langlois-Chateau 'L'Extra par Langlois' Brut RosÃ© CrÃ©mant de Loire
Description: CrÃ©mant is the top choice for savvy  sparkling wine lovers. It's cheaper but no less delicious. Made using the laborious traditional method, Langlois have spent over 100 years perfecting it. As a result, they're known throughout France for producing outstanding crÃ©mant. Their excellence certainly shows in this delightful pink fizz that's made from Cabernet Franc and Grolleau. Expect bright and fresh red fruit flavours with a fine mousse. Delicious with raspberry tart.

Title: Graham Beck Pinot Noir RosÃ© 2017/18, Robertson
Description: Graham Beck is the biggest name in South African sparkling wine. They've produced excellent bubbles since the 1980s, using the second-fermentation 'traditional method' â€“ known here as MÃ©thode Cap Classique â€“ and won countless awards in doing so. This vintage pink sparkling is made from Pinot Noir and Chardonnay grapes. It has an elegant, creamy mousse and flavours of ripe strawberry and raspberry. Try pairing it with smoked salmon canapÃ©s or a red-fruit-based dessert.

Title: The Ned RosÃ© 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Brent Marris spent his youth exploring the area surrounding The Ned mountain, one of Marlboroughâ€™s most famous peaks. It sits in the Waihopai Valley, and, knowing the land inside out, itâ€™s here Brent founded his winery, Marisco Vineyards. This delicious rosÃ© follows in the footsteps of the multi-award winning Sauvignon Blanc â€“ our bestselling white wine. A blend of Pinot Gris and Pinot Noir, grapes are pressed gently to ensure a light colour and an elegant, refreshing sip. It's creamy yet remarkably crisp, with notes of rosewater, ripe summer fruits and citrus. Enjoy it with barbecued fish in a chilli and lime dressing.

Title: Les Hauts de Castelmaure CorbiÃ¨res RosÃ© 2022
Description: The Castelmaure winery was founded in a two thousand-year-old Roman hamlet of the same name. Since 1921, local, quality winegrowers have contributed to its success and today, the cellar is considered the heart of the village. Their CorbiÃ¨res Rouge has long been a Majestic favourite, so our buyers weâ€™re thrilled to find this rosÃ© was deserving of equal praise. If you usually make a beeline for our collection of Provence rosÃ©, this elegant bottling is a great alternative choice â€“ and itâ€™s easier on the wallet too. Discover lively aromatic notes of ripe red fruits and plenty of freshness. Its perfect balance of richness and crisp acidity make it versatile for all manner of dishes, so try a glass with tapas or al fresco nibbles.

Title: Bread & Butter 'Winemaker's Selection' RosÃ© 2021/22, California
Description: Bread & Butter first soared to popularity with their lush Californian Chardonnay. So weâ€™re thrilled to invite this vibrant rosÃ© onto our shelves. It's a remarkably fresh blend of Grenache and Barbera, with bright notes of red fruits, melon and rooibos balanced by a zippy acidity. Try it with fresh seafood.

Title: Abbotts & Delaunay â€˜Les Fleurs Sauvagesâ€™ Jardin RosÃ© 2021/22, France
Description: Laurent Delaunay is a talented winemaker and a fifth-generation Burgundy wine producer. In 1995, he set off to the promising Languedoc region in southern France, with an ambition to produce wines that could compete with the worldâ€™s best. The winery has become synonymous with distinctive, high-quality wines made with passion. The grapes for this rosÃ© come from two terroirs â€“ the HÃ©rault plain which lends richness and roundness, and the Aude area which gives character and freshness. The result is a balanced wine full of refreshing, fruity flavour. It has charming aromas of wild strawberry and raspberry, enhanced by refreshing mineral notes. Its richness and plenty of juicy-fruit flavour makes this a great pairing for oven-baked salmon with ratatouille.

Title: The Guv'nor Sparkling RosÃ©, Spain
Description: The Guv'nor wines break the winemaking rules to bring you incredible flavour at great value. Like the Guv'nor red, this sparkling wine is produced using fruit from a number of Spain's most popular regions. By carefully blending grapes from a range of areas, a winemaker is unrestricted by regional rules. This means they can take advantage of the best parcels available and create something truly special. This is ripe and fruity, with delicious flavours of peach, strawberry and raspberry.

Title: Caves d'Esclans 'Whispering Angel' RosÃ© 2021/22 Half Bottle, Provence
Description: Meet the world's trendiest Provence pink, made by Sacha Lachine, a master of the art of rosÃ©. In 2006, he took over ChÃ¢teau d'Esclans. His vision was to create some of the world's greatest wine. To do so, he introduced groundbreaking winemaking techniques. This revolutionised Provence rosÃ© â€“ with Whispering Angel as the figurehead. It has fresh notes of apple, pink grapefruit, peach and cream, and a long, smooth finish. At its very best with smoked salmon.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Carignan, Cinsault, MourvÃ¨dre, Syrah, Tibouren, Vermentino

Title: Freixenet 0.0% Alcohol Free Sparkling RosÃ©
Description: Freixenet is the biggest name in Cava. But they're not done there. In search of the sparkling wine fit for all occasions, they created this refreshing, balancing, alcohol-free sparkling wine. It has flavours of wild berries, raspberries and tropical fruits and a persistent mousse.

Title: Rupert & Rothschild 'Classique' 2019/20, South Africa
Description: The Rothschild wine legacy began in 1868 when James de Rothschild purchased Bordeauxâ€™s ChÃ¢teau Lafite â€“ an estate which was already synonymous with the finest wines of the region. Over a century later, his grandson, Baron Edmond, set out to create South African wines with the same level of renown. With the help of local businessman Dr Anton Rupert, he began producing blends in Franschhoek using the same traditional grape varieties found in Bordeaux. And it wasnâ€™t long before the world took notice. Today, the estate is managed by the next generation of both families â€“ and their wines continue to attract international acclaim. This is made predominantly from Merlot and is matured for over a year in French oak. Discover juicy flavours of raspberry, cherry and plum, with notes of forest floor and toasty oak spice. A hint of smokiness makes it a wonderful choice for roast duck.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Cherry, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Earth

Title: Aqualta Prosecco DOC
Description: This fresh and fragrant Prosecco is made exclusively for Majestic. The perfect union of flavour and value, this delicious fizz will transport you to the picturesque streets of Venice and its traditional bÃ cari. Expect lively bubbles and delicate flavours of apple and pear. Enjoy it in classic Italian spritz cocktails, or as an apÃ©ritif on a sunny afternoon.

Title: Devaux 'Oeil de Perdrix' Brut RosÃ© Champagne
Description:
What do church organs and high-powered motorbikes have in common? They're the hobbies of Michel Parisot - how he spends his downtime from making sublime Champagnes. It's a fitting portrait of a winemaker whose approach to traditional fizz is decidedly unconventional. Michel is all about maximum flavour. Pinot Noir grapes are picked late in the harvest for as much aromatic flavour as possible. Michel then uses only the first press of the grapes, guaranteeing freshness. The wine is then aged for a minimum of four years â€“ far longer than the required 30 months. The result is a rosÃ© Champagne which punches well above its price point.  Expect moreish flavours of redcurrant and raspberry. Although it's dry in style, the creamy texture is perfect with fruity puddings.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award

Title: Chanoine FrÃ¨res 'RÃ©serve PrivÃ©e' Brut Champagne 2014
Description: Chanoine FrÃ¨res was founded in 1730 and is the second-oldest Champagne house. It's developed its signature style over almost three centuries since, and the expertise certainly shows in this vintage Champagne. It has fine, delicate bubbles and rich flavours of candied fruit, roasted hazelnuts and honey.

Title: Domaine Roger Neveu 'CÃ´te des Embouffants' Sancerre 2021/22
Description: The Neveu familyâ€™s roots in the Loire run deep. For more than four centuries, winemaking expertise has been passed down from generation to generation â€“ and their name is now a byword for quality in Sancerre. The vineyard that this wine comes from is also steeped in history. CÃ´tes des Embouffants was singled out by Abbot Poupart in his 1777 history of Sancerre, saying that that 'the Bouffants hillside is one of the best I know in our Sancerre areaâ€™. Nearly 250 years later, his assessment still holds true. The chalky soils are perfect for vibrant, crisp Sauvignon, and the flavours really leap out of the glass. Itâ€™s intensely refreshing with citrus and lime acidity, and a hard-to-put-your-finger-on complexity from six months of lees ageing. Ideal with a classic goatâ€™s cheese tart.

Title: Pasqua 'Romeo & Juliet' Brut Prosecco DOC, Treviso
Description: Verona is the hub of the Veneto region, where vines surround the lakes. Prosecco is the regionâ€™s lifeblood â€“ and this deliciously soft, fruity fizz celebrates the romantic legend which draws visitors to Verona. Lovers leave messages in the courtyard of â€˜Julietâ€™s houseâ€™ â€“ which also decorate this wineâ€™s label. Bubbles with such a charming story will always make a great centrepiece at parties. Light. Aromatic. Fruity. Itâ€™s full of citrus, apple and pear flavours, with a soft mousse.

Title: Louis Jadot Beaujolais-LantigniÃ© 2021/22
Description: The village of LatigniÃ© is just north-west of RegniÃ© in the heart of the Beaujolais-Villages region. Maison Louis Jadot is a well known name across the Burgundy region. Their aim is to express the true nature of Burgundy and this wine is no exception. This is a bright, vibrant Gamay with moderate acidity and soft tannins, cherry and raspberry flavours and a pleasant finish. Best served lightly chilled either on its own or with cold meats and salads.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Sainte Gemme 2017, Haut-MÃ©doc
Description: ChÃ¢teau de Sainte Gemme is a 13-hectare estate in Haut-MÃ©doc. It was bought by the Bouteiller family, who also own the very well-known ChÃ¢teau Lanessan, in 1981. And it's gone from strength to strength since. Its neighbours command Â£50+ per bottle - and this only makes this stunning mature Bordeaux even better value. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has ripe notes of cherry, blueberry, cedar and forest floor, supple tannins and a long finish. Try it with roast beef.

Title: Pasqua 'PassioneSentimento' Passimento Rosso 2020/21, Veneto
Description: This is one of our most popular Italian reds. Itâ€™s fantastically plush and full of flavour â€“ all thanks to the â€˜appassimentoâ€™ style of winemaking. This means the grapes are picked at the peak of their ripeness and left to dry in special crates until theyâ€™ve lost 30% of their volume. It concentrates all the sugars and flavours in the grapes, making the texture seriously lush and velvety. With this intensity you wonâ€™t believe the price. Think stewed plum, blackberry and juicy cherry flavour, with notes of violet and heady sweet spice. Itâ€™s fantastic with meat ragÃ¹ piled over pasta.

Title: Pasqua 'PassioneSentimento' Passimento Bianco 2021, Veneto
Description: Think â€˜appassimentoâ€™, you'll most likely think Amarone â€“ or other really plush reds. Itâ€™s a method of making wine with a portion of dried grapes, concentrating all the flavours and giving it a real richness of texture. But this wine is a little different. For a start, itâ€™s white â€“ and every single part of its production is designed to make it richer and more intensely flavoured. The grapes are left to dry in special racks, concentrating the sugars and aromas. After itâ€™s pressed the wine is left on its skins to make the texture rounded and the flavours bolder. Finally, a portion is aged in oak for added creaminess. No wonder itâ€™s a beast of a wine. Bold. Fruity. Plush. Thereâ€™s a lovely balance of fresh citrus flavours and apricoty, peachy richness. Delicious with roast chicken.

Title: Louis Latour Bourgogne Gamay 2021/22
Description: Louis Latour is one of the biggest names in Burgundy. Their winemaking history stretches back to the 1700s, and they've been family-owned for 11 generations. So you can expect great things from this fruity red. It's made using grapes exclusively from the Beaujolais crus â€“ the region's ten best villages. The grapes are hand-harvested and fermented in Latour's classic Burgundy style, using open-top French oak vats. Expect flavours of fresh red fruit with a kick of white pepper that makes this a great match for charcuterie.

Title: The King's Favour Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: Brent Marris is winemaking royalty. And it turns out, he may be descended from actual royalty too. His ancestor, William de Marisco was rumoured to be the illegitimate son of Henry I â€“ not that that guaranteed the family good relations with royalty. The de Mariscos spent much of the 12th and 13th centuries living a life of piracy on the Isle of Lundy. Brent created the King Series to celebrate his familyâ€™s history, and their tempestuous relationship with the monarchy. This is a classic Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc â€“ an important Marlborough sub-region where the wines are particularly vibrant. Think guava, gooseberry and a hint of blackcurrant leaf which sets this apart from the standard. Of course, itâ€™s also mouth-wateringly fresh â€“ a dream with barbecued fish with mango salsa.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Jammy Good Malbec 2022, Mendoza
Description: This crowd-pleasing red is made by the Belhara Estate, a family winery located in the renowned Uco Valley in Mendoza â€“ one of the worldâ€™s best spots for quality Malbec. Their vineyards lie at altitudes of up to 1,400 metres, where intense sunlight and cool nighttime temperatures result in grapes with the perfect balance of ripe flavours and fresh acidity. Five months in French oak gives the wine a smoothness and subtle complexity, while still keeping it fruity and fantastically approachable. Discover juicy flavours of plum, blackberry and cherry, plus a hint of vanilla. Its rich, velvety texture makes it an ideal pairing for barbecued meats or a grilled halloumi burger.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Vanilla

Title: Penfolds 'Koonunga Hill Seventy Six' Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/21, South Australia
Description: When it comes to reds from Down Under, you canâ€™t beat Penfolds. After all, this is the most famous premium winery in Australia â€“ makers of the celebrated Grange. And this bold and spicy blend of Shiraz and Cabernet gives you a taste of the Penfolds wine mastery. Itâ€™s complex, structured and fruit-driven: think notes of plum, blackberry, blackcurrant and blueberry. Delicious chocolate and sweet spice notes add to its character and length. Crack it open an hour before sipping, and pair with a fine cut of beef.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Sweet Spice, Vanilla

Title: Villemarin Picpoul de Pinet 2021/22
Description: Picpoul vines are almost exclusively grown in Picpoul de Pinet â€“ an appellation next to the Languedocâ€™s Thau lagoon near Montpellier. The area is a plateau covered in vines, fragrant garrigue herbs and pine groves. We're not surprised Villemarin is a customer favourite â€“ you can practically taste the Mediterranean in the wine. Its flavours are sun-ripened and as fresh as the salty winds that race across the lagoon. If you love crisp whites like Sauvignon Blanc, then this is a must-try. Itâ€™s incredibly zesty, with intense lemon and grapefruit flavours, and refreshing minerality â€“ a perfect choice for fish and seafood dishes.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Nero Oro Appassimento, Sicily
Description: If your idea of a good red is velvety-smooth and full of plush fruit, our top-selling Nero Oro is not to be missed. So what makes it so silky-smooth? Creator Stefano Chioccioli uses the appassimento style of winemaking. After picking, his grapes are left to dry out in the warm sun, adding richness and intensity. Dessert wines have been made this way in Sicily for centuries, but the dry Nero Oro is something entirely unique â€“ and youâ€™ll only find it at Majestic. Itâ€™s full-bodied with concentrated flavours of cherry, damson and blackcurrant. Its silky texture makes it a great match for aubergine-based pasta.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Sweet Spice

Title: Bouvet Ladubay 'Saphir' Saumur Brut 2020/21
Description:
Love vintage Champagne, but not the price tag? Then you need to try Bouvet Ladubayâ€™s Saphir Saumur Brut. This vintage sparkling is the savvy drinkerâ€™s first choice alternative to Champagne, made using the same traditional method. It's made from Chenin Blanc, with a small amount of Chardonnay, which adds a brioche-richness to its character. 18 months of ageing really dials up delicious biscuity flavour. Peachy, honeyed and nutty, this is really classy fizz â€“ and an absolute steal for the quality. Delicious with white fish in a buttery sauce.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.
Characteristics: Peach, Citrus Fruit, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey

Title: Roberto Sarotto 'Campo dell'Olio' Gavi di Gavi DOCG 2021/22
Description: The Sarotto family settled in Piedmont in the 1800s, and Roberto is the latest generation to turn his hand to this historic winemaking region. This is his interpretation of the region's iconic white wine, known as The Chablis of Italy, Gavi di Gavi. It's made from 100% Cortese grapes on a 2-hectare vineyard and went through a long, cool fermentation process to draw out the grape's signature aromatics. Add a further three months resting on lees, and you're in for a seriously textured wine. Expect floral notes, with hints of pineapple, apricot and peach. Try it with fish tacos.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Green Apple, Stone Fruit, Wet Stones

Title: Honey Drop Chardonnay 2022, South Africa
Description: Honey Drop is an unapologetically big, bold and rich Chardonnay. It's made about as close to the sea as you can get in Stellenbosch. Grapes here benefit from a luxuriously long ripening period, allowing complex flavours to develop slowly. They get to soak up the sun and be cooled by sea breezes. Most importantly, it brings plenty of flavour to your glass. Oak ageing brings heady flavours of cream, honey, butterscotch and brioche. Decadently rich, it's fantastic with buttery roast chicken.
Characteristics: Bread, Cream, Smoke, Stone Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Luis Felipe Edwards Gran Reserva Merlot 2020/21, Colchagua Valley
Description: If you love big, bold reds, Colchagua Valley will be your paradise. Itâ€™s sandwiched between the Andes and the Coastal Mountain Range, with an arid climate which is too much for the delicate skin of white grapes â€“ but is perfect to slowly ripen red grapes, intensifying the flavours. Luis Felipe Edwardsâ€™ vineyards are at a particularly high-altitude, 900 meters above sea level, which creates a slightly cooler micro-climate. Ideal conditions for Merlot. Fresh. Fruity. Itâ€™s got incredible intensity from ripening in the Colchagua sun. Think strawberry, black cherry and cassis. A lovely ripe, velvety texture complements this moreish fruitiness. Ideal with roast beef.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: MarquÃ©s de CÃ¡ceres Rioja Crianza 2018/19
Description: If youâ€™ve drunk Rioja, youâ€™re almost guaranteed to have come across MarquÃ©s de CÃ¡ceres. Since the 1970s theyâ€™ve been producing quality wines in the Spanish region. Their expertise certainly shows in this Crianza. The grapes, primarily Tempranillo, are grown on plots in Rioja Alta and Rioja Alavesa, then aged for 12 months in oak to lend aromas of toasted wood and spices. Itâ€™s full of candied red fruit flavours and very smooth to drink, thanks to elegant tannins. A wine for a gourmet burger, comforting stew or chorizo-based dishes.

Title: Luis Felipe Edwards Gran Reserva Chardonnay 2021/22, Casablanca Valley
Description: Luis Felipe Edwards Senior returned from Europe to Chile in 1976 and began growing grapes at a small property in the foothills of the Andes. Less than 20 years later, he stopped selling his grapes in bulk to create his own excellent wines. Luis Felipe Edwards has since become one of the biggest names in Chilean wine. But the winery remains in the family with one aim: to bring you the finest wines at the best prices. This is a rich and textured Chardonnay, with notes of pineapple, apricot, vanilla and butterscotch. It has a gentle nuttiness that matches well with creamy chicken.

Title: RamÃ³n Bilbao 'SelecciÃ³n Especial' Rioja 2020/21
Description:
The Tempranillo and Garnacha grapes used to make this are from all over Rioja. So you can be sure you're tasting the best fo the famous region. Ripe. Fruity. It's full of blackberry and cherry fruit flavours - with a savoury, balsamic note which is really moreish. Vanilla, coconutty spice is from oak barrels, and it's got a lovely velvety texture. Delicious with smoked meats or spicy food.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.

Title: Waimea Estates Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Nelson
Description: Thought New Zealand Sauvignon stopped at Marlborough? Think again. Nelson has warm days, sea breeze-cooled days and plenty of sunshine hours. Some claim that it's the country's sunniest spot. It's where you'll find Sauvignon Blanc with some of the ripest tropical-fruit flavours. And that's why Waimea Estates has a history of winning awards all over the globe. It's tropical, vibrant and crisp. Expect passionfruit, lime and pea pod and a long, elegant finish. Its crisp finish and complex flavours mean itâ€™ll make a fantastic match for sea bass
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Lanson 'Le RosÃ©' Brut Champagne
Description: Lanson made one of the first rosÃ© Champagnes. 60 years later, they've perfected their recipe. The Grande Marque's signature rosÃ© is coloured a delightful salmon pink. It's well-rounded and fresh, with intriguing aromas of roses and red fruits. It makes an ideal partner to delicate white meat dishes, or even fresh fruit desserts.

Title: Domaine des Tourelles CuvÃ©e Pierre Brun 2019/20, Lebanon
Description: When it comes to Lebanese wines it's not only ChÃ¢teau Musar that's worth collecting. Founded in 1868, Tourelles is Lebanon's oldest winery. It's now run by Faouzi Issa, who earned his stripes working in CÃ´te RÃ´tie and at iconic ChÃ¢teau Margaux.This experience is reaping rewards. A blend of Cabernet, Syrah, Cinsault and Carignan, this has fine aromatic morello cherry and spice aromas, a dark fruit core with layered earthy spice, and balanced tannins.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Earth

Title: Cave de Lugny Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2022
Description: With winemaking roots dating back to the 18th century, Cave de Lugny are a classic name in Burgundy. They were the second ever cooperative established in the MÃ¢connais region â€“ and their expertise is evident in all their wines. Since 2015 theyâ€™ve been certified as sustainable winegrowers â€“ and their mission for quality and care extends to the vineyards around them. This silky Pinot Noir wine is mostly produced from vineyards with an average age of 30 years from the communes of Saint-Gengoux-de-ScissÃ© and Cruzille. Here, the south-east facing, hillside-only vineyards feature produce exceptional quality grapes that deliver even more flavour to your glass. Itâ€™s fresh and supple, with juicy notes of red cherry, redcurrant and liquorice. Its smooth tannins make it a great pairing with grilled beef.

Title: Aperol Aperitivo 70cl
Description: The Italian classic. Aperolâ€™s distinctive bittersweet flavour is thanks to its unique infusion of rhubarb, orange and herbs. This is a top-secret recipe that hasnâ€™t changed since 1919. It's bright and bittersweet and will blend perfectly with Prosecco for a fresh Aperol spritz.

Title: Luis Felipe Edwards Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Leyda Valley
Description: Chile's Leyda Valley is a region on the up. Its cooler, Pacific climate is ideal for Sauvignon Blanc grapes. Luis Felipe Edwards' vineyards are some of the closest to the sea in the valley. And the man making this wine on them, Nicolas Bizzarri, earned his stripes at the prestigious Robert Mondavi winery in California. This is a juicy, tropical Sauvignon, with notes of pineapple, passionfruit and lemon. Simply excellent with fish.

Title: Mt Difficulty 'Roaring Meg' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Central Otago
Description: The sustainable Mt. Difficulty winery is the most famous producer in Central Otago. Their famed Roaring Meg range came about almost by accident. In 2003, there was leftover fruit from some of their best vineyards. So the winemaking team here saw an opportunity to try out a different style of Pinot Noir. They made a wine which was exceptionally fruity - one which was made to drink young. Roaring Meg was born. And it was such a success, theyâ€™ve been making it ever since. This is a real favourite of ours. It's packed with red fruity flavours. Raspberry. Red cherry. A hint of spice. Perfect with glazed ham or rustic duck cassoulet.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Cave de VirÃ© VirÃ©-ClessÃ© 2020/21
Description: If you prefer your Chardonnay unoaked, we recommend this VirÃ©-ClessÃ©. Thanks to the limestone soils in the vineyards, this is a mineral style of white Burgundy. Itâ€™s made by VirÃ©-ClessÃ©â€™s biggest producer, who played a large part in the area gaining prestigious appellation status. Itâ€™s also aged on its lees. This brings it a delectably rich texture. Expect bright exotic-fruit flavours that are best enjoyed with oysters and a squeeze of lemon.

Title: Definition Pinot Noir 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Kiwi Pinot Noir is a real success story. Itâ€™s no longer simply compared to Burgundy â€“ itâ€™s become a coveted style of Pinot in its own right. So, it was a no-brainer addition to our Definition range. We wanted something exciting to do justice to New Zealandâ€™s pioneering spirit. So, we headed to Marlborough. The regionâ€™s history with Pinot is younger, but if there was anyone who could help us get the blend just right it was Marlborough and Pinot experts, Saint Clair. With them we selected grapes from top parcels in the Southern Valleys â€“ the best site for Pinot in the region. The results speak for themselves. Itâ€™s deliciously savoury with classic Marlborough dark fruit. Think black cherry and raspberry. Itâ€™s perfumed but fresh, with fine tannins and a lovely silky texture. Ideal with duck.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Luis Felipe Edwards 'Signature Series' Viognier Reserva 2022/23, Rapel Valley
Description: Luis Felipe Edwards is one of the first names in Chilean winemaking. Established in 1976, the family-owned winery has gained global success thanks to their commitment to making wines of only the highest quality. Originating from France, the Viognier grape has flourished in Chileâ€™s Rapel Valley, and the family know exactly how to draw out its signature ripe and aromatic flavours. To add a little richness, this Reserva spends just two months in oak which, in turn, retains maximum freshness. Itâ€™s bright and zingy with notes of pear, peach and apricot, plus a minerality which adds to its elegance. Viognierâ€™s full, fruity flavour complements spice perfectly. So pair this with your favourite spicy Asian dish.

Title: Tenuta dell'Ornellaia â€˜Le Volteâ€™ 2020/21, Tuscany
Description: Ornellaia is an estate in demand. Their first wine is one of the most sought-after in Italy. â€˜Le Volteâ€™ is your chance to taste their expertise at a lower price, and it favours the adventurous. Here, Sangiovese is combined with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's an exciting twist on the Super Tuscan blend. Aged for over 10 months in oak, it has great structure, fresh notes of red fruits and a balancing acidity that are sublime with venison.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Tobacco

Title: Chronic Cellars 'Sir Real' Cabernet Sauvignon 2020/21, Paso Robles
Description: The Beckett brothers grew up in Paso Robles, washing oak barrels and working bottling lines. It was here that they formed life-long connections with local farmers. These ties mean they now have access to the regionâ€™s finest (or â€˜Chronicâ€™ as the duo call them) grapes. Their 'Sir Real' showcases the very best of Paso Robles Cabernet. Try its notes of black fruit and toasted spice with beef ribs.
Characteristics: Savoury, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackcurrant, Chocolate

Title: Robertson Winery 'Winemakers Selection' Chardonnay 2022
Description: South Africaâ€™s Robertson has the terroir and climate to allow a range of grape varieties to flourish. Nestled between the sun-drenched Langeberg Mountains and the fertile reaches of the Breede River, Chardonnay vines here thrive in vineyards tempered by ocean breezes. Named after the region itself, the Robertson winery is housed within an ancient stone missionary church â€“ a nod towards the regionâ€™s 150 years of heritage. And community is at the heart of everything they do. As a major employer in the valley, the team is committed to giving back. They recently set up the â€˜Really Good Wineâ€™ initiative, a project set up to invest in local education. Thirty-five different farms now make up the Robertson Winery community, some of whom have been growing grapes in the valley for seven generations. Winemaker Rianco van Rooyenâ€™s experiences in both California and Bordeaux have contributed to his aromatically intense and fruit-forward style of wine, as this first-rate Chardonnay effortlessly shows. Expect ripe flavours of lemon, melon and a subtle creamy nuttiness. Its refreshing acidity and rounded body makes it a great choice for rich poultry dishes.

Title: Honey Drop Chenin Blanc 2022, Swartland
Description: Honey Drop wines, produced at the renowned Journey's End vineyards, are big, bold, and unmistakably characterful. And this wine is no exception. Made with some of the oldest bush-vine Chenin Blanc in Swartland, each bottle is the result of a mission to sustainably produce wines that are both delicious and environmentally conscious. Only grapes deemed perfectly ripe are picked by hand, and careful use of oak in the winery adds complex layers of woody notes and rich texture. Expect creamy tropical and peachy notes under rich layers of oak and vanilla. The refreshing acidity makes it a great partner for roast pork dishes.
Characteristics: Pineapple, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Videla 'Aranda' Malbec 2021, Mendoza
Description: Aranda Malbec is made by Stephen Huse, a highly esteemed winemaker who has worked at some of the worldâ€™s greatest wineries â€“ most notably ChÃ¢teau Margaux and ChÃ¢teau Mouton Rothschild. He uses high-altitude vines and gentle oak ageing to create a balanced, complex red that punches well above its price tag. It boasts rich flavours of ripe plum and blackcurrant, with hints of sweet spice. Its well-structured tannins and freshness make it a perfect partner for chargrilled steak.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Bodega Matsu â€˜El Recioâ€™ 2020/21, Toro
Description: Matsu translates from Japanese as â€˜to waitâ€™. It perfectly captures the patient philosophy of Bodegas Matsu on their century-old Toro vineyards. The bodegaâ€™s mature vines help to create wines with diverse and complex flavour profiles. â€˜El Recioâ€™ is made from Tempranillo vines between 90 and 100 years old. So expect heady notes of black fruit, chocolate and vanilla, a full body and a fruity, lingering finish. Enjoy it with juicy lamb shanks.

Title: Managers' Choice: Agenda Red 2019/20, DÃ£o
Description: We asked our store managers to select a new wine to be stocked nation-wide. They picked this from a huge pool of contenders. The Agenda Red is a delightfully soft and rounded wine with loads of plum and bramble flavours, plus a touch of herbs. Judicious use of oak adds a slight spiciness to the finish. This will be perfect with roast lamb and rosemary.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackcurrant Leaf, Herbaceous

Title: Pringle Bay Pinot Noir 2021, Western Cape
Description: David Williams, writing in The Observer in 2022, referred to Pringle Bay wines as being "among the best value wines" he'd tried over the year. This Pinot Noir is crafted by winemakers Duncan Savage and Thys Louw, from nearby family estate Diemersdal. Weâ€™re certain itâ€™s a soon-to-be-uncovered gem. It's unusual to find such high quality at such an affordable price, but this wine truly delivers. You'll find soft red cherry, plum and summer fruit notes, plus a touch of baking spice. It pairs excellently with lighter dishes, such as white meats, and can even be served slightly chilled.
Characteristics: Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Red Plum

Title: DeMorgenzon 'DMZ' Chenin Blanc 2021/22, Stellenbosch
Description: The award-winning DeMorgenzon plays baroque music to its vines 24 hours a day, seven days a week in the belief that it coaxes grapes to optimum ripeness. Decide for yourself in this exceptional Chenin Blanc. It has rich notes of green apple, stone fruits and honey and a lingering aftertaste.

Title: Domaine Begude 'L'Etoile' Organic Chardonnay 2020/21, Limoux
Description: They take sustainable winemaking seriously at Domaine Begude. Set in the heart of Languedocâ€™s Limoux region, the soils are totally organic and irrigation-free. Weeding is done manually, sheep manure is used as fertiliser and pesticides are banned. In other words, the Domaine cares both about making great wine and protecting the landscape. Fermentation in barrel produces this Chardonnay with gentle brioche, apple and pear notes â€“ but it maintains plenty of freshness. Try it with a creamy risotto or seafood dishes, like fish pie.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Cream, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Jam Shed Shiraz 2021/22, Australia
Description: Jam Shed was created with one thing in mind â€“ to create delicious, seriously drinkable wines. Theyâ€™ve travelled the world to find the best spots for their grapes and bring you flavourful bottles at exceptional value. This Shiraz comes from sun-soaked Aussie vineyards where the warm days really dial up the rich flavours. Itâ€™s soft and fruity with jammy notes of sweet dark cherry, plum, pepper and spice. Itâ€™s the perfect bottle to enjoy with your favourite pizza.
Characteristics: Jammy, Red Cherry, Red Plum, Vanilla

Title: Ramos Reserva 2019/20 Vinho Regional Alentejano
Description:
JoÃ£o Portugal Ramos started planting his own vines in Alentejo in 1990, gradually increasing the vineyard area and developing the winery. Traditional foot-treading in marble lagares is still practised on the estate, alongside modern temperature-controlled fermentation. A robust ruby red wine, with dense aromas of red berries and pudding spice. Flavours on the palate are bright, thick and jammy, with fine-grained, well integrated tannins and good length. Enjoy with a roasted pork loin marinated in Mediterranean spices.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Ernst Loosen Pinot Noir 2021/22, Pfalz
Description: Ernst Loosen's family have made fantastic Riesling on the Mosel slopes for over 200 years. But to get the best from Pinot Noir, he headed to Pfalz. Pfalz Pinot Noir has quickly become one of Germany's flagship wine styles - and this really shows why. It has bright notes of red fruit, balancing acidity and smooth tannins. Excellent with roast chicken.

Title: Cantine Maschio Extra Dry Prosecco DOC
Description: Cantine Maschio has been making internationally celebrated Prosecco since the 1970s. Bonaventura Maschio turned his familyâ€™s century-old distillery into a state-of-the-art winery, capable of producing exceptional fizz. Winemaker Gabriele Cescon ensures their prized Glera grapes are handled with the utmost care. She prefers to use â€˜free-run juiceâ€™ â€“ high-quality liquid produced when grapes are naturally crushed under their own weight. It means minimal contact with bitter compounds, resulting in elegant wines with pure, fresh flavours. Extra Dry means itâ€™s not as dry as the Brut style â€“ so if you like particularly fruity Prosecco, this will be right up your street. Expect fresh notes of white peach, orange blossom and almond. Best paired with fruity desserts or served as part of a range of cocktails.

Title: Villiera Wines Merlot 2020, Stellenbosch
Description: Villiera Wines has been in the Grier familyâ€™s hands since 1983. Today, they have a strong ethical reputation. The winery is solar-powered, they've planted thousands of trees, use no insecticides and are a wildlife sanctuary. This Merlot was made by Nathan Valentine, who earned his stripes at the renowned De Morgenzon winery, as well as in California and the south of France. You can taste his expertise in every sip. Expect flavours of ripe plum, damson, red cherry and smoky vanilla and elegant tannins. Partner with pan-seared tuna steak.
Characteristics: Red Cherry, Red Plum, Smoke, Vanilla

Title: Jam Shed Chardonnay 2021/22, Australia
Description: Jam Shed was created with one thing in mind â€“ to create delicious, seriously drinkable wines. Theyâ€™ve travelled the world to find the best spots for their grapes and bring you flavourful bottles at exceptional value. This Chardonnay comes from sun-soaked Aussie vineyards where the warm days really dial up the rich flavours. Itâ€™s rich and decadent with ripe notes of peach, citrus and a hint of toasty oak. Enjoy it with creamy pasta dishes.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Pennautier 'Marquis de Pennautier' Chardonnay-Viognier 2021/22, Pays d'Oc
Description: From the estate of the historic 17th century ChÃ¢teau de Pennautier in CabardÃ¨s, this is a bright and fruity Chardonnay-Viognier blend. Expect notes of apple and citrus from the Chardonnay, and hints of apricot from the Viognier. Try with meatier fish and Mediterranean-inspired dished such as ratatouille.

Title: MontGras â€˜Day Oneâ€™ Chardonnay 2021/22, Leyda Valley
Description:
The Day One wines are a celebration of the first day of harvest in each vineyard. The dates are even printed on the labels. Their head winemaker Adolfo Hurtado â€“ a Chilean legend with plenty of experience as former chief winemaker at the famous Cono Sur Vineyards. He produces sustainable wines at MontGrasâ€™ winery in Leyda Valley, Chileâ€™s newest winemaking area. Its cool ocean breezes and morning fog relieve the grapes from the warm sunshine making it perfect for great quality white wines. Expect flavours of citrus, blossom, pineapple and tropical fruit. Its creamy texture and refreshing acidity make it a brilliant pairing with salmon ceviche. 

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Floral, Peach, Tropical Fruit

Title: Graham Beck Blanc de Blancs 2017/18, South Africa
Description: Graham Beck has been synonymous with quality South African fizz since 1991. They've won plenty of awards by producing some of the countryâ€™s best traditional method sparkling wines â€“ known locally as â€˜Methode Cap Classiqueâ€™. These wines have even been sipped by the likes of Nelson Mandela and Barack Obama. This one is made from Chardonnay grapes hand-picked at night to preserve freshness. Expect aromas of lime, green apple and pear. The flavours of citrus, brioche and gentle spice lead to a long finish.

Title: Definition Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: When we looked to define Marlborough Sauvignon, we knew we had to bring in the big guns. There was only one man for the job â€“ Brent Marris, the winemaker behind our best-selling Kiwi Sauvignon, The Ned. We worked with Brent to cherry pick the very best grapes from specific parcels of vines. We wanted to go big on flavour and make it mouth-wateringly refreshing. The result? Itâ€™s the very best of Marlborough in a bottle. Itâ€™s a heady mix of fresh-cut grass, elderflower and passionfruit, with textbook freshness and citrusy flavours. Itâ€™ll sing with creamy goat's cheese.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Georges Duboeuf 'Flower Label' Fleurie 2020/21
Description: 18-year-old Georges Duboeuf knew his familyâ€™s wines had the potential to become some of the most celebrated Beaujolais in France. In 1964, he set off on his bicycle with a selection of bottles strapped to his back. He pedalled around some of the most celebrated French restaurateurs of the day and they all loved the food-friendly wines. Georgesâ€™ success inspired him to expand the family business and build relationships with some of the best growers in Beaujolais. Fleurie is one of best appellations in the region â€“ known for producing floral, delicate wines. Think violets and red berries, with a really silky texture. As for food â€“ itâ€™s brilliant with charcuterie and terrines.

Title: Edna Valley Chardonnay 2019/20, Central Coast
Description: Edna Valley's vineyards are just a stoneâ€™s throw from the Californian coast, an area that's famous for its top-quality Chardonnay. You'll find big names like Napa and Sonoma nearby, but Edna Valley Vineyard choose to work within lesser-known wine regions instead â€“ meaning they're where to go for quality and value. White peach. Apricot. Melon. The flavours are seriously ripe, but itâ€™s still deliciously crisp and refreshing. A touch of oak adds a rich roundness and subtle spice, making it a perfect match for buttery pumpkin ravioli.

Title: Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ© Viognier 2021/22, France
Description: Caroline Frey earned her stripes in the cellars of top Champagne crus and Bordeaux chÃ¢teaux, but taking over such an established label as Jaboulet was still no mean feat. Known for sublime reds, and Â£40-a-bottle Condrieu, Jaboulet is nothing less than a cult RhÃ´ne wine label. And this Viognier is a real steal. It's pure indulgence. A Condrieu doppelgÃ¤nger at a fraction of the price. It's aromatic. It's peachy. But it's also seriously fresh. Every part of the winemaking, from picking the very best grapes, to fermenting the juice in aroma-preserving stainless steel, has been designed to make this as opulent and fragrant a glassful as you could wish for. It's a curry's dream partner, but also delicious alone.

Title: Surani 'Costarossa' Primitivo di Manduria DOC 2021/22, Puglia
Description: If you love ripe, bold reds then this is an absolute must-try. We think Puglia is underrated. Itâ€™s right in the heel of Italyâ€™s boot â€“ and youâ€™d be forgiven for thinking the sun-baked vines could never produce a wine as silky and soft as this. But itâ€™s precisely that heat that Primitivo loves. The grapes are left on the vines until theyâ€™re almost overripe â€“ giving the flavours incredible concentration. Intense. Velvety. Ripe. Itâ€™s full of plummy, red-fruit flavour with moreish spice. Ageing in oak for a year gives it an extra dimension of flavour, smoothing the plush tannins. With a distinctly Italian hint of woody herbs, it's ideal with pasta dishes.

Title: Edna Valley Pinot Noir 2020/21, Central Coast
Description: This is made from a number of lesser-known spots in California's Central Coast. The nearby Pacific ocean provides an almost constant breeze through the vineyards. This keeps fussy Pinot Noir grapes happy through a long growing season. And slow ripening grapes make complex and elegant wines. Central Coast may not grab the headlines like other nearby regions, but this means you get both great value and exceptional flavour. It's light and silky, with flavours of blackberry compote, black cherry, cranberry and a long, smooth finish. Try it with roast lamb, or roast mushroom dish.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Forest Floor, Red Fruit

Title: Domaine Louis Moreau Petit Chablis 2021/22
Description: Chablis may be part of Burgundy â€“ but you wonâ€™t find any Pinot Noir vines here. Itâ€™s all about Chardonnay. Specifically: crisp, citrussy, refreshing Chardonnay. Chablis is a lot further north than the rest of Burgundy so has a cooler climate. This, combined with the tradition of leaving the majority of wines unoaked means that the style of these lean, light white Burgundys are very different from their rich, fruity southern cousins. It takes a real expert to hit the balance of freshness and flavour. Luckily, Domaine Louis Moreau have been doing it for six generations. This Petit Chablis is absolutely textbook. Itâ€™s crisp. Itâ€™s citrussy. Itâ€™s wonderfully fresh. Itâ€™s all about that classic appley, lemony Chardonnay fruit â€“ and itâ€™s a fantastic palate-cleanser. Try it with sashimi.

Title: Alamos Malbec 2020/21, Uco Valley
Description:
This was the number one most-awarded Malbec worldwide in 2018 and 2019. No wonder, when itâ€™s grown in such extraordinary circumstances. The vineyards are in the foothills of the Andes, 5,000 feet above sea level, where everything is more intense. Plentiful sunlight and cool nights here mean Malbec grapes with plenty of delicious fruit flavour. Expect flavours of blackcurrant, ripe plum and spice. Decadently rich with a plush, mouth-filling texture. Itâ€™s a classic inky, full-bodied Malbec, bold enough to enjoy with a hearty steak.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Jean Vincent Pouilly-FumÃ© 2021/22
Description: Pouilly-FumÃ© is known all over the world for its perfumed, flinty, mineral and distinctly smoky character. Some believe that the regionâ€™s unique soils are behind this phenomenon. Father-and-son team Jean and Vincent Chatelain are the 11th and 12th generations of an illustrious winemaking family here â€“ and you can really taste their expertise. Its gooseberry and gentle spice flavours and fresh acidity make it a perfect complement for smoked salmon.

Title: Pol Roger 2013/15 Vintage Champagne
Description: Pol Roger reserve their declarations of a vintage for years when all the climatic, viticultural and winemaking components come together to encourage the finest Champagne. The traditional house vintage blend from 20 grand and premier crus is aged for 7 years in their cellars. Because of this, you can expect nothing less than excellence. Discover notes of flowers, gingerbread and spices. Its excellent structure will stand up for rich meals like roast chicken.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Definition CÃ´tes Du RhÃ´ne 2020/21
Description: When we decided to add a CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne to our Definition range there was one name we immediately thought of: Perrin. The Perrin family are behind legendary the ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape estate, ChÃ¢teau de Beaucastel. ChÃ¢teauneuf is a blend of thirteen grapes â€“ so you know that brothers Jean-Pierre and Francois are absolute masters of blending. They were the ideal partners for our buyers to work with to select the very best grapes, and then blend them to perfection. The result? Itâ€™s a juicy, moreish CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne. Proof that weâ€™ll only put our names to the best of the best â€“ thatâ€™s the Definition promise. Itâ€™s full of flavour â€“ redcurrant, peppery spice, plum â€“ with a soft, silky texture. Not to mention, itâ€™s a really versatile food wine so ideal for buffets.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Grand Faurie La Rose Saint-Ã‰milion Grand Cru 2018/19
Description: Saint-Ã‰milion is one of Bordeauxâ€™s most renowned and prestigious appellations. A UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1999, the region is famed for its complex, Merlot-dominant blends. And ChÃ¢teau Grand Faurie La Rose captures the classic style perfectly in this. Itâ€™s made from vines that have an average age of 30 years, so the flavours are particularly intense, and 12 months of oak ageing give it an elegant, silky texture. Rich yet fresh, it has complex notes of blackcurrant, cherry, and earthy spice. Its firm tannins and balancing acidity make it an excellent accompaniment to roasted red meats â€“ try yours with herby leg of lamb.

Title: Porta 6 Reserva 2019/20, Portugal
Description: Love Porta 6? Weâ€™ve gone one better. When James Martin recommended Porta 6 on Saturday Kitchen it quickly became one of our most popular wines. It seemed impossible to improve on it. But we had a feeling that if Porta 6 is an exceptional wine â€“ we could make a truly extraordinary one. We challenged the producer to go into the vineyards and root out the very best parcels of grapes. What they discovered were grapes of such incredible quality they warranted extra special care and attention. They handpicked and carefully sorted the grapes, then slowly aged the wine in oak barrels. The resulting wine is richly fruity with a twist of charred BBQ spice â€“ itâ€™s like Porta 6 but smoother, richer and even more delicious. Amp up the flavours by pairing it with spicy grilled meats.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Jammy, Red Fruit, Sweet Spice

Title: Domaine Pardon et Fils â€˜Les Mouillesâ€™ JuliÃ©nas 2021/22
Description:
The red wines from the Beaujolais Cru region of JuliÃ©nas are typically expressive, juicy, earthy and a great match for food. This one, by the acclaimed Domaine Pardon, is made with grapes hand-picked from old vines. Expect a deeply coloured wine with fresh, powerful red fruit flavours and a rich character. Allow it to age for up to three years or serve now with coq au vin.

In 2022, this wine won a Decanter award

Title: Saint Clair 'Wairau Reserve' Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description:
Saint Clair have won more awards for their Sauvignon than any other producer in Marlborough. And they've gone even better with their Reserve range. They're made from the very best vineyards in specific regions. This one is made from selected grapes from the Wairau Valley, a Marlborough region that's known for its wonderfully aromatic Sauvignon Blanc. And this is a perfect example. Expect aromas of honeysuckle, passionfruit and gooseberry. An ideal partner for seared scallops.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Pierre Sauvion Haut-Poitou 2020/21
Description: Covering an area to the north of Poitiers, in the southeastern part of the Loire, Haut Poitou has been a well known winemaking territory for centuries, but was created an AOC as recently as 2011 as a result of its wines' notable levels of quality. A crisp, dry and well structured white reminiscent of the classic Sauvignons of the central Loire Valley. Full of incisive citrus fruit character, lifted herbaceous aromatics and cleansing acidity. Drink with fresh seafood.

Title: Alain Jaume 'Grande Garrigue' Organic Vacqueyras 2019/20
Description: Vacqueyras used to be a CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne Villages. But thanks to the quality of its wines, the area was granted Cru status in 1990. Winemaker Sebastien Jaume brings out the best of the regionâ€™s bold style in this organic bottling. His family have been making exceptional RhÃ´ne wines for almost 200 years. So all those generations of experience mean only the finest fruit make the cut. Itâ€™s a blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault grown on the esteemed Les Garrigues plateau â€“ a prime spot for growing flavourful grapes that ripen to perfection. Youâ€™ll find it rich and velvety with notes of black fruits, garrigue herbs and pepper. Its supple tannins and savoury character make it an excellent match for grilled red meats â€“ especially lamb with fragrant rosemary.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Selborne RosÃ© Brut, Hampshire
Description: Selborne captures all the subtle flavours that make English sparkling wine so unique. On the palate, it is wonderfully crisp with delicate summer berry fruits balanced by a hint of lemon zest and a deliciously creamy finish.

Title: The Guv'nor VIP 6 Bottle Taster Case
Silver Ghost Sauvignon Blanc 2022/23, Central Valley
Description: Just because itâ€™s inexpensive, doesnâ€™t mean itâ€™s not great quality. This wine is actually made for us by one of the most prestigious winemaking families in Chile, the Arestis. They know how to get the very best peachy, citrussy flavours out of their grapes, while still keeping prices wallet-friendly. The Central Valley, where this wine is from, is cool but has loads of sunshine â€“ so this is more like a ripe white Bordeaux than a full, tropically fruity Kiwi Sauvignon. The fact is, Chilean wines are just incredible value â€“ a wine of this quality from another country could cost far more. In our book, that makes it the ideal party wine. Itâ€™s got a real citrussy zing and great tropical flavours. Itâ€™s incredibly refreshing, so your guests will be happy to drink it alone, or with finger foods. Itâ€™s hard working bottle which wonâ€™t disappoint.

Title: Russian Jack Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: European settlers arrived in New Zealand in 1840, and set about clearing scrub from what are now top winemaking regions. Originally from Latvia, Russian Jack was one of these gentlemen of the road.  He'd appear on farms at harvest time to pick fruit, well into his old age. As a result, he became a bit of a legend. There's even a statue in his memory. And this wine lives up to his name. It's made with grapes from certified sustainable vineyards, and thereâ€™s no compromise on quality. Every vintage has only one bottling, with the wine left on its spent yeast cells (or â€˜leesâ€™) to concentrate the flavours and add texture. This is a seriously aromatic Sauvignon, with notes of passionfruit, elderflower and gooseberry. Try it with spicy grilled fish.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: The Guv'nor VIP 6 Bottle Wine Case
Description: Just when you thought all the rules were brokenâ€¦The Guvâ€™nor VIP is not the best of two worlds, but three. Robbing grapes from some of the biggest names in Spain â€“Rioja, Ribera del Duero, Toro - this pioneering bandit doesnâ€™t care about tradition. Only great taste. The Guvâ€™nor VIP is an upgrade on everything the Guv'nor stands for: better grapes, meticulously applied oak, and an even smoother, fruitier taste. Heâ€™s taken Majesticâ€™s number one best-selling wine, and made it even better. The Guvâ€™nor rewrote the rule book on wine, taking away vintages, classifications and restrictions. The VIP just wrote a new chapter. The Guvâ€™nor VIP launches exclusively in time for Summer 2023. Drink on warm summer evenings, paired with barbecues or around campfires. This wine packs a punch with bold flavours of black cherry, red plum, and blackberry fruits, balanced with a touch of savoury oak and mellow spice. It's like a black forest gateau with a kick.

Title: Caves des Vignerons de Buxy 'Vieilles Vignes' Montagny 2021/22
Description: Montagny is an appellation in the CÃ´te Chalonnaise. Itâ€™s a real enclave of quality, specialising in Chardonnay. In fact, itâ€™s the only grape thatâ€™s grown in the whole region â€“ so Montagny-based Cave de Buxy really know their Chardonnay inside-out. Montagnyâ€™s limestone soils mean the wines are fresh, with a fuller body than other Chalonnaise wines. The fruit flavours are really pronounced â€“ a factor amped up by the fact that itâ€™s â€˜Vielles Vignesâ€™. Itâ€™s made using grapes from thirty-year-old vines. Because theyâ€™re old, they only yield small amounts of grapes â€“ so all the flavour is exceptionally concentrated. Think ripe apple, citrus and white blossom. The ripeness is balanced by serious crispness, and itâ€™s left unoaked so the fruit flavours can really shine through. Perfect with chicken.

Title: Thymiopoulos Xinomavro 2019/20, Greece
Description: If you're looking to get into Greek wine, Xinomavro is a great place to start. It's one of Greece's star grapes. Think of it as a delicious cross between Barbaresco and Pinot Noir. This example is made by a man whoâ€™s widely recognised as an expert in the art of crafting great Xinomavro. Itâ€™s medium-bodied and complex, with notes of red and black fruit, a vibrant acidity and a long finish. Serve with lamb shank.
Characteristics: Spice, Earth, Red Cherry, Red Plum

Title: Bodegas Bardos Ribera del Duero Reserva 2016/18
Description: Bodegas Bardos sits in the toughest and coldest area of Ribera del Duero, at almost 1,000 metres above sea level. The high-altitude brings elegance and freshness to their bold and powerful wines. This Reserva is made from low-yielding Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon vines. Tim Atkin awarded the 2016 vintage with an impressive 96 points. Aged for 16 months in French oak, it has excellent structure, with balanced tannins and refreshing acidity. Discover rich notes of dark fruit, chocolate, vanilla and smoky-wood spice. Try it with a lamb casserole.

Title: Pelleriti 'Signature' Malbec 2019/20, Mendoza
Description: Marcelo Pelleriti is the first Latin American winemaker to ever score a perfect 100 Parker Points. He has more than 30 years of winemaking experience between Bordeaux and Argentina. And he certainly knows a thing or two about creating first-class wine in the Malbec capital of the world, Mendoza. This is a ripe and fruity wine, with notes of black fruit, red berries and jam. Try it with sirloin steak.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Spice

Title: Definition Malbec 2021/22, Mendoza
Description:
Argentine Malbec is so popular, few people realise the grape is actually native to France. Mendoza, Argentinaâ€™s Malbec-heartland, is the place to look for the style of lush, fruity Malbec which put Argentina on the map. So, when we wanted to add a Malbec to our Definition range, Mendoza was the only place to look. Specifically, the Uco Valley â€“ a sub-region where high-altitude vineyards make the very best Malbec. Working with a top producer, we sourced parcels of super-ripe fruit. The result? This plush, silky red which is all about the plummy, cherry fruit flavours. We only used a very small amount of oak to add a bit of structure, but not overpower the vibrant fruitiness. Itâ€™s a really classic style â€“ so itâ€™s perfect with a good steak or other barbecued meats.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Jackson Estate 'Stich' Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: This is named after Jackson Estateâ€™s founder, John â€˜Stichâ€™ Stichbury, whose family have deep roots in Marlborough. But despite their long history, Jackson Estate have always preferred to keep production low key. Theyâ€™re all about sustainably made wines, made with minimal winemaking intervention. This is released six months later than other Kiwi Sauvignons. Thatâ€™s because it spends extra time ageing on the lees â€“ giving a richness and roundness to the texture. This practice complements the restrained flavours, making for a more French, old-school style Sauvignon rather than the typical Marlborough tropical fruit-bomb. Think gooseberry and zingy rhubarb flavours that are perfect with goat's cheese.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Bodegas Bardos Ribera del Duero Crianza 2019/20
Description: The high-altitude region of Ribera del Duero is known for its robust and deeply fruity red wines. A short and hot growing season helps produce Tempranillo grapes with intense and complex flavours. Bodegas Bardos works in one of the region's most challenging areas to capture the signature style at its very best. After 14 months in oak, itâ€™s beautifully aromatic and has notes of ripe cherry and blackberry, velvety tannins and a complex, spicy finish. The intensity of fruit and fresh acidity make it an excellent pairing for grilled lamb chops.

Title: LB7 Red Reserva 2018, Lisbon
Description:
The delicious LB7 Red is one of our bestselling wines. So what does the Reserva bring to the table? We dial up the flavour and complexity by maturing it in American and French oak. This attention to detail results in a rich and elegant wine that's incredibly food-friendly. Full. Smooth. Moreish. Expect lots of jammy red- and black-fruit flavour with fine tannins. Perfect for roast lamb.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2018 vintage.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Jammy, Red Fruit, Sweet Spice

Title: Bienbebido Pulpo AlbariÃ±o 2021/22, Spain
Description: AlbariÃ±o is usually grown in coastal Spanish regions, but this wine is from a little-known area in Rioja â€“ Valles de Sadacia. Title: Santa Rita 'Medalla Real' CarmÃ©nÃ¨re 2019/21, Colchagua Valley
Description: CarmÃ©nÃ¨re may be Chileâ€™s flagship red grape. But did you know that its history stretches back to Bordeaux? When the tiny phylloxera bugs ravaged Europe in the nineteenth century, Bordeauxâ€™s CarmÃ©nÃ¨re vines were a casualty. It had been a key component of some of the greatest claret at the time â€“ but the vine was only saved by cuttings which had been taken to Chile.  So itâ€™s no wonder that Santa Rita use CarmÃ©nÃ¨re to make this fantastically structured Gran Reserva, which is styled like a classic Bordeaux. Itâ€™s a plush, velvety-smooth wine, packed with intense flavours of blueberry, plum and cassis. The firm tannins make it ideal with red meat.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Earth, Leather, Smoke, Tobacco

Title: BenMarco Malbec 2021/22, Mendoza
Description: BenMarco is made in the Uco Valley, one of the finest spots in Mendoza, under the watchful eye of Susana Balbo. Susana was the first woman in Argentina to graduate with a degree in winemaking and was President of Wines of Argentina no less than three times. So you know you're in for something excellent. Itâ€™s ripe, juicy and seriously concentrated. Packed with flavours of blackberry and oaky vanilla spice. Perfect with steak.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Waimea Estates Pinot Gris 2021/22, Nelson
Description: New Zealand Pinot Gris really is an undiscovered gem. Itâ€™s incredibly aromatic â€“ but refreshing too. Waimea is on the edge of the Tasman Sea â€“ a place regularly credited with being New Zealandâ€™s sunniest spot. Itâ€™s the perfect place to grow Pinot Gris. Sheltered. Coastal. Sunny. The winemaker use specially selected yeasts which draw out the aromatics of the grape. They play it up by ageing the wine on its lees â€“ spent yeast particles â€“ to give more texture and flavour. Think lemon curd, pear drops, lavender and white peaches. Itâ€™s got a lovely lush, creamy, silky texture with hints of exotic spice. Youâ€™ll find it hard not to reach for a second glass. Thereâ€™s nothing better to eat alongside it than seared salmon with nam phrik num dressing.

Title: Chandon Garden Spritz
Description: Chandon Garden Spritz is a refreshing spritz carefully crafted from exceptional sparkling wine and orange peel liqueur â€“ with no artificial additives. Serve over ice for ultimate refreshment.

Title: Tommasi 'Il Sestante' Amarone della Valpolicella DOCG 2017/18
Description: Tommasi have prime sites in some of Valpolicella's best hillside vineyards. It's on these that they produce dazzling and award-winning Amarone. Their signature style is elegance over power. They've come up trumps again with the Il Sestante. Expect a full-bodied palate, smooth tannins and intense aromas of ripe cherries and plums. Decant for at least an hour and serve at room temperature with hard cheeses.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Rauzan-SÃ©gla 'SÃ©gla' 2014/16, Margaux
Description: SÃ©gla is the second wine of the famous Margaux Second Growth ChÃ¢teau Rauzan-SÃ©gla. It's your chance to taste their famous experise for less. Its tannins are ripe and smooth and its deliciously approachable in its youth. It shows fragrant notes of ripe fruits, violets and cedar with beautiful length. Drink it now with roast lamb and rosemary potatoes. Or, if you can wait, this wine will also further improve over the next 7-8 years.

Title: Masi 'Costasera' Amarone della Valpolicella Classico DOCG 2017/18
Description: This is produced by Masi â€“ a byword for quality in Italian winemaking. Amarone is one of the most regulated DOCGs in Italy. Producers arenâ€™t even allowed to pick their grapes until theyâ€™re given official word â€“ so it takes special determination to go above and beyond in pursuit of quality. Masi make it look effortless. Their grapes are dried on special bamboo racks, then fermented for an extraordinary eighty days â€“ about double the standard time â€“ and matured in Slovenian oak. Masi call this their gentle giant â€“ it's beautifully elegant and bold. Discover rich, dark-fruit flavours, with hints of coffee, cocoa and spice. Perfect for strong cheese like Gorgonzola.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Chocolate, Fig, Red Cherry, Red Plum, Sweet Spice

Title: Definition Pouilly-FumÃ© 2021/22
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Pouilly-FumÃ© is one of the Loire Valley's most revered whites and rivalled only by Sancerre when it comes to Sauvignon Blanc. FumÃ© is French for smoke, and it is in Pouilly-FumÃ© Sauvignon that you find the iconic 'gun smoke' aroma. The Definition captures the charm of this special region. Expect fragrant notes of citrus and white peach, a creamy texture, and a delicate hint of smoke. Delicious with spicy dishes.
Characteristics: Smoke, Citrus Fruit, Grass, Green Apple

Title: Beronia Rioja Gran Reserva 2015/16
Description: Some of the best things only come with time. That's certainly the case for Beronia. This was aged for 28 months in oak barrels and three years in the bottle before it was released. It's been mellowing and maturing for four years since â€“ and this gives you that classic Gran Reserva character. This wine has been transformed over time into something incredibly rich, smooth and velvety. Best decanted for an hour before serving with a roast dinner. This wine has won a gold medal at the 2023 IWSC for the 2015 vintage.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Cedar, Cocoa, Dried Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Pasqua 'Villa Borghetti' Chardonnay 2020/21, Veneto
Description: A lot of Italian Chardonnay sits nicely nestled between Old World and New World styles. They can be a little more generous with ripe-fruit flavour, while retaining as much elegance as a classic white Burgundy. If youâ€™ve never tried one before, you can put your trust in one of Venetoâ€™s most renowned wineries to deliver something fantastic. Founded in 1925, Pasqua has a wealth of heritage and winemaking expertise. This third-generation Veronese estate was built on a love of Valpolicella, the regionâ€™s signature red. But as this white wine goes to show, itâ€™s not all that theyâ€™re good at. Made in a distinctly Burgundian style, this Chardonnay has flavours of stone fruit, hazelnut and vanilla. Try it with your favourite creamy pasta dish.

Title: Casal de Ventozela Alvarinho 2021/22, Vinho Verde DOC
Description: Casal De Ventozela produces one of our most popular Vinho Verdes out of the native Arinto grape variety. Its Alvarinho (AlbariÃ±o in Spain) is extremely fresh with flavours of citrus and apple. Complexity and depth are added by ageing in oak barrels and time spent on its lees. This is great with any seafood, especially if cooked with a touch of chili.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple, Peach, Pear

Title: Maison Antech 'Mademoiselle Marguerite' Blanquette de Limoux Brut
Description: Maison Antech has been in the same family for six generations. It's situated in the foothills of the Pyrenees, where every vine is hand-harvested and farmed organically. The attention to detail really shows in this Blanquette de Limoux, the signature sparkling wine of this region. You can expect a blend of Mauzac, Chardonnay and Chenin Blanc aged for a luxurious 24 months on texture-imparting lees. Discover notes of green apple, candied lemon peel and quince with a balancing minerality.
Characteristics: Candied Fruit, Green Apple, Wet Stones

Title: Chanoine FrÃ¨res â€˜RÃ©serve PrivÃ©eâ€™ Brut RosÃ© Champagne
Description: One of the first female winemakers in the Champagne region, Isabelle Tellier has been crafting fine fizz at Chanoine FrÃ¨res for over 20 years. The house itself has even richer history â€“ itâ€™s nearly three centuries old, established back in 1730. Of all of Tellierâ€™s delicious wines, fans of rosÃ© Champagne will have a hard time resisting this velvety, full-bodied fizz. And it's a hit with the critics â€“ Decanter awarded it 92 points and described it as "impressive". Lively. Fruity. Fresh. Discover notes of wild strawberry, raspberry, cherry and apple.

Title: Ayala 'Le Blanc de Blancs' Champagne 2015/16
Description: Ayala, a Champagne house now owned by Bollinger, produces 'Le Blanc de Blancs' in limited quantities only in the best vintages. Winemaker Caroline Latrive, who has rich experience in a wide variety of the leading Champagne houses, picks Chardonnay grapes only from Grand Cru vineyards to craft it. Expect a luxurious, rich texture with pronounced notes of passionfruit and peach. The fruit flavours are balanced by a refreshing, dry minerality and a smooth finish.

Title: Penfolds 'Kalimna Bin 28' Shiraz 2019/20, Australia
Description: Kalimna Bin 28 was first produced in 1959 and is Penfoldsâ€™ earliest Bin-collection wine. Itâ€™s named after Barossa Valleyâ€™s famous Kalimna vineyard, which was bought by Penfolds in 1945. The first releases were made entirely from this plot. Today, Bin 28 is made from multi-region vineyards, ensuring its ripe, robust character is balanced by freshness. Itâ€™s a showcase of warm-climate Australian Shiraz. So if youâ€™re looking for just one â€˜big Aussie redâ€™ to add to your wine collection, make it this. Itâ€™s intense and full of ripe fleshy-fruit flavour. Aromas of plum, vanilla and baking spices lead to flavours of dark raspberry, chocolate and cola. Partner with seared steak.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Coffee, Eucalyptus, Tobacco

Title: Cattier Premier Cru Brut RosÃ© Champagne
Description:
The Cattier family began planting vines in the picturesque village of Chigny-les-Roses in 1625. 1918 saw them release their first Champagne, and the rest is history. Today, the 13th generation of Cattiers uphold the traditions and excellence that they inherited. And the results are unmissable. This is a rich, complex rosÃ© Champagne with notes of blackcurrant, redcurrant and strawberry.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Duckhorn 'Decoy' Merlot 2019/21, Sonoma County
Description: Duckhorn is a Napa Valley icon. Its winemaking team are taking on a new terrain in Sonoma. The best part? The delicious wine made there is a fraction of the usual asking price. This is a lush, inviting Merlot, with notes of black cherry, blueberry, plum and dark chocolate. Pair with tomato-based pasta.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Raspberry

Title: Cillar D Silos 'Torresilo' 2019/20, Ribera del Duero
Description: As a rule of thumb, older vines have more flavoursome grapes. And this is an intense, complex Temperanillo made partially from 100-year-old vines. Expect concentrated notes of red and black fruit, smooth tannins and a long finish. A first-class Ribera red that's great with roast lamb. Decant this for at least an hour before serving at room temperature.

Title: MoÃ«t & Chandon 'Grand Vintage' 2013/15 Champagne
Description: Vintage Champagnes are made solely in the very best years. And MoÃ«t et Chandon accept only the best of the best. In fact, 2013 marks only the 75th Grand Vintage they've released since 1842. They also go several steps further in the winemaking process, ageing this for at least five years in their historic cellars. All the extra effort reflects in elegant flavours of stone fruits, grapefruit, pastry, walnut and biscuit. It's complex, textured and a real treat with salmon.
Characteristics: Walnut, Biscuit, Hazelnut, Nectarine, Pastry, Peach, Pear

Title: Boekenhoutskloof Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/20, Stellenbosch
Description: Boekenhoutskloof and winemaker Marc Kent are behind one of our classic fine wines, The Chocolate Block. And they've smashed the target again with this Cabernet Sauvignon. This is a smooth, textured wine, with notes of black fruit, graphite, sweet spice and cocoa. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with meatballs.

Title: Ciabot Berton Barolo DOCG 2017/18
Description: Barolo is one of Italy's most highly regarded fine-wine styles â€“ with prices that match its stellar reputation. But if you find the right producer, you can still taste something fantastic in the region that doesn't break the bank. Ciabot Berton is a relatively small winery run by brother-and-sister team of Marco and Paola Oberto. They make this wine from a number of vineyards in the celebrated La Morra commune and age it in oak for two years. It's elegant and full-bodied, with aromas of roses, truffle, blackcurrant and cinnamon. Try it with venison stew.
Characteristics: Spice, Earth, Leather, Red Fruit, Rose

Title: Pommery 'Brut RosÃ© Royalâ€™ Champagne
Description: Pommery has been made in Reims since 1836. Under the guidance of pioneering Madame Pommery, it was the first house to create the Brut style of Champagne. She was affectionately known as 'Lady of the Roses'. And this delicious rosÃ© certainly doesn't let her legacy down. It has juicy notes of stone fruit and red berries, with a delicious minerality and a fine mousse.

Title: Rupert & Rothschild Baron Edmond 2017/18, Western Cape
Description: The Rupert & Rothschild partnership began in 1997. Both men were already from prestigious winemaking families. But they had an ambition to create Bordeaux-esque wines in the fantastic South African conditions. They soon produced some of the country's finest wines. The estate is now in the hands of their sons, Anthonji Ripert and Baron Benjamin de Rothschild, who continue the fantastic work. This is a savoury, full-bodied blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. It's complex and silky with notes of blackberries, dark plum, tobacco, vanilla and toast. Try it with a sirloin steak.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Black Plum, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: Pouilly-FumÃ© de Ladoucette 2021/22, France
Description: Father-and-son team Jean and Vincent Chatelain are the 11th and 12th generations of an illustrious Loire wine making family. In fact, the family has been making Loire wines since 1630! This unrivalled level of expertise is translated into this beautiful Sauvignon Blanc that's intense, mineral and concentrated with white-fruit, gooseberry and flint flavours.
Characteristics: Smoke, Citrus Fruit, Grass, Green Apple

Title: Noughty Organic Sparkling Chardonnay 0%
Description: This vibrant sparkling organic Chardonnay has been entirely de-alcoholised. It's all of the enjoyment of your favourite bottle of fizz without the alcohol. Itâ€™s fresh and crisp with notes of green apple and fine bubbles. Itâ€™s the lighter choice for celebrations, but will also be fantastic for a quiet night in with rich, cheesy nibbles.
