Title: Nyetimber 'Classic CuvÃ©e' Brut Half Bottle, Sussex
Description: Nyetimber are located in West Sussex, and since their original plantings of classic varieties in 1988, have established themselves as England's premier sparkling wine house, making world class wines to rival (and often beat in blind tastings) the big names of France. A beguilingly complex nose of citrus fruit, brioche and shortbread. The mousse is finely pearled, soft, yet mouth-filling and persistent. Elegantly shaped and supremely poised. The ultimate home-grown sparkling wine, for all special occasions.
Characteristics: Peach, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple

Title: Nyetimber 'Classic CuvÃ©e' Brut Magnum, Sussex
Description: Nyetimber's head winemaker, Cherie Spriggs, was the first person outside Champagne to be awarded â€˜Sparkling Winemaker of the Yearâ€™ in 2018. She's devoted to impeccably high standards at each stage of production. Nyetimber Classic CuvÃ©e is made using the same â€˜Traditional Methodâ€™ as Champagne, and itâ€™s been known to outperform the finest Champagne in blind tastings. It has a stream of fine, delicate bubbles and flavours of toasted brioche, golden apple, honey and sweet spice. And in this magnum size, it's perfect for a party.
Characteristics: Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple, Peach

Title: Domaine Trouillet â€˜Aux Chaillouxâ€™ Pouilly-FuissÃ© Premier Cru 2020
Description: If youâ€™re a fan of bold, complex Chardonnay, nothing quite hits the mark like Burgundy. The finest â€“ and most expensive â€“ examples come from the CÃ´te de Beaune. But if your wallet wonâ€™t stretch to the asking prices here, head a little further south to the MÃ¢connais. The region is home to Pouilly-FuissÃ© â€“ an appellation renowned for exceptional, yet great value Chardonnay. The Trouillet family have been working the land around Pouilly for generations, and their skills have made them a Majestic favourite. Current winemaker, William Trouillet, is committed to environmentally friendly practices around the estate, crafting complex wines from his 40 to 50 year old vines. This opulent Premier Cru is full and rounded, with aromatic notes of citrus, orchard fruits and fresh blossom. A streak of minerality keeps it refreshing, and makes it a perfect pairing for shellfish.

Title: Ruinart 'Second Skin' Blanc de Blancs Champagne
Description: Ruinart began in 1729 and was the first established house in Champagne. But that doesnâ€™t mean its team has stopped innovating. Its new â€˜second skinâ€™, an alternative to a gift box, is an eco-friendly innovation that reduces the bottleâ€™s packaging carbon footprint by 60%. The paper case, moulded to the shape of the bottle, is entirely recyclable and designed to mimic the region's historic crayÃ¨res cellars. As for whatâ€™s inside the bottle? The same top-quality Blanc des Blanc Champagne that Ruinart is famous for. It's made purely from Chardonnay and has aromas of fresh citrus, white peach, pineapple and flowers. Enjoy it with seafood. Think sea bass tartare or seared sole.

Title: Nivola Lambrusco, Italy
Description: Ruby red colour, enhanced scents of fresh red fuits, typical of Grasparossa grapes. Delicate and aromatic taste with a bright violet froth.

Title: Cattier 'Millesime 2012' Premier Cru Brut Champagne
Description: Prestigious Champagne house Cattier is situated in the heart of Montagne de Reims, surrounded by Premier and Grand Cru vineyards. Vines have been on-site since the 17th Century. Today, the winemaking is in the expert hands of the 13th generation of the Cattier family. Itâ€™s clear they have inherited their ancestors' expertise. The house places special emphasis on Pinot Meunier, using a high proportion in all cuvÃ©es to produce rich, aromatic, fruit-forward Champagnes. This 2012 vintage has spent more than 6 years in the cellar to develop gracefully. It's vibrant and fruity with raspberry, cherry, rhubarb and brioche notes. A hint of fresh pepper on the finish adds to its long, lingering finish. Wonderful with duck Ã  lâ€™orange.

Title: Bollinger Special CuvÃ©e Champagne Half Bottle
Description: A mighty, full-bodied Champagne of great class. Densely packed apple and pear fruits give way to a noticeably creamy, caramel-like finish.

Title: Freixenet 0.0% Alcohol Free Sparkling
Description: Freixenet is the biggest name in Cava. But they're not done there. In search of the sparkling wine fit for all occasions, they created this refreshing, balancing, alcohol-free sparkling wine. It has flavours of tropical fruits and citrus and a persistent mousse.

Title: Emma Marris Sauvignon Blanc 2023, Marlborough
Description:
Emma Marris is the daughter of Brent Marris, the man behind our best-selling Sauvignon Blanc, The Ned. But she's carving her own path as a winemaker. After spending her life surrounded by wine, she applies university-trained, groundbreaking techniques to her Marlborough Sauvignon. And it's a Sauvignon with a real difference. Expect bold, inviting notes of green apple, papaya, lime and lemongrass. Enjoy with a green salad.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Gooseberry, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: M. Chapoutier 'Belleruche' CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne 2021/22
Description:
With a name as well-known in the wine industry as Chapoutier, it's hard to believe that they were once seen as a disruptor. When Michel Chapoutier inherited the family business, he was determined to overhaul their whole process of winemaking to make wines which were as terroir-expressive as possible. His deliciously juicy CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne is a firm Majestic favourite. This wine was made without the use of oak, so itâ€™s fruit-forward and with notes of ripe black cherry, herbs and a kick of peppery spice. It pairs well with lots of foods, especially charcuterie.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: The Ned Pinot Grigio 2022/23, Marlborough
Description: We all know that The Ned is a sure sign of quality Kiwi wine, and their Pinot Grigio has become a bit of a cult favourite among Majestic customers. This is not your standard razor-sharp, green appley Pinot Grigio. Itâ€™s an altogether lusher style, closer to Pinot Gris. Itâ€™s instantly recognisable from its delicate salmon pink colour â€“ made by leaving a portion of wine in contact with the skins. This intensifies the flavours and adds richness. Itâ€™s a beautifully aromatic and moreish wine. Think white peach, honeydew melon and a hint of baking spice. Its creamy texture is complemented by the refreshing finish. Delicious with grilled salmon.
Characteristics: Pear Drop, Blossom, Green Fruit, Nectarine

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Pizay Morgon 2021/22
Description: If youâ€™re looking for a fantastic Beaujolais, you can put your faith in ChÃ¢teau de Pizay, whose wines have been enjoyed since the Middle Ages. This is their flagship red made solely from grapes in Morgon. This area was officially recognised as a Cru and produces a remarkably full-bodied, ripe style of Gamay. Expect hearty notes of cherries and a long finish. Great with charcuterie.

Title: Contesa Pecorino 2021/22, Colline Pescaresi
Description: Pecorino is an early ripening, thin-skinned grape, native to central parts of Italy. The bunches tend to be very triangular in shape, reminiscent of a sheep's head, said to be the reason for the grape's name. Pale yellow, with a remarkably intense nose of citrus fruits, hints of hawthorn and orange blossom. Soft, clean, but persistent palate texture, with a pleasing mineral complexity. Try with nutty cheeses, such as the wine's sheep's milk cheese namesake, or with simple cod dishes.
Characteristics: Lemon, Blossom, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple

Title: ChÃ¢teau Caronne Ste-Gemme 2016/18, Haut-MÃ©doc
Description: When the neighboursâ€™ wines go for Â£50+ a bottle you know youâ€™re onto a good thing. Caronne St-Gemme is only 500 yards from St Julien, next door to ChÃ¢teau Gruaud-Larose and ChÃ¢teau Lascombes â€“ and itself produces classed-growth quality fruit. That makes it not just one of the most reliable Cru Bourgeois â€“ itâ€™s also one of the best value. Itâ€™s classic Haut-Medoc, predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon which means it has a firm structure and lots of tannin â€“ so itâ€™s great with protein, and can age fantastically. Itâ€™s packed with really rich, dark fruit flavours. Plum. Blackberry. Classic Cabernet cassis. Delicious with roast red meat.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Fruit, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Earth, Smoke

Title: ViÃ±a Alarde Rioja Reserva 2016/18
Description: ViÃ±a Alarde is an award-winning bodega, producing reliably delicious Rioja. Theyâ€™re owned by MarquÃ©s de la Concordia â€“ one of a collection of premium wineries. And they bring all their expertise to this classic Reserva. This great value wine is made in a fresh style â€“ itâ€™s fruity and rich, as well as spicy from its Rioja-standard ageing in oak barrels. Itâ€™s fruity, rich and brambly with a touch of vanilla spice. Its velvety tannins make it a delicious partner for roast lamb.

Title: Nunzio Ghiraldi Lugana DOC 2021/22, Italy
Description: Nunzio Ghiraldi Snr sold his delicious grapes off only to watch a famous winery pick up the credit for decades. Not anymore. Twenty years ago, Nunzio Jnr used the vines originally planted by his grandfather to make this dry white wine from the indigenous Turbiana grape. It's fruity and elegant, with notes of almond, peach, apricot and flint, a generous acidity and an excellent length.

Title: Beronia Rioja Crianza 2019/20
Description: Beronia was founded in 1973 by a group of friends who visited La Rioja on holiday. They had a love of its food and wine and even had their own gastronomic society. They were driven by this shared passion and decided to create their own wine to pair with local cuisines â€“ and Bodegas Beronia was born. It's bright and vibrant with red fruits, blackberry and vanilla notes. It's aged for 12 months in oak. This is a short period of time by Rioja standards. As a result, it's all about maximum fruit flavour. Try it with Iberian cold cuts.

Title: Managers' Choice: VIK 'A' Cabernet Sauvignon 2020/21, Cachapoal Valley
Description: In 2004, Alex and Carrie Vik had the ambition to create some of the world's best wines. After a two-year study of 4,300 hectares of Andean wilderness, they're behind some of Chile's finest Cabernet. This one was picked as the best of a delicious pool of contenders by our store managers. It's complex and elegant, with an inviting smooth texture and notes of ripe red fruit and coffee. Enjoy with slow-cooked beef.
Characteristics: Green Bell Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar

Title: Framingham 'Nobody's Hero' Sauvignon Blanc 2020/22, Marlborough
Description: Framingham does things differently. This Marlborough estate holds an outdoor rock concert every harvest. So, as you can imagine, their approach to winemaking is a little unconventional. We love the result. To preserve complexity, each parcel of fruit behind this bold Sauvignon is picked from several sites on Framingham's estate and vinified separately. The result is zesty Sauvignon full of rich guava, apple-skin and pineapple flavours.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Gooseberry, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Definition Chianti Classico DOCG 2019/20
Description:
The Definition range brings definitive examples of the world's greatest wines to Majestic customers. To capture the essence of Chianti, we went to one of the most celebrated producers in the Chianti Classico region. This area is known to produce the finest expression of Chianti, and they've not disappointed. This is a fragrant, well-structured wine, with aromas of sour cherries, plums and wild berries and a long, vibrant finish.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.

Title: Penfolds 'Max's' Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, Australia
Description: Penfolds is Australia's leading winery. The multi-region, multi-grape-varietal winemaking boom began here with Max Schubert. This wine is a tribute to him. It's made by Peter Gago, who has been recognised in The Queenâ€™s Birthday Honours for his winemaking. And it does both these men proud. Itâ€™s a full-bodied, elegant wine, with notes of blueberry, mulberry, mocha and almond, smooth tannins, and a silky finish. Try it with beef.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Sweet Spice, Tobacco

Title: ChÃ¢teau de La Tour de l'Ange Saint-VÃ©ran 2021/22
Description: Winemaker Elise Moore doesnâ€™t only want to make great Chardonnay. She wants to produce environmentally friendly wines that reflect their origin as much as possible. After studying winemaking around the world, she now makes this distinct Chardonnays from a biodiverse vineyard in Saint-VÃ©ran. By minimising the use of oak â€“ this wine is aged in stainless steel vats only â€“ Elise makes a pure expression of the ChÃ¢teau de la Tour de l'Ange terroir. Discover lively aromas of white peach, pear and almond. A streak of minerality adds to the wineâ€™s freshness and would stand up to something rich, like chicken in a creamy leek and bacon sauce.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Tour Bayard 2019/20, Montagne-Saint-Ã‰milion
Description:
This meticulously managed property has be owned by the Nicoletti since 1956.  Hand picking and sorting of the grapes is the norm and the intention is to always make the best quality wine that speaks of its fine terroir. This is a smooth and powerful wine with big flavours of blackcurrant, liquorice and sweet spices. It is drinking beautifully now but could equally be aged for another 5 years. Try this with a rare roast joint of beef.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.

Title: Mendel Selection Malbec 2018/20, Mendoza
Description: Mendelâ€™s founder, Roberto de La Mota likes to joke that he was born in a winery. Before he studied winemaking, he took his first steps under the guidance of his father, renowned Malbec pioneer, Don RaÃºl de la Mota. And just like his father, Roberto has become one of Argentinaâ€™s most famed winemakers. Mendel is a celebration of Robertoâ€™s deep-rooted winemaking heritage. He farms Malbec vines that date back as far as 1928. Along with these old vines and Lujan de Cuyoâ€™s high-altitudes, he skilfully crafts this powerful, elegant and complex wine. Expect notes of red fruit, vanilla, and a touch of spice. Sublime with leg of lamb.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Spice, Vanilla

Title: Cecchi â€˜Governo Allâ€™uso Toscanoâ€™ 2020/21, Chianti DOCG
Description: The Cecchi family has a rich Tuscan history. And today they adopt an 18th-century winemaking method to make this a rich, fruity style of Chianti. Made primarily from Sangiovese, this is a smooth wine with notes of ripe red fruits and a balancing acidity. Excellent with mushroom pasta.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Red Fruit

Title: Domini Veneti Soave Classico DOC 2021/22
Description: Domini Veneti have been a firm favourite of Majestic customers for many years. Theyâ€™re best known for their â€˜La Casettaâ€™ Valpolicella Ripasso, but this white blend of Garganega, Trebbiano and Chardonnay grapes is a head-turner in its own right. Produced from grapes grown on volcanic soils in the heart of the Soave Classico region, Domini Veneti pour over 30 years of experience into every bottle. Youâ€™ll find notes of blossom, citrus and pineapple, plus a creamy texture that pairs well with seafood dishes. Try it with salmon ceviche.
Characteristics: Blossom, Citrus Fruit, Pineapple, Tropical Fruit

Title: Primitivo 'Il Feudo' 2021/22, Puglia
Description: Puglia, Italyâ€™s heel, is the ideal region for great Primitivo. It thrives in the warmth here and the bright sunshine helps perfectly ripen its thick skins. Crisp sea breezes refresh the vines,  giving the grapes plenty of time on the vine and letting flavours develop slowly. This is made by a family winery that has over a century of winemaking history since it was founded in 1910 â€“ so you know youâ€™re in for something great. Itâ€™s rich and bold with flavours of black fruits and Mediterranean herbs with a spicy finish. Itâ€™s perfect for rustic pasta or Pizza with 'Nduja.

Title: Castello Banfi Rosso di Montalcino DOC 2019/20
Description:
Banfi was founded in 1978 by Italian-American wine merchants from New York. In the time since, they've been named International Winery of the Year five times and Italian Winery of the Year 13 times. This is a fresher alternative to Brunello, with a full body, flavours of liquorice, plum and vanilla and great balance. Pair this with medium cheeses.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2017 vintage.

Title: Domodo Negroamaro 2021/22, Puglia
Description: Our store managers know Majestic customers best. Which is why once a year we task them with selecting a wine they know you'll love. In 2018, they overwhelmingly chose this. Indulge in an intense palate of blackcurrant and wild bramble fruit, elevated by charming hints of thyme and sweet spice.

Title: Vasse Felix 'Filius' Cabernet-Merlot 2020/21, Margaret River
Description: The Margaret River region, in Western Australia, makes some of the countryâ€™s finest Cabernet Sauvignon â€“ and the founder of Vasse Felix is partly to thank. Inspired by European wines in the 1960s, Dr Thomas Brendan Cullity was the first to plant vines by the Wilyabrup Brook. Decades after his inaugural vintage, many other wineries have cropped up nearby, but Vasse Felix remains among the finest. This juicy Bordeaux-style blend has opulent strawberry and raspberry flavours and soft tannins. Pair with a steak sandwich or rich pork stew.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Leather, Spice, Sweet Spice

Title: Naudin PÃ¨re et Fils Chardonnay 2021/22, France
Description: Doudet-Naudin was founded in 1849 and is one of the oldest maisons in Burgundy. This Chardonnay is made by the same fantastic winemaker behind their most expensive white Burgundy, Christophe Rochet, but from grapes grown all across France. It's your chance to taste his expertise at a lower price. It's remarkably aromatic, with flavours of mango, peach and citrus. It has a freshness which is great with white fish.

Title: Oliver Dubois Muscadet 2020/22, Loire
Description: Muscadet from the Loire Valley, made from Melon de Bourgogne, is famously lean, green and perfect with seafood. The Oliver Dubois is the perfect introduction to the style with zesty, palate-tingling citrus flavours and bracing acidity that'll go down a treat with oysters, mussels and other 'fruits de mer'.

Title: Caves d'Esclans 'The Beach by Whispering Angel' 2021/22, CÃ´teaux d'Aix-en-Provence
Description: Whispering Angelâ€™s pioneering winemaker Sacha Lichine revolutionised rosÃ© wine â€“ and heâ€™s turned his attention to creating this new label. This wine doubles as ChÃ¢teau d'Esclansâ€™s mission statement: the same love and care that goes into each bottle should go into protecting our planet. It represents their commitment to sustainability, protecting the planet, and the preservation of our beaches. And itâ€™s even packaged in a light-weight bottle with an eco-friendly label. Itâ€™s an elegant and refreshing blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah. Expect a crisp wine with subtle stone-fruit flavours, herbal notes and a mineral finish that pairs perfectly with fresh seafood dishes.

Title: Corallo Nero dâ€™Avola Organic 2020/21, Sicily
Description: With its sun-drenched landscapes and moderate rainfall, the Mediterranean island of Sicily is a prime place for organic grape-farming. And the young winemaker behind this bottle, Marco Lachemet, knows how to make the most of it. Set between 200 and 450 metres above sea level, his organic vineyards have shown to be perfect place for growing fruity Nero Dâ€™Avola, Sicilyâ€™s trademark red grape. This is bright and packed with red-berry aromas. It's smooth, fresh and incredibly drinkable. Youâ€™ll love it with meat dishes, such as ox-cheek ragÃ¹.

Title: Naudin PÃ¨re et Fils Pinot Noir 2022, France
Description: Doudet-Naudin was founded in 1849 and is one of the oldest maisons in Burgundy. Just like their most-expensive bottles, this is made by their fantastic winemaker and owner, Christophe Rochet. But this time it's from grapes grown all across France. It's your chance to taste his expertise at a lower price. Expect a light, velvety Pinot Noir with flavours of red and black fruits. It has a snappy acidity that's great with roast chicken.

Title: Selvapiana Chianti Rufina Riserva DOCG 2018/20
Description: Francesco Giuntini is one of the most respected winemakers in Chanti Rufina. He now crafts this organically, and it goes a long way to show why Chianti Rufina is well worth looking out for. This is a perfumed, elegant red with fine-grained tannins, flavours of dark cherries and spice and a freshness on the finish.

Title: Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ© 'ParallÃ¨le 45' Organic CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne 2020/21
Description:
Domaine Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ© was founded in 1834. The name is behind some of the RhÃ´ne Valley's most historic and celebrated wines. Since 2006, the estate has been in the hands of accomplished winemaker Caroline Frey. Her leadership has seen the estate gain organic accreditation. This Grenache-Syrah blend is named after the 45th parallel north â€“ the circle of latitude, which passes close to the winery, located close to the famous hill of Hermitage. Along with traditional barrel ageing, the wine spends a few months in stainless steel tanks, helping retain freshness and lively aromas. Itâ€™s wonderfully fragrant, with floral, bramble and sweet spice notes. Bold, ripe fruit flavours make it a superb choice to enjoy with a cheese board.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry, Spice

Title: Domaine du Vaux St Georges Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Touraine
Description: Lovers of Sancerre will recognise Touraine as a source of equally superb Sauvignon Blanc. And customer-favourite Domaine du Vaux St Georges craft some of the regionâ€™s best wines. Their vines sit close to the banks of the Cher River, where sandy and flinty soils help to bring richness and minerality to the finished wines. This bottling is vibrant with notes of citrus, elderflower blossom and a note of cedar. Itâ€™s crisp acidity and freshness make it an ideal choice for any fish or shellfish.

Title: Baron Edmond de Rothschild 'Rimapere' Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: You might not associate the Rothschild name with Marlborough, since the family are famed in Bordeaux for some of the finest chÃ¢teaux in the world. But Benjamin de Rothschild was so fond of Marlborough Sauvignon, he bought the best land possible and flew in award-winning French winemaker, Anne Escalle in order to create his own. The winery is situated next to Cloudy Bay in whatâ€™s known as the â€˜Golden Triangleâ€™ â€“  arguably the oldest and most established spot of Marlborough. The Rothschild exacting requirements for excellence shine through in this single-vineyard Sauvignon. Expect aromas of lemon, gooseberry and green tea, plus a long, smooth finish. Try it with grilled meaty swordfish to make its flavours sing.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Domaine Olivier Foucher Menetou-Salon 2021/22
Description: If youâ€™ve never heard of Menetou-Salon, this is the perfect introduction. It's a tiny appellation in the Loire region. And their Sauvignon Blanc has an amazing concentration of flavour. Expect herb and citrus aromas, with a crisp acidity. Serve with a goatâ€™s cheese salad.

Title: Domaine Moillard-Thomas Santenay Rouge 2018/19
Description: Moillard-Thomas is one of the oldest wine merchants in Nuits-Saint-Georges. It was established by LÃ©once Bocquet, who, at the time, was owner of the chÃ¢teau within Clos de Vougeot â€“ the largest and most famous Grand Cru vineyard in the CÃ´te de Nuits. So naturally, standards have been high since the very beginning. From Chablis right down to Beaujolais, the winery has been partnered with several reliable growers for generations, allowing the team to craft some of the finest wines in the region. This Santenay is a shining example of their skill. 12 months in oak barrels gives it complexity and structure. Discover lively notes of raspberry and cherry, plus a touch of vanilla and fresh minerality on the finish. Its juicy fruit flavours and fresh acidity makes it a great choice for rich stews and casseroles.

Title: Domaine de Villemajou Organic CorbiÃ¨res Boutenac Rouge 2020/21
Description: Located on a sun-soaked ridge in the South of France, CorbiÃ¨res-Boutenac is a relatively new sub-region of the Languedoc, dedicated to producing red wines of exceptional quality. Domaine de Villemajou sits at the heart of the appellation, and is considered one of its top estates. Itâ€™s where winemaker-owner GÃ©rard Bertrand first discovered his passion for wine â€“ his father owned the domaine in the â€˜70s, and GÃ©rard had been helping out with harvests since the age of ten. His drive for excellence shines through in this complex, structured red. Itâ€™s full of rich, jammy black-fruit flavours with notes of sweet spice, coffee and leather that make it a perfect match for grilled red meats. Try decanting it a few hours beforehand to let the flavours truly sing.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Dried Herbs

Title: Definition Riesling Kabinett 2021/22, Mosel
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Riesling's spiritual home is on the dizzying slopes in Mosel, Germany. The best vines here are grown on steep, south-facing terraces, where grapes benefit from day-long sun exposure, and so ripen to perfection. This off-dry wine is a classic Kabinett Riesling, and to ensure we captured the best of this iconic region, we went to Riesling rockstar Ernst Loosen. His ancestors have made wine here for over 200 years, and the Loosen name is now synonymous with some of Germanyâ€™s most loved wines. Itâ€™s fruity and elegant, with notes of blossom, citrus, stone fruits and lychee. Its zesty acidity perfectly balances its subtle sweetness, making it an all-round perfect match for lightly spiced Asian dishes.

Title: Petaluma â€˜White Labelâ€™ Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/19, Coonawarra
Description: Petaluma believe that to make the best wine, you need to plant the right grape varieties in the right regions. This philosophy has certainly paid off â€“ theyâ€™re renowned for their premium Yellow Label wines that showcase the best of Australiaâ€™s regional classics. Itâ€™s no surprise, then, that they chose Coonawarra to make this fantastic Cabernet. The famed terra rossa soils and cooling sea breezes create the ideal environment for the grapes, resulting in an elegant style similar to that of Bordeaux. Discover notes of cassis, mint, spice and eucalyptus, alongside soft tannins. Its complexity and depth of flavour will pair perfectly with red meats like beef or lamb.

Title: Adega de PegÃµes â€˜Selected Harvestâ€™ White 2021/22, Portugal
Description:
This elegant white is made by Portugalâ€™s most awarded cooperative. They have over 900 international awards and were awarded IWSC Portuguese producer of the year in both 2017 and 2018. Winemaker Jaime Quendera makes this from a selection of four native Portuguese grapes. Aged in oak, it's creamy with stone fruit and vanilla flavours. A great value alternative to white Burgundy that's fantastic with crab linguine drizzled in chilli oil.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Cream, Floral

Title: LB7 Red 2019/20 Boxed Wine 2.25L, Lisbon
Description: Portuguese red blends are a Majestic speciality. They're easy-drinking, rich, packed with juicy fruit flavours and great value. Not to mention, they're a bit out of the ordinary. We look for a blend of exotic Portuguese grape varieties to give you something a little different and a lot more exciting. And we've really stepped up our game with this exclusive box. It's made by one of Portugal's most-awarded producers in homage to Lisbon's legendary food scene. It's big. It's bold. It's very drinkable â€“ all brambly fruit with a kick of spice. Plus, it'll enhance any richly flavoured food you throw at it, whether that's barbecue or a warming casserole.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Spice

Title: Villa Maria 'Cellar Selection' AlbariÃ±o 2020/21, Gisborne
Description: In 1962 George Fistonich â€“ now Sir George â€“ told his father he was quitting carpentry to try his hand at making wine. His gamble more than paid off. His estate is now not just a household name, but New Zealandâ€™s most-awarded winery. Sauvignon Blanc lovers will know that New Zealand is the place to go for wines with mouth-watering freshness. But the true potential of new grape varieties grown here are just being discovered. AlbariÃ±o is fairly new to Villa Mariaâ€™s repertoire, but it thrives in Gisborneâ€™s sunshine. More importantly, the regionâ€™s cool nights mean that the grapes retain their acidity, giving it delicious crisp and refreshing flavours. It has fresh, zingy flavours of lime, peach, apricot and honeysuckle that are ideal with seafood served with a squeeze of lemon.

Title: Marea Syrah 2020/21, Leyda Valley
Description: Thought Chile ends at good value? Think again. If you do some digging, you can find refined reds on cool-climate sites. Like the Marea. It's made by Nicolas Bizzarri, who previously worked at the iconic Robert Mondavi winery in Napa Valley. Expect notes of blackberry, cherry, black olive and white pepper. Pair this with mushroom risotto.

Title: LFE 900 Single-Vineyard 2016/17, Colchagua Valley
Description:
This wine is a blend of Syrah, Petite Syrah, Grenache and Mourvedre. All are sourced from the same high-altitude vineyard in Colchagua Valley, which enjoys average temperatures 3oC lower than in the valley floor, producing intensely flavoured, slow-ripened grapes. As a result the wine is a symphony of ripe, dense black fruit flavour, structured by muscular yet velvety tannins.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2017 vintage.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Coffee, Raspberry

Title: Grant Burge 'Fifth Generation' Shiraz 2018, Barossa
Description: Fifth-generation winemaker, Grant Burge,  is the name behind one of Australia's most respected and innovative producers. His family's roots in the Barossa Valley stretch back to 1855, when they immigrated from Wiltshire, England. Their classic South Australian wines are now recognised worldwide for their consistent quality as a result of being crafted from the finest Barossa fruit and passionate hands-on winemaking. This Shiraz â€“ named in honour of the Burge family's winemaking heritage â€“ is an excellent balance of classic Barossa power and elegant freshness. It's full of ripe plum, blueberry and strawberry with notes of black pepper, clove and chocolate. A wine this flavoursome will pair perfectly with punchy barbecued meats.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Chocolate, Cloves

Title: Festive French Classics 12 Bottle Mixed Wine Case
Description: Discover favourites from France's iconic wine regions with this mixed case. From Bordeaux and Burgundy to the sunny south coast, these bottles are classics for a reason.

Title: Kanonkop 'Kadette' Pinotage 2019/20, Stellenbosch
Description: Kanonkop was named Outstanding Producer of the Past 50 Years at the International Wine and Spirits Competition in 2019. The family-owned estate is considered to many as the equivalent of a South African First Growth. And when you taste what they've done with the country's star grape, Pinotage, you'll know why. Made in a soft, fruit-forward style, it spends 12 months in French oak barrels to give a silky-smooth texture. This is a complex Pinotage wine, with notes of raspberry, strawberry, red cherry and chocolate. Try it with a hearty beef burger.
Characteristics: Coffee, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant

Title: Definition Chardonnay 2021/22, Limoux
Description:
Limoux is an insider secret for all but the most ardent Chardonnay lovers. Itâ€™s in the Languedoc, but itâ€™s higher and cooler than the rest of the region. This means the wines are more concentrated, more aromatic and more delicious. Chardonnay thrives here. So it was a no-brainer to head here for the Definition. Pineapple. Peaches. Vanilla. Itâ€™s a wonderfully ripe, deliciously aromatic wine with a lovely creamy, full texture. Itâ€™s delicious with anything cream or butter-based, like BÃ©arnaise sauce.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Louis Latour 'Domaine de Valmoissine' Pinot Noir 2020/21, Var
Description: Pinot Noir can be a really difficult grape. Itâ€™s why itâ€™s usually so expensive. But leave it to Louis Latour, Burgundy superstars, to find a way to make to a Pinot Noir which is both delicious and every-day affordable. They looked to Var, in Southern France. An unusual choice, perhaps, for this cool-climate-loving grape, but at 500 meters above sea level youâ€™re guaranteed the perfect conditions. Itâ€™s made on the site of an abandoned monastery at the same altitude as the Grand Cru red Burgundies which made Latourâ€™s name. Cherry. Raspberry. Blackcurrants. Itâ€™s fruity â€“ but with a savoury edge which is pure Pinot. The main problem with inexpensive Pinot Noirs tends to be that theyâ€™re too light â€“ but this is silky and fresh. A really delicious glassful, perfect with a charcuterie platter.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Dried Herbs, Strawberry

Title: Jim Barry 'Cover Drive' Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/20, Australia
Description: Thought Australian wines were all sun, fruit and alcohol? Think again. The Jim Barry winery specifically chose to pick its Cabernet Sauvignon grapes from the cooler-climate Clare Valley and Coonawarra regions. In these spots, the grape develops deliciously over a long ripening period. The result is an Old World-esque wine with notes of blackberries, cherries, mocha and oak. 'This release hails from the Jim Barry winery - awarded the prestigious 'Winery of the year' accolade by the James Halliday Wine Companion Awards.'
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Cedar, Eucalyptus

Title: Abbotts & Delaunay â€˜Les Fruits Sauvagesâ€™ Malbec 2020/21, Languedoc
Description: French Malbec is scarce outside of the South West and the Loire. But Languedoc experts Abbotts & Delaunay uncovered 30-year-old vines amongst their plots in the warm HÃ©rault department. Older vines produce fewer grapes, but they have much greater concentration and complexity. To balance the ripe flavour of these sun-soaked vines, grapes from the cooler Aude department are added to the blend. The result is a bold, fruity red marked by freshness and elegance. Rich. Powerful. Spicy. Discover intense notes of red and black fruits with a hint of liquorice. Just like your favourite bottle of Mendoza, this is excellent with a chargrilled steak.

Title: Pringle Bay Chenin Blanc 2022, Western Cape
Description: Friends Duncan Savage and Thys Louw created The Project in 2017. But the pair are far from being the new kids on the block in South Africaâ€™s wine scene. Duncan is behind the highly acclaimed and multi-awarded Savage brand, while Thys is a sixth-generation winemaker. In 2021, we launched their Pringle Bay Sauvignon Blanc. Itâ€™s been so successful we couldnâ€™t wait to see what the duo would put their hand to next. The answer is this deliciously fresh, unoaked Chenin Blanc. Its grapes are mostly sourced from coastal vineyards, so the cool breezes that blow in from the Atlantic have a marked impact on the flavours that develop in the wine. If youâ€™re a fan of Pinot Grigio, this makes a fantastic alternative. Lively. Fresh. Crisp. Expect juicy citrus and apple flavours with a long, zesty finish. Its aromatic character makes it the perfect pairing for fragrant and spicy Asian dishes.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Grimont 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' 2017/18, Cadillac CÃ´tes de Bordeaux
Description: Made from selected parcels of grapes grown on clay/gravel soils this is a classic claret with flavours of blackcurrant, plum and cedar. Aged to perfection this is a treat you will not want to miss Made from selected parcels of grapes grown on clay/gravel soils this is a classic claret with flavours of blackcurrant, plum and cedar. Aged to perfection, this is a treat you will not want to miss. Try it with a warming beef ragu or herb encrusted slow roast lamb.

Title: La Baume 'CuvÃ©e Florence' Piquepoul Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Languedoc
Description: The Languedoc is hot. So at first glance, itâ€™s not the best place to grow Sauvignon Blanc and Picpoul (also known as Piquepoul). Both of these grapes need a bit of coolness to keep their crispness. Luckily, these grapes are grown close to the Thau lagoon. Itâ€™s the biggest saltwater lagoon in France â€“ and it helps to moderate the intensity of the heat. This delicious Picpoul-Sauvignon Blanc has the best of both worlds. All the tropical fruit flavours which develop in intense sunshine â€“ and all the cool-climate zing of a citrusy G&T. Itâ€™s lemony. Itâ€™s peachy. Itâ€™s got a lovely herbal edge. And it's fantastic with oysters.

Title: Definition Barolo DOCG 2017/18
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Barolo is one of Italy's most iconic wines. To some, it is the very best. To capture the very best elements of it, we went to a family-run company who are considered local pioneers in the region. They didn't take the task lightly. This is aged for at least 24 months before release. As a result, it's intense and wonderfully aromatic, with notes of red fruits and creamy oak and silk-smooth tannins. Try it with game birds or a roast dinner.

Title: Behind Closed Doors Reserva Red 2018/19, Lisbon
Description:
Casa Santos Lima is a family winery with global ambitions: to share their love of distinctly Portuguese wines with the world. For their efforts, theyâ€™ve won â€˜Portuguese National Producer of the Yearâ€™ a whopping five times. Their brilliance certainly shows in this expert blend of Portuguese grape varieties. It's big, bold, powerful and full of plum, blackberry and vanilla. Itâ€™s delicious with rustic meat dishes, like casseroles.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.

Title: La Belle AngÃ¨le Pinot Noir 2020/21, France
Description: For a distinctive taste of what makes French Pinot Noir so adored, donâ€™t miss La Belle AngÃ¨le Pinot Noir. Itâ€™s made from grapes expertly-selected across several French regions. This means the winemakers can create a wine with the perfect balance of rich flavour and freshness. And because it's not from a single designated area, you can get it for an incredible price. Expect flavours of ripe red cherry, gentle notes of sweet spice and satisfying length. It's a great partner for roast chicken.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Black Cherry, Dried Herbs, Spice

Title: Porta 6 Vinho Verde 2021/22
Description: When James Martin recommended Porta 6 red on Saturday Kitchen it quickly became one of our most popular wines. Naturally, we wanted to introduce an equally delicious example of Portuguese white wine. We opted for a classic: Vinho Verde. Itâ€™s Portugalâ€™s signature glass of white â€“ youâ€™ll be offered it in every bar, restaurant and street-side cafÃ© from Lisbon to the Algarve. The winery sits on the edge of the Atlantic. Cool ocean breezes help retain freshness in the grapes prior to picking. And that's clear from the first sip. Itâ€™s crisp and thirst-quenching with zingy citrus in abundance. The gentle, refreshing spritz makes it an excellent apÃ©ritif â€“ or else try it with seafood.

Title: MarquÃ©s de Riscal Verdejo 2021/22, Rueda
Description: Since it was founded in 1858, MarquÃ©s de Riscal has been one of Spain's most inventive wineries. They were the first to create fresh, fruity Verdejo in the Rueda region. They also make it from older vines (30 years old) than many of the other estates. As older vines nourish the tastiest grapes, you can rest assured that you're in for a real treat. This is smooth, fresh and aromatic with notes of tropical fruits, verbena and fresh-cut grass. Try it with shellfish.

Title: Famille Perrin Ventoux 2021/22
Description: The Perrin family make ChÃ¢teau de Beaucastel ChÃ¢teauneuf du Pape â€“ one of the most famous reds from the RhÃ´ne Valley. This silky Ventoux red is equally impressive, and it wonâ€™t leave as big a dent in your wallet. Just inside the Provence region sits the mighty Mont Ventoux. Cycling fans will know it as the most gruelling climb of the Tour de France. Though the vines that grow on the mountainâ€™s slopes arenâ€™t half as demanding. Grapes retain their natural acidity thanks to the high altitude, so resulting wines are wonderfully aromatic and full of freshness. This is supple, fresh and juicy. Flavours of blackberry, blackcurrant and a touch of cinnamon will complement slow-cooked pulled pork.

Title: Terrazas de los Andes Malbec 2020/21, Mendoza
Description:
From vineyards situated at over 1000 metres above sea level, this is a Malbec of Mendoza's trademark intensity and purity of fruit, which is further enhanced by use of only the free-run wine, aged for 12 months in a mixture of new and old French and American oak barrels. The wine is harmonious and smooth, with racy notes of violet and graphite accenting the backbone of plum and currant fruit, followed by a finish reminiscent of dry cherries, raisins and prunes. Ideal with rare roasted lamb or beef, or heavily seasoned rustic, meaty sausages.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Chocolate, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Tobacco

Title: Definition GrÃ¼ner Veltliner 2020/21, Austria
Description:
Our exclusive Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. When Austriaâ€™s GrÃ¼ner Veltliner grape started to turn heads, our buyers beelined for a winemaker they knew would craft something special. Markus Huber knows the grape inside out. So itâ€™s no surprise he was once named Best White Wine Producer by the International Wine Challenge. With vines planted throughout the Danube Valley, heâ€™s able to create a perfectly balanced and fresh wine which captures the signature flavours of this unique grape. If youâ€™re yet to sample all that Austria has to offer, this bottle is the perfect starting point. Aromatic. Textured. Fresh. Discover bold and zesty notes of blossom, citrus and stone fruits, plus a hallmark touch of white-pepper spice. Its full, fruity flavour makes it incredibly food-friendly, so try it with everything from vegetarian dishes to your favourite curry.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Robert Oatley 'Signature Series' Chardonnay 2021/22, Margaret River
Description: Margaret River is widely respected for its European-style wines. This cooler-climate Australian region is perfect for Chardonnay grapes. Here, they mature slowly on the vine, making for complex and elegant Chardonnay that's celebrated worldwide. This is your chance to taste what the fuss is about at a lower price. It's rich and toasty, with notes of lemon, peach, vanilla, butter and cream that are best with salmon.

Title: Santa Rita '120' Merlot 2021/22, Central Valley
Description: In 1814, Chile was in the throes of a civil war and 120 soldiers sought refuge in Santa Ritaâ€™s cellar. A century later, theyâ€™re still maturing wines in those same cellars. The 120 range was created to commemorate this legend. Itâ€™s also a testament to Santa Ritaâ€™s legacy in Chile. Theyâ€™re one of the countryâ€™s most celebrated producers â€“ and we can see why. This is a masterclass in Merlot. Itâ€™s got that red-fruit ripeness that's typically Chilean, and a lovely full-but-smooth texture. The perfect choice to go with lighter meat dishes â€“ or even richer fish like monkfish or salmon.
Characteristics: Ripe Fruit, Black Fruit, Red Fruit

Title: Winzer Krems 'Orange' GrÃ¼ner Veltliner 2020/21, Austria
Description: In Krems, winemaking goes back more than 2,000 years. So it's safe to say that Winzer Krems, one of Austria's most significant producers, is a project that honours tradition and exceptional quality. Their GrÃ¼ner Veltliner is a deep gold colour, from its time spent in contact with its skins. Discover complex flavours of pepper and honey, with a fresh finish. This is an incredibly versatile wine, so don't be afraid to pair it with complex aromatic dishes, like Thai food.

Title: Yalumba Y Series Tempranillo 2020/21, Australia
Description: Yalumba has been in the same family since 1849. Over nearly two centuries, theyâ€™ve refined the art of show-stopping fine wine, as well as affordable everyday bottles known and loved worldwide. Tempranillo is often associated with Rioja. But Yalumba have broken conventions and put an exceptional Aussie twist on this traditionally Spanish grape. It has flavours of blackberries, cherries, chocolate and sweet spices. Try it with lamb cutlets.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Dried Herbs, Liquorice, Red Cherry, Smoke, Sour Cherry

Title: Pavillon La Tourelle Bordeaux SupÃ©rieur 2019
Description: If youâ€™re a fan of classic French reds that combine great quality with incredible value, look to wines labelled â€˜Bordeaux SupÃ©rieurâ€™. A step up from your average bottle, these delicious blends are made from vines with lower yields of grapes. Lower yields mean more concentrated flavours â€“ and once you add a minimum of 12 months of oak ageing, youâ€™re in for a flavourful, complex wine thatâ€™s a steal for the quality. Weâ€™re proud to have the UK exclusive on this example. Its distinctive label is inspired by the fortified turrets â€“ or â€˜tourellesâ€™ â€“ that were built to defend Bordeaux from sea-faring invaders. Expect fresh notes of black fruits, spice, menthol and a hint of liquorice. Itâ€™s a versatile wine thatâ€™ll pair well with charcuterie and other cold meats.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Liquorice, Spice

Title: Creation Chardonnay 2021/22, Walker Bay
Description: In 2002, Jean-Claude and Carolyn Martin struck up the courage to start the Creation winery on the picturesque Hemel-en-Aarde ridge. Back then, this lofty spot had never seen a vine before. Today, they create exceptional Chardonnay sustainably and you'll get the high-altitude benefits in every sip. This is a Burgundy-style Chardonnay with South African sensibilities, expect flavours of peach, pear and vanilla and a refreshing minerality. Jean-Claude and Carolyn suggest pairing it with creamy pasta.

Title: Carpe Diem Feteasca Alba 2021/22, Moldova
Description: No country better demonstrates the hidden treasures of Eastern Europe than Moldova. Many drinkers might regard it as a relatively new winemaking country; however, wines have been produced here for over five thousand years. Soviet times saw a drop off in quality and reputation, but producers such as Carpe Diem continue to set new trends for the industry. For four generations, the Lucas family have dedicated their lives to crafting expressive wines that reflect their unique terroir and local wine making traditions. However, the last century presented significant obstacles. In 1949, under the Soviet Union regime, the Lucasâ€™ vineyards were nationalised and the whole of their family were deported to a Siberian labour camp. After several years, part of the family managed to return to the winery. And today, almost sixty years on, the Carpe Diem estate is thriving. While the Soviet threat has returned â€“ with the winery pausing operations to aid their Ukrainian neighbours â€“ their wines continue to go from strength to strength. Crafted from an indigenous variety, Feteasca Alba, this dry white has crisp notes of jasmine, white peach and newly cut grass. Itâ€™s light and fresh â€“ perfect for serving as an apÃ©ritif or with soft cheeses.
Characteristics: Blossom, Citrus Fruit, Grass, Green Apple

Title: Domaine AndrÃ© et Edmond Figeat â€˜Melodyâ€™ Pouilly-FumÃ© 2021/22
Description: Pouilly-FumÃ© is, to many, the finest expression of Sauvignon Blanc in France. It has a signature smokiness ('FumÃ©' is French for 'smoke) that's imitated the world over. But nothing beats the real thing. This one is made by one of the most-experienced family wineries in the region. AndrÃ© Figeat and his daughter, Anne-Sophie, apply no-expense-spared winemaking practices (strict pruning measures and plenty of patience) to bring the ripest Pouilly-FumÃ© to your glass. Expect flavours of citrus, peach and grapefruit, gunflint aromas and a long finish. Thanks to lees-ageing, it has a textured complexity that's great with goat's cheese.

Title: DomÃ¤ne Wachau 'WeingÃ¤rten Weissenkirchen' GrÃ¼ner Veltliner Smaragd 2021/22, Wachau
Description:
With wild strawberries growing among the vines, it's no wonder why DomÃ¤ne Wachau was awarded the Best Vineyard in Europe in 2020 by World's Best Vineyards. Sustainability and biodiversity are paramount here, and it shows through their characterful wines. Expect notes of ripe apples, pears and tobacco. Drink with Vietnamese noodles.

In 2022, the 2020 vintage was awarded 93 points by Decanter.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Santa Rita '120' CarmÃ©nÃ¨re, Central Valley
Description: CarmÃ©nÃ¨re is Chile's secret weapon. And Santa Rita is one of the country's best wineries. A lively and juicy example of the grape, '120' will provide drinking pleasure time and again. Pair the plentiful fruit and subtle spice with hearty homecooked dishes.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Raspberry, Tobacco

Title: Santa Rita '120' Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Central Valley
Description: In 1814, Chile was in the throes of a civil war, and 120 soldiers sought refuge in Santa Ritaâ€™s cellar. A century later, theyâ€™re still maturing wines in those same cellars. The 120 range was created to commemorate this legend. Itâ€™s also a testament to Santa Ritaâ€™s legacy in Chile. Theyâ€™re one of the countryâ€™s most celebrated producers â€“ and you can taste why in this Sauvignon Blanc. It's crisp and zesty, with flavours of lemon, lime, green apple and passionfruit. It has a refreshing acidity that'll cut through the richness of goat's cheese.

Title: Yalumba Y Series Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Australia
Description: The grapes behind Yalumba's Y Series Sauvignon Blanc are picked in the cool of night to bring every hint of grapefruit, Granny Smith apple and white blossom to your glass. It's also stirred on its complexity-building lees. So you're in for a structured sip.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Gooseberry, Grapefruit, Grass, Lemon, Lime, Peach

Title: ChÃ¢teau Bel Air Bergerac Rouge 2020
Description: Bergerac is Franceâ€™s unsung hero. Some consider it to be in the shadow of Bordeaux, but savvy buyers know that itâ€™s renowned for its similar reds â€“ at wallet-friendly prices. Blends here often include the same traditional grape varieties as its famous neighbour. And if you know where to look, you can find some real gems. This expressive red is made by a fourth-generation family winery nestled on the hillside of the Dordogne Valley. The nearby river regulates temperature year-round, ensuring grapes are perfectly ripe â€“ bringing even more flavour to your glass. Itâ€™s elegant and rounded, with ripe red and black fruit notes and toasty vanilla. Generous tannins will complement the bold flavours of barbecued meats, so partner with a grilled steak.

Title: Von Der Land Zweigelt 2021/22, Austria
Description: This Austrian wine is a project between the prestigious Bauer family and one of the country's leading wine experts, Ferdinand Mayr. Von der Land is a celebration of the expressive quality of the Austrian land. Discover notes of cherries and a touch of oak. Enjoy with roast duck.

Title: Smith & Wright Shiraz 2020/21, Australia
Description: Smith & Wright is the creation of a duo with a passion for enjoyable, fruit-forward wine that's best enjoyed with company. Delve into intense notes of ripe raspberry, cherry, vanilla and pepper.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Pepper, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Red Fruit

Title: Emiliana 'Elemental' Organic Gran Reserva Viognier 2021/22, Casablanca Valley
Description: In the last decade, Emilianaâ€™s drive for sustainability has seen them gain carbon zero certification and scoop multiple awards. Not ones to rest on their laurels, the team continues to lead the way with delicious organic wines. This Viognier is a brilliant example of their skill. Coastal breezes help keep the vines cool, allowing the grapes to develop fresh, aromatic flavours, and oak ageing adds texture and complexity. Expect luscious notes of apricot, peach and honey with floral hints. Itâ€™s a perfect partner for a Thai curry.

Title: Nero Oro Grillo Appassimento 2021/22, Sicily
Description: Itâ€™s very unusual to find a white wine made appassimento-style. Thatâ€™s what makes this plush Sicilian white so exciting. Itâ€™s made by drying a portion of grapes on the vine and a portion in the sun. This method is best known for making decadently rich reds, like Amarone. But this, an appassimento Grillo, is something entirely new. Grillo is a wonderfully aromatic and distinctly Italian white grape. Itâ€™s the perfect base for this style of winemaking. Honeyed and full of dried-fruit notes, this has the fresh zing of grapefruit. Not to mention, itâ€™s delicious with Moroccan-spiced rice dishes.

Title: Tutiac 'Lion & The Lily' Sauvignon Blanc 2021, Bordeaux
Description: Les Vignerons de Tutiac is the cornerstone of wine production in Bordeaux. Formed in 1974 by local growers, the co-operative has grown to become the biggest appellation-focused winery in France. And sustainability is at the heart of everything they do. Using sophisticated weather-forecasting programs to prepare for all kinds of weather, theyâ€™re able to vastly reduce the necessity for chemical treatments and tractor work. Unlike classic Bordeaux Sauvignon Blanc, this is crisp and unoaked, showcasing pure, refreshing flavours. Expect fresh flavours of citrus fruit and gooseberry with a mouth-watering finish. Itâ€™s the perfect wine for sipping in the sunshine whilst grazing charcuterie boards.

Title: Iona â€˜The Good Stuff Whiteâ€™, Cape South Coast
Description: This blend of three grapes shows exactly why the countryâ€™s wine scene is turning heads. Iona has the coolest vineyards of all in Elgin, resulting in an incredibly fresh wine with notes of citrus, stone fruits and herbs.

Title: Majestic Classics 12 Red Wine Case
Description: A varied selection of delicious red wines, perfect for gatherings or enjoying with hearty roasts. It ticks all the boxes and you'll see why. This includes a juicy Spanish Tempranillo, a peppery South African Shiraz, a rich Argentinian Malbec and a French Rhone.

Title: Perdeberg Wines The Dry Land Collection â€˜Rossouwâ€™s Heritageâ€™, Paarl
Description: This blend shows off one of the challenging extremes of South Africaâ€™s terroir: dry land. The grapes â€“ Chenin Blanc, with a dash of Grenache Blanc and Viognier â€“ are grown on parched soils. The resulting wine has bold aromas of citrus, passion fruit, white pear and lychee.

Title: The Guv'nor Red 6 Bottle Wine Case
Description: A firm Majestic favourite. Pick up this case to Mix Any Six & Save.The Guv'nor is delicious proof that throwing out the rulebook can yield fantastic results. Spainâ€™s wine laws are notoriously strict and convoluted. The Guv'nor breaks them all. We commissioned the winemakers to make the best wine they could â€“ no rules, no restrictions, no red tape. The bottle they want to kick back with after a long day in the vineyards. The result? Itâ€™s bold. Itâ€™s fruity. Itâ€™s a very modern Spanish red that goes with anything, especially spicy barbecue meats or anything chargrilled.

Title: MarquÃ©s de Altillo Rioja 2021
Description: The bar for good quality Rioja used to begin with Crianza. But in recent years, winemakers have begun paying more attention to the potential of the youthful â€˜Jovenâ€™ style. With little, or zero oak ageing, these wines are amazingly fresh, with pure, juicy fruit flavour. This comes from one of the largest wineries in the subregion of Rioja Alta. Theyâ€™ve been awarded Best Spanish Winery no less than 9 times at International wine competitions â€“ a sure sign of excellent quality wine. This 100% Tempranillo is smooth, bright and fresh with notes of violet, cherry and strawberry. Try it with creamy mushroom linguine.

Title: ViÃ±alba 'Reserve' Malbec-Touriga Nacional 2020/21, Mendoza
Description: ViÃ±alba's winemaker, HervÃ© J Fabre, is renowned for producing award-winning wines â€“ some of which are made from innovative blends beyond Argentina's signature grape, Malbec. This is a collaboration between HervÃ© and his friend â€“ another award-winning winemaker, Rui Reguinga. The Portuguese grape, Touriga Nacional, brings bold red-fruit flavours and floral hints to the blend. This is a powerful yet elegant wine with rich, complex flavours of blackcurrant and plum. Plenty of fruit and polished tannins make this a great match for grilled octopus.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Georges Duboeuf Morgon 2020
Description: The late Georges Duboeuf made it his lifeâ€™s work to popularise the wines of Beaujolais. He more than succeeded â€“ and his wines are now recognised worldwide for their quality. This Morgon is full bodied and smooth, and itâ€™s already a hit with the critics â€“ the 2020 vintage was awarded 91 points by James Suckling. Expect bright notes of red berries, black cherry, plum and black pepper. Its vibrant flavours make it a fantastic partner for steak frites and other bistro classics.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Pepper, Spice

Title: Masi 'Campofiorin' Rosso Veronese 2018/19
Description: The Boscaini family have owned and run Masi for six generations, and are one of Veneto's most well established producers. This delicious wine goes through a second fermentation process with partially dried grapes. The result is a velvety-smooth complex red comparable to plush Amarone wine â€“ without the price tag. Wine critic James Suckling awarded the 2018 vintage an impressive 91 points. Expect intense notes of ripe cherry with hints of tobacco, vanilla and cinnamon spice. Enjoy it with a cheese and charcuterie platter.

Title: Two Hands 'Gnarly Dudes' Shiraz 2021/22, Barossa Valley
Description: 21 years ago, Michael Twelftree and Richard Mintz got chatting at a mutual friendâ€™s engagement party. That night, Two Hands was born. Their idea was to make the best possible Shiraz-based wines from the most prized growing regions in Australia. They quickly won plaudits. This is the very best of modern-day Barossa Shiraz. Big, bold and chock-full of black-fruit flavour. It's even made by a man named Winemaker of the Year 2019 by the Barossa Barons, Richard Langford. Expect flavours of fig, blackcurrant, cedar, liquorice and tar. Try it with a rib-eye steak.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Cedar, Chocolate, Tobacco

Title: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr Kuhlmann-Platz 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' Pinot Gris 2020/21, Alsace
Description: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr began in Alsace, on the German border of France, in 1954. Their aim was to restore the regionâ€™s winemaking industry after it was badly damaged by the German occupation in World War Two. Today, this cooperative consists of 110 members, and it's safe to say they've smashed their initial target. This is a rich and full style of Pinot Gris, with notes of pear and white flowers. It has a refreshing acidity that's works well with duck.

Title: Moillard-Thomas Coteaux Bourguignons 2021
Description: Moillard-Thomas is one of the oldest wine merchants in Nuits-Saint-George. And since the 19th century, the Moillard family name has been synonymous with incredible Burgundy wines. They work with a network of quality winegrowers to bring together the finest grapes from vineyards around the region. For this light, fruity red, you can expect beautiful aromas of cherry and blackcurrant. Its full body and silky tannins make this a perfect pairing for a cheesy vegetable gratin or a slow cooked beef stew.

Title: Thymiopoulos â€˜Whiteâ€™ Xinomavro-Malagousia 2021, Greece
Description: Apostolos Thymiopoulos is widely considered to be one of Greece's most dynamic winemakers. His innovative approach and mastery of the Xinomavro grape variety have helped bring Greek wines to worldwide attention. And now, heâ€™s been recognised as Decanterâ€™s Rising Star of 2022. This delicious blend marries hand-picked Xinomavro and Malagousia to create a wine that really raises the bar for Greek whites. Both varieties are fermented separately, with the Xinomavro juice kept separate from the skins to avoid any red colour. It's fresh and floral with aromas of white flowers, citrus and peach. Its wonderfully crisp acidity makes it an ideal match for fish dishes.

Title: Lulu 'l'Alouette Organic Chinon 2020/21
Description: Cabernet Franc rules the roost in Chinon, one of the Loire's very few red-dominated regions. Organic, fragrant and light, the Lulu L'Alouette is mouthwateringly approachable in its youth. You'll discover fruity hints of raspberry and redcurrant.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Earth, Green Bell Pepper, Raspberry

Title: Plum & Pepper Barossa Shiraz 2017
Description: The key to Australian Shiraz is its intensity. It's known for two unmistakable features: plenty of dark-fruit flavour and a signature kick of pepper. We wanted to capture both of these features in abundance. When we tasted what we'd made from some of key spots in Barossa, there was just one thing to name it: Plum & Pepper. This is unashamedly big, bold and juicy, with a balancing acidity and a long finish. Try it with herby sausages.
Characteristics: Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Jammy

Title: ChÃ¢teau Livran 2014, MÃ©doc
Description: ChÃ¢teau Livran began more than 700 years ago. It has a very rich history. It's been owned by the family of the man who went on to be known as Pope Clement V. It was used as makeshift hospital, in 1914. And it later became a seat for the resistance in the Second World War. Today, the exceptional Edwige Lurton Michon runs the chÃ¢teau. We were so impressed by this wine, we ased her to create our Definition of claret. It's well-balanced and rich, with flavours of black fruits and cedar. Try it with roast beef.

Title: ViÃ±a Alarde Rioja Gran Reserva 2013/15
Description: Gran Reserva is the crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me of Rioja. Itâ€™s the level of Rioja which experiences the most oak ageing â€“ giving it the most structure and ageing potential. This is aged for three years in oak casks which gives it delicious coconut spice â€“ it then spends a further three years in bottle. Such care and attention usually adds up to a big price tag, but this is a real steal. The lengthy ageing process makes for a flavoursome wine with both fresh and dried-fruit flavours. Think cherry, strawberry and cranberry. Smooth. Full. Lusciously spicy. Itâ€™s delicious with a roast dinner.

Title: ViÃ±a Albali Cabernet Tempranillo 0.5% 2021/22, Spain
Description: ViÃ±a Albali was created by the renowned international wine group, FÃ©lix SolÃ­s Avantis. This is a great-value Cabernet-Tempranillo blend. What it lacks in alcohol, it more than makes up for in flavour. It's fresh and juicy with notes of red cherry and violets. Great with pizza.

Title: ViÃ±a Albali Sauvignon Blanc 0.5% 2021/22, Spain
Description: ViÃ±a Albali was created by the renowned international wine group, FÃ©lix SolÃ­s Avantis. This is a great-value Sauvignon Blanc. What it lacks in alcohol, it more than makes up for in flavour. It's juicy and fresh with notes of exotic fruit and citrus. Enjoy with tapas.

Title: Alturo Malbec 2022/23, Mendoza
Description: Wine laws are often a headache for producers â€“ but theyâ€™re a gift to you. The majority of grapes for this Malbec come from the Uco Valley. Itâ€™s an enclave of quality in Malbec-hotspot Mendoza, with wines commanding high prices. But because of convoluted wine shipping laws we can only label it as generic â€˜Mendozaâ€™ Malbec â€“ so you get it for an absolute steal. Because this is a really fantastic quality wine. Itâ€™s made with grapes from vineyards at seriously high altitude â€“ over 3500 feet above sea level. It means the flavours become concentrated in the intense sun, but the nightly temperature drop keeps it fresh and silky. Itâ€™s packed with red berry fruity flavours â€“ strawberries and cherries â€“ with a pretty, violet-like aroma. Soft and approachable, itâ€™s perfect with chargrilled vegetables.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild Lafite 'RÃ©serve SpÃ©ciale' 2019/20, MÃ©doc
Description: Domaines Barons de Rothschild Lafite is not only one of the most prestigious winemaking names in Bordeaux, but in the world. Their coveted top wines sell for hundreds, even thousands, of pounds a bottle â€“ that is, if you can get your hands on them. The RÃ©serve SpÃ©ciale gives you a taste of the greatness for a far more accessible price. The blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is harvested from the best vineyards in the appellation. It's crafted with  the utmost care by Bordeaux native winemaker Diane Flamand. Youâ€™ll get all you could ask for in a fine MÃ©doc: elegance, balance, and silky tannins. Expressive aromas of ripe fruit, leather and oak make this a superb partner for roast lamb.

Title: Taylor's LBV Port Decanter 2017/18 50cl
Description: Late-bottled vintage port is aged in oak for up to six years. This means it's deliciously mature and ready to drink when bottled. Made by one of the greatest Port houses, this is dense and smooth, with flavours of blackcurrant jam, mint, cigar box and cedar, and a very long finish. Pair with hard cheeses.

Title: Croft Reserve Tawny Port
Description: Croft is the Port industryâ€™s oldest producer still active today. Founded in 1588, the house has a rich and fascinating history. Their innovative thinking saw them create the very first vintage Port, and the house continues to lead the way with some of the regionâ€™s finest fortified wines. This Reserve Tawny is a prime example. Itâ€™s beautifully smooth and round, with warm aromas of butterscotch, walnut and spice. Ripe and jammy fig flavours will complement a strong cheddar or a dark chocolate dessert.

Title: Bodegas Olarra 'Dehesa de Lantana' Rioja Gran Reserva 2015
Description: Gran Reserva Rioja must spend at least two years in barrel, followed by a further three years in bottle. This extended ageing creates a more savoury, spicy style from contact with wood and slow oxidation. The Dehesa de Lantana is a delicious example of this evocative style with dark cherry flavours and aged notes of leather and tobacco.

Title: Taylor's 'Quinta de Vargellas' 2013/15 Port
Description:
The 300 year old Port House of Taylor's, based in Oporto on the Atlantic coast are owners of the Quinta de Vargellas vineyard, based high up in the Douro Valley. Vines of over 75 years old make up 60% of the vineyard, produces wines that age as long as vintage Port. Concentrated spicy aromas of raisin, spices, and currant. Exceptionally rich, with layer upon layer of fruit, a chewy, unctuous texture, firm structure and tannin and a finish lasting in over a minute. Decant well in advance and enjoy anytime over the next decade (or two). Serve with a full cheese platter, or just savour after dinner.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2013 vintage.

Title: Saladini Pilastri Organic Pecorino 2021/22, Offida DOCG
Description: Aromatic Pecorino is a centuries-old Italian grape. Its home is in the rolling hills of Marche and Abruzzo, close to the Adriatic Sea. Nestled in the borders of these regions sits Offida DOCG â€“ here is where youâ€™ll find the cream of the crop. Saladini Pilastri were one of the first winemaking estates in Italy to convert to organic farming. If you havenâ€™t tried Pecorino before, this fantastic bottle is deserving of a place in your collection alongside Gavi and Sauvignon Blanc. Itâ€™s bright and full of character, with notes of citrus, white peach, pear and tropical fruit. The energising minerality makes it a wonderfully refreshing wine. Try it with soft cheeses.

Title: Royal Tokaji 5 Puttonyos 2016/17, Hungary 50cl
Description: Acknowledged as one of the region's top winemakers, Karoly Ats combines traditional techniques with modern technology to create the award-winning Royal Tokaji range. Tokaji is produced by blending hand-picked shrivelled or 'aszu' berries with top quality base wines. A medium amber colour with a nose of orange peel, figs and cinnamon. The sugar on the palate is well-balanced by the fine acidity, leading to a clean, refreshing finish. Will continue to improve over several years but drink now, slightly chilled, with blue cheeses or fruit desserts.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Dried Fruit, Fig, Orange Marmalade

Title: Bodegas Caro 'Malbec Argentino' 2021, Mendoza
Description: Bodegas Caro is a partnership between Catena â€“ one of Mendozaâ€™s most renowned producers â€“ and the famous Rothschild winemaking family. Itâ€™s a prestigious marriage of French and Argentinian expertise. This is a pure expression of Malbec. Grapes are hand-harvested and aged without oak, so the grapeâ€™s fruity character is forefront in your glass.  The vineyards are on a high plateau, with huge variations in temperature between night and day, which gives the resulting wine a delicate, round and soft character. Itâ€™s full of fresh blueberry, blackberry, cassis and violet. It makes a prime match for South American-style steak.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Violet

Title: ChÃ¢teau Meyney 'La Chapelle de Meyney' 2016/17, Saint-EstÃ¨phe
Description: This 92-point claret is made by ChÃ¢teau Meyney, the only winery in MÃ©doc that has clay soils similar to those at Â£2,500-per-bottle PÃ©trus. It's a second wine in name, but it's made with the same care as the grand vin. The only difference is that it's from younger vines - which are still, on average, 35-years-old. Its depths of black-fruit flavour and snappy tannins and beginning to hit their peak right now.

Title: Parcel Series Saint-EstÃ¨phe 2020
Description: Parcel Series is for when top-class wineries need to make space quickly and discreetly. So we pick up their wines at a fraction of the usual price and pass the saving to you. The catch? We can't tell you who makes it. This is an aromatic and full-bodied Saint-EstÃ¨phe from a prestigious estate. It's a blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon that has bold flavours of blackcurrant, red cherry and spice. It has ripe tannins which are fantastic with braised or grilled meats.

Title: MarquÃ©s de Murrieta Rioja Gran Reserva 2014/15
Description: MarquÃ©s de Murrieta began in 1852 and is the oldest estate to stand in Rioja Alta. The winemaker here today is Maria Vargas, who was Tim Atkin MW's Winemaker of the Year in 2017. This is a full-bodied and generous Gran Reserva Rioja, with flavours of red and dark fruits, spicy oak and vanilla. Decant for at least half an hour before serving at 16-18 degrees with a roast dinner.

Title: Louis Latour Marsannay Rouge 2021, Burgundy
Description: The red wines of Marsannay get their lively, robust character from the rich iron soils carpeting the north of Burgundyâ€™s CÃ´te dâ€™Or. And Louis Latour, one of the regionâ€™s foremost producers, makes this classic, delicious example. Only the best hand-picked Pinot Noir grapes â€“ from vines averaging 30 years of age â€“ are used. The finished wine is packed with that enticing red fruit and gamey character that makes red Burgundy so popular. Use it to wash down roasted duck or coq au vin.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Cedar, Earth, Raspberry, Red Cherry

Title: Domaine Pierre Marchand 'Les Cigales' Pouilly-FumÃ© 2021/22
Description: Eric Marchant spent his childhood in his father Pierreâ€™s vineyards, observing and helping where he could. His inherited love of the land led him to study viticulture, and since 1998, along with the help of his brother Pascal, he makes wines combining traditional and modern practices. Their vines have an average age of 25 years, allowing grapes to ripen with greater complexity, and their minimal intervention approach means the resulting wines have deliciously pure fruity flavour. This has aromatic notes of citrus, blackcurrant leaf and gooseberry. The finish is elegant and long with hints of flinty minerality and ripe apple. Its crisp and zingy character makes it a great choice for a goatâ€™s cheese and apple salad.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Smoke, Stone Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Domaines Schlumberger 'Les Princes AbbÃ©s' GewÃ¼rztraminer 2020/21, Alsace
Description: Domaines Schlumberger make their wines using only estate-grown fruit, from vineyards located on the breathtaking slopes of southern Alsace, many having up to 50o elevation. Of their 140ha of vineyards, 70ha are recognised as grand cru sites. An intense nose of rose petals, oriental spice and tropical fruit. Gently off-dry, with a round and mellow texture, balanced by a burst of acidity and a peppery note on the finish. Wonderfully food-friendly, especially when paired with mildly spiced Thai or Indonesian dishes, or with pungent cheeses.

Title: Yellow Tail Pinot Grigio 2021/22, Australia
Description: Yellow Tail Pinot Grigio is zesty, bright and refreshingly light. With gentle notes of apple, pear, citrus and just a touch of passionfruit, it's a delicious fruit-forward foray into Pinot Grigio territory. Enjoy yours with colourful salads or simple fish dishes.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Floral, Green Apple, Lime, Melon, Passionfruit, Peach

Title: Fonseca â€˜Quinta do Panascalâ€™ Vintage Port 2008
Description: Founded in 1815, Fonseca has a centuries-old reputation for decadent vintage Port. Sourced from their flagship estate, the Quinta do Panascal bottlings are famed for their distinctive character and vibrancy. Crafted using sustainably grown fruit, grapes are foot-trodden in traditional cement tanks and then aged in oak barrels. This 2008 vintage is a pure expression of the estate's slopey, riverside terroir, with opulent notes of cassis, black cherry, dark chocolate and sandalwood.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Tinta Barroca, Tinta Cao, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca

Title: Croft 10 Year Old Tawny Port
Description: The 10 Year Old Tawny is drawn from a reserve of fine wood ports which have been aged to full maturity in seasoned oak casks, each holding about 630 litres of wine. The individual wines are then blended to guarantee consistency of quality and house style.

Title: Les Hauts de Castelmaure, CorbiÃ¨res 2020/21
Description: Embres-et-Castelmaure is a tiny village to the south of CorbiÃ¨res, with around 150 residents, all of whom are families of grape growers. The village's local cooperative makes this wine from Grenache, Syrah and Carignan hand-picked from high altitude plots, with vines aged up to 80 years old. An expressive and open red, this has notes of damson jam and cassis, and that unmistakable 'garrigue' aroma of heather and wild thyme.
Characteristics: Dried Herbs, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry

Title: Bodegas Roda 'Roda I' Rioja Reserva 2015/16
Description: Bodegas Roda is one of Rioja's forward-thinking producers. They began just over 30 years ago and aim to show the modern face of the region. As a result, they're quickly gaining plenty of fans. They age this Reserva in French, as opposed to American, oak. This gives a much more subtle oak influence to the wine. Think well-integrated chocolate and tobacco that join hints of black fruit and plum. Try it with a roast dinner.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Cherry, Red Fruit

Title: Royal Tokaji 'Gold Label' 6 Puttonyos 2017, Hungary 50cl
Description: Tokaji AszÃº is the original 'noble rot' wine. Made from a blend of 'botrytis' grapes it matches (and often surpasses) Sauternes. In fact, its vineyards were the world's first classified vineyards - a century before Bordeaux's famous classification! The Gold Label is a blend of several 'First Growths' where single-vineyard bottlings will set you back Â£50 minimum! At 6 'Puttonyos', this is the richest, most opulent style of Tokaji with aromas of rich citrus, grapefruit and spice mirrored in a palate of lemon-peel, peach and candied mango.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Dried Fruit, Orange Marmalade

Title: Bodegas Hidalgo 'Triana' Pedro XimÃ©nez Sherry
Description:
Produced by the Hidalgo Family bodega, established in 1792 in SanlÃºcar. Made using grapes dried on straw mats,  fermented and fortified, then aged under the solaria system. One of the sweetest wines in the world, PX is about as sweet as things can get! Aromas of raisins, molasses, figs, toffee, caramel, nuts, the palate is incredibly thick, dense, with an oily texture, massive concentration and unsurpassed sweetness and prolonged length. The ultimate sweet wine! Fantastic when poured over ice-cream.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Yellow Tail Malbec 2021/22, Australia
Description: Full-bodied and decadent with a lingering finish, Yellow Tail Malbec is bursting with blackberry and cherry notes. Soft swathes of dark chocolate, vanilla and spice emerge through the palate for a deliciously steak-loving sip.
Characteristics: Jammy, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Chocolate

Title: Torbreck 'Woodcutter's' Shiraz 2020/21, Barossa
Description: Torbreck 'The Laird' Shiraz costs Â£660 per bottle. On the same vineyard, made with the same care but from younger vines, its 'Woodcutter's' Shiraz is deliciously approachable in its youth - and you'll taste a delicious complexity that you'd expect in three-figure-sum reds in its turbocharged tapestry of black fruits, sweet spices and vanilla.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Chocolate, Coffee, Liquorice, Prune, Spice

Title: Pringle Bay Shiraz 2022/23, Western Cape
Description: The Pringle Bay range is a rarity â€“ winemaking expertise at an incredibly affordable price. So much so that David Williams, writing in The Observer in 2022, referred to Pringle Bay wines as being "among the best-value wines" he'd tried that year.  Created by legendary winemaking duo, Duncan Savage and Thys Louw (from nearby family estate Diemersdal), this new arrival to Majestic is packed full of blackberry, black pepper and juicy redcurrant fruit. There's a hint of oaky smoke that pairs beautifully with roasted pork or rich, baked aubergine dishes.

Title: Making Tracks Shiraz 2019/20, South Australia
Description: Shiraz is Australia's star grape. This is bold and full of dark bramble fruit - everything a big Aussie red should be. And thereâ€™s plenty of flavour for the price. Jammy blackberry and blackcurrant, pepper and vanilla spice. Excellent with beef short ribs.
