Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Pepper, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Jammy

Title: Chateau l'Hyverniere Muscadet 2020/21, Muscadet SÃ¨vre et Maine
Description: ChÃ¢teau de l'HyverniÃ¨re is deeply rooted in the history of the Muscadet SÃ¨vre et Maine region. Its first records date back to the 15th century. It was destroyed during the French revolution, and the vines behind this Muscadet today grow on where the illustrious chÃ¢teau once sat. As you'd expect, this is the benchmark for aromatic, complex Muscadet. It has flavours of lemon, grapefruit and green apple and a chalky minerality which is great with the saltiness of oysters.
Characteristics: Almond, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Lime, Pear

Title: Gonzalez Byass Solera Cream Sherry
Description: The Gonzalez family have been making exceptional sherry since 1835. And the experience really shines in this cream sherry. It's been aged for an average of eight years, so it's beautifully smooth. Expect notes of raisins, vanilla, caramel and hazelnuts. Try this with your cheese board or a vanilla cheesecake snuggled up in front of the fire.

Title: Two Hands 'Sexy Beast' Cabernet Sauvignon 2021/22, McLaren Vale
Description: Two Hands is already one of the finest Shiraz producers in Australia. Turning its hand to Cabernet Sauvignon, it's crafted a red that's chock full of blackcurrant, mocha, mint and a hint of graphite. Scoring a solid 90 Parker Points with this vintage alone, it's clear the winery is master of many.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Coffee, Smoke, Tobacco

Title: Veuve Clicquot Demi-Sec Champagne
Description: Demi-Sec is a style of Champagne that's a bit sweeter than usual. And Veuve Clicquot haven't neglected any of the flavour. First produced for the Russian court in the 19th century, this Champagne shows rich, candied fruits, toast and baked bread. It has a creamy mousse, a decadent palate and ends in a deliciously fresh finish. It's a perfect dessert wine, so serve it with peach pudding.

Title: Famille Hugel â€˜Classicâ€™ Riesling 2021/22, Alsace
Description: Hugel are one of the wine dynasties of Alsace, established in 1639. Today the 12th and 13th generation of the family continue to produce exceptional Riesling. And plenty of attention to detail goes into making it. Grapes are hand-harvested from vines averaging 35 years old â€“ adding complexity â€“ and plans to become certified organic are underway. This elegant bottling couldnâ€™t be more typical Alsace, with its aromas of apple, pear and citrus. With that underlying minerality and vibrant acidity, wines also donâ€™t get much more food-friendly. Try it with sea bass ceviche or traditional pÃ¢tÃ© en croÃ»te.
Characteristics: Lime, Peach, Red Apple, Wet Stones

Title: Penfolds 'Max's' Chardonnay 2019/22, Adelaide Hills
Description: Penfolds played a pivotal role in the evolution of winemaking in Australia and across the world. A huge part of this was Max Schubert, Chief Winemaker for 27 years. He paved the way for those who continue to make Penfolds one of the world's greatest wineries. And this Chardonnay lives up to the great name. Expect fresh flavours of stone fruits, citrus, grapefruit, crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and nougat. Try this with creamy chicken.

Title: Hidalgo 'Pastrana' Pasada Manzanilla Sherry
Description:
This old (pasada) Manzanilla comes from the heralded Hidalgo family, where it is blended by 'capitaz' Antonio Sanchez. Becoming a capitaz requires a lifetime of dedication. Antonio must be familiar with the taste of every cask in the Bodega. This sherry has intense notes of apple skin, almonds, and orange peel with a salty twang. A prolonged finish marks this out as real quality. This Manzanilla should be served chilled as a stunning apÃ©ritif.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Thauvenay Sancerre 2021/22
Description: The Loire Valleyâ€™s Langlois-Chateau winery is owned by the Bollinger family. Their L'Extra par Langlois CrÃ©mant has long been a Majestic customer favourite. Along with premium fizz, the winery also lays claim to vines surrounding the magnificent ChÃ¢teau de Thauvenay in Sancerre. Here, rich calcareous soils and the teamâ€™s sustainable practices help to craft a style of Sauvignon Blanc for which the region is so renowned. Intense. Crisp. Aromatic. Expect exotic notes of pineapple, mango and grapefruit, with plenty of freshness and rich citrusy flavour.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Cream, Grass, Green Apple, Flint

Title: Pieropan â€˜Ruberpanâ€™ Organic Valpolicella Superiore DOC 2019
Description: Known for their timeless quality, Pieropan have been producing incredible wines in Veneto since the 1890s â€“ and they were the first to use the Soave name on their bottles. The family has been at the forefront of innovation, popularising the use of French barriques for fermentation and ageing. And fourth-generation Dario Pieropan is no different. His adventurous nature has led him to explore the production of a duo of red wines from his family estate in Valpolicella. This silky red is crafted from just eight hectares of vines, spending between 18-24 months ageing in large oak barrels and further ageing in bottle at the estate. And, like all Pieropan wines produced since 2015, it's certified organic. Expect a soft and smooth wine, with complex flavours of red cherry, wild strawberry, and hints of spice. Itâ€™s an ideal match for roasted pork dishes.

Title: Parcel Series Pauillac 2019
Description: Our Parcel Series wines are Majestic's best kept secret. They're for when top-shelf wineries need to make space quickly and discreetly. So we pick up their wines at a fraction of the usual price and pass the savings to you. The catch? We can't tell you who makes it. What we can tell you is that thanks to our price-savvy buyers, this expressive Pauillac delivers all the flavour of a top estate at a snip of the price. Expect intense flavours of blackcurrant, blueberries, liquorice and savoury hints of cedar and tobacco. Its ripe tannins make this an excellent pairing for herby lamb roasts and other rich red meat dishes.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Fourcas DuprÃ© 2013, Listrac-MÃ©doc
Description: Listrac-MÃ©doc sits in a prime spot on Bordeauxâ€™s prestigious left bank. Situated between St-Julien to the north and Margaux to the south, the appellation offers classic Cabernet Sauvignon-led blends that offer excellent value for money. ChÃ¢teau Fourcas DuprÃ© began in 1843, and itâ€™s grown to become one of the leading estates in the region. This spends up to 14 months in barrel prior to release, and with almost a decade of bottle maturation under its belt, you can expect an impressive, complex claret. Expect silky notes of ripe red fruits and cedar wood spice. Its elegant tannins make it an ideal drop for white meat dishes.

Title: Krasno Sauvignon Blanc-Ribolla Gialla 2021/22, Brda
Description: Brda is known as 'the Tuscany of Slovenia'. It sits between the Alps and the Adriatic, just over the border from Friuli, Italy, where similar white wines demand much higher prices. But because Slovenian Sauvignon is still relatively under the radar, you can pick it up for a bargain. This is fresh and fruity, with aromas of green apple, pear, lemon and freshly cut grass. Try its refreshing acidity with oysters.

Title: Incanta Pinot Noir 2021/22, Romania
Description: Romania is where insiders look for great value, great tasting Pinot. Itâ€™s in the swing of a post-Soviet winemaking renaissance â€“ and Englishman Philip Cox and his Romanian wife, Elvira, are ready to sing its praises to the rooftops. Their Cramele Recas Estate is now the most successful winery in Romania, and they continue to set new trends for Romanian wine. This Pinot punches way above its price point â€“ and the 2020 vintage was awarded 90 points by Tim Atkin MW. This is a wonderfully approachable wine with notes of fresh black cherry, raspberry and cinnamon. Try its juicy flavours with a classic charcuterie board.

Title: Bollinger R.D. 2008 Champagne
Description: RD is kept 'on the lees' in Bollinger's cellars, and only released once the wine has reached a particular degree of  development. Weighty and rich, with aromas of white truffle and layers of concentrated flavour, RD represents the pinnacle of Bollinger's expertise.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Tour Massac 2013/14, Margaux
Description: Margaux is one of the most celebrated Bordeaux appellations. It has legions of fans â€“ and prices to match its reputation. But there are still bargains to be found in the region. Enter, ChÃ¢teau Tour Massac. Itâ€™s owned by the Guillemet family, who work with very old vines to produce expressive and elegant wines. Youâ€™ll find this fantastic-value bottle easily competes with the more famous Crus of the region. Itâ€™s full bodied with complex aromas of black fruit, cedar, leather, spices, tobacco and mint. Elegant. Aromatic. Balanced â€“ in other words, classic Margaux. Crack open a bottle with herb-crusted lamb.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Cedar, Leather, Mint, Spice, Tobacco

Title: ChÃ¢teau d'Esclans 'Garrus' RosÃ©, CÃ´tes de Provence 2020/21
Description: If you donâ€™t think of rosÃ© as a fine wine, that's because you havenâ€™t tried this one. This top bottling comes from the renowned ChÃ¢teau dâ€™Esclans in Provence. Itâ€™s made from century-old Grenache vines and Vermentino â€“ or Rolle, as itâ€™s known in Provence â€“ and is aged in French oak barrels. In less than a decade since launch, itâ€™s become a coveted world-class wine with many critic fans â€“ Matthew Jukes has previously rated it 20/20 and James Suckling 96/100. Expect an impressively concentrated wine, with a creamy finish and rich, spicy notes to rival any top white wine or prestige Champagne. Itâ€™s a superb match for grilled salmon with roasted Mediterranean vegetables.

Title: Muga Rioja Blanco 2021/22
Description: Muga are as classic as Rioja gets. They even make their own oak barrels to get the ageing process spot on. Their reds may make the headlines, but this Rioja Blanco is a real hidden gem. It's rested on its lees and aged in oak for three months. As a result, there's a deliciously subtle texture to its flavours of citrus, apple and white flowers. Try it with grilled fish.

Title: Dom Perignon Brut Vintage Champagne
Description: The bouquet spirals through sweet, bright floral notes and the lively minerality so typical of Dom PÃ©rignon, then notes of candied fruit, plants, the incredible freshness of camphor leaf and finally the dark hints of spices and liquorice root. The wine is currently still physical. It is compelling, tactile and vibrant rather than aromatic. The rhythm and tempo are more dominant than the melody. At first mild and delicate, then strongly, confidently mineral, persistent, precise, with a refined bitterness, and an iodine, saline tang. A classic accompaniment to any stylish celebration.
Characteristics: Smoke, Biscuit, Bread, Green Apple, Peach, Pear

Title: Kanonkop 'Kadette' Pinotage RosÃ© 2022/23, Stellenbosch
Description: Wine has been made at Kanonkop since the 1940s, but it wasnâ€™t until 1973 that the iconic label was created. Today, the winery has an international reputation as one of the finest in Stellenbosch. Their production is focused around South African signature grape, Pinotage, and Cabernet Sauvignon. Wines are made from vines in the Perdeberg â€“ the largest single block of Pinotage in the world. Very few estates attempt to make rosÃ© from this robust, full-flavoured grape, but Kanonkop have perfected the art. It's wonderfully perfumed, with notes of Turkish delight, rose water, summer berries and crisp red apple. Rich and fruity but with plenty of freshness, this will pair brilliantly with sushi.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Tour Haut-Caussan 2014/17, MÃ©doc
Description: ChÃ¢teau Tour Haut-Caussan, and its iconic windmill, is an inside secret for MÃ©doc experts. Robert Parker, the world's most famous wine critic, called the family-run estate "excellent". And it's known to compete with some of the prestigious classified estates in its best vintages. But as it's relatively unknown, its Cabernet-Merlot blends are still a bargain. Expect aromas of red and black fruits and smoke, flavours of ripe blackberries and cherries, firm tannins and a hint of oak. Try it with roast beef.

Title: Definition AlbariÃ±o 2021/22, RÃ­as Baixas
Description:
The best AlbariÃ±o comes from RÃ­as Baixas on the lush Galician coastline â€“ so thatâ€™s where we went to make the Definition. With misty hills, a wild green coast and bracing winds, the region feels closer to Ireland than Spain. While it may put off sun-bathers, these conditions are perfect for producing fresh, zesty whites. And this is made by one of the region's finest producers, MartÃ­n CÃ³dax. It's typical of its coastal location, with crisp apricot and citrus notes, and a distinctive sea-spray minerality. Enjoy with fresh white fish.    

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Rijckaert F. Rouve 'Haute CuvÃ©e' VirÃ©-ClessÃ© 2020/21
Description: Florent Rouve was fresh out of Dijonâ€™s wine college when he first met Jean Rijckaert, an established Burgundy wine legend. The pairâ€™s shared vision for a natural style of winemaking has led to phenomenal success and Florent has now been at the helm of production since 2013. His minimal intervention approach includes carefully hand-picked harvests and zero chemical use in the vineyards. He ages this VirÃ©-ClessÃ© on its lees in small oak barrels for up to 15 months. The result is a richly textured Chardonnay with crisp notes of citrus, stone fruits and blossom, balanced by a delicate minerality. The 2020 vintage scooped an IWC award in 2022.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Bread, Floral, Honey, Lemon

Title: Abbotts & Delaunay, Domaine de la MÃ©tairie d'Alon 'Le Village' Organic Chardonnay 2022, Languedoc
Description: If youâ€™re seeking out elegant Chardonnay, the warm Languedoc might not be the first place youâ€™d look. But in the right spot â€“ and in the right hands â€“ the grape can produce refreshing wines to rival the best of Burgundy. CÃ´te de Nuits native, Laurent Delaunay, acquired Domaine de la La MÃ©tairie d'Alon in 2015 â€“ a high-altitude vineyard in the cool foothills of the Pyrenees. He farms organically, and with vast experience of crafting fine Burgundy wines, brings the same standards of winemaking to new territory. The handpicked grapes for Le Village are gently pressed, with 75% of cuvÃ©e spending 8 months ageing on its lees to add complexity. The remaining 25% is kept in stainless steel tanks, altogether resulting in a rich wine balanced by freshness. Expect intense notes of white peach, ripe lemon, banana and hints of fresh pastry and hazelnut. Itâ€™s full, rounded character makes it the perfect choice for creamy chicken and fish dishes.

Title: La Rioja Alta 'Finca Martelo' Rioja Reserva 2016/19
Description: La Rioja Alta are one of the biggest names in Rioja. They craft this Reserva only in perfect vintages, so you can expect excellence in every bottle. The Tempranillo vines on the Torre de OÃ±a estate are over 60 years old â€“ resulting in a wine with incredible concentration and complexity. Add two years of ageing in oak barrels, and you've got all the hedonistic qualities of delicious Rioja. Expect rich flavours of wild strawberry, cherry and redcurrant accompanied by notes of pastry, biscuit, vanilla, liquorice and pepper. Its silky tannins and long, elegant finish make it a fantastic partner for braised and roasted meats.

Title: Definition Claret 2018/19, Medoc
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. When it came to adding the king of classic reds, we didnâ€™t take the task lightly. Claret has been a British synonym for red Bordeaux for centuries. Such a traditional wine required a prestigious winemaker with a wealth of regional knowledge. One person immediately sprang into our buyersâ€™ minds: Edwige Lurton Michon. Edwige was raised in Margaux vineyards and was influenced by her familyâ€™s viticultural and artistic heritage. She is now head winemaker at the renowned ChÃ¢teau Livran, and her passion and skill certainly show in this bottle. It has notes of ripe black fruits, cedar and spice. Structured yet soft tannins make it a fantastic pairing for your Sunday roast.

Title: Beato Bartolomeo Pinot Grigio Rosato 2021/22, Delle Venezie
Description: The Alpine foothills tumble down into the Veneto in North-Eastern Italy. Itâ€™s here youâ€™ll find the tiny Breganze DOC. Itâ€™s so small that the regionâ€™s 700 growers have formed a single cooperative: Beato Bartolomeo Breganze. They make so little of this delicious rosÃ© that we buy everything they make. Itâ€™s incredibly bright and fruity with really delicate flavours. Peach. Apricot. Raspberry. Itâ€™s delicious with light salads.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Berne â€˜Inspirationâ€™ RosÃ© 2021/22 Magnum, CÃ´tes de Provence
Description: A stunning property and landmark of Provence, ChÃ¢teau de Berne is a luxurious hotel with a Michelin-starred restaurant. It also happens to be located on a 18th-century wine estate, making it a pilgrimage for food & wine lovers around the world. Their eye-catching square bottles donâ€™t just look the part, they taste great too. Inspiration rosÃ© has remarkable freshness due to the grapes having been picked at night-time, when the heat of the day has dropped. Concentrated yet elegant, it has vibrant summer fruits with a hint of mango, and lively, balanced acidity. Match its freshness with lemony roast chicken sprinkled with plenty of ProvenÃ§ale herbs.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Le Boscq 2013, Saint-EstÃ¨phe
Description: ChÃ¢teau Le Boscq has a rich winemaking history dating back to the 1700s. This Cru Bourgeois estate is recognised for consistently high quality, classic-style wines that offer great value for money. And this 2013 vintage punches way above its price tag. Itâ€™s a rich blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon that combines the powerful character of Saint-EstÃ¨phe with extraordinary finesse. Expect a beautifully balanced wine with aromas of ripe cherry, plum, liquorice and cedar. Its silky tannins make it a great partner for roasted game meats.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Cedar, Liquorice, Red Fruit

Title: ChÃ¢teau Minuty 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' 2021/22, CÃ´tes de Provence
Description: ChÃ¢teau Minuty sources the grapes for its 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' from some of the very best ProvenÃ§al vineyards. Taste the benefits in this blend of Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah and Tibouren, a grape found almost exclusively in Provence. It's powerful-yet-balanced with hints of citrus and red fruit licked by a refreshing minerality. This is the sun-soaked south of France in a bottle.

Title: Maison Saint Aix 'AIX' RosÃ© 2021/22 Magnum, Coteaux d'Aix en Provence
Description:
The iconic rosÃ© magnum. Maison Saint Aix sits high up in the Provence hills. Behind the ancient stone gates, the winemaking team dedicate themselves to just one wine â€“ this fresh, fragrant rosÃ©. The aim is to create the purest possible expression of Provence rosÃ©, and they harvest before sunrise to get the very best from the grapes. As a result, it's full of fresh red fruits, juicy peaches and white flowers. Pair it with a feta salad.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Muga Rioja Rosado 2021/22, Rioja
Description: Muga is one of the most respected Bodegas in Rioja. But it doesn't stop at reds. Predominantly Garnacha, its Rioja Rosado is more intense and fruity than you'd find in France, but it retains a delicious dry character. Pair its red apple and tropical notes with your next alfresco meal.

Title: The Pale RosÃ© by Sacha Lichine 2021/22, IGP Var
Description: In 2006, Sacha Lichine took over ChÃ¢teau d'Esclans with the goal of creating some of the worldâ€™s greatest wines. He revolutionised Provence rosÃ© and developed Whispering Angel into the trendiest Provence pink. Heâ€™s turned his attention to new areas with The Pale. Crafted with grapes from the Vin de Pays Du Var region of Provence, itâ€™s classic Mediterranean rosÃ© with a twist. Itâ€™s a classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah â€“ but from an area known for great value. Itâ€™s deliciously dry and refreshing with bright red-fruit flavours and a clean, crisp finish. A perfect apÃ©ritif or partner for salmon blinis.

Title: Vieux Remparts 2019/20, Lussac St-Ã‰milion
Description: If you love Saint-Ã‰milion but want a wine which is more pocket-friendly, then this is for you. Lussac is one of Saint-Ã‰milionâ€™s satellite appellations â€“ and one of the only ones considered of high enough quality to use â€˜Saint-Ã‰milionâ€™ in its name. Its wines are dupes for top-dollar Saint-Ã‰milion â€“ but at a fraction of the price. Itâ€™s mainly Merlot, with some Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon to give it great structure. Itâ€™s super-smooth and silky, packed with black fruit flavours. Blackcurrants. Plums. Cherries. Itâ€™s really delicious claret â€“ and perfect for drinking young. Itâ€™s ideal with roast lamb or strong cheeses.
Characteristics: Spice, Blackcurrant, Game, Red Plum, Smoke

Title: 19 Crimes Red Blend, Australia
Description: In 1788, 'punishment by transportation' to Australia became the sentence of choice for convicts in the UK. If you were guilty of one of 19 crimes, then you were chosen to build a new life across the world. This wine shows that, sometimes, it pays to break to rules. It's a Shiraz-dominated blend made from grapes sourced across South Eastern Australia. Aged in American oak, it has full flavours of vanilla, chocolate and cedar spice. A great partner for braised beef.

Title: Acacia Road Chardonnay 2020/22, South Africa
Description: This South African Chardonnay hasn't seen a drop of oak, so its fruit really sings. Expect punchy aromas of melon and pineapple and subtle hints of vanilla and sweet spices. Sublime with roast chicken.

Title: Acacia Road Chenin Blanc 2022/23, South Africa
Description: Chenin Blanc has found a home in South Africa and this example shows exactly why with bright flavours of tropical fruit and apple followed by a honeyed yet refreshing finish.

Title: Acacia Road Merlot 2022/23, South Africa
Description: It's the weeknight sipper to bring a splash of sun to your sofa. Gentle oak influence gifts a silkiness to a bouquet of dark plum and blackcurrants. This really is a steal at a pocket-friendly price.

Title: Acacia Road Sauvignon Blanc 2022/23
Description: South Africa is a fabulous place to look for innovative and great value wines.  This Sauvignon is lively and fresh with an abundance of zingy grapefuit and apple flavours softened by hints of ripe melon. Grapefruit and green apple shine from the glass with a lovely honeydew melon to soften the finish. A marvellous addition to a lovely fish dish or mixed vegetable platter.

Title: Alain Grignon Carignan 'Vieilles Vignes' 2022, Pays de l'HÃ©rault
Description: Carignan can be a little rough and ready. Itâ€™s usually used to make simple table wine, but this is something quite different. Everything is focussed on quality. Itâ€™s made using grapes from at least fifty-year-old vines â€“ some are even a hundred years old. Such age means that the yield of grapes from each vine is tiny â€“ and the flavours are really concentrated. Part of it is aged in oak to give it some good structure, but itâ€™s still a really juicy, fresh wine. It was made to be really easy-drinking â€“ and it really does slip down oh-so-easily. Itâ€™s packed with brambly fruit flavours. Blackberry. Cherry. A hint of vanilla and spice. This style of Carignan is absolutely delicious with roast pork or a meaty chicken casserole.

Title: Allegrini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico DOCG 2017/18
Description: Amarone is one of Italyâ€™s most celebrated wines. Hailing from the Valpolicella region, itâ€™s made from Corvina grapes that have been partially dried before crushing. This makes for concentrated dried-cherry aromas and a distinctly rich, powerful wine. Allegriniâ€™s version, made in the heart of the prestigious Vapolicella Classico sub-region, strikes a happy balance between modernity and tradition. Expect intense notes of ripe dark fruit and spice. Try it with a fillet steak or Italian-style braised beef stew.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Chocolate, Fig, Red Cherry, Red Plum, Sweet Spice

Title: Alphonse Mellot 'Les Demoiselle' Organic Sancerre 2019/21
Description: The Mellots have a rich 507-year-history in Sancerre. One member was even appointed as Louis XIV's official wine advisor. Today, Alphonse Sr and Alphonse Jnr, the 18th and 19th generations, together craft biodynamic, organic Sancerre with a distinctly creamy character. This is deep and rich, with flavours of pink grapefruit, gunflint and oak. Serve at ten degrees with shellfish.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Citrus Fruit, Cream, Grass

Title: Alphonse Mellot 'Les Demoiselles' Organic Sancerre Rouge 2019/20
Description: The Mellots have a rich 507-year-history in Sancerre. One member was even appointed as Louis XIV's official wine advisor. Today, Alphonse Sr and Alphonse Jnr, the 18th and 19th generations make this red biodynamically and organically. It has hints of raspberries, cherries, vanilla and cinnamon. A great alternative to red Burgundy that's fantastic with duck. Serve at room temperature.

Title: Ammazza Montepulciano 2020/21
Description: ''Ammazza translates as wow and that is what this wine does with its heady cherry flavours and extra body.  This is a modern take on traditional Italian reds - bold, characterful and  full of flavour.'' Great to drink on its own, but a secret to drinking Italian ... it's all about the food. Try with your mid-week pizza, or any other tomato based dishes.

Title: Ammazza Pinot Grigio 2020/21, Terre di Chieti IGT
Description: Delle Venezie is famous for its Pinot Grigios â€“ and three years ago, it was awarded DOC status to protect the quality of its wines, and to show the world exactly how delicious Pinot Grigio can be. DOC stands for Denominazione di Origine Controllata â€“ and it means that wines here have a quality guarantee. This wine is a case in point. Zippy. Citrussy. Crisp. Itâ€™s a seriously refreshing glassful, full of zesty citrus flavours. Itâ€™s lemony. Itâ€™s refreshing. Itâ€™s got a lovely peach and white-blossom flavours too. Such a delicious Pinot Grigio makes a fantastic aperitif, but itâ€™s also fantastic with salads.

Title: Anna's Way Viognier 2021/22, Marlborough
Description: Marlborough has long been famed for excellent Sauvignon Blanc. But pioneering winemaker Louis Vavasour, who grew up on Marlborough vineyards, has discovered that the long sunshine hours also create the perfect conditions for complex, fruity Viognier. Expect flavours of ripe apricot, papaya and allspice, with a gentle stroke of acidity. Try this with roast pork and apple sauce.

Title: Araldica Barbera d'Asti DOCG 2019/20, Italy
Description: When it comes to lavish, supple reds that partner beautifully with richly-flavoured food you needn't look further than Italy. Indulge in Araldica Barbera's cocoa-and-spice-stroked palate of red cherry and dried fruit.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Red Cherry, Red Plum, Spice

Title: Araldica Barolo DOCG 2018/19
Description: In the belief that the best Barolo's delicate and aromatic, Araldica rests its this for at least two years in oak and another in the bottle. It's not until four years after the harvest has finished that this is released. Taste the benefits of patience in a full-bodied palate that's chock full of rich red fruits, sweet spices, a balancing earthiness and a brooding hint of smoke.

Title: Avior Malbec 2020/21, Argentina
Description: A top-drawer Argentine Malbec at an everyday price. Impossible â€“ or is it? We challenged our buyers to find a wine which was great value â€“ and great quality. They tasted more than fifty â€“ and this one was the hands-down winner. What makes it a cut above? The intense concentration of flavours. Itâ€™s rich. Itâ€™s ripe. Itâ€™s smooth. Itâ€™s a textbook Mendoza Malbec, packed with those classic black berry and red-fruit flavours. Think blackberries, cherries and a touch of the floral, violet aromas which mark it out as a high-quality wine. We think our buyers have hit it out of the park â€“ and weâ€™re sure that youâ€™ll love it just as much as we do. And with a juicy, fruity Argentinian Malbec like this thereâ€™s nothing better than a beefsteak burger. Delicious.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Babich Organic Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: Babich own one of the first vineyards to ever be planted in New Zealand.  As a result, this is a real benchmark organic Sauvignon Blanc. It's fresh and ripe, with notes of stone fruit, lime and apple and a mouth-watering finish. Try it with a light salad or white fish.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Bodega Matsu â€˜El Viejoâ€™ 2019/20, Toro
Description: Matsu translates from Japanese as â€˜to waitâ€™. It perfectly captures the patient philosophy of Bodega Matsu on their Toro vineyards. This is their remarkable flagship wine. It's sourced from a vineyard thatâ€™s now in its second century. The mature vines make for an intensely flavoured, complex wine. Despite the regionâ€™s hot and dry climate, it's also incredibly elegant. And unlike neighbouring Ribera Del Duero, Toro wines don't demand the same price tag â€“ making this fine wine even more extraordinary. It has notes of jammy black fruits, smoky, toasty spice and an elegant structure. Perfect for herb-crusted filet mignon.

Title: Bodega Matsu 'El Picaro' 2021/22, Toro
Description: Much like Ribera Del Duero, the Tempranillo grape is king in the region of Toro. Since the area is not as well-known as its famous neighbour, you can find excellent wines at a lower price. The regionâ€™s vineyards strive to survive the fiercely hot, dry climate. In the right hands, hard-working vines create complex and intensely flavoured wines. El Picaro translates as 'the rogue', which perfectly sums up this vibrant, charming wine. With just two months ageing in concrete vats, you can taste its youthful freshness â€“ thereâ€™s notes of juicy blackberry and blueberry, liquorice and sweet spice. The perfect choice for cuts of roast beef.

Title: Bodega Matsu 'La Jefa' 2018/19, Toro
Description: As soon as the team behind Bodega Matsu visited Toro, they knew they had to make wine there. 100-year-old vineyards, perfect soils and a goldilocks climate all pointed to a wine of exceptional quality. La Jefa is made there from these obscure, ancient vines â€“ it's a century in the making, but it's well worth the wait. A wide variety of white grapes were picked by hand and fermented on lees in French oak. So you can expect a seriously lush texture and plenty of flavour. Discover notes of vanilla, ripe stone fruits and cream. Perfect with seafood.

Title: Bodega Volcanes CarmÃ©nÃ¨re 2020/21
Description: Bodegas Volcanes de Chile is a new winery, founded in 2009, that focuses on making wines on Chile's volcanic soils (there are nearly 3,000 volcanoes in Chile) and that truly represent their unique volcanic landscape. This abundantly fruity expression of CarmÃ©nÃ¨re possesses dark fruit flavours heightened by rich notes of chocolate and subtler notes of spice, herbs and olives. This is an ideal wine to go with meaty stews or toad in the hole.
Characteristics: Smoke, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Earth

Title: Bodegas Olarra 'Dehesa de Lantana' Rioja Reserva 2017/18
Description:
Bodegas Olarra have a winery with a difference. Itâ€™s nicknamed 'the cathedral of Rioja' and was purpose-built to be ideal for ageing wine. Perfect for Rioja, given that itâ€™s all about oak and ageing. The roof of the cellar has 111 hexagonal domes which are arranged to keep the temperature consistent. This is really important when laying down wine to age. Reservas are only made in the best vintages. And thanks to Olarraâ€™s special cellars, this has the perfect balance between sweet fruit and toasty oak. Itâ€™s got a savoury smokiness to it and flavours of ripe black fruit. It's silky, smooth and perfect with roast lamb.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2018 vintage.

Title: Boekenhoutskloof Syrah 2018/20, Swartland
Description: Boekenhoutskloof began in 1776 and is now in the very capable hands of Marc Kent, one of the biggest names in South African wine. Tim Atkin MW labelled them a First Growth in his 2021 South Africa report, and this is one of the most in-demand Syrahs in the country. It has concentrated notes of blackcurrant, black olive, ripe plums, cardamom and black pepper. Match with a dish that can stand up to plenty of flavour, like barbecued ribs or juicy beef burgers.
Characteristics: Blackcurrant, Red Plum, Tobacco, White Pepper

Title: Cantina Negrar 'Vigneti di Roccolo' Amarone della Valpolicella 2019/20
Description: Barolo, Brunello and Amarone are the three kings of Italian wine. But while Barolo and Brunello have been around for centuries â€“ even millennia â€“ Amarone has only existed since 1938. How has it reached equal renown so quickly? In short: Amarone is unique. Itâ€™s made using dried grapes. Thatâ€™s standard practice for sweet wines. as it reduces the water volume in the grapes, upping the percentage of sugar. But Amarone ferments the grapes to dryness, meaning itâ€™s got a lot of alcohol, a lot of viscosity â€“ and a lot of flavour. It makes for a seriously opulent wine. Plush. Layered with both fresh and dried-fruit flavours. There really is nothing quite like it. Fantastic with braised meat and aged cheese like Parmesan or Pecorino.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Chocolate, Fig, Red Cherry, Red Plum, Sweet Spice

Title: Caruso & Minini 'Corte Ferro' Nerello Mascalese-Frappato 2021/22, Sicily
Description: Caruso & Minini are one of the producers defining Sicily's wine revolution. From an estate 400 metres above sea level in the remote west of the island, they concentrate on reviving local varieties. This blend of light-bodied Frappato and more tannic Nerello Mascalese, is a red truly unique to Sicily. It's snappy and full of wild berries, spices and refreshing acidity that'll delight fans of Beaujolais or Cabernet Franc.

Title: Casal de Ventozela Vinho Verde DOC 2021/22
Description: Vinho Verde is in the far north of Portugal, a cool area with tempering Atlantic breezes and frequent rainfall. This unique climate retains acidity in grapes, giving this wine its bright, crisp finish. Expect aromas of white pepper, green apple and citrus fruit. Its aromatic complexity makes it a superb match for lightly-spiced dishes and seafood.

Title: Castello Banfi â€˜Poggio alle Muraâ€™ Brunello di Montalcino 2016/17
Description:
Montalcino is an area famous for its high-end wines made from the Sangiovese grape. Castello Banfi is regarded as one of its most beautiful estates. And the class doesn't end at architecture. This is a complex, elegant Brunello, with notes of violets, red fruit, cigar box and spices. Decant for an hour before serving at 14 degrees with roast lamb or cellar for up to 20 years.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2016 vintage.

Title: Castello di Meleto 'San Pietro' Chianti Classico DOCG 2020/21
Description: The first mention of Castello di Meleto dates back to the 13th century. But it wasn't until the 1960s that the castle became the home of Viticola Toscana, a company that champions the winemaking traditions of the Chianti subzone of Gaiole. And this wine is classic Tuscany: a Chianti made from Sangiovese grapes in the 'Classico' foothills. Expect complex notes of cherry, flowers and vanilla. Serve now with leg of lamb or cellar for another five years.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Red Fruit, Spice, Strawberry

Title: Castelnau de Suduiraut 2016/17 Sauternes Half Bottle
Description: This is the second wine of ChÃ¢teau Suduiraut, a premier Cru ClassÃ© Sauternes whose vines border those of ChÃ¢teau d'Yquem. Crafted after stringent grape selection, this is a well-made and elegant wine. With seductive aromas of fragrant orange blossom, spices and fudge. The smooth initial taste develops into soft sweetness on the palate backed by the delicate aromas that are found on the nose. Savour these great value half bottles as a partner to traditional smooth duck liver terrine or alternatively just enjoy it on its own.

Title: Catena Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/21, Mendoza
Description: Catena's Agrelo vineyards possess ideal soil and micro-climatic conditions for growing classic varieties such as Cabernet Sauvignon, and are renowned for producing wines of great finesse and elegance. Full bodied, with rich, dark, supremely concentrated cassis-scented black fruit and a warm, spicy finish. Excellent with steaks, roast beef or, if you are feeling adventurous, haggis.

Title: Catena Malbec 2019/20 Half Bottle, Mendoza
Description: NicolÃ¡s Catena was the first South American winemaker to ever be named â€˜Decanterâ€™s Man of the Yearâ€™. No wonder when he pioneered high-altitude Malbec in the Argentine Andes. Before that, Argentina was only seen as a producer of cheap bulk wine. The Catenaâ€™s changed all that. NicolÃ¡sâ€™ great-grandfather, Nicola, planted his first Malbec vines in 1902. Since then, the family have amassed a collection of Malbec varietals which are exclusive to them. It makes the Catenaâ€™s wines completely distinct from other Argentine Malbecs. Bold. Ripe. Fruity. Itâ€™s a big wine with lots of flavour â€“ and a lovely plush texture. Itâ€™s crying out for grilled meats â€“ think barbecued steak with a punchy chimichurri sauce. Delicious.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Violet

Title: Catena Zapata â€˜Nicasiaâ€™ Malbec 2019/20, Uco Valley
Description: The Catena Zapata family's mission is to make profound and unforgettable wines. They specialise in making high-quality Malbecs in uncovered Uco Valley spots. It's a lot of work. But it's how you find the finest fruit. This is complex and expressive, with notes of blueberries, cassis, vanilla and cream. Decant and serve at 12-18oC with chargrilled steak or cellar for 10-15 years.

Title: Cave des Vignerons de Buxy 'Les MilliÃ¨res' Montagny Premier Cru 2021/22
Description: Deep in the CÃ´te Chalonnaise, Montagny is an appellation with a difference. It dedicates itself entirely to the production of white wine â€“ all Chardonnay. Two thirds of the vineyards have the prestigious Premier Cru classification â€“ an extremely high proportion of high-quality vineyards. â€˜Les Milliersâ€™ is one of these Premier Crus, made by Caves de Buxy. Theyâ€™re a name to note, known as an excellent, quality-conscious producer â€“ and because theyâ€™re a cooperative with access to grapes from a variety of top-notch growers, itâ€™s excellent value for money. Itâ€™s fermented and matured in stainless steel tanks to preserve the really pure, ripe fruit flavours. Peach. Pear. Honey. Itâ€™s a really delicious glassful, with a nicely rich texture thatâ€™s still fresh. Perfect with cold ham.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Cream, Floral, Honey, Lemon

Title: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr Kuhlmann-Platz 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' GewÃ¼rztraminer 2019/20, Alsace
Description: Cave de Hunawihr began in Alsace, on the German border of France, in 1954. Their aim was to restore the regionâ€™s winemaking industry after it was badly damaged by the German occupation in World War Two. Today, this cooperative consists of 110 members, and it's safe to say they've smashed their initial target. This is a rich and full GewÃ¼rztraminer, with notes of lychee, mango and white pepper. Try it with lightly spiced Thai food.

Title: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr Kuhlmann-Platz 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' Pinot Noir 2021/22, Alsace
Description: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr began in Alsace, on the German border of France, in 1954. Their aim was to restore the regionâ€™s winemaking industry after it was badly damaged by the German occupation in World War Two. Today, this cooperative consists of 110 members, and it's safe to say they've smashed their initial target. This is a light and fresh Pinot Noir, with flavours of cherry, strawberry, sweet spices and cedar. Try it with turkey or chicken.
Characteristics: Red Fruit, Black Cherry, Blackcurrant, Cranberry, Red Cherry

Title: Domaine L. Chatelain Chablis Premier Cru 2020/21
Description:
Fourchaume is one of the most acclaimed spots in Chablis. Exposed to the rising sun, vines here see bucketloads of grape plumping hours. Here, you'll find Chablis that's powerful and elegant, standing toe to toe with the finest Grand Crus. Domaine L. Chatelain's is a prime example. On the nose, it emits delicate hints of almond, butter and licorice. The palate is round and buttery with flavours of citrus, marmalade and toasted almond.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Almond, Floral, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: M. Chapoutier 'Les Moniers' Crozes Hermitage 2019/21
Description: The Northern reaches of the RhÃ´ne Valley are famed for hedonistic Syrah. But you need to shop smart to avoid eye-watering prices. Crozes-Hermitage is a haven for great value and, combined with the expertise of Chapoutier, this means this ripe, red-fruit-packed red is sublime value.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Spice

Title: ChÃ¢teau Certan de May 2007, Pomerol
Description: ChÃ¢teau Certan de May is a first-class Pomerol estate that is named after its 17th-century founders. It sits on Pomerol's prized central plateau, opposite Le Pin and next to PÃ©trus. After 13 years of development, the tannins in this, its first wine, are wonderfully integrated. Expect ripe black-fruit flavours, low acidity and an excellent finish. When serving, drive the corkscrew in further than usual. Gently ease the cork out and decant for at least an hour before serving at 15 degrees. Excellent with lamb.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de la Cour dâ€™Argent 2014, Bordeaux SupÃ©rieur
Description: This family-owned Bordeaux winery knows that without good grapes, you donâ€™t get good wine. Thatâ€™s why they take great pains to make sure every vintage starts with perfectly ripe fruit, before harvesting begins. This is made mostly from Merlot, with a dash of Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, and aged in oak barrels for 14 months. Expect spicy, fruity aromas with hints of black pepper, blackberries and cinnamon. Try it now with grilled beef or cellar for another decade.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Grand-Puy-Lacoste 2013, Pauillac
Description: ChÃ¢teau Grand-Puy-Lacoste is one of the oldest properties in the MÃ©doc. But that doesn't mean they rest on their laurels. Winemaker Phillipe Gouze is constantly innovating through a combination of traditional and modern technology. This 2013 vintage is yet another of his successes. It's linear and well-balanced, with flavours of black fruit, creamy cassis and a touch of vanilla spice. Decant for an hour before serving at room temperature. Divine with stroganoff.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Guiot 2019/20, CostiÃ¨res de NÃ®mes
Description: CostiÃ¨res de NÃ®mes has more in common with the RhÃ´ne across the river than it does with the wines of Languedoc immediately neighbouring it. ChÃ¢teau Guiot lies just outside the city of NÃ®mes, in the heart of this appellation. Deep purple hue, a beautifully scented nose with herby aromas, lashings of juicy forest fruits and spicy, rich berry flavours on the palate and a good, smooth finish. Equally good with anything from shepherd's pie, meatballs or moussaka style vegetarian dishes.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Montrose 'La Dame de Montrose', Saint-EstÃ¨phe
Description: ChÃ¢teau Montroseâ€™s second wine is made with grapes from the same vineyard as its iconic Grand Vin. And itâ€™s produced with the same rigorous standards. The historic estate first planted vines in 1815 in vineyards that stretch along the banks of the Gironde estuary. The river creates a unique microclimate ideal for producing high quality grapes, providing the perfect level of sun exposure and frost protection. Expect complex notes of ripe black fruit and toasty oak with silky tannins. Perfect for roast beef.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Red Fruit, Tobacco

Title: ChÃ¢teau PesquiÃ© â€˜Edition 1912m' 2021, Ventoux
Description: Mont Ventoux is known as the Giant of Provence. Itâ€™s long been the toughest stretch of the Tour de France, but itâ€™s also home to the coolest microclimate in the Southern RhÃ´ne. Lower temperatures here allow the grapes to ripen slowly and become much more aromatic â€“ showing a more delicate side to the classic red RhÃ´ne blend. We picked up a small parcel of this last year and the reception was so good, we jumped at the chance to get another vintage. Expect notes of violet, red fruits, garrigue herbs and a kick of pepper. The silky texture and fine tannins will complement roast chicken and lentils perfectly.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Earth, Spice, Strawberry

Title: ChÃ¢teau Pichon Baron 'Les Griffons de Pichon Baron' 2015, Pauillac
Description: ChÃ¢teau Pichon Baron is a leading Pauillac producer with history dating back to 1694. This is the second wine of their iconic Left Bank estate. And itâ€™s made to the same high standards as their top wines. The Cabernet Sauvignon grapes that dominate the blend primarily come from gravel soils near Gironde estuary. These soils produce some of the most expensive and renowned wines that have brought Bordeaux so much fame. Expect a full-bodied wine with flavours of blackcurrant, blueberries, liquorice and hints of cedar and tobacco. Enjoy it now with classic Pauillac lamb shoulder or cellar for up to 20 years.

Title: Cloudy Bay Chardonnay 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Cloudy Bay are one of New Zealandâ€™s most celebrated producers. Theyâ€™ve been crafting world-class wines for almost 50 years â€“ and while their famous Sauvignon often grabs the headlines, this elegant Chardonnay is deserving of equal attention. The grapes are handpicked from vineyards in Marlboroughâ€™s sun-soaked Wairau Valley and cooler Southern Valleys, bringing plenty of flavour and freshness to your glass. Add barrel fermentation and 11 months of ageing, and youâ€™re in for a seriously lush, complex wine. Discover intense flavours of citrus, peach and apricot with savoury notes of toast and hay. Its rounded texture makes it incredibly food-friendly â€“ enjoy yours with seafood, cheese, or any dish made with a creamy sauce.

Title: Cloudy Bay Pinot Noir 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Cloudy Bay crafts some of New Zealand's finest wine. The cool-climate Marlborough is almost too generous to the demanding Pinot Noir grape. Here, the trailblazing winery has created this silk-smooth 92 Parker Point 2017 vintage that's loaded with raspberry, strawberry and cola. A deliciously sweet hint of spice lingers on the finish.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Cloudy Bay Te Koko 2019, Marlborough
Description: An iconic wine from New Zealand's most iconic winery.  Atypical for Kiwi Sauvignon, the Te Koko is fermented using indigenous 'wild' yeasts, and subjected to batonnage as it ages in oak. Released as a three year old wine, this is unlike anything else from New Zealand! Lychees and almonds with classic gooseberry notes and a hint of wood smoke. A full bodied palate of citrus fruits with the richer flavours of caramel and nougat, leading to a crisp yet spicy finish. Able to age for up to five years, this wine an ideal partner to tuna, oysters and poached fish.
Characteristics: Pineapple, Almond, Charred Wood, Gooseberry, Lychee

Title: Collovray & Terrier 'Reserve' Saint VÃ©ran 2019/20
Description: Collovray & Terrier's Reserve is delicious proof that Saint VÃ©ran remains one of the best value communes in Burgundy. Ageing for 6 months on lees in both oak and steel tanks gives this golden Chardonnay a beautiful structure and richness. Expect notes of ripe citrus, white flowers and a delicate minerality. Serve with chicken terrine.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Butter, Cream, Floral, Honey, Lemon

Title: Cune Barrel Fermented Rioja Blanco 2022
Description:
Cune (or CVNE to some) are world-famous for their Rioja. But have you tried their whites before? This one is made from the Viura grape, which is known as Macabeo outside of Rioja. They aim to create a modern style of Rioja Blanco. And itâ€™s fermented in 50% new American oak, which gives the wine a creamy texture and pronounced aromas of vanilla and brioche. Itâ€™s full and rounded with a balancing citrus acidity. Fantastic with roast pork.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: CuvÃ©e de Richard Blanc 2021/22, France
Description: CuvÃ©e de Richard Blanc is a Majestic standard. Itâ€™s fresh, easy-drinking â€“ and, better still, itâ€™s absolutely fantastic value for money. Our buyers are always on the lookout for the very best wines to give you great flavour and great value, so it says something that this wine has been in our range for over a decade. Itâ€™s hard to best for a crisp, light, dry white â€“ the sort of easy-drinking table wine the French do better than anyone else. Green apple. Lime. Grapefruit. Itâ€™s got a really citrussy zing, and lovely, delicately floral, stone-fruit aromas. This is a real crowd-pleaser, so itâ€™s a perfect party wine. But itâ€™s also great with light salads â€“ or just as a nice glassful on the sofa.
Characteristics: Lemon, Grapefruit, Grass, Green Apple, Herbaceous

Title: CuvÃ©e de Richard Rouge 2021/22, France
Description: From the Languedoc region on France's Mediterranean coast, CuvÃ©e de Richard Rouge offers remarkable value for money. A blend of Carignan and Grenache, it has smooth blackberry and plum notes and a rounded finish.

Title: CuvÃ©e Sainte GeneviÃ¨ve Rouge VdF
Description: This wine is made from grapes sourced from a number of growers, and vinified at Caves de Landiras, a state-of-the-art winery at the heart of the winemaking scene for many small vaineyards in the south and southwest corners of France. Supple and inviting, this wine blends the soft and jammy raspberry fruit of ripe Grenache with the firming influences of Carignan's blackberry flavours and robust tannin. Light-to medium-bodied, this wine will partner with anything from cold cuts to flavoursome pasta dishes.

Title: CVNE 'Imperial' Rioja Reserva 2017/18
Description:
CVNE is unquestionably one of Rioja's finest producers. And this is one of the very best Rioja Reservas around. Interestingly, it's named 'Imperial' as it was initially exported to the UK in imperial-sized pint measures. It's made from some of their very best grapes, which are picked by hand, and aged in both French and American oak to create a truly sensuous experience. Expect aromas of vanilla, mulberry and spice, flavours of stewed blackcurrants and a long finish. Decant it for at least an hour before enjoying its fine tannins with lamb.  

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2017 vintage.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Dried Herbs, Red Fruit

Title: De Bortoli Botrytis Semillon 2019 Half Bottle, RiverinaÂ
Description: Inspired by the late Australian designer Florence Broadhurst, this is a limited release botrytis dessert wine from Semillon masters De Bortoli. Whilst made from the same grape as De Bortoli's iconic Noble One Semillon, one of the most awarded wines in history, this is a lighter, more refreshing style. Pair its citrus and spicy apricot notes and fresh acidity with fruit desserts.
Characteristics: Orange Marmalade, Citrus Fruit, Honey, Honeysuckle

Title: Definition Barossa Shiraz 2019/20
Description:
The Definition range brings the worldâ€™s greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Barossa is the heartland of Australian Shiraz. Here, it's unmistakably big, bold and full of black-fruit flavour. To capture this at its best, we went to a Barossa producer that's respected worldwide. They haven't disappointed. Itâ€™s deeply concentrated with rich notes of blackcurrant, ripe plum and pepper spice. Partner with a hearty steak, drizzled in black pepper sauce. 

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.
Characteristics: Black Pepper, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Jammy, Spice

Title: Definition MÃ¢con-Villages 2021/22, Burgundy
Description:
The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers, so it isnâ€™t complete without white Burgundy. The MÃ¢connais is the regionâ€™s best-kept secret, and itâ€™s yet to get the fanfare of the north, so continues to make fantastic Chardonnay at great value. Wines are typically made unoaked, and the warmer climate here means pure fruit flavours sing from your glass. And this exclusive bottling is a shining example. Itâ€™s fresh with flavours of citrus and stone fruits that will pair excellently with soft, creamy cheeses.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Definition Margaux 2018/19
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Margaux, on the Left Bank of Bordeaux, is where you'll find remarkably supple, perfumed and elegant claret. To capture the very best of the region, we went to a very prestigious producer. To get them on side, we had to promise to keep their name top secret. It was well worth the effort. It's wonderfully complex, with flavours of red berries, smoke and sweet spices. It's medium body pairs perfectly with chicken or turkey.

Title: Definition Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore DOC 2017/18
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. To capture the essential elements of Valpolicella Ripasso, we went to a family that's made wine in the region for 108 years. Rich and spicy, with notes of cherry, tobacco and black pepper. Serve with chargrilled steak.

Title: DeMorgenzon â€˜Reserveâ€™ Chenin Blanc 2019/20, South Africa
Description: Hereâ€™s a wine that celebrates the South African sunshine: DeMorgenzon means â€˜the morning sunâ€™ in Afrikaans. The name comes from the vineyardâ€™s location. At a high altitude of 250-300 metres above sea level, itâ€™s the first spot in the Stellenbosch Kloof Valley to catch the day's rays. This is made from 100% Chenin Blanc vines planted in the 1970s. It's wonderfully balanced with both freshness and complexity, thanks to barrel fermentation. Itâ€™s a lushly fragrant wine â€“ think orange blossom, pear, caramel and spice. Thereâ€™s plenty of mouth-watering acidity, too, which means it will cut through creamy sauces with aplomb. Try it with a carbonara.

Title: Devil's Creek Merlot 2020, Hawke's Bay
Description: Hawke's Bay is still something of a Kiwi secret. Itâ€™s Bordeaux as Bordeaux used to be â€“ cool and coastal. Thatâ€™s why Bordeaux varieties like Merlot do so well here. The relative coolness lets the grapes ripen slowly â€“ it concentrates all the flavours so this is even plusher and juicier than your standard Merlot. We just knew we had to have a wine from such a stellar region on our books, but try as we might we couldnâ€™t find quite the right Hawke's Bay Merlot. So, we commissioned it. That means this great value red is exclusive to us. Plummy. Red-fruity. Smooth. As delicious as it is great value. We guarantee thereâ€™s nothing nicer with Chinese-style crispy duck pancakes.
Characteristics: Red Plum, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Raspberry

Title: Dog Point Chardonnay 2018/19, Marlborough
Description: 18 months in mainly old French oak barrels has formed this top quality Marlborough Chardonnay into a genuine rival to premier cru Burgundy. Straw coloured, with aromas of flint, grapefruit peel and ripe citrus fruits are framed by nutty mineral nuances in this wine. Seamlessly integrated oak leads into a wonderfully balanced Chardonnay with a concentrated and lively finish. Will reward careful cellaring of 3-5 years.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Lime, Ripe Fruit

Title: Dom Ruinart 2009/10 Champagne
Description:
This great vintage boasts a unique complexity, an aromatic freshness, an elegant effervescence and a fine balance between strength and smoothness. Dom Ruinart has an elegant nose of white flowers and citrus notes developing into brioche and toast.

Please note that either one or both of the two vintages may be sent.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Almond, Apricot, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Domaine Cauvard Chorey-lÃ¨s-Beaune 2020/21
Description: Three-generations of wine-growing experience is behind this wine. Domaine Cauvard, a family business, has 17 hectares of vines spread across the heart of the celebrated CÃ´te de Beaune, which is to many the home of the world's finest Pinot Noir. You can taste their expertise in this light, elegant red Burgundy. Expect enticing aromas of raspberry, cherry and liquorice, with elegant tannins that will make it equally enjoyable to drink on its own or with food. The perfect match? Charcuterie and cheese boards.

Title: Domaine de la MÃ©tairie dâ€™Alon Organic Pinot Noir 2019, Languedoc
Description: Laurent Delaunay is the fifth generation of a family with a rich winemaking history. In an innovative step, he acquired Domaine de la La MÃ©tairie d'Alon in 2015 â€“ a high-altitude vineyard, just a stoneâ€™s throw from Limoux. He farms organically, and with vast experience of crafting fine Burgundy wines, brings the same standards of winemaking to new territory. The handpicked grapes for Le Village are gently pressed, with just under half the wine spending 6 months in oak barrels to add complexity. Just like a classic Burgundy, the resulting wine is elegant, juicy and fresh. Discover floral and red-berry notes with a touch of ginger. Flavours of cherry and hints of liquorice and white pepper will complement grilled red meats.

Title: Domaine de Ladoucette 'Comte Lafond' Sancerre 2020/21, Loire Valley
Description: Domaines de Ladoucette are known for producing some of the world's finest Sauvignon Blanc. They made their name by creating Pouilly-FumÃ© but also make smaller amounts of exceptional Sancerre. This is an intense, mineral wine, with notes of grapefruit, pear, peach and gunflint. Serve it at 6-10 degrees with grilled fish.
Characteristics: Honey, Citrus Fruit, Grass, Green Apple

Title: Domaine des AubuisiÃ¨res â€˜CuvÃ©e de Perruchesâ€™ Vouvray 2021/22
Description: Bernard Fouquet has around 30ha of Chenin vines, planted across a range of soils, from limestone to flint. Each parcel is hand-picked and vinified separately, with fermentation taking place partly in oak barrels and partly in old glass-lined vats cut into the rock. A pure, well developed nose of fresh quince and pear. The palate is a swathe of ripe apple fruit, with a honeyed sweetness, balanced by Chenin's characteristic blade-like acidity and mineral grip. A superb aperitif wine which will also partner the delicate flavours of salmon en croute or cold cured meats.
Characteristics: Quince, Green Apple, Honey, Lemon, Pear

Title: Domaine des Deux VallÃ©es 'Clos de la Casse' Anjou Blanc 2022
Description: Philippe Socheleau and his father sold their apple orchards in 2001 and took a leap of faith. They bought 36 hectares of Anjou vineyards, in the Loire Valley, ripped out the Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay vines and planted Chenin Blanc. Philippe's now a specialist in the grape. And it really shows in this dense, full-bodied wine. Expect flavours of green apple, quince, pear and lemon peel. Try it with scallops with a dash of crÃ¨me fraÃ®che.

Title: Domaine des Tourelles 'Grand CuvÃ©e Pierre Brun' 2015/17, Lebanon
Description: Faouzi E Issa has a knack for making fantastic wine in challenging circumstances. After earning his stripes at ChÃ¢teau Margaux and with RenÃ© Rostaing, he's one of the world's few Lebanese winemakers. And he's guaranteed to go down as one of the country's greats. This is made from small parcels of old-vine Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes. Each is picked by hand from high altitudes in the Bekaa Valley. It's savoury and full-bodied, with notes of black cherry, plum, blackcurrant, cedar and chocolate. Great with a lentil stew.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Chocolate, Game, Red Fruit, Spice, Tobacco

Title: Domaine Faiveley  Nuits Saint Georges Premier Cru 2013/14
Description: Domaine Faiveley was founded in 1825 and has been passed from one generation of the family to the next since. This is made in the Les PorÃªts Saint-Georges climat, which was recognised as one of the very best spots in the CÃ´te de Nuits by a renowned expert, Dr Lavalle, in 1855. The Faiveley family is particularly attached to these vines, as they were some of the first purchased by the domaine in the 1830s. Most importantly, the red Burgundy they make on this Premier Cru is exceptional. It has aromas of strawberry, raspberry, toast and oak and rich, smooth tannins. Try it with duck breast now or cellar for up to 12 years.

Title: Domaine GÃ©rard Thomas Saint-Aubin Blanc 1er Cru 2020/21
Description: Bordering the acclaimed vineyards of Puligny-Montrachet, GÃ©rard Thomas produces a St Aubin premier cru that challenges its pricier neighbour. He barrel ferments this wine to give it a softer and smoother complexity. With a nose of ripe citrus, fresh peach, subtle sweet spice and hints of minerals, this is followed by gentle hazelnut aromas, lemons and limes, hints of vanilla and butter on the palate. This fantastically well balanced and complex wine would be a great accompaniment  to pan fried scallops, fresh crab or lobster dishes.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Butter, Lemon, Pastry, Peach, Sweet Spice

Title: Domaine Jean Chauvenet Nuits-Saint-Georges 2020/21
Description: The Chauvenet family have been making wine in Burgundy since 1680. For their outstanding Pinot Noir, they balance their heritage with constant innovation. Expect complex notes of red berries. Pair with rich tomato pasta.

Title: Domaine Jean Perrier & Fils 'Altus' 2020/21, Savoie
Description: This is our first foray into the Alpine region of Savoie, which is famed for its fresh, thirst-quenching wines that are the hit of the region's many ski resorts. It's made by the Perrier family, who have worked here since 1853, from the JacquÃ¨re grape in one of the area's finest spots. Expect a light and refreshing white with notes of lemon and hawthorn and a flinty minerality. Try this with cheese fondue.

Title: Domaine L. Chatelain Chablis 2021/22
Description: Domaine L. Chatelain have been family-run for generations. Based in the village of Fontenay, just north of the town of Chablis, their vines grow on the regionâ€™s famous KimmÃ©ridgien soils â€“ a mixture of chalky limestone and clay that dates back to the Jurassic period. Itâ€™s these soils that give Chablis its signature flinty character, which certainly shines through in this elegant bottling. Crisp, aromatic and seriously refreshing, itâ€™s full of zingy citrus and green apple flavours. Its distinctive minerality makes it the perfect accompaniment to shellfish â€“ especially oysters.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Cream, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Domaine Passy â€˜Le Clouâ€™ Petit Chablis 2021/22
Description: This winery was founded in the 1950s and sold wine in bulk to local wine merchants. When the Descombes took over, in 2017, everything changed. They switched its sights to quality, not quantity â€“ focusing on the environmental conservation of their coveted Burgundy plots. They've even gone as far to plant hedges and trees and use natural fertilisers in the vineyards. This is their Petit Chablis, and it has all the classic flavours you'd expect: lemon and grapefruit, and a textbook lick of minerality. Enjoy it with salmon tartare.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Green Fruit, Wet Stones

Title: Domaine Robert Sirugue 'Les Trois Terroirs' 2019/20, Vosne-RomanÃ©e
Description: Vosne-RomanÃ©e is a region internationally renowned for its smooth and silky red Burgundy. This is made on three areas of the region specifically selected for their characteristic structure and elegance. Ripe red fruit and spices are the main notes in this excellent Pinot Noir. It will develop aromas of forest floor and leather as it ages over ten years. Divine at 14-16 degrees with roasted lamb.

Title: Domaines Schlumberger â€˜Spiegelâ€™ Pinot Gris Grand Cru 2020/21, Alsace
Description: Domaines Schlumberger sets the standard for quality in Alsace. Now in its seventh generation of family ownership, the estate lies on a steep, picturesque hillside where the vineyards reach altitudes of almost 400 metres. Spiegel is one of four Grand Cru spots in this part of Alsace, and itâ€™s one of the best Pinot Gris sites in the region. Here, the grapes ripen perfectly under the sun while retaining a balancing freshness and acidity â€“ making for an opulent, complex and elegant wine. Discover rich notes of ripe yellow plum, apricot, quince, orange blossom and honey, with a silky, full-bodied texture courtesy of eight monthsâ€™ careful lees ageing. It has a luxurious touch of sweetness, so try it with soft, creamy cheeses or something a little exotic like apricot-stuffed pork.

Title: Dr Loosen Slate Hill Riesling 2021/22, Mosel
Description: Ernst Loosen is a superstar of German winemaking. He took over his family winery in 1988 and immediately set out to gain international recognition for his wines, the Mosel region, and Riesling in general. Heâ€™s more than succeeded â€“ today, Dr Loosen is one of Germanyâ€™s most highly regarded estates, and both Ernst and his wines have won numerous prestigious awards. This aromatic, medium-dry Riesling is an excellent demonstration of his skill. Discover flavours of lime, peach and apricot, plus a touch of sweetness balanced perfectly by a crisp acidity. Enjoy it with lightly spiced Asian-style dishes.
Characteristics: Pear, Floral, Green Apple, Honey, Lime, Peach

Title: Duckhorn Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, California
Description: Duckhorn is a Napa Valley icon. Its winemaking team are taking on a new terrain in Sonoma. The best part? The delicious wine made there is a fraction of the usual asking price. It's a rich, ripe Cabernet Sauvignon, with flavours of black fruits, plum, cedar and spice. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with a rack of ribs.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Chocolate

Title: E. Guigal ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape 2017/18
Description: The Guigal family may have made their name with iconic CÃ´te-RÃ´tie. But they also produce fantastic ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape from 45-year-old vines. And the critics can't get enough of it. This is a full-bodied, velvety and powerful wine, with notes of red fruits, plum, hazelnut and spice. Decant for an hour before serving at 16-18 degrees with cheese or cellar for up to 15 years.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: E. Guigal Condrieu 2020/21
Description: Guigal played a large part in the resurgence of Condrieu, the enclave famous for rich, exotic and perfumed Viognier with worldwide acclaim. They pay the same attention to detail today. And it really shows in this full-bodied wine. It has intense notes of apricot, peach and citrus and is excellent with fish. Serve at 12-13 degrees or age for five years.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Butter, Cream, Grapefruit, Honey, Honeysuckle, Lemon, Peach, Pear

Title: E. Guigal Gigondas 2019/20, RhÃ´ne Valley
Description: Gigondas is where you'll fine ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape-esque reds at great value, and E. Guigal is one of the finest producers in the RhÃ´ne Valley. Here, it presses Grenache, Syrah and MourvÃ¨dre grapes and ages the wine for two years in oak. The result is full-bodied and intense, with powerful hints of red fruit, liquorice and oak and supple tannins. Jeb Dunnuck gave the 2016 vintage 93-95 points.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry, Spice

Title: Eccelsa Vermentino 2021/22, Sardinia
Description: Vermentino is the gem of the island of Sardinia. Because it's still relatively unknown, you can find great value with the grape. Like this expression from Eccelsa. It's made by a family whose wines top tables in the best Italian restaurants. It's intense and aromatic, with notes of summer fruits. Excellent with seafood.

Title: Eddystone Point Chardonnay 2019/20, Tasmania
Description: Tasmania is fast becoming one of the most exciting Australian Chardonnay regions. And for good reason. This is made there by Penny Jones, who worked for ten vintages at the famous Petaluma winery. Juicy. Fresh. Textured. Discover notes of stone fruit, pear juice and lemon curd, with a delicious minerality. Pair with ravioli dressed in butter.

Title: Edouard Delaunay 'Septembre' Chardonnay 2019/20, Burgundy
Description:
Maison Edouard Delaunay has a rich history dating back to 1893. Its wines were the choice of The Orient Express and the finest restaurants in France. A century later, it fell out of family hands. That was until Edouardâ€™s great-grandson, Laurent, bought it back. He re-established his deep-rooted family connections with the best local grape-growers, and has more than succeeded in restoring the name of Edouard Delaunay to its former glory. This great-value, barrel-aged Chardonnay is an fantastic example of his efforts. This is opulent and buttery white Burgundy. Discover expressive notes of citrus, white chocolate and hazelnut. Enjoy it with an equally indulgent lobster dish.

This wine scored 92 points from Decanter for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Caramel, Lemon, Peach, Vanilla

Title: El Aviador Tempranillo 2021/22, Spain
Description: Tempranillo is the Spanish grape variety par excellence and it is grown widely throughout the region of Castilla y Leon, having different local names like Tinta de Toro and Tinta del PaÃ­s. Aromas of red and black berries,with a hint of liquorice. Concentrated flavours of black fruits with a perfect balance between fruit and tannins. Round, soft and persistent. Lamb Tagine, Mediterranean mixed platter or mild cheeses.

Title: Emiliana 'Elemental' Organic Gran Reserva Cabernet 2019/21, Maipo Valley
Description: Emiliana were voted Winery of the Year 2016 by Wines of Chile. They're leading the way with delicious organic wines at great value. This Maipo Valley Cabernet is a case in point. It's velvet-smooth and intensely flavoured, with flavours of blackcurrant, strawberry and chocolate.
Characteristics: Green Bell Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar

Title: Ernesto Catena Vineyards â€˜Ãnimalâ€™ Organic Malbec 2021/22, Mendoza
Description: Ernesto Catena is the son of NicolÃ¡s Catena Zapata, the man that put Argentina on the fine-wine map. He's quickly paving his own unconventional way. He makes delicious organic Malbec in the foothills of the Andes, ferments it in concrete eggs and keeps each step of the process in line with the lunar cycle. You can taste the attention to detail in indulgent notes of plum, blackberry, chocolate and vanilla. Its full fruity flavour and tannins make it ideal for your next steak dinner.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Violet

Title: Errazuriz Estate Series Pinot Noir 2021/22, Aconcagua Valley
Description: Don Maximiano ErrÃ¡zuriz founded ViÃ±a ErrÃ¡zuriz in 1870 in the Valle de Aconcagua, 100km north of the capital city, Santiago. He realised that the cool, rainy winters and hot, dry summers combined with Pacific breezes to make it an ideal area to grow grapes. He was the first to plant French varieties there â€“ and it's safe to say his gamble paid off. Today, Errazuriz is regarded as a world-class winery with an array of awards in their trophy cabinet. This smooth and juicy Pinot Noir has aromatic floral notes and fresh flavours of cherry, strawberry with hints of toasty oak. Its silky mouthfeel makes it an excellent partner for roast pork or fillet of salmon. In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Errazuriz Wild Ferment Chardonnay 2020/21, Casablanca Valley
Description: With grapes taken from 'La Escultura Estate,' where cool sea breezes help preserve the freshness in the grapes. Naturally occurring yeast in the grape skins are used instead of cultivated yeasts, along with subtle use of 10% French oak. This wine is unbelievably well balanced, with subtle tropical stone fruit in the form of apricot and peach mingling with subtle oak characters and a rich creaminess. Enjoy this wine over the next two years to allow further integration of oak and fruit, and enjoy with roast chicken and seafood dishes.

Title: Escarpment 'Kupe' Pinot Noir 2021, Martinborough
Description: Escarpment was born from winemaker Larry McKenna's passion for the Martinborough wine region. After years of extensive research, he set up his own winery. He believes that the area is ideal for growing Pinot Noir. In his rendition of this delicate grape, expect fresh flavours and soft tannins. Wonderful with roast chicken.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Earth

Title: Escarpment Pinot Noir 2017, Martinborough
Description: Larry McKenna has been celebrated in the New Zealand Wine Hall of Fame and is a Fellow of the New Zealand Wine Growers. He's a specialist in Pinot Noir and is even known affectionately as Larry McPinot by fans of his fantastic reds. Taste what all the fuss is about in this perfumed, delicate wine, with elegantly textured tannins and supple red and black fruits. It will cellar for up to 10 years but also drink well now with crispy pork belly.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Forrest Wines 'The Doctors'' Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: In 1988, John and Brigid Forrest left behind careers in molecular biology and medicine and founded Forrest Wines. They brought their innovative approach to The Doctors' range, which is a series of lower-alcohol wines that don't compromise on flavour. This 9.5% ABV Sauvignon Blanc is sustainably grown and brings plenty of that classic Marlborough charm. Expect notes of gooseberry, passionfruit and citrus. It's bold and tropical, with a refreshing acidity that's great with goat's cheese.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Georges Vigouroux 'Le Grand Retour' Malbec 2018/20, Cahors
Description: Did you know that Malbec began in Europe? It's often celebrated as an Argentinian grape variety. But it all began in the south-west of France. To be precise, Cahors. Cahors won Wine Enthusiast's Wine Region of the Year in 2017. And that was around the time when Georges Vigouroux decided to honour the return of Malbec in its birthplace â€“ creating Le Grand Retour. This is exceptionally fruity and rich, with flavours of raspberry, blackcurrant and blackberry, and ripe tannins. Try it with roast pork.

Title: GÃ©rard Bertrand Clos d'Ora Organic 2017, Minervois La LiviniÃ¨re
Description: GÃ©rard Bertrand is a former professional rugby union player who played for the French national team. After he retired, he became one of the most recognisable names in Languedoc winemaking. This is his flagship wine that's made in one of the region's very best spots with organic and biodynamic practices. You'll find it on the wine lists of some of the world's most exclusive restaurants. For good reason. It's robust and powerful yet remarkably elegant, with flavours of red cherries, dark chocolate and tobacco. Decant for an hour before serving now or age for up to 20 years. Decanter's Georgina Hindle gave this 2017 vintage 94 points.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Dried Herbs, Earth, Liquorice, Spice

Title: GÃ©rard Bertrand 'Clos du Temple' Organic RosÃ© 2019, Languedoc
Description: GÃ©rard Bertrand was a professional rugby player who, later in life, took over the family winemaking estate. He now manages several sites around the South of France, and Clos du Temple is producing some of his finest rosÃ©. The vines on this 8-hectare spot are farmed with biodynamic, organic methods to let the purity of the fruit shine through. The grapes are picked just as the sun rises over the estate to further preserve this fresh flavour. The result is a layered and long-lasting rosÃ© with aromas of ripe apricot, white peach and pink pepper, and a signature minerality. Enjoy with baked salmon or cellar for another 10 to 15 years.

Title: Grant Burge 'Filsell' Shiraz 2017/19, Barossa
Description:
A deep, intense Shiraz from Grant Burge, this will show you the perfumes and powerful flavours that only come from the Filsell vineyard. It's the best of the Barossa, and will make the perfect partner to a premium cut of well aged beef.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2018 vintage.
Characteristics: Liquorice, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth

Title: Guidalberto 2020/21 Tenuta San Guido, IGT Toscana
Description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, and is the 'little brother' to the winery's celebrated Sassicaia, from three vineyard sites surrounding Bolgheri. The varieties are vinified separately before blending and maturation in French and American oak. The wine has an intense violet colour and a soft and rounded fruit profile, and can be enjoyed immediately or over the next 3-4 years.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Leather, Smoke

Title: Hambledon Classic Cuvee, Hampshire
Description: Hambledon is the UK's oldest commercial vineyard, and its head winemaker, HervÃ© Jestin, was cellarmaster at the Duval Leroy Champagne house for over 20 years. The Classic CuvÃ©e, a blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir & Pinot Meunier, once famously beat Pol Roger, Veuve Clicquot and Taittinger in a blind tasting. It has notes of fresh bread, greengage, red plums and dessert apples and a precise acidity.
Characteristics: Red Plum, Bread, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Harvey's Bristol Cream
Description:
Pale Cream and Cream sherries are usually made from sweetened Oloroso's, but Harveys Bristol Cream is a blend of Fino, Amontillado, Oloroso and Pedro XimÃ©nez wines and is of superiour quality.   Amber-gold in colour, medium-sweet, displaying smokey oranges, vanilla, toffee, caramel, nuts and raisins. Viscous and full, but with a superb balance and long finish. Good as an aperitif, as an after dinner drink, or with cheesecake. Drink chilled or over ice.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Hospices de Beaujeu Bourgogne Gamay 2020/21
Description: In existence since 1240 the Hospice de Beaujeu have received numerous donation of land over the years and now own 80.5 hectares of vineyards. This Gamay has a classic Burgundian character with lots of fruit flavours and woody notes.

Title: Indomita 'Gran Reserva' Pinot Noir 2021/22, Casblanca Valley
Description: Chile's Casbalanca Valley has the perfect climate for ripening the infamously tricky Pinot Noir grape. A long, warm ripening season fills the fruit with delicious juice. You can taste the benefits in this luscious wine's flavours of strawberry, coffee and vanilla. Pair a glass of this with thinly-sliced JamÃ³n ibÃ©rico.

Title: J. Moreau et Fils â€˜Le Sans Bois' Chardonnay 2020/21, France
Description: J Moreau began in 1814 and are one of the oldest names in Chablis. They've since branched out, working with dozens of growers in over a hundred different sites to respond to yearly changes in weather, source the best grapes and bring you great value. This is made by winemaker Lucie Depuydt from Chardonnay grapes grown on different mineral soils throughout France. And to great result.
