It's intense and bright, with aromas of jasmine, lemon and pear. Try it with grilled fish, white meat or seafood.

Title: Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ© 'Les Cedres' Organic ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape 2019/20
Description: Jaboulet is the name behind some of the RhÃ´ne Valley's most desired wines. The estate is today in the hands of talented young winemaker Caroline Frey. She's done the name proud with this terrific ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape. It's made from 50-year-old vines and has candied notes of raspberry, strawberry and soft spices. Decant for an hour before serving at room temperature with cassoulet.

Title: Jaboulet 'Les Jumelles' CÃ´te-RÃ´tie 2017/20
Description: Jaboulet is one of the most famous names in the RhÃ´ne. And Caroline Frey is one of France's most exciting young winemakers. With her in charge, they continue to create iconic CÃ´te-RÃ´tie.This is deep and silky, with flavours of raspberries, violets and light spices, and a touch of vanilla on the finish. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with roast lamb or cellar for five years.

Title: Jackson Estate 'Somerset' Pinot Noir 2015/16, Marlborough
Description: Jackson Estate makes the Somerset from hand-picked grapes on a tiny vineyard that has heavy clay soils and a cool climate. The result is a Waihopai River Pinot Noir that takes on the best red Burgundy. But less than 300 cases are made only in the very best years. Expect an intense, concentrated red-fruit character, aromas of rose petal and violet and hints of spice.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Jackson Estate Vintage Widow Pinot Noir 2016, Marlborough
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Earth

Title: Jas des Vignes RosÃ© Boxed Wine 2.25L, IGP MÃ©diterranÃ©e
Description: This stylish pink has its roots in the IGP MÃ©diterranÃ©e region, which encompasses Provence and parts of the RhÃ´ne valley. This large area gives the pioneering winemaker plenty of choice. As a result, this is a Provence-style rosÃ© at a snip of the usual asking price. It's dry, fresh and perfect with artichokes, bacon and garlic on a warm afternoon.

Title: Jean Bon Merlot IGP Pays D'Oc 2021/22
Description: After a red for your Sunday roast? Look no further. Flavour-packed notes of blackberries, jam and redcurrants entwine with hints of regal spices and black pepper. Notes of cassis, raspberry and hints of black pepper compliment the palate while being serenaded by the aroma of sweet black berries. A warming veal dish accompanied by roasted mixed vegetables.

Title: Jean Sablenay Muscadet 2021/22, Loire
Description: This Muscadet is made near the city of Nantes, where the Loire Valley meets the Atlantic coast. Because of this, its affinity with seafood is renowned across France and beyond. And youâ€™ll be hard-pressed to find such a fine example at a better price than this. Delicate and herbaceous, this classic Muscadet has notes of lemon and lime with a fresh minerality. Pair it with any delicious white-fish dishes.

Title: Jean-Louis Chavy Puligny-Montrachet 2019/20
Description: The Chavy family have been in Puligny-Montrachet for almost 200 years. When their father, Gerard, passed on the vineyards, Alain and Jean-Louis split their inheritance in two. They've both very quickly carved their own way in this prestigious region, and Jean-Louis' style is a restrained use of oak and old vines â€“ two techniques that let the natural flavours of the grapes shine. Expect flavours of white peach and citrus with hints of nuts and baked bread. It has a signature Puligny minerality which goes very well with shellfish.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Cream, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey

Title: Jim Barry 'McRae Wood' Shiraz 2013, Clare Valley
Description: The late Jim Barry is a godfather of Australian wines. His Clare Valley estate is now in the hands of his grandson, Tom, and was named Winery of the Year 2020 by Australiaâ€™s leading wine critic, James Halliday. This wine is made partially from grapes declassified from one of Jim Barry's finest vineyards, The Armagh, where bottles usually fetch Â£100+. As a result, this has been the choice of some of the most prestigious Michelin-starred restaurants since its first vintage. Expect balanced aromas of black berries and pepper and flavours of dark fruit and savoury spices. Its refined structure and long finish make it an excellent choice for intensely-flavoured lamb shanks, drizzled in jus.

Title: Kendermanns Riesling Kabinett 2020/21, Germany
Description: This vintage was actually rather good for Riesling as the golden autumn with warm day-time temperatures and cool nights allowed excellent flavour ripening whilst still retaining crisp acidity. This Riesling Kabinett has only 8.5% abv and is delightfully fragrant with aromas of vineyard peach with a touch of apple and grapefruit. On the palate it is off-dry to taste with a crisp and refreshing lick of acidity An enjoyable compliment to Thai green curry or any dishes containing a hit of spice.

Title: Krug 2004/08 Champagne
Description: Krug Vintage Champagne is a blend of the most expressive wines from a single year, and it's aged for ten years in the cellar. A blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Meunier, it's fine and balanced, with notes of lemon, brioche and honey and an elegant finish.
Characteristics: Peach, Almond, Apricot, Biscuit, Bread, Green Apple

Title: Krug Grande CuvÃ©e Champagne
Description: In 1843, Joseph Krug had an aim: to craft the very best Champagne he could offer. This is the result. It's a blend of multiple vintages, made from only the best grapes, aged for up to seven years fine oak casks. Expect complex and elegant layers of honey, nuts and a balancing acidity.

Title: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr Kuhlmann-Platz Riesling, Alsace 2021/22
Description: This cooperative was started by a group of small producers in Hunawihr in 1954, but today has member growers throughout the Alsace heartland. Winemaking is headed by Nicolas Garde, an Alsace-born winemaker, schooled in Burgundy and New Zealand. A pale straw yellow, this wine is a classic Alsace Riesling, showing ripe pear and peach fruit, braced by a steely acidity. Clean and pure on the palate, finishing with a citrussy freshness. Drink now or within the next 5 years, with seafood or creamy fish dishes.

Title: La Buxynoise Bourgogne CÃ´te Chalonnaise 2020/21
Description: The CÃ´te Chalonnaise in the southern part of the CÃ´te d'Or is responsible for the majority of winemaking in Burgundy, where cooperatives of growers produce some of the most consistently good quality wines such as this Chardonnay, representing great value. With just 3% of the blend fermented in new oak, this is a fresh and crisp Chardonnay with a focus on golden apple and citrus flavours, with very subtle texture and toastiness. The perfect white wine to accompany cod or other white fish cooked 'au gratin'.

Title: La Garnacha Salvaje del Moncayo 2019/20
Description: Northen Spain offers some of the most classic expressions of Garnacha (or Grenache), with this wine being a notable example, made from grapes harvested from ancient 'wild' bush vines in the mountainous Moncayo end of the Ebro Valley. Powerful aromas of wild berries and tobacco leaf are tempered by a sense of freshness and floral edges. The middleweight palate has ripe red fruit and a Burgundian minerality, with subtle French oak. Drink with barbecued red meats or spicy chorizo.

Title: La Garnatxa Fosca 2020/21 Proyecto Garnachas de EspaÃ±a, Priorat
Description: Proyecto Garnachas de EspaÃ±a is a project led by Raul Acha to protect Spain's old Garnacha vines. To craft this red, he's used vines over 60 years old, from slate-rich soils, in the acclaimed region of Priorat. The combination of old vines and slate soils have created a red with complex notes of dark cherry, cedar, herb and 'crushed rock' minerality.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Dried Herbs, Leather, Red Plum

Title: La Gioiosa Ca Divo Spumante
Description: When it comes to classic Italian fizz, La Gioiosa is a name you can rely on for quality. They're behind some of the most popular bottles in our Prosecco collection, and they bring all the same expertise to this vibrant sparkling wine. It's made in the same style as their signature Prosecco, but with a different blend of white grapes. You'll find it fresh and fruity with crisp apple and pear flavours. The perfect apÃ©ritif for any occasion.

Title: La Serena Brunello di Montalcino 2016/17
Description: The La Serena estate is just nine hectares. But what you'll find there is excellent an organic  Brunello. It's soft and balanced, with flavours of black fruit and spice. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with a roast leg of lamb. Drink now.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Earth, Leather, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Tobacco

Title: De Forville Langhe Nebbiolo 2020/21, Piedmont
Description: The De Forville domaine covers ten hectares over two Piedmont villages and their production is now almost entirely bottled on the estate. Nebbiolo is a Piedmont stalwart and most famous for its role in Barolo. A Nebbiolo with striking ruby colour and a nose that displays bright red fruits with hints of spice. This complexity is carried onto the palate with racy acidity and oak bringing freshness and structure. The soft tannins make this wine a viable option to open now. Give it time in the decanter and serve with fatty meats or creamy cheese.

Title: Laurent-Perrier 'Grand SiÃ¨cle' Champagne
Description: Laurent Perrier's Non-Vintage Deluxe CuvÃ©e is a blend of a number of vintages and is a beautifully elegant, fresh, creamy style. Gloriously fine bubbles and a slight nuttiness complete a sophisticated experience all-round.

Title: Le Bois DorÃ© Chenin Blanc 2021/22, Saumur
Description: Eric Laurent, one of Saumur's top winemakers, makes Le Bois DorÃ© from Chenin Blanc on 30-year-old vines. The wine spends time in contact with texture-building grape skins, resulting in a mouth-filling white that bursts with grapefruit, pineapple and honeycomb notes.

Title: Le Relais du Roi Cairanne 2019/20
Description: If you like robust RhÃ´ne reds, but not the prices of the more expensive areas, like ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape, Cairanne is a fantastic option. The blends made here were traditionally labelled 'CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne Villages Cairanne'. But as the region's brilliance became undeniable, it was given prestigious Cru status. This is made there by born-and-bred RhÃ´ne expert Julien Dugas from the ripest Grenache, Syrah and MourvÃ¨dre grapes. And his expertise shows in every sip. Expect flavours of black plum, blackberry, liquorice and woody spice. Try it with lamb kebabs.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Le Voyage d'Odette Sauvignon Blanc 2022, France
Description: When it comes to choosing the perfect party wines for summer, youâ€™ll want an easy-drinking Sauvignon Blanc on hand. This bright French expression, made from a number of selected vineyards, is just the ticket. Expect fresh flavours of citrus, exotic fruit and white flowers. Enjoy a glass alongside barbecued white fish dishes.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Citrus Fruit, Gooseberry, Grass

Title: LÃ©on Perdigal CÃ´tes-du-RhÃ´ne 2021/22
Description: LÃ©on Perdigal was the legendary first cellar master at Ogierâ€™s famous ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape cellars, founded in 1859. For 155 years, they have been making top-drawer ChÃ¢teauneuf, and their LÃ©on Perdigal label, named for that cellar master, makes equally delicious CÃ´tes de RhÃ´ne. Itâ€™s a blend of Grenache and Syrah from sites across the Southern RhÃ´ne â€“ a perfect balance of jammy red fruit and classic Syrah spice. Expect a juicy wine with peppery, woodland herb aromas which are distinctively CÃ´tes-du-RhÃ´ne. The red-fruit, slightly spicy flavours are excellent with a range of foods â€“ making it perfect for buffets and cold meat platters.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Les FrÃ¨res LumiÃ¨re CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne 2020/21
Description: The RhÃ´ne Valley was the birthplace of Syrah, and the first wine producing region in France. However, did you know it was also the inspiration for cinema? The LumiÃ¨re Brothers were pioneers of modern cinema; born in the RhÃ´ne Valley, they filmed some of the first moving pictures there. This blockbuster raspberry-and-pepper flavoured red is a homage to this special region that gave us both wine and cinema.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Les FrÃ¨res LumiÃ¨re CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne RosÃ© 2021/22
Description: This delicious rosÃ© was produced by Union des Vignerons des CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne, the largest wine cooperative in the Southern Rhone. Their vines cover a whopping 12,000 hectares, including many of the southern Rhone's crus and villages. Because of this, they get their pick of the best grapes and don't make any compromises on quality. This rose is a classic blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault that has crisp, delicate notes of red fruit and peach, and a streak of minerality. We can't think of a better pairing for shellfish.

Title: LÃ³pez de Haro Rioja Blanco 2021/22
Description: White Rioja fell out of fashion, but itâ€™s made a comeback and with wines like this itâ€™s easy to see why. Itâ€™s evidence that sometimes, patience wins the game. And weâ€™ve had to wait an awful long time for this. Itâ€™s made using grapes from vines up to an extraordinary eighty years old. Vines of this age yield really tiny portions of grapes so all the flavours are intensified â€“ you can taste it in this deeply aromatic wine. Itâ€™s nutty, rich and full with a really moreish creamy texture. Itâ€™s a heady wine, packed with the flavours of ripe yellow fruits â€“ but itâ€™s also nice and crisp. Think pear, quince and honey, with a citrusy backbone. This is wonderful with salty, tapas-style food like salted almonds or Serrano ham.

Title: Louis Jadot 'Les Roches Rouges' MÃ¢con Rouge 2021
Description: The gentle, rolling hills of the MÃ¢connais region in the south of Burgundy makes fresh and fruity wines accessible in their youth. This wine is sourced from several vineyard sites to create a light and supple blend of around 80% Gamay and 20% Pinot Noir. An enticing nose showing subtle hints of redcurrant and raspberry, with a fruity, well-balanced palate and a fresh finish. Best consumed while fresh and young, making the perfect red for white meat.

Title: Louis Latour 'Grand ArdÃ¨che' Chardonnay 2020/21
Description: The ArdÃ¨che is a bit of an insider secret. Only the most savvy know itâ€™s the source of some seriously delicious, good value wine. Louis Latour are Burgundy masters, and theyâ€™ve brought their considerable skill to this out-of-the-way valley to make wines which are fantastic value for money. If you like rich, creamy Burgundian whites from the CÃ´te d'Or or MÃ¢con, this is an absolute must-try. Itâ€™s juicy and fresh, with flavours of citrus and ripe orchard fruits. 10 months of barrel ageing adds spiciness and a deliciously buttery texture. Wonderful with roast pork, creamy mash and apple sauce.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Butter, Cream, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Louis M. Martini 'Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine' Zinfandel 2016/18, Sonoma
Description: Of all the Sonoma Valleyâ€™s many prized grape-growing locations, Monte Rosso Vineyard is arguably among the finest. Its steep rugged slopes stretch along the Mayacamas Mountains, where higher altitudes moderate the California sunshine. Louis Martini Winery has been farming the rich red volcanic soils here since 1938, producing terroir-driven wines from low-yielding vines. Grapes for the Gnarly Vine Zinfandel were handpicked, then after vinification aged in a blend of French and American oak barrels. Expect aromas of baked raspberry, cherries and mulberries rippled with cracked peppercorn, vanilla bean and the labelâ€™s characteristic spice. Rich and concentrated, this is a wine to crack open with chilli con carne, pulled pork or barbecued meats.
Characteristics: Black Pepper, Black Plum, Cinnamon, Dried Herbs, Raspberry

Title: Maison Chanzy 'En Rosey' Rully Blanc 2020, Burgundy
Description: If you're looking for a great-value alternative to the expensive areas of Burgundy, Rully is a great choice. The appellation is in the southern part of Burgundy, so the flavours in the Chardonnay made here are ripe and pronounced. This one is made by Chanzy, one of Burgundy's great names. It has notes of lemon, white peach, honeysuckle, buttercup and flint that are fantastic with roast chicken.

Title: Marcarini Barolo del Comune di La Morra 2017/18, Italy
Description: Barolo is widely considered Italy's king of wines. Head to the region, and you'll find the dark depths of Poderi Marcarini's winery. They may not make for an enticing holiday destination, but this wine is protected from light and temperature changes while ageing there. This means it can evolve and mature to its best without disruption, perfecting the powerful aromas and preserving unique flavours. The result is a rich, fresh bouquet of violets and roses and a long, intense finish.

Title: Marsala Fine Curatolo Arini
Description: Light wines from local grapes Grillo, Inzolia and Cataratto are fortified with white grape spirits in the traditional way. The Marsala Fine is dry in style and has all the characteristics of good Marsala with notes of toasted almonds, citrus and caramel.

Title: Martinborough Vineyard Pinot Noir 2022, Martinborough
Description: Martinborough Vineyard produces some of the best Pinot  in New Zealand, having made some of the first plantings near the town of Martinborough. Their consistently excellent and internationally acclaimed style has come to represent the terrior of the Martinborough Terrace. A fantastic, complex and seductive aroma of red cherry, spice, tobacco and earth.  Perfectly balanced, an elegant and beguiling structure of tannin and fruit and a long, complex and layered finish. If you can resist drinking it, the wine will develop and improve over 10 years, but the seductive fruit allows for immediate drinking.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Gonzalez Byass 'Matusalem' 30-Year-Old Oloroso Sherry Half Bottle
Description:
Produced in very small quantities, Matusalem is made by enrichment of a dry Oloroso sherry with 25% Pedro Ximenez, followed by additional ageing in its own solera. Rich and opulent in feel but with well moderated sweetness. Absorbingly complex, both nose and palate are awash with notes of raisins, figs, candied orange peel and pudding spices. Partner with a fruit dessert such as tarte tatin, or with a selection of mature cheeses.

In 2023, this wine won the cream sherry trophy at the IWSC awards.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Fig, Raisin

Title: Meerlust Rubicon 2018/20, South Africa
Description: The Rubicon is a South African classic. It's made by the Meerlust estate, which has been in the Myburgh family since 1756. And it paved the way for the country's Bordeaux blends that are rightfully celebrated today. This has notes of black fruit, cedar, tobacco leaf and spice. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with roast lamb.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: Domaine Prunier 'Les Clous' Meursault 2020
Description: For this luxurious Chardonnay winemaker Vincent Prunier picks every grape by hand from one of Meursault's most famous vineyards - known as a 'lieu-dit'. Once they're pressed, he vinifies it in stainless steel and ages it in oak for up to a year and a half. The result is a smooth, creamy marriage of vanilla and stone fruit with an all-important balancing acidity.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Cream, Hazelnut, Honey, Smoke

Title: Miraval RosÃ© 2021/22 Magnum, CÃ´tes de Provence
Description: The 17th-century Miraval estate is located in the Var region of Provence, and was bought by Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie in 2009 and extensively renovated. With winemaking expertise from Perrin, the first modern vintage was released in 2012, and was met with wide acclaim. A beautifully pale pink colour, with a nose of wild strawberry and stone fruit, with delicate floral touches. Great palate texture, with soft tangerine and peach notes joining layers of berry fruit. Enjoy on its own or with fine seafood.

Title: Mollydooker 'The Boxer' Shiraz 2020/21, Australia
Description: The Boxer Shiraz is perhaps the lightest and most accessible of Mollydooker's reds, although by any other standards it is still a hugely full-bodied and voluptuous wine. Made from the fruit of Mollydooker's own vineyards, aged in a mixture of new and old American oak, this wine offers a swathe of lush, velvety berry fruit, and layer upon layer of sweet spice, vanilla and dense, polished tannins.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Chocolate, Eucalyptus, Liquorice, Sweet Spice

Title: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2020/21 Masciarelli
Description: Abruzzo has seriously strict rules. And you can really taste the quality in this. It's a step up from other Montepulciano, boasing notes of ripe cherries, sweet spices and an alluring hint of smoke. It's comfort food in a bottle.

Title: Montes â€˜Purple Angelâ€™ CarmÃ©nÃ¨re 2019/20, Colchagua Valley
Description: Montes was founded in 1987 by winemaker Aurelio Montes and Douglas Murray. Their vision was to produce Chilean wines of premium quality. They've continued to raise the bar for the country ever since. And the Purple Angel is one of the most sought-after CarmÃ©nÃ¨res in the world. Expect complex aromas of ripe and dried dark fruit, along with toast and vanilla from oak-ageing. Decant for an hour before serving at 17-19 degrees.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Leather, Tobacco

Title: MorandÃ© 'One to One' GewÃ¼rztraminer 2022, Chile
Description: MorandÃ© are true pioneers. They were the first winery both to set up in the Casablanca Valley and be certified as sustainable in Chile. The One to One GewÃ¼rztraminer is made from a vineyard where one vine makes one bottle - hence the name. As a result, you can expect a remarkably concentrated wine. It has ripe flavours of rose petal, peach and citrus. Its off-dry nature makes it a great partner for lightly spiced Thai foods.

Title: Morande Reserva One to One Pais 2019/21, Casablanca Valley
Description: The Pais grape was brought to Mexico by HernÃ¡n Cortes and from there spread throughout the Americas.  The variety, once the most planted in Chile and used for table wine, is now enjoying a renaissance as quality driven producers are making light, fresh fruity red wines. Reminiscent of good Beaujolais this wine is light and fruity with red cherry and raspberry flavours followed by an earthy and spicy finish. This will be delicious with charcuterie and ripe cheese.

Title: Mt Difficulty 'Ghost Town' Pinot Noir 2020, Central Otago
Description: The Mt Difficulty winery is named after what was once an impassable mountain for New Zealand explorers. Today, brave winemakers have traversed its steep slopes, discovering it an ideal location for growing the delicate Pinot Noir grape. The 'Ghost Town' vineyard is at 340 metres about sea level, so this wine shows lots of fresh dark cherry and spice flavours. Age for a further 8-12 years or drink now with duck.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Earth, Red Plum, Spice

Title: Mt. Difficulty 'Roaring Meg' Pinot Gris 2021/22, Central Otago
Description: The sustainable Mt. Difficulty winery is the most famous producer in Central Otago. Its 'Roaring Meg' Pinot Gris boasts a tropical palate of stone fruit, melon and red apple that's chased by a washing finish, which balances its off-dry style.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Melon, Pear, Red Apple

Title: Mud House â€˜The Woolshedâ€™ Sauvignon Blanc 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: If you're a fan of Marlborough Sauvignon, you've probably tried Mud House's before. This is it taken up to a whole new level. It's made from grapes from a single vineyard, The Woolshed, in Wairau Valley, where the flavour is even more aromatic than usual. It has ripe notes of tropical fruit, blackcurrant, lime and zesty grapefruit. Try it with seared scallops and lemon-butter sauce.
Characteristics: Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Tropical Fruit

Title: Olivier Dubois 'CuvÃ©e Prestige' Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Touraine
Description: Sancerre and Pouilly FumÃ© Sauvignons demand regal sums. But if you head to Touraine you can discover the Loire Valley's best value. This is boasting all the aromatic, herby notes you'd expect from a top-shelf Sauvignon.

Title: Orin Swift 'Abstract' 2020/21, California
Description: Dave Phinney went to Florence, Italy, for a semester abroad and fell in love with wine. After he graduated, he moved to Napa Valley, sent his CV to 50 wineries, and just one replied - Robert Mondavi. After a year there, he went it alone at with Orin Swift. Today begins with 100 different wines before selecting the perfect blend for the Abstract. This is a ripe and intense, with notes of black fruit, raspberry and liquorice. Decant for an hour before serving at 16-18 degrees.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Pepper, Cranberry, Raspberry, Red Fruit, Red Plum

Title: Ornellaia 'Le Serre Nuove dell'Ornellaia' 2019/20, Bolgheri
Description: You'll find Ornellaia in one of the worldâ€™s most exciting wine regions, Bolgheri. They create one of Italy's most in demand wines. This, their second wine, is made on the same estate, with the same attention to detail, and exactly the same practices, but from slightly younger vines. It's your chance to taste their excellence at a reasonable price. A true Super Tuscan. Itâ€™s a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot with depths of flavour and excellent ageing potential.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon

Title: Oyster Bay Chardonnay 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Oyster Bay is Marlborough's, if not New Zealand's, most iconic producer. Their Sauvignon is an enduring favourite, and this fresh and elegant Chardonnay is deserving of equal recognition. Marlborough's cool climate and ancient alluvial soils provide the perfect conditions for fruity, aromatic Chardonnay, resulting in unrivalled intensity and purity of flavour. Part oak-aged, this is full of creamy lemon and peach notes, making it an ideal aperitif â€“ and a delicious match for buttery fish dishes.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Almond, Citrus Fruit, Lemon, Peach, Stone Fruit

Title: Penfolds â€˜Fatherâ€™ Grand Tawny, Australia
Description: Penfolds is an iconic name in Australian wine. Widely regarded as the countryâ€™s leading producer, their reputation for excellence is recognised throughout the world. Their tradition of crafting fortified wines dates back to 1844 â€“ the wineryâ€™s founding year â€“ and this elegant bottling is a tribute to their over 170 years of winemaking greatness. Itâ€™s a blend of outstanding wines that have each been matured separately in oak, then combined to create Penfoldsâ€™ distinctive Tawny house style. Discover opulent notes of toasted nuts, chocolate, raisin, fruitcake and clove, with a long, fresh finish. Itâ€™s ready to drink now, so enjoy it with a classic cheeseboard.

Title: Peter & Ulrich Griebeler Dry Riesling 2021/22, Mosel
Description: Peter & Ulrich Griebeler are a small, family-run producer based in Germanyâ€™s Mosel region. They specialise in dry styles of Riesling, the countryâ€™s signature white grape â€“ and this elegant bottling is an excellent example of their expertise. Itâ€™s a blend of grapes from different villages, aged on its lees to give it a subtly rounded texture. Youâ€™ll find it fresh and floral with notes of lime, apricot and herbs. Its crisp acidity and long finish pair beautifully with light salads or seafood dishes.

Title: Philippe le Hardi 'Petit Clos' 2019/20, Pommard
Description: This is made on a magnificent 9th century estate that's named after the first Duke of Burgundy, Philippe le Hardi. He, interestingly, became famous when he banned Gamay from the region in 1395, insisting on the domination of Pinot Noir in red Burgundy. True to its Pommard roots, this is a ripe and concentrated Pinot Noir with flavours of black cherry, blackberry and dark chocolate. Serve slightly cooler than room temperature and drink now with salmon or develop for another 8 years.

Title: Pieropan Soave Classico Organic 2021/22, Italy
Description: This is a remarkable example of why Soave Classico is a whole different sip from what you'll find from the Soave crowding supermarket shelves. The Pieropan estate was the first to ever make single-vineyard Soave. Today, they make this organic expression on the hillsides in the heart of the Soave Classico area. Left on texture-building lees, it's fresh and expressive with notes of white flowers, almond and marzipan, a fresh, clean acidity and hints of pastry on the finish.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Honey, Quince

Title: Pio Cesare Barbaresco 2017/18
Description: The Pio Cesare winery has gained fame around the world since it began in 1881. Today, their exceptional wines are found in high-class restaurants and hotels around the world. Their Barbaresco is subtle and silky, with notes of wild berries, white liquorice and a hint of oak. Decant for at least an hour before serving at room temperature with steak tartare.

Title: Planeta Chardonnay 2020/21, Sicily
Description: Planeta began with a dream to put Sicily on the world map. But how do you convince the naysayers? You speak their language - Chardonnay. This is now a Sicilian icon that's enjoyed the world over. So it's fair to say they nailed the brief. It's rich and creamy, with notes of yellow peach, honey, toast and marzipan. Fantastic lightly chilled with turkey.

Title: Planeta 'Cometa' 2020/21, Sicily
Description: Planta is one of Sicily's great wineries. It played a large part in boosting the region's reputation for fine wines. And this one is particularly interesting. The winemaking team first began experimenting with Fiano in the 1990s and, after much deliberation, created their finest expression of the grape: Cometa. It's complex and intense, with aromas of chamomile, thyme and mango, flavours of apricot, almond and basil and a long finish. Try it with grilled snapper.

Title: Pol Roger 'Sir Winston Churchill' 2013/15 Vintage Champagne
Description: The clue's in the name. Pol Roger created this in tribute to Winston Churchill in the style of the 1928 vintage, one of his personal favourites. It's made exclusively from Grand Cru Chardonnay and Pinot Noir vineyards that were under vine in his lifetime. This is robust, full-bodied and rich, with a capacity to age for decades. It's so delicious, the family behind it keep the recipe top-secret. A fitting tribute to one of Britain's most prominent figures. Drink with oysters.
Characteristics: Peach, Almond, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Puligny-Montrachet 2019/20 Doudet Naudin
Description: Founded in 1849, Doudet Naudin is one of the most respected wineries in Burgundy. Made from old vines, from hand-picked grapes, and aged in vanilla-imparting oak for a year, its Puligny-Montrachet is a creamy cocktail of almond, honeysuckle and exotic fruits.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Cream, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey

Title: Rasteau 'L'AndÃ©ol' 2019/20 Famille Perrin, RhÃ´ne Valley
Description: ChÃ¢teau de Beaucastel is an estate in ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape thatâ€™s world renowned for highly complex and ageworthy wines. The Perrin family who run it are just as famous as their much sought-after bottles. Happily, their expertise extends to other areas of the Southern RhÃ´ne which donâ€™t warrant the same price tag as ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape. Up until 2010, Rasteau was an appellation known mostly for sweet, fortified wines, but winemakers like the Perrins are changing that. They make this Grenache blend from 70-year-old vines, with only a small amount of the wine being aged in oak to let its fruity flavours shine. Expect an elegant and silky red, with flavours of black cherry and wild berries, plus notes of dark chocolate, garrigue herbs and spice â€“ just the thing for rich red meat dishes.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Reyneke 'Vinehugger' Organic Chenin Blanc 2021/22, South Africa
Description: Johan Reyneke is one of South Africa's most celebrated producers. With winemaker Rudiger Gretschel on board, the Reyneke winery was described as one of the country's 'First Growths' by Tim Atkin MW. This Chenin Blanc has notes of quince and pineapple, well integrated acidity and a long finish.

Title: Rijckaert F. Rouve Saint VÃ©ran 'Haute CuvÃ©e' 2020/21, Burgundy
Description: Jean Rijckaert is renowned for creating fantastic white Burgundy. Under his guidance, Florent Rouve, who began making wine in Jura at just 16 years old, has created this exceptional Saint-VÃ©ran. Aged for up to 15 months in small oak barrels, it's rich and round with gentle oak influence and a fine, succulent texture.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Butter, Cream, Floral, Honey, Lemon

Title: Robert Oatley 'Signature Series' Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, Margaret River
Description: Bob Oatleyâ€™s mantra was that all wines should be a â€œdarned good drinkâ€. And his legacy continues today in the expert hands of Larry Cherubino. Larry's reputation has gained lofty heights in Australia's wine scene since establishing his own winery, Cherubino, in 2005. Some of his own Margeret River wines are priced upwards of Â£40 a bottle. This Signature Series Cabernet gives you the chance to enjoy his expertise for less. It's rich and vibrant, with flavours of blackcurrant, black plum and vanilla. The ripe tannins make for a long, elegant finish. Try it with BBQ beef ribs.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Sweet Spice, Vanilla

Title: Roberto Sarotto Barbaresco Riserva 'CurrÃ ' 2016/17
Description: Barbaresco is the less tannic sibling of Barolo. The wine here is also made from the Nebbiolo grape, but typically aged for a shorter period. The pioneering family behind Roberto Sarotto make it on a single vineyard called CurrÃ . It's complex, refined and smooth, with hints of roses, violet, plum, liquorice and chocolate. It was aged for two and a half years, so it's a harmonious wine that compliments red meats excellently.

Title: Rustenberg â€˜Peter Barlowâ€™ 2017, Stellenbosch
Description: Peter Barlow was a driving force in South Africaâ€™s wine industry, bringing the celebrated Rustenberg estate to greatness after purchasing it in the 1940s. The Barlow family continue to run things today, staying true to Peterâ€™s traditional methods. This powerful Cabernet Sauvignon is made from grapes hand-picked from a single vineyard and aged for a luxurious 20 months â€“ fitting given who itâ€™s dedicated to. Patient drinkers will be able to age this for 10-15 years, but open now to enjoy concentrated flavours of cassis, black cherries and herbs. Try with a grilled steak. In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.

Title: Rustenberg 'John X Merriman' 2019/20, Stellenbosch
Description:
Murray Barlow's wines have won heaps of critical praise. He's the only winemaker to twice win Young Winemaker of the Year at South Africaâ€™s biggest wine awards event, Diners Club. This wine commemorates John Xavier Merriman, the last prime minister of The Cape, and it's surely a fitting tribute. Expect aromas of mint, black fruits, spice and cigar box. This wine suits robust meat dishes, especially roast beef.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Leather

Title: Saint Clair 'Pioneer Block' AlbariÃ±o 2021/22, Marlborough
Description: Neal and Judy Ibbotson settled in Marlborough in 1978. Despite being self-taught winemakers, their first vintage saw every wine win medals, including gold. They're now one of New Zealand's most accomplished producers. AlbariÃ±o is fairly rare in the country. So this release is an exciting opportunity to taste the fruits of innovative winemaking. Crisp, refreshing and rich in lemon, lime and herbaceous notes, it's a great match for fish tacos.

Title: Saint Clair 'Pioneer Block 5' GrÃ¼ner Veltiner 2021, Marlborough
Description: In recent years, there's been a huge increase of plantings of GrÃ¼ner Veltliner in New Zealand. For good reason: New Zealand offers a long ripening period, allowing the aromatic grape to acheive its highest level of complexity. And Saint Clair's 'Pioneer Block' series works only with the best vineyards. So you can be sure you're tasting the best Gruner that New Zealand has to offer. Complex. Elegant. A fusion of stone fruit and spice with gentle aromas of nectarine and red apple. Divine with spicy curries.
Characteristics: Lemon, Lime, Red Apple, White Pepper

Title: Saint Clair 'Pioneer Block 28' Pinot Blanc 2021, Marlborough
Description: Neal and Judy Ibbotson settled in Marlborough in 1978. Back then most New Zealanders didnâ€™t drink wine, let alone make it. Despite being self-taught winemakers, their first vintage saw every wine win medals, including gold. Theyâ€™re now one of New Zealand's most accomplished producers. They craft this Pinot Blanc in small quantities. It's extraordinarily perfumed, with notes of white peach and pepper. Try it with soft cheeses.

Title: Saint Clair 'Pioneer Block' Pinot Noir 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Saint Clair Pioneer Block wines are made from small parcels of outstanding fruit identified by our winemaker. Fruit for this wine was sourced from Saint Clair's own vineyard at Doctor's Creek, and blended with a small amount from the Southern Valleys to add complexity. Bright ruby in colour, aromas of raspberry and plum are complemented by a touch of spice. A luscious and soft palate with flavours of redcurrant, cherries and an added warmth from ageing in oak barrels. This is perfectly matched with tuna or beef fillet with mushrooms and will cellar for the next two to five years.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Saint-VÃ©ran Les Vignerons des Grandes Vignes 2020/21
Description: Saint-VÃ©ran is in the southern part of Burgundy overlapping the MÃ¢connais and Beaujolais districts. This wine is produced by an outstanding co-operative. This is a lively wine showing delicious aromas of peach and acacia blossom. Fantastic when young, it has the potential to develop a more honeyed, complex palate with age. This delicate and elegant wine would be a great match with seared scallops or mushroom ravioli.

Title: Santa Rita â€˜Medalla Realâ€™ Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/20, Maipo Valley
Description: Renowned Chilean winery Santa Rita was founded in 1880. Medalla Real was created to celebrate Francisco GarcÃ­a Huidobro, an ancestor of the wineryâ€™s founders. He established the first Mint in Chile and had a medal coined to commemorate his innovation. Mature vines are used to create this complex wine. Grapes are slow-ripening thanks to cool night-time temperatures, allowing concentrated flavours to develop before picking. The end result is powerful but elegant. It has intense aromas of blackcurrant, blueberry and cherry, combined with soft cedar and spice. It's supple and juicy with a long, lingering finish. Delicious with steak in pepper sauce. The 2020 vintage was awarded 90 points by Tim Atkin MW, and 90 points by James Suckling.
Characteristics: Green Bell Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar

Title: Santa Rita â€˜Medalla Realâ€™ Chardonnay 2020/21, Limari Valley
Description: At Santa Rita, each plot of vines is treated individually according to how fast they ripen in the hot Chilean sun. The grapes for this Chardonnay are sourced from the northernmost point of Chile, bringing all the delicacy of a cool-climate wine. Expect fresh flavours of green apple and citrus. Oak ageing gives it a soft, creamy texture, which will marry perfectly with a creamy carbonara.

Title: Shaw + Smith â€˜M3â€™ Chardonnay 2021/22, Adelaide Hills
Description:
The Shaw + Smith winery was purpose built in 2000 to make exceptional wine. It's already won a perfect 5 Red Star rating from Australia's leading wine critic, James Halliday. This is an Adelaide Hills Chardonnay with a heavy Burgundy influence. It's made from hand-picked grapes, fermented in French oak and aged on its lees. As a result, it's elegant, restrained and textured. It has notes of white flowers, citrus and nectarine. Try it with salmon fishcakes. 

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Smoke

Title: Shaw + Smith Sauvignon Blanc 2022/23, Adelaide Hills
Description: Shaw + Smith have made this Sauvignon Blanc for 30 years. Made from hand-picked grapes, aged on texture-imparting lees, this is no ordinary Sauvignon Blanc. Expect bright aromas of freshly-cut grass and pink grapefruit, with a luxuriously long finish. Serve with smoked salmon bagels. James Halliday, Australia's top wine critic, gave the 2019 vintage 95 points.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Lemon, Lime, Smoke

Title: Smith & Wright Chardonnay 2020/21, Australia
Description: Smith & Wright is the creation of a duo with a passion for enjoyable, fruit-forward wine that's best enjoyed with company. Expect juicy notes of peach and lemon blossom, a creamy slather of vanilla and a crisp, refreshing finish.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Smith & Wright Merlot 2020/21, Australia
Description: Smith & Wright is the creation of a duo with a passion for enjoyable, fruit-forward wine that's best enjoyed with company. Pair this Merlot's fruity lashings of red fruit, vanilla and sweet spices with red meats and roasted vegetables.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Red Plum, Sweet Spice

Title: Solomonar Reserve Red 2020/21, Romania
Description:
Tried Romanian wine before? When you taste this, you'll be glad you did. It's a blend of Cabernet, Merlot and the indigenous Feteasca Neagra grape made by one of the country's very best wineries. It's full-bodied and rich with notes of blackcurrant, plum, blueberry and vanilla.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Sweet Spice, Vanilla

Title: Tahbilk 'The Tower' Marsanne 2019/22, Victoria
Description: Tahbilk is the oldest family-owned winery in Victoria, but they're still very much leaders of their region. They were named 2016 Winery of the Year by James Halliday, Australia's leading wine critic. The winery is now in the hands of the fifth-generation of the Purbrick family and holds carbon-neutral status. This Marsanne boasts mineral hints of grapefruit, citrus and Granny Smith apple. If you can wait, it'll gain a honeyed complexity over the next decade. Divine with smoked cheeses.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Herbal

Title: Taylor's Historical Collection 'The Mallet' Reserve Tawny Port
Description: In the 1720s, Peter Bearsley, the son of the founder of Taylor's, was the first person from the English wine trade to embark on the Douro Valley, the picturesque home of port. Today, Taylor's is widely considered the gold standard of aged tawny port. This one is made in tribute to their great history, and the bottle is how it would have looked centuries ago. Expect opulent notes of coffee, butterscotch, plum and dried fruit. The perfect digestif.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Tinta Barroca, Tinta Cao, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca
Characteristics: Black Plum, Date, Fig, Raisin, Red Plum, Sweet Spice, Toffee, Walnut

Title: Tbilvino 'Qvevris' Rkatsiteli 2020/21, Georgia
Description: Tbilvino is one of Georgiaâ€™s most important wineries. For over 60 years, theyâ€™ve been dedicated to showcasing the best of their countryâ€™s wines and native grape varieties, using both traditional and modern techniques to produce a wide range of delicious styles. This white is made with Rkatsiteli, believed to be one of the oldest grape varieties in the world. The juice is fermented with the grape skins in â€˜qvevriâ€™ â€“ clay pots buried in the ground â€“ resulting in a beautiful amber colour and rounded texture, plus aromatic notes of apricot and pear. Thanks to its fuller body, itâ€™ll make an excellent match for smoky lamb dishes.

Title: Te Mata Estate Syrah 2020/21, Hawke's Bay
Description: Te Mata is the oldest winery in New Zealand, but that doesn't mean they rest on their prestige. They continue to set a standard in new technique and classic flavour. Case in point: this delicious wine. Strong with a long and powerful finish, it's full of red-fruit, vanilla and allspice flavours. Sublime with grilled beef.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Ten Minutes by Tractor Estate Pinot Noir 2019/20, Mornington Peninsula
Description: This is a complex, silky red from one of Australia's finest Pinot Noir regions, Mornington Peninsula. This cool-climate region is a go-to for those in the know. And it really shows in Ten Minutes by Tractor's Estate Pinot Noir. Expect elegant notes of red fruit and a savoury complexity. Excellent with roast chicken.
Characteristics: Smoke, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackberry, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Savoury

Title: Tenuta San Giorgio â€˜Ugolforteâ€™ Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2016/17
Description: Overlooking the Orcia Valley, with cooling Mediterranean breezes coming in from the west, the Tenuta San Giorgio estate is undeniably picturesque. But its Sangiovese-based wines are even more impressive. This vibrant, rich Brunello di Montalcino is drinkable now, but has potential for future aging, too. Expect aromas of wild strawberry, mint and wood, and a velvety texture with dark-fruit flavours. Try it with grilled meats, truffle-laced pasta or hearty game dishes.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Blueberry, Charred Wood, Coffee, Red Fruit, Violet

Title: Terrazas de los Andes Chardonnay 2020, Mendoza
Description: Argentina is home to some of the worldâ€™s highest vineyards. This Chardonnay hails from Uco Valley in Mendoza, where plots are 1250 metres above sea level. At these altitudes, the natural acidity and freshness of the grapes are retained. The cool night-time temperatures also slow down the ripening process, helping concentrate flavours. These conditions make for less interaction when it comes to the winemaking process â€“ the natural expression of the grapes is allowed to shine. The end result is an elegant and deeply refreshing style of Chardonnay. Expect white peach, papaya and citrus. Gentle oak ageing shows in subtle toasty notes of hazelnut and vanilla. The 2018 vintage was awarded 92 points at the annual International Wine Challenge.

Title: Terre del Buontalenti 2018/19, Toscana
Description: If you're looking for a pure expression of everything great about Tuscan wine, look no further than Buontalenti. Located to the west of the prestigious Chianti region, this family-owned winery only buys from growers they've known for decades. As you'd expect, this wine is a classic Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It has bright red and black fruit aromas, with elegant hints of spice and succulent tannins from oak-ageing. We can't think of a better partner for braised lamb.

Title: The King's Legacy Chardonnay 2019/20, Marlborough
Description: This Chardonnay is sourced from two vineyards, one a mature plot in the centre of the Wairau Valley, the other a plot of younger vines in Brancott Valley. The grapes were fermented in large French oak casks using predominantly wild yeasts and allowed 10 months' on lees. An easily enjoyable Chardonnay that combines fresh apple, nectarine and tangerine flavours with subtle creaminess, hints of toasted almonds and a gently spicy complexity. Try this with seared scallops served with black pudding.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Cream, Green Apple, Nectarine, Orange

Title: The King's Wrath Pinot Noir 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Brent Marris is the man behind our bestselling white wine, The Ned. And he's exceptional at making reds too. Like Sauvignon Blanc, another thin-skinned grape, Pinot Noir thrives in Marlborough's cool climate and long ripening season. As a result, this is a rich and full of fruit. Expect blackberry, raspberry, plum and toasted oak. Try it with rich fish, like tuna or trout.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: The Ned 'Southern Valleys' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Marlborough
Description:
Marlborough Pinot Noir is a bit of an unsung gem. Itâ€™s often overshadowed by its regional sister, Sauvignon Blanc â€“ but we think itâ€™s fantastic if you love deeply fruity, silky reds. This is from the Southern Valleys, the prime spot for pernickety Pinot Noir which needs very specific soil and climate conditions to thrive. The grapes ripen slowly, developing really concentrated, berry-fruit flavours which are a trademark of the Marlborough style. Added to which, Brent Marris is the master of Marlborough â€“ he knows how to get the very best out of his grapes in these famous valleys. Itâ€™s a real corker of the wine. Ripe. Juicy. Fruity. Itâ€™s full of raspberry, strawberry and red plum flavours, with a nicely savoury quality and silky texture. Perfect with slow-cooked beef ragu.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Red Plum, Smoke, Strawberry

Title: Thierry Delaunay 'Ceptembre' Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, France
Description: Thierry Delaunay is a Sauvignon Blanc specialist. His winery is one of the leading estates in the Loire Valleyâ€™s Touraine region â€“ and with five generations of winemaking experience behind him, itâ€™s easy to see why. To make this crisp bottling, he blends carefully selected cuvÃ©es from all across France, bringing together different expressions of the grape to create a wine with excellent aromatic complexity. Itâ€™s then aged on its lees for up to six months, giving it a subtly rounded texture. Discover bright notes of citrus, pear and gooseberry with a touch of tropical fruits. Its mouth-watering acidity makes it an ideal match for the richness of goatâ€™s cheese.

Title: Torbreck 'The Struie' Shiraz 2020/21, Barossa
Description: Torbreck is one of the most celebrated producers in Barossa, the New World's full-bodied-Shiraz nirvana. Adding a dash of Eden Valley fruit to the mix, ageing the wine for 18 months in oak, it's created this heady assemblage of bluebearry, cream and spice with a long, velvet smooth finish. This vintage scored 94 Parker Points.
Characteristics: Smoke, Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Chocolate, Earth, Eucalyptus, Liquorice, Mint

Title: Two Hands Ares Shiraz 2017/18, Barossa Valley
Description: Deep garnet-purple in color and intensely scented of blackberries and black plums with nuances of cedar, black pepper, Indian spices and loam, the medium to full-bodied Ares Shiraz has a solid core of youthful black fruit and exotic spice flavors with the oak standing out a little as do the firm, grainy tannins at this stage. It finishes with great length.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Sweet Spice, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: Two Hands 'Bella's Garden' Shiraz 2017/18, Barossa Valley
Description: Two Hands was started on a shoestring with two friends who had one task in mind: to create the best Aussie Shiraz going. It's now the only winery to be named in Wine Spectator's Top 100 nine times in a row. In the Australian hub of turbocharged Shiraz. Barossa, it's crafted this ripe, heady, dark cherry, vanilla cedar and briar-packed beauty that bagged 92 Parker Points
Characteristics: Mint, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Earth, Leather, Liquorice

Title: Two Hands 'Lily's Garden' Shiraz 2018/19, McLaren Vale
Description: The Two Hands winery was formed by a duo of friends on a shoestring. It's now one of Australia's top fine-wine producers. The Lily's Garden is a heady bouquet of cherry, raspberry, mint, thyme and cream. Wine Advocate gave it 92 Parker Points.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Coffee, Jammy, Sweet Spice

Title: Vavasour 'Papa' Sauvignon Blanc 2020, Marlborough
Description: Vavasour won 'Best in Show' at the Decanter World Wine Awards with another Sauvignon Blanc - and the Papa is its best work. Taken from a single vineyard, it's a rich tapestry of white peach, blackcurrant leaf, crushed herbs and sea air that's lined by a crystalline minerality. This is first-class Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Green Bell Pepper, Lemon

Title: Vavasour Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: Peter Vavasour founded his winery in the 1980s. It was the very first in Marlboroughâ€™s sub-region of the Awatere Valley, and so the team had the pick of the best spots for growing the finest grapes. His plan was to make elegant, restrained styles of wine, like the Sauvignon Blancs of the Loire and Bordeaux. The team have more than succeeded with this one â€“ and now those original vines are some of the oldest in the region, it shows even greater complexity and unique character. Itâ€™s beautifully textured, with vibrant notes of tropical fruits, green pepper and citrus. A delicate note of elderflower and a flint-mineral finish adds to its elegance. Such a mouthwatering wine will be perfect for crumbly goatâ€™s cheese.

Title: Monte Schiavo Organic Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi DOC 2022
Description: Italyâ€™s central Marche region is Verdicchioâ€™s spiritual homeland. The grape has been documented here since the 14th century. Itâ€™s said that Venetian grapegrowers brought it with them upon fleeing to the countryside during the Plague. Between the Apennine Mountains and the Adriatic Sea, cool and breezy hillsides offer the perfect environment for citrusy, high-acidity Verdicchio. Wines from the high-altitude Castelli di Jesi appellation are known for their refreshing, minerally character. If youâ€™re a fan of Gavi or Chablis, this organic bottling makes a fantastic alternative choice. Itâ€™s versatile thanks to rich, zesty flavours and crisp acidity. So pair notes of stone fruits, pineapple and citrus with everything from hard cheeses to fish pie.

Title: Veuve Clicquot 'La Grande Dame' 2012/15 Champagne
Description: Veuve Clicquot is one of the most popular Champagne brands in the world, and its success is largely down to one woman: Barbe-Nicole Clicquot-Ponsardin. Madame Clicquot's innovative thinking saw her invent winemaking techniques that are still used in Champagne today. So it's no wonder her influence earned her the title of 'La Grande Dame de la Champagne'. This Pinot Noir-dominant cuvÃ©e was created in 1972 to honour the 'Great Lady' â€“ and to also celebrate the bicentenary of the house. Madame Clicquot believed that Pinot Noir had the broadest range of expression and potential to create the best Champagnes. Veuve's current cellar master, Didier Mariotti, wholeheartedly agrees and the grape now accounts for up to 90 percent of the blend. He sums up this prestigious wine as  â€˜structured and texturedâ€™. With such exquisite flavour and complexity, weâ€™re certain youâ€™ll find popping its cork a memorable event. Expect fine bubbles that are delicately creamy, with lively notes of ripe lemon, rye bread and a hint of smokiness. Its incredibly fresh, making every sip mouthwatering. Italian artist and ceramicist Paola Paronetto is behind the label and packaging design of the 2015 vintage. Her love of colour is reflected in the vast array of eye-catching cases. (Please note that specific coloured cases cannot be requested).
Characteristics: Pear, Almond, Biscuit, Bread, Green Apple

Title: VIK Milla Cala 2019/20, Cachapoal Valley
Description: In 2004, Alex and Carrie Vik set out with the ambition to make one of the world's best wines. After a two-year scientific study, an architectural competition and 4,300 hectares of Andean wilderness, they now create some of the finest reds in Chile. A previous vintage of the Milla Cala was once featured in Decanter's Best 100 Wines in the World. This has lush flavours of strawberry, plum, vanilla and coffee. Decant for an hour before serving at 16 degrees with roast lamb or cellar for up to a decade.
Characteristics: Green Bell Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar

Title: Vidal-Fleury CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne 2019/20
Description: Very few French wineries can claim to have been visited by one of America's Founding Fathers. Serving as US Ambassador at the time, Thomas Jefferson visited the Vidal-Fleury estate in 1787, six years after it was founded. Today, it is the oldest continuously-operating winery in the RhÃ´ne Valley. Winemaking has been in the hands of Guy Sarton du Jonchay since 2008. His experience extends to both sides of the hemisphere, including Bordeaux, Australia and Argentina. Along with making some of the most prestigious wines of the region, like CÃ´te-RÃ´tie, Condrieu and Hermitage, Guy makes this introductory CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne â€“ and its value for money has long made it a Majestic favourite. Expect rich and juicy bramble-fruit flavours with savoury herbs and spice, plus silky, persistent tannins. Try it with a classic RhÃ´ne dish, like a duck confit cassoulet.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Cedar, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Villa Maria Cellar Selection Pinot Noir 2020/21, Marlborough
Description:
This wine is made by blending grapes of selected vineyards in the Awatere and Wairau Valleys of Marlborough. The vineyards are managed to the highest standard to ensure quality. It is medium bodied with beautifully poised red fruit and very well integrated oak flavours. The crisp acidity and fine grained tannins provide a delightfully clean long finish of considerable finesse. Serve with rabbit, veal or duck.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Villa Vito Pinot Grigio 2021/22, Italy
Description: Italian Pinot Grigio is a classic for a reason â€“ itâ€™s the ultimate light, crisp white. Perfect for everyday and versatile enough to work in any situation, with almost any food. But we didnâ€™t want to settle for just any old wine. We challenged our buyers to find the very best wine they could at this price point. And they donâ€™t do things by halves. They tasted more than fifty Pinot Grigios before they settled on this as the very best quality for the money. We think they hit the nail on the head. Itâ€™s citrussy. Itâ€™s peachy. Itâ€™s got lovely crisp apple flavours â€“ and itâ€™s really refreshing. All you could want from an Italian Pinot Grigio. Of course, itâ€™s a great party wine, but itâ€™s also perfect with light salads and fish.

Title: Villarei AlbariÃ±o 2021/22, RÃ­as Baixas
Description: Think AlbariÃ±o, think citrussy, zingy, intensely refreshing whites. This wine has all that in spades â€“ but it also has a little something extra. Itâ€™s from Val do SalnÃ©s, is the oldest sub-region of RÃ­as Baxias right on the coast. Itâ€™s known as the birthplace of the AlbariÃ±o grape â€“ and itâ€™s the coolest and wettest part of the region. It means the AlbariÃ±os from here are extra crisp and green-fruity. They age this on the lees which gives the wine even more complexity and a lovely viscous texture which works incredibly with all those zingy, citrussy flavours. Itâ€™s a really special, unusual AlbariÃ±o which is perfect if you love both crisp whites and richer styles of wine. But thereâ€™s a catch. Only 1,100 cases of this wine were made â€“ so be quick. Itâ€™ll be ideal alongside a seafood platter.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Apricot, Bread Dough, Lemon, Peach

Title: ViÃ±alba â€˜CuvÃ©e Dianeâ€™ 2019/20, Mendoza
Description: HervÃ© J Fabre was the first winemaker in Argentina to create single-variety Malbec wines. Thatâ€™s not to say he doesnâ€™t still champion other grape varieties that thrive in Mendozaâ€™s high-altitude vineyards. His winemaking philosophy is very much one of minimal intervention, aiming to create powerful-yet-elegant, fruit-forward wines. His innovation and skill has won him countless medals and 20 major international trophies. CuvÃ©e Diane is named after HervÃ©â€™s wife. Itâ€™s complex, elegant and embodies the very best of ViÃ±alba. It has delicate and fresh aromas of liquorice, vanilla and a touch of mint. Cabernet Franc shows itself with notes of ripe dark cherry. 18 months of French oak ageing adds roundness and vanilla spice. Venison in a berry sauce will pair beautifully with its jammy dark fruit and silky tannins.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Liquorice, Mint, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Vanilla

Title: ViÃ±alba â€˜Parrillaâ€™ Malbec 2020/22, Mendoza
Description: A parrilla is an Argentinian grill, and this was created with steak in mind. It's expertly crafted by award-winning winemaker HervÃ© J Fabre â€“ the first person to produce single-variety Malbec in Argentina. It's dark, bold and complex, thanks to expert use of Mendoza's high altitudes. Expect lots of black fruit, plum and toasty vanilla oak.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: ViÃ±alba SelecciÃ³n TorrontÃ©s 2021/22, Lujan de Cuyo
Description:
The aromatic Torrontes grape is a distant relation of Muscat, and has become Argentina's signature white variety, as it produces bright and perfumed white wines in the sunny yet cool high-altitude vineyards of Argentina. Bursting with ripeness, the nose is a cascade of tropical fruit and blossom aromas. Lively flavours of white peach, melon, pear and pineapple provide a refreshing and involving palate sensation. Best served with mild Thai curries or dressed prawn salads.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Floral, Lychee, Peach, Pear

Title: Vino Nobile Di Montepuliciano 2017/18 Bonacchi, Italy
Description: Don't confuse this Montepulicano with the grape of the same name - this is one of Italys best kept secrets. It's made by one of Tuscany's most exciting up-and-coming winemakers, Ivan Misuri. It's clean and intense, with notes of red fruits, vanilla and spice and a touch of oak. Pair it with grilled meat, aged cheeses or game.

Title: VirÃ©-ClessÃ© Vieilles Vignes 2020/22 Christophe Cordier
Description: Cordier's VirÃ©-ClessÃ© is made from 40-year-old vines from village of VirÃ©, with grapes bought in from a mixture of winegrowers, some of which practise biodynamic viticulture. Using 300lt barrels, 10% of which are new, the lees are also stirred for added body. Elegant yet opulent, this wine combines fresh fruit on the palate with a minerally core, with added dimension provide by a slight toastiness. Langoustines, lobster and prawn dishes will match well with this wine, as will most fowl recipes.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Bread, Floral, Honey, Lemon

Title: Voerzio Martini 'La Serra' Barolo DOCG 2017
Description: The Voerzio brothers were part of the Barolo Boys, an iconic generation of winemakers that changed the world of Barolo wine. Gianni Voerzio's son, Mirko, today continues with their work. To create the most concentrated Barolo, he strictly limits the yields in the vineyard, allowing just 1kg of grapes per vine. It's no-expense-spared winemaking, and the benefits show in this bottle. Expect notes of plum, blackberry, spice and dried herbs and silk-smooth tannins, thanks to a very long ageing process. Drink now with grilled lamb, or cellar it for another 10 years. Monica Lamer gave the 2017 vintage 92 Parker Points.

Title: Waimea Estates GewÃ¼rztraminer 2021/22, Nelson
Description: Nelson experiences long, sunny days and Waimea are one of the best producers here. In the early nineties, Trevor and Robyn Bolitho were growing apples on this estate and diversified into vines, with impressive results. An intense, tropical-fruit-laden wine, full of concentrated flavours of orange zest and lychee, embellished with floral notes on the nose and a delicate yet slightly unctuous texture. The off-dry apÃ©ritif style really emphasises the wine's fruitiness. A marvellous match for spicy foods such as Thai curry.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Lychee, Orange

Title: Waimea Estates GrÃ¼ner Veltliner 2021/22, Nelson
Description: Just three rows of vines known as the 'Railway Reserve', owing to their following the path of a disused railway line, within Waimea's Annabrook Vineyard are planted with GrÃ¼ner Veltliner. The wine is made deliberately off-dry to achieve the perfect flavour balance. An inviting golden colour, this is a fresh and crisp wine with a little extra richness. Stone fruit and pineapple flavours are accented with nuances of fennel, white pepper and a lingering minerality. Pair with fine seafood or poultry dishes.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Pineapple, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

Title: Weingut BrÃ¼ndlmayer 'Langenloiser Alte Reben' Organic GrÃ¼ner Veltliner 2021/22, Langenlois
Description: Willi Brundlmayer is widely recognised as one of Austria's finest winemakers, and he's an expert in GrÃ¼ner Veltliner. Older vines nourish the tastiest grapes. And this is made from his oldest vines, with an average age of 45 years. It's fresh and delicate yet remarkably rich. Expect flavours of yellow fruit, apple, citrus and peppery spice. Try it with vegetable casseroles.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Almond, Citrus Fruit, Stone Fruit

Title: Winemaker Series The Red 2019/20, Swartland
Description: Winemaker Series celebrates some of our favourite people behind the bottles. Marc Kent is the man behind The Chocolate Block, which has long been a customer-favourite fine wine at Majestic. He creates this from the same vineyards with a wide variety of traditional RhÃ´ne grape varieties. It's rich and full-bodied, with flavours of red fruits, sweet spices and pepper. Try it with a vegetable chilli.
Characteristics: Chocolate, Black Fruit, Black Pepper, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cedar

Title: Winzer Krems GrÃ¼ner Veltliner 2021/22, Austria
Description: Crisp, refreshing and the perfect accompaniment to Weiner Schnitzel this fine Gruner abounds in flavours of peach and citrus and finishes with notes of minerals and pepper.

Title: Wolf Blass Yellow Label Chardonnay 2021/22, South Australia
Description: Yellow Label is the original series from Wolf Blass, one of Australia's most awarded wineries. Founded in the Barossa Valley, grapes are now carefully sourced from particularly ripe parcels of fruit across South Australia and matured in oak. A rich, honeyed, vanilla-flavoured Chardonnay, showing smooth, tropical fruit flavours on the creamy palate. Try it with Chinese-style fish dishes or more traditional roast chicken.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Wynns Coonawarra Estate 'Black Label' Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18/19, Coonawarra
Description:
Coonawarra's cool climate and famous terra rossa soils are now rightfully celebrated the world over. This region's reds are seen amongst Australia's greatest. Much of this is down to Samuel Wynn and his son, David, who bought an almost desolate vineyard in 1951 with no expectations of making a profit. Today, the Wynns Coonawarra Estate label is one of the most recognisable in Australia. This is one of the country's most collectable Cabernet Sauvignons. It has flavours of dark cherry, lavender and dried mint. The estate recommends trying it with fish tacos with green salsa.   

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cigar Box, Mint, Spice

Title: Yalumba Cigar Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18, Coonawarra
Description: Coonawarra is home to some of Australia's most famous vineyards â€“ and world famous Cabernet Sauvignon. 'The Cigar' is no exception. It's named after the unique shape of Coonawarra's famous â€˜terra rossaâ€™ soils, and â€“ quite rightly â€“ is one of Yalumba's most popular fine wines. It's a rich and powerful red â€“ expect bold notes of blackberry, strawberry, mocha and violets with soft, rounded tannins. Its velvety texture makes it a perfect partner for braised beef. The 2018 vintage was awarded gold at the 2022 Decanter World Wine Awards. Please be aware that this bottle may be closed with a cork or a screwcap, depending on the vintage.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Cigar Box, Eucalyptus, Mint

Title: Yalumba 'The Signature' Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz 2018/19, Barossa
Description: You may have tried Yalumba's entry-level work before. This is its Saturday-night wine. Almost equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz, it?s a rich, full-bodied cocktail of mocha, plum, cherry and black pepper that boasts plenty of complexity. Wine Enthusiast gave it 93 points, calling it "Classic Barossa".
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Smoke, Spice, Tobacco

Title: Zuccardi 'Q' Malbec 2020/21, Mendoza
Description: Alberto Zuccardi created the Zuccardi winery in 1963, when he planted his first vines in Mendoza. Fast forward to present day, and his first plantings have transformed into what was named number one at The World's Best Vineyard Awards in 2020. Not to mention, SebastiÃ¡n, the third generation of the family, is one of South America's finest winemakers. This is a chance for you to taste what the fuss is about. The Q stands for quality, as the fruit is sourced from Mendoza's finest spot. Try its notes of blackcurrant, cherry and roses with a sirloin steak.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Chocolate, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Indomita 'Duette' Pinot Noir 2021/22, Casablanca Valley
Description: The cooler-climate Casablanca Valley is perfect for the delicate Pinot Noir. ViÃ±a IndÃ³mita believe in minimal-intervention winemaking, which allows the natural beauty of the region to shine. 10 months in French oak have given it a silky texture and softened its cherry, dried fruit and fresh tobacco flavours. Enjoy a generous glass with barbecued chicken.

Title: Definition Sauternes 2013/16
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Sauternes, in Bordeaux, is responsible for some of the world's finest 'stickies'. The dessert wines here are made from rare SÃ©millon and Sauvignon Blanc grapes and can age for decades. To capture the best of this world-respected style, we went to a chÃ¢teau that's made it since 1709. It was classified as a 2nd Cru ClassÃ© in the 1855 classification and was even temporarily known as ChÃ¢teau Sauternes. This certainly lives up to the great name. It's luscious yet well-balanced with flavours of dry apricot, citrus and honey. Try it with an apricot tart.

Title: Waimea Estates Sauvignon Gris 2021/22, Nelson
Description: Plantings of Sauvignon Gris in New Zealand remain tiny but highly sought after. A cousin of Sauvignon Blanc, but with a richer texture and even more aromatics, the grape is a delicious option for fans of exotic whites. Made by customer favourite producer Waimea, this has vibrant flavours of smoky tropical fruit and honeysuckle.

Title: Casa Ferreirinha 'Planalto' White Reserva 2021/22, Douro
Description: Portuguese blends are a Majestic speciality â€“ and this seamless seven-grape white blend was too good to pass up. It's from the Douro â€“ a hot, dry region best known for producing robust, full-bodied wines, including Port. So how is this wine so light, crisp and refreshing? It's down to winemaker LuÃ­s Sottomayor. He carefully chooses grapes from high-altitude vineyards where the temperatures are cool and yields are low. So vines produce grapes full of freshness and intense flavour. Itâ€™s full of tropical and zingy citrus flavours. Something this refreshing and aromatic cries out for grilled octopus with chilli and lime.

Title: Negrar Appassimento Rosso Veneto 2021/22
Description: Red wine is a go-to for winter warming and Negrar Il Viaggo Appassimento leaves no trace of doubt as to why. It's rich in texture, deep and plummy with uplifting notes of red cherry and violet that perfectly round the palate. Enjoy with rich red meat dishes, such as aged beef and venison.

Title: Veuve Clicquot Brut Champagne
Description:
In 19th-century France, women werenâ€™t even allowed to have bank accounts. So it's extraordinary that twenty-something Madame Clicquot turned her late husbandâ€™s business into the must-have Champagne of several European courts. Take a sip of their signature Brut and youâ€™ll see exactly why. This is aged for twice the time legally required. The extra ageing brings biscuity and toasty flavour. It's rich â€“ but balanced by ripe and zingy notes of citrus. Refreshing. Decadent.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award

Title: L'Ouest de Lamothe Guignard Sauternes 2010 Half Bottle
Description: Sauternes is Bordeauxâ€™s most renowned dessert wine style â€“ and this is a stunning example. ChÃ¢teau Lamothe-Guignard occupies one of the highest points within the boundaries of Sauternes. The property was ranked as a 2nd classified growth in the 1855 classification and itâ€™s impressed drinkers and critics alike for decades since. Itâ€™s made with grapes affected by the coveted â€˜noble rotâ€™, which results in grapes shrivelling on the wine and becoming exceptionally sweet. The reduction in liquid concentrates sugars, but means that volumes are limited, so if youâ€™re looking to treat yourself to something special, this is it. Discover complex and luscious flavours of apricot, tropical fruits, marmalade and honey.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Duhart Milon Pauillac 2011
Description: The story goes that a privateer to Louis XV, Sieur Duhart, settled in Pauillac upon his retirement. The house that he lived in by the port inspired the label of Duhart-Milon â€“ and still features proudly on it today. The wine produced here was classified as one of the ten 'Fourth Growths' in the historic 1855 Bordeaux Classification - a ranking of Bordeaux's most important wines by Napoleon III. The winery and its 100 hectares of vineyards, marshes, meadows and woodlands was later acquired by Domaines Barons de Lafite Rothschild in the 1960s and sits adjacent their vineyard, offering an excellent alternative for those looking for exceptional quality without the price tag. Red grapes thrive on the sandy gravel soils â€“ this wine is a blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Merlot â€“ with hillsides shaped by the influences of the nearby Gironde estuary. Aromatic with red fruit, tobacco and spice notes, this is a Pauillac thatâ€™s elegant, fresh and finely structured. Pair it with red meat.

Title: Bollinger 'Special CuvÃ©e' Brut Champagne
Description: Bollinger is synonymous with high quality Champagne. The house stands apart by doing things a little differently to most other producers in the region. One of the ways they stand apart is by fermenting their base wines in oak casks. This results in fizz with complex creamy and spicy flavours. To make the highly-esteemed Special CuvÃ©e, grapes are predominately picked from Grand Cru and Premier Cru vineyards. And if that wasn't luxurious enough, the wine is then aged for double the legal requirement, so expect nothing less than excellence in every sip. Rich. Ripe. Powerful. These velvety complex bubbles have aromas of roasted apple, walnut and spice, with flavours of pear, biscuit and toasted brioche.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Porta 6 2020/21, Lisbon
Description:
Weâ€™ve become a bit of a specialist when it comes to Portuguese red blends â€“ and this wine is why. Celebrity chef James Martin said it was one of the nicest reds heâ€™d tasted in ten years of Saturday Kitchen. The subsequent scramble to buy it broke our website. Since then, weâ€™ve sold tens of thousands of bottles of this wine. And itâ€™s not hard to see why itâ€™s such a firm customer favourite. Bold. Juicy. Jammy. Itâ€™s full of ripe forest fruit flavours â€“ a really easy-drinking, approachable wine. At home on the sofa, at a party or with a hearty casserole.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Marcelo Pelleriti Malbec 2020/21, Mendoza
Description: Marcelo Pelleriti was the first Argentinian winemaker to receive 100 points from legendary wine critic Robert Parker when he worked at ChÃ¢teau La Violette in Pomerol. He has since brought his talent back to Mendoza, where he made this stunning Malbec exclusively for Majestic customers. It's rich and intense with plum, dried fruit and spicy oak notes, all balanced by fresh acidity on the long finish. Partner with slow-roasted pork.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Definition Provence RosÃ© 2021/22
Description: The Definition range brings the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. To capture the very Definition of rosÃ©, naturally we made a beeline for Provence. Specifically, to an area where 2,900 annual hours of sunshine, and the famous Mistral wind create the perfect growing environment for grapes ideally suited to make exceptional rosÃ©. This blend includes fruity Grenache and Cinsault, plus some Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah for structure and a hint of spice. The result is a classically crisp and refreshing wine that punches well above its price point. Itâ€™s elegant and beautifully aromatic, with juicy flavours of raspberry, strawberry and redcurrant. The delicate fruity notes and fresh character make it ideal for light summer salads.

Title: Mirabeau 'Pure' RosÃ© 2021/22, Provence
Description:
True to its title, Mirabeau Pure Provence RosÃ© is renowned for its distinctive purity. Itâ€™s a classic blend of Grenache and Syrah, gently pressed and lovingly crafted to express its refined and elegant flavours. This attention to detail has won it wide critical acclaim. Expect lush notes of pink grapefruit and summer berries, with a hint of minerality on the finish. Mirabeau lovingly calls this 'Provence in a glass'. It'll make a fantastic partner for light fish dishes.

In 2022, this wine won IWC and Decanter awards for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Balfour '1503' Brut, Kent
Description: This superb English sparkling comes from one of the countryâ€™s leading producers. Owen and Fergus Elias have been winemakers at Balfour for the last 10 years. So they know the best local vineyards for crafting traditional method sparkling that rivals some of the top French fizz. For the 1503 Brut, they picked Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from the beautiful Hush Heath Estate in Kent. The resulting wine shows crisp notes of apple and citrus fruits, pepper and thyme. Complex, toasty and the perfect apÃ©ritif to any meal.

Title: Graham Beck Brut, South Africa
Description: Youâ€™ll be in good company when you uncork a bottle of this Brut. Itâ€™s affectionately known as the â€˜Presidentâ€™s Choiceâ€™ because it was served at both Nelson Mandelaâ€™s inauguration and Barack Obamaâ€™s presidential win. Itâ€™s made with the MÃ©thode Cap Classique â€“ a style identical to the traditional method used to make Champagne, using Chardonnay and Pinot Noir too. It means itâ€™s a real steal for fizz fans who love the taste of Champagne â€“ but not the price. Fresh but creamy.
