Full of limey citrus flavours â€“ itâ€™s got a lovely brioche richness from its second fermentation in the bottle. Fantastic with cheesy nibbles.

Title: Dog Point Organic Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: James Healy and Ivan Sutherland are Sauvignon Blanc experts with over 50 years of winemaking experience between them. After spending a decade at Cloudy Bay, they began making this Sauvignon from Sutherland's vineyards, which were planted in the '70s and '80s. This vine age makes for a unique complexity in their wine. As a result, it's long been the darling of critical praise. It has plush notes of passionfruit and citrus, and a saline acidity. Try it with fresh seafood.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

And the results are seriously impressive â€“ earning 90+ points from many renowned critics. Discover intense aromas of fresh strawberry, raspberry, redcurrant and cherry, with a long finish and a delicate mousse. The ultimate apÃ©ritif for any special occasion.

Title: Pasqua 'Romeo & Juliet' Prosecco DOC RosÃ© 2021/22

Title: Mirabeau 'La Folie' Sparkling RosÃ©, Provence

Description: This is made by two of Portugal's best-known winemakers, JosÃ© Maria Soares Franco and JoÃ£o Portugal Ramos. Both have played crucial roles in modern-day Portuguese winemaking. Its creation celebrates wines crafted from this region only â€“ unlike the systemâ€™s first denomination â€“ Bourgogne wines, which can be made from grapes picked across the whole of Burgundy. Louis Latour is a long-time Majestic favourite. This traditional-yet-innovative producer was one of the first to celebrate the distinction â€“ and naturally weâ€™re delighted to get our hands on it. Made organically from young vines, this is aged in stainless steel tanks. So expect plenty of fresh and fruity flavour. Discover lively notes of citrus, almond and honey, with a mineral finish. Its fresh flavours make it incredibly versatile â€“ try a glass on its own, with light chicken dishes or shellfish.

Title: Leonidas Nassiakos â€˜White Ashâ€™ Assyrtiko 2020, Santorini

The Assyrtiko vineyards used to make this are between 50 and 70 years old â€“ and itâ€™s believed that a few vines may have been growing for up to 180 years. So along with the incredible depth of flavour that comes from old vines, youâ€™re in for a seriously impressive and unique wine. Expect aromas of citrus and peach, combined with lively minerality thanks to volcanic soils. Thereâ€™s a hint of honey alongside fresh-fruit flavours. Title: Heidsieck & Co. Monopole 'Rose Top' Champagne
Description:
Heidsieck & Co. founder Florens-Louis Heidsieck had the tall ambition of creating Champagne fit for a queen. And he achieved exactly that when he presented a cuvÃ©e to Marie Antoinette in 1788. The house has been a favourite of many European royal courts and remains one of the most respected Grand Marque Champagnes today. This rosÃ© is an elegant example of their prestige. Expect a floral note of violet, with rich flavours of wild strawberry, raspberry and refreshing redcurrant. 

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Simpsons Wine Estate RosÃ© 2020/22, England
Description: This English rosÃ© is made by Ruth and Charles Simpson. Until 2012, the couple only made wines at their acclaimed Southern French estate Domaine Sainte Rose, but returned home, buoyed by the UKs increasing quality and unique terroir. Title: Definition GSM 2020/21, South Australia
Description:
To capture the Definition of the famous Grenache, Syrah, MourvÃ¨dre blend, we went to two Masters of Wine at a highly acclaimed winery. Title: Montes Single Vineyard Merlot 2020/21, Colchagua Valley

Title: Dourthe RÃ©serve Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Bordeaux
Description: Dourthe have over 20 years of winemaking experience, which has allowed them to explore the best terroirs for their wine styles. Title: Araldica Moscato d'Asti 2021/22
Description: Moscato is one of the few grapes that actually tastes of grapes once it is made into wine. This delightful, light and fresh example also possesses floral and honeyed notes.

Title: Catena Chardonnay 2020/21, Mendoza
Description: Catena is one of the biggest names in Mendoza. NicolÃ¡s Catena is a former Decanter Man of the Year. And the winery, known as Catena Zapata, is largely responsible for putting Argentinian wine on the world map. It's now in the expert hands of his daughter, Laura. And she's living up to the family's widespread acclaim. Her talent shows in this ripe Chardonnay. It's rich and tropical, with flavours of apple, pear, butter and sweet spices. Try it with roast chicken.

Title: Montes Single Vineyard Chardonnay 2020/21, Casablanca Valley

Title: Miraval Blanc 2022, CÃ´tes de Provence
Description: Provence is famous worldwide for its crisp, elegant rosÃ©s â€“ but did you know that itâ€™s home to some excellent white wines too? This limited-release bottling is a case in point. Itâ€™s crafted by the renowned Perrin family, whose winemaking expertise stretches back five generations. And itâ€™s a true reflection of ChÃ¢teau Miravalâ€™s refinement and finesse. Youâ€™ll find it delicate and aromatic with notes of white flowers, peach, lemon, and a subtle toastiness from partial oak-ageing. Its fresh, mineral finish makes it an excellent accompaniment to shellfish dishes.

Title: The Whale Cove Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, South Africa

Title: Cave Vinicole de Hunawihr â€˜8â€™ Pinot Noir 2019, Alsace
Description: Alsace may be celebrated for white wine, but this Pinot Noir is a real head-turner too â€“ ample and structured, with silky tannins, flavours of red fruits and a long harmonious finish. The name comes from the fact that the cuvÃ©e is made from a blend of eight different plots, from eight different winegrowers.

Title: Quinta do Portal â€˜Muros de Vinhaâ€™ 2021, Douro
Description: Quinta do Portal is a boutique Portuguese winery, now in its fourth generation of family ownership. Up in the steep slopes of the Douro Valley, Paulo Coutinho manages plots worked by the family since 1881. Heâ€™s been head winemaker here since 1994 â€“ and itâ€™s safe to say heâ€™s perfected his craft. Utilising a range of planting techniques depending on the gradient of the slopes, he ensures only the finest Touriga Franca, Tinta Roiz and Tinta Barroca grapes are handpicked for this blend. Discover flavours of ripe red fruits, spicy notes and hints of vanilla. Itâ€™s dense yet elegant â€“ a perfect match for roast meat dishes.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award

This sparkling rosÃ© is made from Lombardyâ€™s finest Pinot Nero â€“ the Italian name for Pinot Noir. Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Honey, Raspberry, Red Apple, Strawberry

Title: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut Champagne
Description: If you order a glass of Champagne in a Parisian wine bar, more likely than not itâ€™ll be a glass of Nicolas Feuillatte. Itâ€™s far and away the most popular Champagne label in France â€“ and the third most popular in the world. The house founded in the 1980s by coffee magnate and jet-setter Nicolas Feuillatte. Jackie Kennedy and Lauren Bacall once flitted in and out of his Fifth Avenue apartment, glasses of fizz in hand, and the brand has been known for delicious, incredibly well-made Champagne ever since. Itâ€™s creamy and full of ripe-fruit flavour â€“ white peach, apple and raspberry, with a citrus-fresh finish.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Cune Rioja Reserva 2018/19
Description:
Though itâ€™s nearly 150 years old, CVNE is still run by the family of the brothers who founded it. Rioja is all about the oak ageing â€“ so itâ€™s strange to think that back in 1900 most wineries sold their wines as soon as possible. But the brothers changed this â€“ creating an incredible ageing capacity of 80,000 bottles in their new winery. This Reserva reflects that focus on ageing. Rich. Warm. Vanilla-spiced. Itâ€™s aged in oak barrels for 50% longer than it legally needs to be, giving it more finesse, more coconut spice, more softness. Itâ€™s delicious â€“ ideal with roast lamb or Spanish-style beef steaks.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2017 vintage.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Tour de Bigorre 2016, Bordeaux
Description: ChÃ¢teau Tour de Bigorre have been making excellent value claret for 80 years. You'll taste their expertise in this Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blend. Showing signs of maturity, its juicy and ripe red-fruit flavours are complemented by hints of vanilla. Try it with your Sunday roast.

Title: Journeyâ€™s End â€˜Lone Creekâ€™ Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Western Cape
Description:
The Gabb family is one of the UK's finest winemaking exports. Since moving to their Schapenberg Hill estate in the 1990s, they have been producing top-quality wines while tackling ethical and environmental projects. Theyâ€™ve converted to solar power, become Fairtrade-certified and even launched a foundation to provide meals to the local community. It's no surprise they've recently been awarded Ethical Company of the Year by The Drinks Business â€“ for the second year in a row. This Sauvignon Blanc is delicious proof of their passion and dedication. Youâ€™ll find it crisp and refreshing with notes of passionfruit, green apple and kiwi. Match its lively flavours with something equally aromatic, like an Asian-inspired fish dish with ginger and soy sauce.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: LB7 Vinho Verde DOC 2021/22
Description: If Port is Portugal's signature red, then Vinho Verde is its flagship white. It's a light, spritzy apÃ©ritif â€“ served in practically every Lisbon restaurant. And this is made by Calcada, the Vinho Verde experts. With a relatively low alcohol content (just 10%) this is a seriously thirst-quenching, drinkable wine. Itâ€™s fresh and zesty with lime and lemon flavours. With peachy, slightly floral aromas, itâ€™s perfect with fresh salads or lightly spiced seafood.

Title: Cloudy Bay 'Pelorus' Brut, Marlborough
Description: You'll know Cloudy Bay for their award-winning Sauvignon. But their sparkling wines are just as deserving of the spotlight. Pelorus is a Chardonnay-dominant blend made with a dash of Pinot Noir. It's fermented in oak and aged on its lees for a generous two years. This gives a nutty, elegant complexity to crisp apple flavours. Try it well-chilled with crab pasta.

Title: Fincher & Co. Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Awatere Valley
Description: This is made by Ben Glover, previously winemaker of Wither Hills and Mud House, and Master of Wine, Liam Steevenson. It's from the Awatere Valley, a Marlborough sub-region thatâ€™s cooler than the rest of the area. As a result, the wine is less overtly tropical. It's a New Zealand Sauvignon with Loire sensibilities. Zingy. Crisp. Refreshing. Try its elegant peach, lemon sherbet and mineral hints with sea bass and asparagus.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Green Bell Pepper, Lemon

Title: Springfield Estate AlbariÃ±o 2022, Robertson
Description: When brother and sister winemaking team Abrie and Jeanette Bruwer visited Argentina, they fell in love with AlbariÃ±o. So they made the second to ever be made in South Africa's Cape. It's crafted sustainably with a 'hands off' approach and only in small quantities. But what little there is tastes fantastic. It's complex and rich, with flavours of apricot, nectarine and that vital saline minerality. Try this with white fish or oysters.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Peach, Stone Fruit, Wet Stones

Title: Morgadio Da Torre Alvarinho 2019, Vinho Verde
Description: If you love citrusy Spanish AlbariÃ±o, you need to try Alvarinho from Portugal â€“ itâ€™s the exact same grape. Its heartland is in the Vinho Verde region. With vineyards set back from the Atlantic, and hotter summers than elsewhere in the DOC, this wine has a more generous body and character than the average bottle.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Green Apple, Peach, Spice

Title: Definition Hautes-CÃ´tes de Nuits 2017
Description: Burgundy is the spiritual home of Pinot Noir. You'll find the world's most sought-after expressions of the grape here. This is made high up on the Burgundian slopes by one of the oldest producers in the region. You'll taste the 200-year expertise in ripe red-fruit notes, smooth tannins and a spicy finish. Try it with grilled Portobello mushrooms.
Characteristics: Dried Herbs, Red Cherry, Savoury, Strawberry

Title: Villiera Barrel Fermented Chenin Blanc 2022, Stellenbosch
Description: Villiera Wines has been in the Grier familyâ€™s hands since 1983. Today, they have a strong ethical reputation. The winery is solar-powered, they've planted thousands of trees, use no insecticides and are a wildlife sanctuary. This Chenin Blanc was made by Nathan Valentine, who earned his stripes at the renowned De Morgenzon winery, as well as in California and the south of France. You can taste his expertise in every sip. It's spent time on its lees. This process transforms the wine into something more textured and complex. Itâ€™s full-bodied with a balancing fresh finish. Expect notes of citrus, pineapple and honey. Fantastic with Camembert.
Characteristics: Bread, Green Apple, Stone Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Gabb Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2020/21, South Africa
Description: Although the Gabb family are originally from Shropshire, their premium Stellenbosch wines have made them renowned in South Africa. Their picturesque vineyards are situated 6 miles from False Bay. The maritime climate and granite-based soils are reminiscent of Bordeaux, so itâ€™s no surprise that Cabernet Sauvignon thrives here. To make this wine, the selected grapes are chilled for two days prior to fermentation, allowing unique flavours to develop. 18 months barrel-aging in various types of oak adds further layers of delicious flavour. Expect intense, ripe aromas of blackberry, cassis and rich Christmas fruitcake. Itâ€™s full-bodied yet juicy and elegant. A hint of tobacco smoke and structured tannins make this a delicious pairing for beef short ribs.

Title: Mayu Gran Reserva Chardonnay 2020, Elqui Valley
Description: Elqui valley is Chileâ€™s northernmost wine region â€“ and its ideal conditions make it renowned for producing quality wines. Itâ€™s here that Italian winemaker Giorgio Flessati brings his mastery and flair to the ViÃ±a Mayu range. Combining Old World winemaking with New World fruit, his wines have their own unique style and personality that has seen them win an impressive array of awards. Only the best grapes are meticulously picked by hand before theyâ€™re fermented in French oak barrels. And to add even more complexity, the wine is left on its lees for 10 months, adding creamy notes and providing a delicious velvety texture. Itâ€™s full bodied and rich with ripe notes of banana, pineapple and papaya. Its fresh acidity makes it a brilliant pairing for Mediterranean pasta or creamy chicken dishes.
Characteristics: Banana, Pineapple, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

Title: VIVIR Tequila Blanco
Description: Grown for 9 years in the highlands of Jalisco, Mexico, VIVIR's 100% Agave Tequila is produced from the finest Weber Blue Agave. With a nod to tradition, Clay ovens (Hornos) are used to cook their Agave, using natural volcanic spring water from a well at their distillery. The end result is a natural, fresh and authentic spirit that stays true to its Agave routes.

Title: Moillard-Thomas Chablis 2021/22
Description:
Not much changes in the centuries-old vineyards of Burgundy, but that hasnâ€™t stopped Moillard-Thomas from finding ways to innovate. One of the regionâ€™s oldest wine merchants, they respect the heritage of the land and its world-class grapes while using modern winemaking methods. For their Chablis, that means swift pressing after harvest and fermentation in thermo-regulated stainless steel vats. The result is a wine with complexity, minerality and fresh aromas of white-stone fruits and citrus. Itâ€™s already drinking well, but could continue to age well for a few more years. A natural match for oysters, sushi or goatâ€™s cheese. 

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Devil's Creek 'Gold Reserve' Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Marlborough
Description: Since we introduced it to the UK, Devilâ€™s Creek Sauvignon Blanc has become a firm customer favourite. And with this, weâ€™ve gone one better. To make it, we went to Marlboroughâ€™s premium Wairau Valley region, where plenty of sunshine results in wine with more intense, tropical flavours than your average bottle. Whatâ€™s more, winemaker Michele Pedron is a true Sauvignon specialist. Heâ€™s worked in top Sauvignon regions around the world â€“ from Sancerre to Chileâ€™s Maule Valley. With this Gold Reserve, Michele draws out the pronounced style of the grape. This is beautifully tropical and full bodied, bursting with gooseberry, guava and elderflower flavours. Crisp and refreshing â€“ itâ€™s a fantastic wine for sharing over some Thai food.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Gooseberry, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Domaine Claude Lafond â€˜CuvÃ©e Nathalieâ€™ Reuilly Blanc 2021/22
Description: The Loire Valley is home to some of the best kept secrets in wine. Sauvignon Blanc from Reuilly is one of these gems. Right next to Sancerre, it shares the same soil and many of the same delicious characteristics, but without the higher price tag of its more well-known neighbour. Nathalie Lafond runs this domaine which was originally built by her father, the legendary Reuilly producer Claude Lafond. She now farms organically and continues to take the estate from strength to strength, along with the reputation of Reuilly itself. This is fresh, fruity and has aromas of grapefruit and citrus â€“ plus a delicious saline finish. Try it with grilled meaty fish.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Gooseberry, Green Apple, Peach

Title: Thierry Delaunay 'Le Manoir' RosÃ© 2020/21, Touraine
Description: Touraine, in the Loire Valley, is full of fantastic Sauvignon Blanc. But if you scratch the surface, you'll find exceptional rosÃ© too. 90% of what fifth-generation winemaker Thierry Delaunay makes here is white wine. He crafts a small amount of this rosÃ© from Gamay, Cabernet Franc and Malbec grapes. Interestingly, he ages it on its lees, and this brings a curious texture to notes of redcurrant, strawberry and raspberry. Delicious with goat's cheese.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Floral, Peach, Raspberry, Strawberry

Title: Lyme Bay Chardonnay 2020/21, Essex
Description:
Your next favourite Chardonnay might just be from Essex vineyards. This area has a warm growing season and very little rainfall. That's why head winemaker James Lambert, who has decades of experience in English winemaking, specifically chose to grow Chardonnay here. Taste the benefits of a long growing season in hints of apricot, peach, apple skin and sweet spices. Try it with meaty fish, like cod or halibut.
In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Definition Sancerre 2020/21
Description: The Definition range brings the worldâ€™s greatest wines to Majestic customers. Our buyers have tried hundreds, if not thousands, of expressions of Sancerre. They chose this one for good reason. Itâ€™s crafted by a producer with more than 58 years of Sancerre experience. And the grapes behind it come from old vines in limestone soils â€“ the perfect recipe for the citrusy, structured style that Sancerre's known for worldwide. It's a clean wine with a refreshing, dry finish. Expect aromas of white flowers and flavours of crunchy green apple and citrus. Enjoy with baked white fish dishes.

Title: Domaine Skouras Assyrtiko 2021/22, Nemea
Description: Assyrtiko is Greece's most exciting white grape variety. It really rewards the adventurous Sauvignon Blanc drinker. This mouth-watering, fresh expression is made in Nemea by George Skouras, a man with a rich winemaking CV. He leaves it on contact with its lees for a few months, and this adds a delicate texture to its flavours of green apple, citrus and stone fruits. Try it with Greek-style roast pollock and roasted Mediterranean vegetables.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Green Apple, Lemon, Nectarine

Title: Didier Montchevot Organic Beaune Premier Cru 2018
Description: Didier Montchovet is revered as a true pioneer of organic and biodynamic viticulture in Burgundy. He was the first producer to be organically certified by Demeter back in 1984 â€“ and heâ€™s been leading the charge for pesticide-free viticulture ever since. Utilising his extensive network of growers, Didier crafts this wine from two idyllic premier cru plots. Theyâ€™re situated high on the hillsides of Beaune where perfect sun exposure and limestone and clay soils result in deliciously ripe grapes with complex flavours. The 2018 harvest produced Pinot Noir with extra richness and silky tannins â€“ and this is a case in point. Expect ripe and juicy red-fruit flavours with earthy notes and hints of baking spice. Its punchy flavours make it a great match for game birds.

Title: Domaine Cordier PÃ¨re et Fils 'En Faux' Saint-VÃ©ran 2020/22
Description: Domaine Cordier is a third-generation Burgundy estate founded in 1968. Today, it's run by the fantastic Christophe Cordier, who creates stunning white Burgundy at great value. This Saint-VÃ©ran is made from hand-picked grapes and aged in oak. As a result, it's rich and ripe. It has flavours of peach, apple, vanilla and oak. Try it with white fish or cured meats.

Title: Domaine Cordier PÃ¨re et Fils 'Vieilles Vignes' Pouilly-FuissÃ© 2020/21
Description: Domaine Cordier is a third-generation Burgundy estate founded in 1968. Today, it's run by the fantastic Christophe Cordier, who creates stunning white Burgundy at great value. This Pouilly-FuissÃ© is made from hand-picked grapes and aged in oak. As a result, it's rich and full-bodied. Expect flavours of peach, apricot and passionfruit. It has hints of sweet spices that go excellently with lightly spiced seafood.

Title: Domaine Roux PÃ¨re & Fils â€˜Les AgniÃ¨resâ€™ Rully Blanc 2020
Description: With a winemaking history stretching back to 1885, Domaine Roux PÃ¨re & Fils are renowned for producing elegant Burgundy wines. Today their winemaking is led by Matthieu Roux, part of the familyâ€™s fifth generation. Heâ€™s earned his stripes at top wineries around the world, including Australia's iconic Penfolds, so itâ€™s safe to say he knows a thing or two about quality. By adopting a minimal-intervention approach in his familyâ€™s vineyards and cellars, he crafts wines with exceptional purity of fruit. And this aromatic Rully is a fine example. Discover delicate floral notes of elderflower and honeysuckle, alongside flavours of lemon, peach and a flinty minerality. Itâ€™ll continue to age well for up to five years, with touches of honey and dried fruits developing over time. Youâ€™ll find it a perfect match for white fish, crab or lobster.

Title: Famille Brocard Chablis Premier Cru Vau de Vey 2021
Description: Jean-Marc Brocard first began cultivating vines in Chablis  back in 1973. Half a century later, the Brocard name is synonymous with incredible wines that showcase the essence of the region. And their passion extends far beyond the creation of exceptional wines. Theyâ€™re at the leading edge of sustainability in Chablis, widely using sustainable methods and gradually moving their vineyards to organic. The iconic style of their wines is owed to ancient soils dating back to the Upper Jurassic period â€“ and this elegant, mineral wine showcases it perfectly. Expect floral aromas and crisp notes of lemon, lime and fresh-cut grass. Its refreshing minerality makes it a perfect pairing for shellfish or goatâ€™s cheese.

Title: Henri Pion Gevrey-Chambertin 2018
Description: The Pion family have been distributors of independent Burgundy wineries since 1949. Today, they represent more than 400 estates, including the prestigious Domaine de la RomanÃ©e-Conti, Georges Roumier, Armand Rousseau and Domaine Leflaive to name but a few. The current generation, brothers Oliver and Christian, wanted to take the business one step further. With the familyâ€™s knowledge and expertise behind them, theyâ€™ve begun making wine themselves. To make this, grapes are handpicked from three organic plots across Gevrey-Chambertin. The meticulous selection results in a wine which strikes the perfect balance of flavours and structure. Its light and delicate character reminds us of elegant Chambolle-Musigny wines. Expect mature notes of ripe red and black fruits, with silky soft tannins that make it an excellent choice for meaty fish dishes.

Title: Nicolas Feuillatte 'Grande RÃ©serve' Brut Champagne Magnum
Description: Feuillatte is far and away the most popular Champagne label in France. Itâ€™s a name that guarantees quality and flavour in every bubble â€“ and the Grande RÃ©serve Brut takes their expertise to new heights. A step up from their original brut Champagne, it has more Chardonnay in the blend and uses a higher proportion of reserve wines, giving the winemaker even more possibilities to curate delicious flavour. Itâ€™s aged for at least three years in their cellars, slowly developing complex flavours and a rich texture. The ideal wine to elevate any occasion â€“ and now in a show-stopping magnum bottle. Expect fresh flavours of grapefruit, tangerine, plum and nectarine with a smooth, creamy finish

Title: Olarra ClÃ¡sico Rioja Reserva 2018
Description: When the Limousin family began Bodegas Olarra in 1970, they soon set a new standard of winemaking in Rioja. And theyâ€™ve built more than a reputation for quality. Their winery is an iconic landmark on Riojaâ€™s landscape, with a patchwork of pointed roofs covering Olarraâ€™s vast underground cellar. The distinguished architecture has earned it the nickname â€˜The Great Cathedral of Riojaâ€™. Today, the estate is managed by the familyâ€™s third generation, with one of Spain's best winemakers, Javier MartÃ­nez de Salinas, having been on board since 1998. Working with growers across Rioja Alta, Baja and Alavesa, only the best grapes are selected to make this Reserva. It spends 18 months in oak casks before it's left to rest in bottle to develop complexity. Discover vibrant notes of red berries, liquorice and hints of smokiness. Savoury flavours make it a great choice for roast game dishes. In 2022, both Wine Enthusiast and Decanter awarded the 2018 vintage more than 90 points.

Title: Pagos del Rey â€˜409â€™ Ribera del Duero 2020/21
Description: Pagos del Rey was founded in 2002, with the goal of crafting quality wines in Spainâ€™s most prestigious winemaking regions. This rich Ribera del Duero proves that theyâ€™ve succeeded. Itâ€™s made with both old- and young-vine Tempranillo grapes, which are fermented separately to preserve their individual characters. The young-vine grapes give bright fruit and floral aromas, while the old-vine parcel provides firm tannins and riper fruit notes. The wine is then aged in oak for 409 days, hence its name, followed by several months in bottle. All that attention to detail has paid off â€“ this 2020 vintage was awarded an excellent 92 points from top critic James Suckling. Discover juicy dark-fruit flavours balanced by complex notes of toasted spices, dark chocolate, walnut and tobacco. Its supple tannins and long, savoury finish make it an excellent match for red meats, like roast lamb or peppery beef â€“ or you could choose to cellar it for up to five years.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Sweet Spice

Title: Tbilvino Saperavi 2021, Georgia
Description: Itâ€™s been around for 60 years, and yet still Tbilvino are relative fledglings in Georgiaâ€™s Kakheti region. After all, people have lived in this area since the Stone Age and made wine on its riverbanks since about 6,000BC. The winery combines modern tech and slick organisation with traditional indigenous varietals to make an impressive range of wine styles. Many regularly medal at lauded international competitions. Youâ€™ve perhaps not heard of Saperavi, but as Georgiaâ€™s award-winning Tbilvino winery turn more and more heads internationally, you might just find it making your list of new favourite grape varieties. In this wine, it shows lively aromas of ripe black fruits and sweet spices. Good, soft tannins and nice acidity, too.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackberry, Sweet Spice

Title: Falua Tercius Tinto 2021, Tejo
Description: Originally hailing from the Vinho Verde region, Antonina Barbosa is one of Portugalâ€™s most exciting winemakers, as well as head honcho of Falua, Terciusâ€™s parent brand. The company was founded in 1994 to revitalise terroir-driven winemaking in Portugalâ€™s lesser-known Tejo region, and business has boomed since then. Low yields help them maintain both quality and a sense of place in the wines. With a gold-medal win at the Decanter World Wine Awards and a 94-point score from lauded critic Robert Parker, the wines of Tercius have landed serious international acclaim. And this one impresses with its freshness, bountiful red-fruit aromas and smooth-as-silk profile.
Characteristics: Cranberry, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Violet

Title: Chateau de TargÃ© 'Les Cerisiers de Targe' Organic Saumur-Champigny 2020
Description: Just steps from the Loire River, majestic limestone ChÃ¢teau de TargÃ© was constructed in 1655, by the ancestors of current owner Edouard Pisani-Ferry. Fast forward a few hundred years and, under the stewardship of Edouard and his son Paul, the estate specialises in organic viticulture. With the recent rebirth of their â€˜closâ€™ parcel cuvÃ©es, each highlighting different geographical patches of the estate, terroir-driven wines are increasingly becoming a focus. Aromatic, fruity and juicy, this Cabernet Franc is the perfect introduction to one of the regionâ€™s finest producers. If thatâ€™s not impressive enough, itâ€™s organic too.
Characteristics: Blackcurrant, Red Fruit, Violet, White Pepper

Title: Rhonea 'Notre Dame des Vignes' Visan 2020
Description: A group of nearly 400 artisan winegrowers with vineyards across the CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne, RhonÃ©a shows off the power of community winemaking. Theyâ€™re part of Winegrowers for Sustainable Development and have blossomed from just a handful of families in the 1920s to an influential body making fruit-forward wines. This Grenache and Syrah blend bagged a gold medal at the Concours des Grand Vins de France. When you taste it youâ€™ll know why: itâ€™s powerful yet restrained, with intense black and blue fruits, a kick of white pepper on the finish and harmonious tannins.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Grand Jean Bordeaux Blanc 2021
Description: The Dulon family have been making wine at ChÃ¢teau Grand Jean for 250 years. Theyâ€™ve come a long way; when the estate was founded there were just 2 hectares and now thereâ€™s 160. Sophie and Carole Dulon, daughters of owner Michel, joined the team in 2012 and are using technology to ensure grapes are picked at optimum ripeness. White Bordeaux doesnâ€™t get more classic than this blend of Sauvignon Blanc and SÃ©millon. With bold, fruity aromas and a lively flavour, it makes just as great an apÃ©ritif as it does a match for food. No wonder French wine competition Gilbert & Gaillard awarded it a gold medal.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Gooseberry, Grapefruit, Green Apple

Title: Bodegas OntaÃ±Ã³n 'Canderuela' Rioja Crianza 2019
Description: When youâ€™re after a classic bottle, you canâ€™t do better than this â€“ a bold Rioja from a family whoâ€™ve been making it for 80 years. The fourth-generation PÃ©rez Cuevas family farm high-altitude plots at up to 800 metres in the  Sierra de Yerga mountains. They are working to make all their vineyards 100% organic and are continuously promoting biodiversity. Olive trees and other native flora are dotted among their picturesque vineyards. Expect plenty of bold strawberry and cherry flavours, with hints of vanilla and spice â€“ the perfect accompaniment to roast lamb.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Plum, Coconut, Sweet Spice

Title: ChÃ¢teau Purcari 'Nocturne' Rara Neagra de Purcari 2021, Moldova
Description: The worldâ€™s most award-winning winery in 2021, Purcari have bagged 333 gold and silver medals across a huge number of influential wine competitions. But theyâ€™re not just some young upstart. An imperial Russian decree in 1827 granted Purcari status as the first specialised winery in Bessarabia. In 1847 they won their first medal and in 1878 snagged gold at the Paris World Fair â€“ a trend that would continue. This ruby-hued number made from local RarÄƒ NeagrÄƒ grapes has pure fruit aromas of sour cherry, blackcurrant and plum, and hints of spice. A satiny texture with every sip, too. Think of it as Moldovaâ€™s take on a classic RhÃ´ne red.

Title: Bostavan Winery  47Â°N Chardonnay 2021, Moldova
Description: Hereâ€™s something a little different: a Chardonnay from Moldova. Founded in 2002 by Victor Bostan as a sister project to ChÃ¢teau Purcari, Bostavan is a leading name in Moldovan wine. It has collected more than 70 awards at prestigious industry competitions. Rich and fruity, this bottling exemplifies why this eastern European country is winning serious acclaim for both the quality and value of its wine. It doesnâ€™t hurt that this made by the same people who run ChÃ¢teau Purcari â€“ the worldâ€™s most award-winning winery in 2021.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Red Apple, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

Title: Cantina del Garda Valpolicella Ripasso DOC 2019
Description: The timeless, elegant wines of Cantina del Garda match their wonderfully ornate labels, which evoke the classic design style of Verona. They produce a range of impressive wines that capture the character of the northern Italian region, including a Soave, Corvina and Italyâ€™s favourite sparkling â€“ Prosecco. It doesnâ€™t get much more classic Valpolicella Ripasso than this. Crushed Corvina Veronese, Corvinone, Rondinella and Molinara grapes are combined with the partly fermented skins from Amarone wine production. This creates a bottling thatâ€™s a beefy step-up in body, flavour and tannin from standard Valpolicella. Expect intense cherry aromas and full-on flavour.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Sweet Spice

Title: Baron Edmond de Rothschild Montagne-Saint-Ã‰milion 2016/18
Description: This delicious Saint-Ã‰milion-lookalike is made by Domaine Edmond de Rothschild Heritage â€“ the same family behind some of Bordeauxâ€™s most expensive wines. The family brings all the same expertise to this. Itâ€™s from Montagne-Saint-Ã‰milion â€“ one of the only Saint-Ã‰milion satellite appellations with high enough quality wines to use the Saint-Ã‰milion name. Thanks to its Rothschild winemakers, it punches well above its price point. It's rich, savoury and full of both fresh- and dried-fruit flavours. A perfect pairing for roasted pork.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Cedar, Chocolate, Sweet Spice

Title: Ruinart Blanc de Blancs Champagne
Description: Grand Cru Chardonnay has been used to make this Champagne. Citrus, peach and white flower aromas evolve into a fresh and supple palate, ideal when married with oysters and sashimi.
Characteristics: Hazelnut, Almond, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Aqualta Prosecco DOC
Description: Prosecco is to Venice what pork pies are to Melton Mowbry. Itâ€™s part of the cityâ€™s identity. Venetians are just crazy about Prosecco â€“ but not just any old fizz. They know the good stuff when they taste it, and they demand the very best. Our buyers tasted countless Proseccos to try and find the perfect union of flavour and value, but we couldnâ€™t quite find what we were looking for. So, we decided to commission it. Aqualta was the result, made exclusively for us â€“ and we think itâ€™s the perfect Prosecco. Itâ€™s fragrant with really delicate aromas of apple and pear. The styleâ€™s typical of the super-fresh fizz served in backstreet bÃ cari; used to top up Veniceâ€™s signature spritzes, or chase a groaning table of cichÃ¨ti. Itâ€™s a mouthwatering slice of Italy at home. Great flavour. Great value. Great fizz. What more could you need?

Title: Veuve Clicquot RosÃ© Champagne
Description:
A relatively recent addition to the Veuve Clicquot stable, this medium bodied rosÃ© is reminiscent of the power and finesse of the non-vintage label, with a soft red-fruit core. Match with smoked salmon or strawberries and cream for optimum enjoyment.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award

Title: Mud House Pinot Noir 2020/21, Central Otago
Description: Central Otago is the central part of New Zealand's south island, and with its free-draining loam and gravel soils and wide diurnal temperature variation, it has become known for superb Pinot Noir. This is a single-vineyard wine from Otago's sub-region of Bendigo. An intense and powerful Pinot, full of bright red cherry and darker bramble fruit, layered with gentle notes of mocha and spice. Finely balanced tannin and acidity provide great grip and length. Enjoy with duck or lamb.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Domaine Fouassier 'Sur le Fort' Organic Sancerre 2021/22
Description: The Fouassier family are part of the fabric of Sancerre. Itâ€™s a tenth generation domaine â€“ one of the oldest in the region, and their wines usually sell for top dollar. It means their organic Sancerre wines are of incredible quality â€“ and incredibly well made. Think tart green apple. The pear and lemon notes are trademark Fouassier, and itâ€™s so crisp youâ€™ll find it slipping down all too easily. Full, fruity â€“ itâ€™s incredibly intense so the flavours really last. That fruitiness combined with Thai-syle spice is a marriage made in heaven.

Title: Ayala 'Brut Majeur' Extra Age Champagne
Description: One of the best kept secrets in Champagne, Ayala has been under the ownership of the Bollinger family since 2005. And it's been brought back to brilliance by winemaker Caroline Latrive â€“ one of few female Chefs de Caves at the helm of a Grande Marque Champagne House. Under her watchful eye, Brut Majeur Extra Age has been recommended by Decanter as â€˜must try fizzâ€™ with an excellent 94-point score. The clue is in the name â€“ itâ€™s aged for an additional 12 months in Ayala's cellars, so you can expect an opulent and complex Champagne that punches well above its price point. Itâ€™s dry and decadent, with rich notes of citrus and toast. Fine bubbles add to its elegance.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Batailley 'Lions de Batailley' 2015/16, Pauillac
Description: This is the second wine of ChÃ¢teau Batailley, one of the oldest estates in the MÃ©doc, and its first vines were planted in the 16th century. The chÃ¢teauâ€™s wines gained a great reputation and it was recognised in the prestigious 1855 Bordeaux Classification as a Fifth Growth. Over the past few decades, there has been an even greater emphasis on quality of fruit. Expect intense flavour, great structure and ripe tannins. Youâ€™ll find it fresh and earthy, with aromas of tobacco, raspberries and red cherry. Silky, smooth tannins make this a perfect pairing for roast lamb.

Title: Catena Zapata 'Catena Alta' Malbec 2019/20, Mendoza
Description: NicolÃ¡s Catena Zapata was the first ever South American to be named Decanter Man of the Year. He introduced high-altitude Malbec to the world, helping make Argentinian expressions of the grape a household name. Catena Alta is a collection of wines made in limited quantities from carefully selected vines in Catenaâ€™s best vineyards. These prized bottles are best enjoyed after 3 years of maturation and will continue to improve over at least a decade. It's aged for 18 months in oak, making it rich and supple. Expect notes of black fruits, mocha and vanilla. Enjoy a generous glass with roasted pork, studded with cloves.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Chocolate, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Bollinger RosÃ© Champagne
Description: Bollinger have been producing world-class Champagne since 1829. Famous for their powerful, refined house style, their name is synonymous with luxury and quality. This elegant rosÃ© is an excellent demonstration of their blending mastery. To make it, they add a portion of an exceptional red wine made with grapes from top plots in their Pinot Noir vineyards â€“ bringing deliciously fruity aromas to the finished fizz. Youâ€™ll find it wonderfully structured and velvety, with notes of fresh strawberry, redcurrant, cherry and spice.

Title: Louis Roederer 'Collection 242' Brut Champagne
Description: Louis Roederer has been family-owned for seven generations and is one of Champagneâ€™s most respected names. Today, the entire estate is sustainably certified, with 120 hectares of vineyards certified organic and ten hectares certified biodynamic. About 90% of its waste is recycled, too. As for the wine? The rich, toasty Brut goes to prove you can produce a top-quality fizz while being kind to the earth. Grapes are hand-harvested, and the wine is aged for three and a half years before release, allowing for complexity to develop. As a result, it won World Champion Classic Non-vintage Brut at the Champagne & Sparkling Wine World Championships 2021.

Title: Piper-Heidsieck 2012 Champagne
Description: Over its 235-year history, Piper-Heidsieckâ€™s Champagne has been the choice of 14 royal courts. This vintage Champagne is made by a head winemaker who's been named Sparkling Winemaker of the Year eight times at the International Wine Challenge. It's rich and toasty, with notes of citrus, almond and honey. The 2012 vintage scored 97 points at the International Wine & Spirits Competition.

Title: Vallformosa Fest Brut Organic Cava, Penedes
Description: A big name in Cava, Vallformosa has been making Spainâ€™s signature fizz since the 1930s, and they've racked up plenty of awards along the way. And yet the team â€“ headed by winemaker Xavi Pons â€“ doesnâ€™t rest on its laurels. Since the early 2000s theyâ€™ve been focused on both environmental and social sustainability, using fewer natural resources and supporting a network of 500 long-term local growers. The attention to detail hasnâ€™t shifted, and all wines are aged for longer than the legal requirement, bringing more complex flavour to your glass. This is delicate, balanced fizz with bright notes of apple, pear and citrus.
Characteristics: Apricot, Bread, Cream, Green Apple, Melon, Pear

Title: Rupert & Rothschild 'Baroness Nadine' Chardonnay 2021/22, South Africa
Description: The Rothschild familyâ€™s winemaking legacy began in 1868, when James de Rothschild bought the prestigious ChÃ¢teau Lafite in Bordeaux. Over a century later, his great-grandson Baron Edmond decided to take his passion and expertise to South Africa. There, in partnership with businessman and philanthropist Dr Anton Rupert, he began producing French-style wines in picturesque Franschhoek. The estate is now managed by the next generation of both families â€“ and the wines continue to attract international acclaim. This Chardonnay was named in honour of Baron Edmondâ€™s wife, Baroness Nadine de Rothschild. And with its elegance and sophistication, itâ€™s a fitting tribute. Discover notes of grapefruit and lemon peel, plus hints of vanilla, cinnamon and toasted hazelnut. Its citrusy character and long, mineral finish make it an ideal match for fish and seafood dishes.
Characteristics: Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Smoke, Vanilla

Title: Bottega 'Gold' Prosecco DOC
Description: Once youâ€™ve seen a bottle of Bottega fizz, itâ€™s not easily forgotten. But thereâ€™s more than a touch of glamour behind these wines. This legendary estate dates back all the way to the 17th century, when Andrea Bottega began cultivating vines high in the Treviso hills. Fast forward to today and the sustainably run family estate is now world-renowned for its award-winning Prosecco, grappa and gin. Bottega Gold is made from grapes in Valdobbiadene â€“ the area recognised for producing the finest Prosecco. It even took gold at The Drinks Business Prosecco Masters 2021. So you can rest assured that this eye-catching bottle is not style over substance. Expect orchard fruit, citrus and floral aromas, a soft, refreshing mousse, and a touch of spice on the finish.

Title: Nicolas Feuillatte Champagne Half Bottle
Description: A light and fruity Champagne with fine discreet bubbles and subtle overtones of apples and pears. Has undergone 2 years cellar ageing.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Bouvet Ladubay 'Saphir' Saumur Brut 2018/19, Magnum
Description: Love vintage sparkling wine, but not the price tag? This show-stopping magnum is not to be missed. A blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay, itâ€™s made using the same traditional method as premium French fizz, offering plenty of delicious complexity for just a fraction of the cost. 18 months of ageing adds richer brioche and biscuit notes, alongside flavours of honeyed peach and hazelnut. In magnum form, it'll make a classy addition to any party or special occasion â€“ enjoy it as an apÃ©ritif or with canapÃ©s.

Title: Cantina Chiara Ziliani 'Duca Diseo' Franciacorta DOCG Brut
Description: Franciacorta is Italy's answer to Champagne. To achieve the same high quality, sparkling wines here are produced using the traditional second-fermentation method applied in the prestigious French region. And much like in Champagne, winemaker Chiara Ziliani ensures only the best Pinot Noir and Chardonnay grapes are carefully harvested by hand for her blend. Luxurious and complex, itâ€™s aged in contact with the residual yeast sediment known as â€˜leesâ€™, giving it a delicious creamy texture. Expect aromas of white peach, apple and pear and rich bread and biscuit flavours. Itâ€™s a perfect match for seafood risotto.

Title: Ruinart 'Second Skin' Brut RosÃ© Champagne
Description: Ruinartâ€™s innovative â€˜Second Skinâ€™ is an eco-friendly alternative to a gift box. It's a paper case that fits snugly around the bottle that's entirely recyclable and moulded to resemble the Champagne region's historic crayÃ¨res chalk cellars. It reduces the packaging carbon footprint by a whopping 60%. Meanwhile, whatâ€™s inside the bottle is Ruinart's same great pink fizz. Produced from four centuries of winemaking experience, this blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir is rich in tropical fruit. Flavours of guava, pomegranate and lychee â€“ plus freshly picked berries, pink grapefruit and mint â€“ follow with each sip. Itâ€™s surprisingly food-friendly: try it with slivers of salmon sashimi.

Title: Vallformosa Fest Brut RosÃ© Cava, Penedes
Description: Vallformosa is one of the most respected names in Cava. Theyâ€™ve been making Spainâ€™s famed bubbly since the 1930s, and today work with more than 500 small growers. They lay claim to the high vineyards in Penedes, where grape ripening is slower and flavours and aromas are enhanced. Taste the complexity for yourself in this delicate rosÃ© with fresh notes of strawberry, raspberry and cherry.
Characteristics: Cream, Pear, Raspberry, Red Apple, Red Cherry, Strawberry

Title: Ruinart RosÃ© Champagne
Description: Ruinart RosÃ© was first released in 1962. It is the blanc de blanc to which 15% Pinot has been added. Sublime golden pink in colour, a subtle nose of cherry and freshly-picked red berries leads to a fleshy and delightfully smooth finish.

Title: Veuve Amiot â€˜Elisaâ€™ CrÃ©mant de Loire
Description: CrÃ©mant is enjoying something of a renaissance among wine-lovers. This is a rich-yet-vibrant style of sparkling wine. And this bottle is made by a historical Saumur winery. With poised structure and aromas of fresh white fruit, itâ€™ll make a great partner for smoked salmon.

Title: Drappier 'Signature' Blanc de Blancs Brut Champagne
Description: A pioneer of hands off winemaking, and the first carbon neutral Champagne house, Drappier is a byword for innovation. Made from Chardonnay and a dash of rarely used Pinot Blanc - this Blanc de Blancs is a prime example of its ingenuity. With 5% of the wine aged in barrel and lees ageing of 36 months with little sulphites, it's both thoroughly modern and delicious.
Characteristics: Pear, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple, Honey

Title: Nicolas Feuillatte Champagne Magnum
Description: A light and fruity Champagne with fine discreet bubbles and subtle overtones of apples and pears. Has undergone four years cellar ageing.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Majestic Fizzy & Fruity, Italy
Description: Each bottle in our Selected by Majestic range has been chosen by our award-winning team of buyers for its unmistakable value and instantly enjoyable taste. Fizzy & Fruity is made predominantly from Glera â€“ Prosecco's star grape â€“ so fans of Veneto's signature sparkling are in for a real treat. Expect notes of fresh citrus, ripe apple and peach, with soft, creamy bubbles.

Title: La Gioiosa 'Biologico' Organic Prosecco DOC
Description:
La Gioiosa is one of the biggest names in Prosecco. This bottle demonstrates the perfect partnership of tradition and innovation. In 2017, the winery launched its La Gioiosa for Life project, establishing their commitment to the environment. They use minimum-impact practices on the ecosystem around them and beyond. The result? This elegant, organic Prosecco. Itâ€™s mineral and fresh, with notes of golden apple and white flowers. Superb with Pad Thai.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Maison Roche de Bellene 'CuvÃ©e Bellenos' CrÃ©mant de Bourgogne Brut
Description: Burgundyâ€™s CrÃ©mant sparkling wines are a fabulous alternative to Champagne. They're often made in the same second-fermentation traditional method and cost a fraction of the price. This fizz, produced by Maison Roche de Bellene, shows the sophisticated heights that CrÃ©mant can reach. It has flavours of exotic fruit, citrus, white flowers and pastries. Try it with canapÃ©s.

Title: Nicolas Courtin RosÃ© Champagne

In this delightful rosÃ©, discover fresh strawberry flavours and notes of cream and brioche on the finish. Perfect as an apÃ©ritif or with sashimi.

Title: Ruinart RosÃ© Champagne Half Bottle
Description: Sublime golden pink in colour, a subtle nose of cherry and freshly picked red berries lead to a fleshy and delightfully smooth finish.

Title: Veuve Clicquot Champagne Half Bottle
Description: Superb marriage of freshness and power; with a richness of fruit and mouthfilling mousse that lingers delightfully.

Title: Cattier 'Clos du Moulin' Premier Cru Brut Champagne
Description: Cattier is perhaps best-known for creating one of the worldâ€™s most expensive Champagnes â€“ Armand de Brigac, also known as Ace of Spades. To make Clos du Moulin, three vintages are carefully selected for their ability to age gracefully. After 8 years maturing in the cellar, the resulting wine reflects the unique origin of the grapes. Itâ€™s rich and generous with endless notes of citrus, orchard fruits, melon, ripe red berries and frangipane. Hints of caramel and spice add to its long finish. Itâ€™s dry and beautifully balanced by its complex aromas. Delicious with wild mushroom risotto.

Title: Polvanera Organic Primitivo 2021/22, Marchesana
Description: The sun-kissed region of Puglia is the perfect setting for growing Primitivo grapes. It was first brought to Manduria, on the heel of Italyâ€™s boot, back in 1881 by Countess Sabini di Altamura as part of her dowry. And now the region is renowned for its deep, velvety wines. Expect aromas of blackberry, cherry and violet and a long, smooth finish. Try it with braised meats or hard cheeses.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Red Fruit

Title: Villa Antinori Chianti Classico Riserva 2019/20
Description: So whatâ€™s a Riserva? In Chianti Classico, it must be aged for at least two years in oak barrels, plus three months in the bottle. It takes a lot of patience. But this means itâ€™s more elegant and smooth. Taste the benefits in this release from Villa Antinori. It has aromas of wild cherries and cinnamon and a long, spicy finish. Try it with roasted vegetables.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Cloves, Earth, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Domaine Reverdy Ducroux â€˜Moulin Les Lysâ€™ Sancerre 2021/22
Description: The Reverdy-Ducroux family has been cultivating its vines on the famous Sancerre hillsides for 14 generations. Passed down from fathers to sons, their vineyards have been extensively developed over the years. Fast forward to today, they have 50 plots spread across some of the best terroirs in the region. With the aim of producing wines that showcase the best of the region, their pursuit of quality has led to considerable winery renovations. Theyâ€™ve even built their facilities into the hillsides, where grapes are pumped by gravity. And the reduction of human interaction results in a truly pure expression of the wines. Its crisp acidity makes it a delicious apÃ©ritif or an ideal pairing for seafood and smoked fish.

Title: Framingham 'Nobody's Hero' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Marlborough

They now produce some of the best value Pinot Noir in New Zealand. This is lush and rounded with notes of vibrant red fruits, oak and chocolate. Pair this with roast chicken.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: ViÃ±a ErrÃ¡zuriz â€˜Estate Seriesâ€™ Merlot, 2021/22, Valle de CuricÃ³

This is a soft, smooth Merlot guaranteed to wow the crowd. It has flavours of red fruit, caramel and mocha. Exceptional with rich tomato pasta.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.
Characteristics: Ripe Fruit, Black Fruit, Red Fruit

Title: Lyrarakis Assyrtiko 2021/22, Crete

Discover wild aromas of meadow flower and yellow orchard fruit, backed by a heavy dose of minerality. Divine with oysters.

Title: Denis Marchais Chenin Blanc 2021/22, France
Description: This French Chenin Blanc is drier and fruitier than those you'd find in South Africa. Made by AndrÃ© Lacheteau, a winemaker that's respected over much of the globe, it's a fresh, balanced cocktail of exotic fruit that's balanced by a flinty minerality.

Title: Domaine de Villargeau Coteaux du Giennois Blanc 2021/22
Description: The small appellation of CÃ´teaux de Giennois is often overlooked by its world-famous neighbours, Sancerre and Pouilly-FumÃ©. But youâ€™ll find equally exceptional Sauvignon Blanc here, with Domaine de Villargeau offering a prime example. The winery is very much a family affair, led by brothers Jean-Fernand and FranÃ§ois Thibault. Their winemaking journey began in 1991 with the discovery of some abandoned southwest-facing vineyards. Decades on, Jean-Fernandâ€™s sons and nephew now make up the team, having gained a wealth of winemaking experience from around the world, ranging from South America to neighbouring Sancerre. This Sauvignon has previously received high praise from Decanter, and as of the 2022 vintage, the winery will be officially certified as organic. Itâ€™s lively and aromatic, with notes of white peach, pear and a touch of mint. Expect flavours of orange zest and orchard fruit, plus a streak of chalky minerality reminiscent of Pouilly-FumÃ©. Plenty of freshness makes it a wonderful match for seafood dishes.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Citrus Fruit, Gooseberry, Grass

Title: Dogajolo Carpineto 2019/20, Toscana

Cabernet Sauvignon is blended with a majority of the native Sangiovese to create a wine superior to its IGT classification. Soft and intensely fruity, this wine combines the elegance and complexity given by oak-ageing with the fragrant, fresh fruit of a young wine. Soft on the palate with a smooth finish. A great all-rounder, this wine will complement a rich Tuscan stew, as well as cold cut meats or even just with pizza. This wine won a silver Decanter award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Domaine Lucien Lardy Moulin-Ã -Vent 2019/20
Description: Thought all Beaujolais was light and easy-drinking? Moulin-Ã -Vent is where you'll find some of the most concentrated wines in the region. So you can expect ripe notes of cherry, fig, plum and black peppery from this juicy, persistent wine. Excellent with lamb.

Title: Bodegas Caro Amancaya Malbec 2019

Predominantly Malbec, half of the blend is aged in concrete vessels to enhance its vibrant fruity character. The resulting wine is fresh and supple, with a smooth, rounded texture. Title: Coney 'Pizzicato' Pinot Noir 2020, Martinborough

Martinboroughâ€™s cool climate is similar to that of Burgundy, so Pinot Noir thrives here. Pizzicato proves this time and again, having scooped awards for several of its vintages. Complex and elegant, it has juicy notes of raspberry, cherry and pomegranate. Plenty of fruity flavour and fresh acidity make it a wonderful choice for rich lamb dishes.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Framingham 'Classic' Riesling 2021/22, Marlborough
Description: The older the vine, the tastier the grape. Framingham's 'Classic' is made from some of the oldest Riesling vines in New Zealand. It hand-selects small parcels of berries from these crops to create a deliciously complex wine. Expect soakings of fresh melon and orange with a zippy acidity.

Title: Kangarilla Road Primitivo 2018/19, McLaren Vale
Description: Deep and intense Primitivo â€“ commonly referred to as Zinfandel â€“ is typically found in California, Puglia and its native Croatia. But it grows excellently in Australiaâ€™s McLaren Vale, too, as this wine shows. A temperate Mediterranean-style climate and moderating sea influences result in a dark, richly perfumed red wine with aromas of strawberry jelly, roses, tea and orange. Flavours of spice and truffle â€“ mixed with dark berry fruit â€“ make this one to drink with barbecued ribs or lamb curry.

Title: ChÃ¢teau la Sauvageonne Organic â€˜Grand Vinâ€™ 2019/20, Terrasses du Larzac
Description: Terrasses du Larzac is a modern appellation created in 2005, covering red wines grown within a specific area on the slopes of the Causse du Larzac. Including some of the northern Languedoc's highest vineyards, the area is noted for its hot days and cool nights. A robust, fleshy wine with plenty of fine-grained tannins giving weight, volume and an enduring texture. Heady aromas of garrigue herbs and fruit compote complete the picture. Drink now or allow to mature for another 3-5 years. Serve with steak or strong cheeses.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Pennautier 2020/21, CabardÃ¨s
Description: Bertrand Seube used to make wine at the world-famous ChÃ¢teau Mouton-Rothschild. Today, he creates this rustic red blend at a historic 15th century estate a stone's throw from the fortress town of Carcassonne. You can taste the benefits of his expertise in flavours of blackcurrant, raspberry and baking spices. It has firm tannins that are great with a casserole.

Title: MarquÃ©s de CÃ¡ceres Rioja Reserva 2016/17
Description: Located in the heart of Rioja Alta, MarquÃ©s de CÃ¡ceres started off as a family business. Today, their wines can be found in 120 countries. Their secret? They specialise in producing exceptional Tempranillo, the main grape that goes into Rioja. Their decades of experience can be tasting in their Reserva, which is aged for 20 months in oak, and then refined for a minimum of two years in the bottle. Because of this, you can expect exquisite flavours of cherry, vanilla and toast. Enjoy over the next six years with roast lamb or game birds.

Title: Cune Rioja Crianza 2019/20
Description: In 1879, two brothers, Eusebio and Raimundo Real de AsÃºa, founded CVNE. It's still run by one of their direct descendants and based in the heart of Haro â€“ the capital of Rioja. But far from being constrained by tradition, CVNE is known as an innovator. Take this Crianza. Itâ€™s a really modern style, made from a single plot of their oldest vines. They have an average age of 30 years old, so yields are low â€“ and fewer grapes mean more concentrated flavour. Bright. Supple. Fresh. It's full of juicy red-fruit flavours, making it ideal for tapas dishes.

Title: Chateau de Pitray 2017, Castillon CÃ´tes de Bordeaux
Description: If youâ€™re looking for great value Bordeaux, head to Castillon. Itâ€™s a lesser-known appellation right next to Saint-Ã‰milion, so you can find similar wines at much more wallet-friendly prices. After 300 years' winemaking experience, ChÃ¢teau de Pitray is widely acknowledged as the leading property in the region. Legendary wine critic, Robert Parker, called this flagship wine an "old-time favourite". Its blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec offers complex flavours of ripe dark fruits, with hints of earthiness, cedar and chocolate. Fine tannins make it a fantastic partner for meaty casseroles.

Title: Ravenswood Zinfandel 2020/21, Lodi

Title: ChÃ¢teau Tour Saint Bonnet 2011, MÃ©doc
Description: Great Bordeaux doesn't have to cost the earth â€“ you just need to know where to look. Based in Saint-Christoly in the north of the MÃ©doc region, ChÃ¢teau Tour Saint Bonnet is recognised as a Cru Bourgeois estate: a classification of quality and value. The grapes for this mature claret are sourced from a single plot of old vines overlooking the Gironde estuary, on the finest gravel soils. Here, brothers FrÃ©dÃ©ric and Edouard employ innovative winemaking techniques, ageing their wines in large oak foudres instead of traditional oak barriques. Their blends have a reputation for concentration and excellent ageability. And with over 10 years of age, this 2011 vintage is remarkably complex. Ripe. Structured. Rounded. It has perfumed notes of blackcurrant, blueberry and spice, great texture and a long finish. Its subtle savoury character will pair well with rich meat dishes such as beef, lamb or venison.

Title: Les Lauriers du Terroir Sainte-CÃ©cile CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne Villages 2019
Description: If you love traditional RhÃ´ne blends, Sainte-CÃ©cile is a name to look out for. Its wines have a similar elegance to those of its neighbour, Cairanne, which was recently elevated to prestigious 'cru' status. This one is made by TerranÃ©a, one of the best co-operatives in the area. Their founder, Patrice Roland, was born and raised in the RhÃ´ne Valley, so you can be sure that he knows what a quality RhÃ´ne wine should be. Expect notes of red and black fruits, spice and dried herbs, plus a hint of classic RhÃ´ne pepperiness that makes it a perfect match for rich beef dishes.

Title: Charmes de Kirwan Margaux 2019
Description: The second wine of renowned Margaux proerty ChÃ¢teau Kirwan, this promises high quality and fantastic value for money. A delicate blend of traditional Bordeaux grapes, which gives the wine structure and balance â€“ Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. This comes from younger vines than their grand vin â€“ but it's made with the same scrupulous attention to detail. It has a higher proportion of Merlot, giving it a supple, rounded mouthfeel and delcious plummy notes.True to its Margaux roots, it's a plush, fragrant claret that's full of perfumed blackberry, blackcurrant, black cherry and spice aromas. Its firm tannins will make it an ideal pairing to roasted meats or strong cheese after an hour in the decanter.

Title: Saintsbury Chardonnay 2017/18, Carneros
Description: A complex, balanced Burgundy-style Chardonnay from the winery that put Caneros on the wine world map. It's tropical, nutty and balanced, with notes of apple compote and pear. It's deliciously fresh when young but will age excellently for three years. Best served lightly chilled.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Green Apple, Hazelnut, Melon, Peach, Spice

Title: Laurent-Perrier â€˜La Cuveeâ€™ Brut Champagne with 2 glasses
Description: One of the worldâ€™s bestselling non-vintage Champagnes. This is a uniquely fresh fizz with elegant citrus, peach and toast notes. And now it's available in this impressive gift pack, along with two Champagne glasses.
Characteristics: Peach, Blossom, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple

Title: Definition Pouilly-FuissÃ© 2019/20
Description: The Definition range brings definitive examples of world-famous wines. We travel the globe to find the makers excelling in their field and commission them to make showstopping wines. This Pouilly-FuissÃ© is no different. The winery behind it is renowned for its enviable vineyard locations. South-eastern exposure from the sun ripens the Chardonnay grapes to perfection. Combine this with a serious attention to detail in the cellar, and you've got a impressive wine. Expect notes of tropical fruit, enhanced by vanilla notes from the wine's time in oak. Description: This is made by the family behind the famous Armand de Brignac Champagne, also known as Ace of Spades, the Cattiers. Title: Edouard Delaunay 'Septembre' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Burgundy

Expect opulent notes of ripe bramble fruits, dark chocolate and spice. Its silky tannins and rich flavours make it a great match for red meats.

Title: Grato Grati â€˜Vecchia Annataâ€™ Rosso Toscana 1999
Description: Despite the label, you can consider this bottle to be a Chianti Rufina Reserva DOCG â€“ Chiantiâ€™s most northerly subzone â€“ and the area renowned for making the regionâ€™s most long lived wines. Sat in the foothills of the Apennine mountains, vines here benefit from warm sunny days followed by cool nights. The huge changes in temperature results in wines with intense aromas and plenty of fresh acidity â€“ and itâ€™s this acidity that gives them their lengthy ageing potential. Due to a change in production rules in the 1980s, the prestigious Grato family canâ€™t label this bottling a Chianti Rufina. They keep back some of their best cuvÃ©es, ageing them for longer than the DOCG panel allows. It means they become what's known as a declassified wine, but donâ€™t let that fool you into thinking this is anything less than a first-rate Tuscan red. Predominantly Sangiovese, the blend spent 30 months in oak barrels, followed by further ageing in tank and bottle before release. Discover intense notes of ripe black cherry and forest floor, with hints of cinnamon spice and leather. It has a silky and savoury character with mellowed tannins, making it a delicious choice for roasted game.

Title: Domaine de Saint FerrÃ©ol 'Grande RÃ©serve' Viognier 2018/19, Languedoc
Description: Wine has been produced at Domaine Saint FerrÃ©ol since 1146. In 1998, the property was bought by Jorje and Ania Maslakiewicz, who have a much-deserved reputation for making some of the very best Viognier in the Languedoc. Their wines are reminiscent of Condrieu, the finest and most expensive expression of Viognier, but come without the usual price tag. This is named 'Grande RÃ©serve' for good reason â€“ once it's aged in oak for ten months, it's not released until it's spent a further year in the bottle. As a result, it's truly indulgent. Discover rich and warming notes of peach, apricot, butterscotch and vanilla. Great with poultry, game, fish, mature cheeses and spicy Asian foods.

Title: Pol Roger Pure Extra Brut Champagne
Description: This new fizz from acclaimed Pol Roger captures Champagne at its most elegant. Made in a 'Extra Brut' style, completely unsweetened, without dosage, it's as pure as Champagne can get. Delight in it's thoroughbred notes of smoky, creamy fruit, fine beading bubbles and lingering chalky finish.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Ruinart Blanc de Blanc Champagne Half Bottle
Description: Grand Cru Chardonnay has been used to make this Champagne. Citrus, peach and white flower aromas evolve into a fresh and supple palate, ideal when married with oysters and sashimi.
Characteristics: Hazelnut, Almond, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Taittinger Comtes de Champagne 2005
Description: Taittinger's Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs is widely regarded as the finest Blanc de Blancs going. After more than ten years ageing in the bottle on texture-imparting lees, this has a wonderfully aromatic complexity and an excellent depth. It has flavours of honeysuckle and walnut, and a long, elegant finish.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Green Fruit, Honey, Honeysuckle, Walnut

Title: ChÃ¢teau la FaviÃ¨re 2018/19, Bordeaux SupÃ©rieur
Description: Made with consultation from the Mitjavile family, who own renowned chateaux on Bordeaux's Right Bank, FaviÃ¨re is fermented in oak and aged for 18 months it's step up from its peers. Expect an excellent structure with elegant tannins, ripe dark fruit and oak spice.

Title: Definition Pauillac 2017/18
Description:
The Definition range brings essential elements of the world's greatest wine styles to Majestic customers. Pauillac where you'll find some of Bordeaux's finest reds. So to create the Definition, we went to one of the most prestigious ChÃ¢teaux in the appellation. This is medium-to-full-bodied, with ripe notes of black fruit, fine tannins and a long finish. Drink now with red meat or cellar for five years.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2017 vintage.

Title: Edouard Delaunay 'Charmont' Bourgogne Hautes-CÃ´tes de Nuits Blanc 2019/20
Description: The Edouard Delaunay estateâ€™s rich history dates back to 1893. Its wines were the choice of The Orient Express and the finest restaurants in France. A century later, it fell out of family hands. Thatâ€™s until 2017, when Laurent Delaunay bought back his great-grandfatherâ€™s estate and re-established his deep-rooted family connections with the best local grape-growers. This is made from vines that grow high up in Burgundy, a few kilometres from some of the most prestigious Grand Crus. It's ripe and fresh, with notes of ripe apple, stone fruits, cream and vanilla. Try it with roast chicken.
Characteristics: Cream, Ripe Fruit, Stone Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Laurent-Perrier RosÃ© Champagne Magnum
Description: This is a classic pink fizz made with a method rarely applied in Champagne. The result's plenty of stylish strawberry fruit, vivacity and easy-drinking charm. It's a wonderfully refreshing apÃ©ritif. But its elegant structure means that it also works well with a variety of dishes, particularly shellfish.

Title: Mud House Chilean RosÃ© 2021, Central Valley
Description: Itâ€™s not been long since Mud House released their great-value Chile Sauvignon Blanc. Well, theyâ€™ve just gone one better in time for summer. This rosÃ© will more than fit the bill if youâ€™re a fan of a glass of pink with rich, fruity flavour. Itâ€™s made with Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Noir grapes picked from Chileâ€™s rugged Central Valley vineyards. A few months ageing on its lees in French oak gently softens the acidity and adds richness, creating a deliciously moreish wine. Expect intense flavours of strawberry, pomegranate and zingy citrus. Try this with a feta cheese salad topped with fresh pomegranate to match those fruity flavours.

Title: Piper-Heidsieck 'Sauvage' RosÃ© Champagne
Description:
Piper Heidsieck is the most awarded Champagne house of the century. Over its 235-year history, it's been the choice of 14 royal courts. And today, a cork of its fantastic fizz is popped every eight seconds. This Pinot Noir-dominated rosÃ© Champagne is made by a head winemaker who's been named Sparkling Winemaker of the Year eight times at the International Wine Challenge. It has juicy, fresh flavours of peach and raspberry, and hints of toasted brioche. Wine Spectator gave it 92 points.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award

Title: 10 year old Malmsey Henriques and Henriques Madeira 50cl
Description: This Madeira is made solely from Malmsey, one of four classic grape varies on Madeira. Fortified and aged in Canteiro, or dockside warehouses, the wine oxidises, giving it its characteristic colour and flavour. Intense coffee and raisin aromas with caramel and complex spicy aromas. Luxurious sweetness, silky textured fruit on the palate, bracing acidity and integrated fortifying spirit with a fantastic finish. Madeira is all but indestructible, once open the bottle will not deteriorate. Enjoy as an after dinner drink or with toffee pudding.

Title: 19 Crimes Cabernet Sauvignon 2020/21, Australia
Description: In 1788, 'punishment by transportation' to Australia became the sentence of choice for convicts in the UK. 19 Crimes is made in tribute to those rogues who forged a new life across the world. And this Cabernet is every bit as bold as their stories. It's aged with 100% American oak, so expect flavours of redcurrants, dark cherries, vanilla and chocolate. Great with beef shortribs.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Spice, Vanilla

Title: Agricola Fuster 'Dardell' Organic Red 2020/21, Terra Alta
Description: The mountainous region of Terra Alta certainly lives up to its name. Here, the peaks reach heights of up to 950 metres â€“ and all that altitude makes for some seriously elegant wines. The Agricola Fuster estate lies right in the heart of the region. Itâ€™s been in winemaker Pepe Fusterâ€™s family for three generations, and thanks to his philosophy of sustainability and self-sufficiency, itâ€™s been certified organic for over 15 years. Pepe crafts this smooth red with a blend of Garnacha and Syrah grapes. Itâ€™s juicy and fresh with notes of raspberry, spice and a hint of smoke thatâ€™ll pair perfectly with Spanish-inspired ham dishes.

Title: Agricola Fuster 'Dardell' Organic White 2021/22, Terra Alta
Description: Terra Alta means 'high land' in Catalan, so it's no surprise that the mountainous region is famed for its elegant high-altitude wines. Winemaker Pepe Fuster was the first to plant Viognier in the region, and he's blended his mature vines with Garnacha Blanca to make this organic white. Expect a delightful roundness from the Garnacha and rich apricot and peach flavours from the Viognier.

Title: Alain Chavy 'Clavoillonsâ€™ Puligny-Montrachet Premier Cru 2018/20
Description: Alain Chavy is the most recent in 200 yearsâ€™ worth of Chavy winemakers, producing fine Chardonnay in and around Puligny-Montrachet. When he and his brother Jean-Louis inherited the family vineyards in 2003, they decided to divide them up, and Alain took on vines on the prestigious Clavoillons Premier Cru in Puligny-Montrachet. These vines were planted by his grandfather in 1953. Their maturity, plus the benefits of their clay-rich soils, make for a full-bodied, concentrated style of Chardonnay. Think flavours of apple and toast that are a delight with lobster.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Pear

Title: Alain Chavy 'Les Champs Gainsâ€™ Puligny-Montrachet Premier Cru 2018/19
Description: Alain Chavy is the most recent in 200 yearsâ€™ worth of Chavy winemakers, producing fine Chardonnay in and around Puligny-Montrachet. When he and his brother Jean-Louis inherited the family vineyards in 2003, they decided to divide them up, and Alain took on vines in some of the regionâ€™s top Premier Cru plots. Les Champs Gains, the second largest Puligny Premier Cru, sits high on a hillside at 360m. This relatively high altitude means the very best wines tend to be lean, zippy and mineral, with serious aging potential. This one is no exception. Pair it with fish or seafood, such as a butter-smothered Dover sole.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Cream, Green Apple, Hazelnut, Lemon, Peach

Title: Alain Chavy 'Les Charmesâ€™ Puligny-Montrachet 2019/20
Description: Though his family has been producing white Burgundy for two centuries, Alain Chavy has only run his own domaine since 2003. It was then that he and his brother, Jean-Louis, divided up the family vineyards to create their own labels. Alain now produces his signature style from his 17 hectares of vines. As he has one of the coolest cellars in Puligny-Montrachet, he brings a unique freshness to this bottle. It's elegant and perfumed with notes of apricot, gooseberry and slate. Try it with grilled fish or a decadent seafood platter including scallops, oysters and prawns.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Caramel, Cream, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey

Title: Alain Chavy Puligny-Montrachet 2018/19
Description: The Chavy family has been a name in Burgundy for over 200 years, but recently itâ€™s been doing things differently. Brothers Alain and Jean-Louis divided up the family plots in 2003, and set about making their own styles of wine. Harvesting from vines averaging 42 years old, Alain picks his grapes early to maintain freshness and ages them slowly in his underground cellar â€“ one of the few in the region. As a result, this is a restrained Puligny-Montrachet, with flavours of green apple and lemon, and aromas of toast from aging in oak barrels. It pairs well with fish and shellfish and will bring freshness to cream-based sauces, too.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Cream, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey

Title: Alain Jaume 'La Butte d'Or' Condrieu 2020
Description: The Jaume family have been producing wine in the RhÃ´ne Valley since 1826. They believe in low yields, healthy vines and hand-picking grapes - and this allows the demanding Viognier grape to flourish. This is exotic and textured, with flavours of brioche, white peach and apricot marmalade and a long, refined finish. Best with soft cheeses or white fish. Serve now at 12 degrees or cellar for five years.

Title: Alamos Chardonnay 2021/22, Mendoza
Description: Alamos has more than 100 years of experience and is one of the biggest names in Mendoza. They specialise in winemaking at lofty Andean heights, and this Chardonnay is made up to 5,000 feet above sea level. Here, intense sunlight and cool evening temperatures transform into pristine flavours. Think tropical fruits, vanilla and sweet spices that are best with fish cakes.

Title: Alamos Lujan De Cuyo Cabernet 2021/22, Mendoza
Description: The grapes for Alamos are grown at an altitude of between 3,000 and 5,000 feet where the temperature variation allows the grapes to grow slowly developing more flavour. Hand harvesting and sorting ensure only the best grapes are used to make the wine. There is lots of blackcurrant and bramble fruit flavours in the concentrated and silky wine.  The purity of fruit is enhanced by a slight woody note on the finish. This will be great with grilled meats flavoured with herbs.

Title: Alluria Pinot Grigio Organic Boxed Wine 2.25L, Sicily
Description: Pinot Grigio only came to Sicily in the past couple of decades. And itâ€™s taken to its new island home like a duck to water. This organic Pinot Grigio was lovingly made by Federico Stella â€“ a gentle giant who knows how to coax the very best from his grapes. These grapes come from 25-year-old vines, and they're handpicked in the cool of dawn to preserve the aromatics. All that work pays off. Itâ€™s a deliciously crisp wine with a moreish citrusy zing. But thanks to Sicilyâ€™s warm climate, it also has riper, peachy flavours and a fragrant, herby aromas. Delicious with freshly caught seafood.

Title: Alvaro Palacios 'Les Terrasses' 2018/21, Priorat
Description: Alvaro Palacios is one of Spain's finest winemakers. This is a chance to taste his expertise at a reasonable price. It's a blend of old vine Carignan and Garnacha grapes picked on steep Priorat slopes. Expect a ripe and concentrated wine, with velvety notes of black fruit, firm tannins and hints of spice. Decant for an hour before serving at room temperature with slow-cooked pork.

Title: Andrew Quady 'Essensia' Orange Muscat 2019/21 Half Bottle
Description:
Full bodied, sweet and complex, this is made with rare Orange Muscat grapes. Winemaker Andrew Quady aimed to create a wine that celebrated the grapes' intense aromas and spicy fruit flavours â€“ and he's certainly succeeded.
