Essentia is full of apricot, orange and pear flavours with a balancing acidity and a long, lingering finish. It's delicious with rich chocolate puddings.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Apricot, Blossom, Honey, Orange, Peach

Title: Anthonij Rupert Wyne 'Cape of Good Hope' Chenin Blanc 2020/21, Swartland
Description: This is from an estate with a mission to showcase the magic of Swartland's old vines. The vines behind the wines are at least 35 years old. Older vines nourish tastier grapes, so you can be certain that this Chenin Blanc is packed with complex and rich flavour. Expect luscious notes of apricot, nectarine and flowers, and a balancing acidity. Perfect with seared scallops.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Citrus Fruit, Floral, Quince

Title: Antinori â€˜Tignanelloâ€™ 2020, Tuscany
Description: Antinori have been making wine for six centuries. For a whopping 26 generations, this family has produced some of the most celebrated wines throughout central Italy, including this â€“ Tuscanyâ€™s iconic Tiganello. It was one of the first 'Super Tuscans', back in the 1970s, that blended traditional with untraditional grape varieties. It's made primarily with Sangiovese, plus Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, and is now one of Italyâ€™s most sought-after wines. It's just as impressive when you crack it open. It's remarkably complex, with aromas of cherry, vanilla, mint and white pepper. Thereâ€™s a velvety plushness, but freshness, too, so it feels both elegant and rich. Serve with a no-holds-barred special occasion meal: filet mignon with black truffle, for example.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Blackberry, Chocolate, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Apostoles 30-Year-Old Palo Cortado Sherry Gonzalez Byass Half Bottle
Description:
Palo Cortado is a light wine chosen to be a Fino but instead aged oxidatively like an Oloroso whilst retaining some of the elegant Fino character. It is the rarest type of sherry and this example has had 30 years' ageing to gain even further complexity. Dark amber in colour, with intense nuttiness and caramel on the nose but a dry finish with a delicate yet mouth-filling warmth. To fully appreciate every nuance of this wine, you must try it by itself, but it will also pair with cheese, salted almonds and tapas.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award.

Title: Au Bon Climat Chardonnay 2021/22, Santa Barbara County
Description: Jim Clendenen was a true pioneer. He contradicted assumptions that all Californian wines are ripe and fruity since 1982, when his were some of the very few Santa Barbara vineyards. He specialised in creating highly-acclaimed Burgundy-style wines from traditionally Burgundian grape varieties. This Chardonnay is a real Majestic classic. It's made from grapes hand-picked from 25-year-old vines and aged in French oak. As a result, there's subtle notes of vanilla and sweet spice that join flavours of lemon and lime. Try it with mushroom pasta.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Green Apple, Lemon, Lime, Peach

Title: Auberge Petite Pierre 2019, Corbieres
Description: The Auberge Petite Pierre is a blend of Syrah, Grenache and Carignan from Corbieres, a region in the foothills of the Pyrenees. Unoaked and fresh, it has notes of ripe red fruits, liquorice and spice and smooth tannins.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Dried Herbs

Title: Barbaresco 2019/20 De Forville
Description: Nebbiolo takes it name from 'nebbia', the fog cloaking the hills of Piedmont around harvest time. The village of Barbaresco lies only a little to the north-east of Barolo in Piedmont and produces wines of a similar style and quality. A big, elegant wine of pale colour. Dark cherries and leather with earthy hints, and a rose perfume, a charming, well integrated wine with a long finish. Muscular tannins give the wine a solid backbone. Try this with a fillet steak with mushrooms. The wine will nicely echo the earthy notes of the mushrooms.

Title: De Forville Barbera D'Alba 2021, Piedmont
Description: Barbera is a prolific Italian grape variety grown in Piedmont and particularly around the towns of Alba and Asti. This Barbera d'Alba is made by the excellent De Forville family using fruit from over 40 years old vines. Very concentrated dark fruits on the nose, with well integrated spices. This exhibits confected dark cherry fruits with hints of chocolate, cloves and vanilla. Well integrated and silky smooth finish. Meat dishes with grilled vegetables will complement this wine superbly.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Earth, Red Cherry, Red Plum

Title: Bodegas Bardos 'Roble' 2020/21, Ribera del Duero
Description: Ribera del Duero now rivals Rioja as Spainâ€™s most celebrated region. Its higher altitudes keep it relatively cool. Throw in a drop in nighttime temperature, and this is the perfect recipe for intense red wines. Bodegas Bardos work in some of the Riberaâ€™s toughest spots. And this delicious release is your chance to taste what all the fuss is about. Aged for six months in oak, the Bardos Roble displays charming wild herb notes and a rich palate of dark fruits. Serve with lamb shanks.

Title: Bodegas Muga 'Flor de Muga' 2021/22, Rioja
Description: A remarkable rosado made from 100% Garnacha from high altitude bush vines that are as old as 90-years-old. Lightly oaked, but still fresh, the Flor de Muga is a grown up rosÃ© with excellent texture and elegant flavours of peach and cantaloupe melon and a stony minerality.

Title: Bodegas Roda Rioja Reserva 2016/17
Description: This is an intense, silky Rioja Reserva from an excellent modern-day bodega. It has notes of ripe black fruit and mocha, and a long finish. This will go excellently with rib-eye steak and black pepper sauce.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Bodegas Volver 'Tarima' Monastrell 2021/22, Alicante
Description: The vineyards at Bodegas Volver are a winemakers dream. Located 2,000 feet above sea level, some of them are as old as 90 years. This means low yields but an amazing concentration of flavour in the few grapes. Never tried a wine from Alicante? Take one sip of this wine, and you'll wonder why you didn't sooner. The powerful fruit flavours of bramble fruit and dark cherry are lifted by an elegant floral finish. Enjoy this with grilled lamb.

Title: Boekenhoutskloof 'The Chocolate Block' 2020/21 Magnum, Western Cape
Description: An exciting blend of 5 grape varieties, from innovative winemaker Marc Kent. Dominated by around 67% Syrah, the grapes come from several specially selected blocks of vines on Boukenhoutskoloof's estate, fermented and aged for up to 18 months in old French oak. An earthy, rustic nose gives up aromas of leather, earth and spices over a backdrop of blackcurrant and ripe raspberry fruit. Harmonious and powerful on the palate, with a cocoa and pepper complexity. Most at home with spice-rubbed steaks, roast rib of beef, or game dishes.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Chocolate, Coffee, Tobacco

Title: Bollinger â€˜Grande AnnÃ©eâ€™ Champagne 2012/14
Description: Only produced in exceptional years from exclusively Grand Cru rated grapes. Rich, biscuity and yeasty, this wine carries the ultimate expression of the house style.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Almond, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Bollinger Special CuvÃ©e Champagne Magnum
Description: At the Bollinger Champagne house, only the finest will do. Their Champagne is made from first-run juice, and the majority of vineyards have Premier and Grand Cru status. This results in a full-bodied Champagne of great class. It's pale-gold in colour and the mousse is light and persistent. The ideal accompaniment to smoked salmon canapes.

Title: Cape Mentelle Cabernet Sauvignon 2017, Margaret River
Description: Cape Mentelle shot to fame with pioneering Cabernet Sauvignon in the 1970s. They're still rightfully considered a benchmark Margaret River winery. Take one sip of this famous Cabernet blend, and you'll see what all the fuss is about. Discover vibrant aromas of dark black fruits, cocoa and orange peel, and flavours of vanilla and bramble fruit. We suggest pairing it with steak and peppercorn sauce.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Chocolate, Tobacco

Title: Cape Mentelle Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon 2019/21, Margaret River
Description: Cape Mentelle is one of the 'Founding Five' wineries of Margaret River, one of Australia's finest wine regions. Its Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon is fresh and juicy, with creamy flavours of lemon and fresh herbs and a textured complexity, thanks to four months of lees ageing.
Characteristics: Lemon, Citrus Fruit, Gooseberry, Grass, Herbal

Title: Catena Malbec 2019/20 Magnum, Mendoza
Description: NicolÃ¡s Catena was the first South American winemaker to ever be named â€˜Decanterâ€™s Man of the Yearâ€™. No wonder when he pioneered high-altitude Malbec in the Argentine Andes. Before that, Argentina was only seen as a producer of cheap bulk wine. The Catenaâ€™s changed all that. NicolÃ¡sâ€™ great-grandfather, Nicola, planted his first Malbec vines in 1902. Since then, the family have amassed a collection of Malbec varietals which are exclusive to them. It makes the Catenaâ€™s wines completely distinct from other Argentine Malbecs. Bold. Ripe. Fruity. Itâ€™s a big wine with lots of flavour â€“ and a lovely plush texture. Itâ€™s crying out for grilled meats â€“ think barbecued steak with a punchy chimichurri sauce. Delicious.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit, Violet

Title: Caves des Grand Crus Blancs Pouilly-Vinzelles 2019/20
Description: Caves des Grand Crus are a co-operative bringing exceptional value to famously expensive Burgundy areas. And they don't compromise on quality. This rich white Burgundy is a case in point. It's expressive and complex with notes of soft peach, hazel and toast from oak ageing. Serve with chicken in a creamy sauce.

Title: Chablis 1er Cru Vaillons 2020/21 SÃ©guinot-Bordet
Description: An elegant, steely and incredibly pure Premier Cru Chablis from Jean-Francois Bordet. The Vaillons Premier Cru vineyards face south east, and as a result the wines are famous for their great richness. Expect mineral notes together with plenty of fine citrus and white stone fruit flavours. There is a yeasty complexity and a creaminess to the texture, but the finish remains classically racey and fresh.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Green Apple, Honeysuckle, Lemon, Smoke

Title: Chassagne-Montrachet Blanc 2020/21 ChÃ¢teau de la Maltroye, Burgundy
Description: You'll find some of the world's finest white wines in the village of Chassagne-Montrachet. Here, winemaker Jean-Pierre Cornut continues the family tradition, picking Chardonnay grapes by hand, selecting only the best grapes in effort to create the finest white Burgundy. Once they're pressed, the wine is aged for 10 months in oak. The result is an astonishing cocktail of stone fruits, apple and brioche. Pair its charming aromas and creamy minerality with sea food or roast pork.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Caramel, Cream, Hazelnut, Smoke

Title: ChÃ¢teau Arnauton 2014, Fronsac
Description: Fronsac is situated in Bordeauxâ€™s Right Bank. Itâ€™s predominantly made from Merlot, just like neighbouring Pomerol and Saint-Ã‰milion. This wine also includes Cabernet Franc and Malbec, bringing greater structure and vibrant, fruity aromas. The 2014 vintage won a gold medal at the prestigious Concours GÃ©nÃ©ral Agricole de Paris competition. Thereâ€™s notes of red and black fruits with a spicy hint of vanilla and elegant tannins. Enjoy it with beef Wellington.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Belair 2003, Saint-Ã‰milion Grand Cru
Description: ChÃ¢teau BÃ©lair traces its origins back to Roman times and has long been considered one of Saint-Ã‰milion's finest estates. This is a plush, silky red made from predominantly Merlot. After 16 years of ageing, it has well-integrated tannins, flavours of black fruits, leather, cedar and sweet tobacco, and a long finish. When serving, slowly ease the cork out, decant for at least an hour and pair with a roast dinner.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Citran 'Moulins de Citran' 2010/12, Haut-MÃ©doc
Description: ChÃ¢teau Citran has stood strong since the 14th century. Moulins de Citran is the estateâ€™s second wine. This means that it's made from slightly younger vines than the Grand Vin, but with just as much care and attention. So if youâ€™re adding just one bottle of great-value Bordeaux to your wine rack, make it this. Ripe. Structured. Supple. Discover flavours of ripe strawberry, raspberry and black cherry, with mature notes of nutmeg, cedar and tobacco. Its silky texture and long, complex finish pairs perfectly with grilled pork chops topped with melted cheddar cheese.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Cedar, Nutmeg, Tobacco

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Chassagne-Montrachet 2019/20, Chassagne-Montrachet
Description: To many, Burgundy's Chassagne-Montrachet is home to the world's greatest white wines. Take a sip of this, and you'll see why. It's delicate and fruity, with elegant hints of peach, white flowers, almond and cedar, and a very long finish. Outstanding Chardonnay that's best with king prawns.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Cream, Hazelnut, Smoke

Title: ChÃ¢teau De CrÃ©zancy Sancerre Rouge 2021/22
Description: Deep red in color with a nose of black cherries, blackberries and currant kissed with a touch of praline.. The palate is sweet and slightly spicy with fine tannins and a silky finish. This wine is the perfect accompaniment with white meats and poultry, duck, and dried goat cheese. It has medium body with a firm and persistent palate of flavors unadulterated by oak.

Title: ChÃ¢teau de Rayne Vigneau Sauternes 2002
Description: ChÃ¢teau de Rayne Vigneau was named a Premier Cru ClassÃ© estate in the famous 1855 classification of Bordeaux. It's hotter and more humid than much of the region, and its misty mornings are perfect for Noble Rot to thrive in. As a result, this is a benchmark for Sauternes. It's made with 80% SÃ©millon and 20% Sauvignon Blanc and boasts a high acidity that's allowed it to age excellently. It's complex and rich, with notes of white plum, pear and exotic fruits and a very long finish. Try it with Roquefort.

Title: ChÃ¢teau du Domaine de L'Ã‰glise 2014, Pomerol
Description: The first recorded mention of ChÃ¢teau du Domaine de l'Eglise dates back to 1589. It's reportedly the oldest chÃ¢teau in Pomerol. It sits close to Petrus, the producer of the world's most desired and expensive claret. Today, it's owned by one of the most experienced families in Bordeaux, who also own some of the region's very best estates. Expect rich notes of plum, crÃ¨me de cassis and cedar. It'll pair well with lamb and a red wine sauce. Drink now or age until 2040.

Title: ChÃ¢teau du Tertre 'Les Hauts du Tertre' 2018, Margaux
Description: This is the second wine of thousand-year-old Margaux estate ChÃ¢teau du Tertre. The estate was recognised as a Classed Growth in the famous 1855 Bordeaux classification but really hit its stride in the past 20 years. This is made on the same vineyards as the Grand Vin but from younger vines, ensuring a fruity, vibrant and bright style that's raring to be tasted now. It's full-bodied and ripe, with flavours of blackcurrant, red cherry, spice and dried herbs. It has a snappy acidity that's great with cheese.
Characteristics: Blackcurrant, Dried Herbs, Red Cherry, Spice

Title: ChÃ¢teau FonplÃ©gade 2014, Saint-Ã‰milion Grand Cru
Description: ChÃ¢teau FonplÃ©gade aimed to create the purest expression of Saint-Ã‰milion. So they recruited one of the world's most sought-after winemaking consultants, farmed organically, picked each bunch of grapes by hand from their oldest vines and made this from 95% Merlot. As a result, it's full-bodied and plush, with notes of blackcurrant, blueberry, cocoa and fresh tobacco and a long, smooth finish. Try it with a cassoulet.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Guiraud 'G de Guiraud' Organic SÃ©millon/Sauvignon Blanc 2019/20, Bordeaux Blanc
Description: Made organically and stirred on texture-gifting lees, this Bordeaux Blanc blend stands out from much of the competition because it's partially aged in barrels that the year before created 1er cru Sauternes. It's intense, rich and complex and has notes of tangerine and grapefruit peel, a touch of redcurrant and a long finish. James Suckling gave it 93 points.

Title: ChÃ¢teau la Garde 2013/14, Pessac-LÃ©ognan
Description: In 1990, the winemaking team at Dourthe, one of Bordeaux's most successful producers, were transfixed by the possibility of ChÃ¢teau la Garde's fantastic soils. And today, after decades of hard work and investment, it's one of Pessac-LÃ©ognan's rising-star estates. Its claret is made from almost equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It's deep and concentrated, with hints of ripe red fruits, liquorice and smoke. It has delicate tannins and well-integrated oak influence that are fantastic with a roast dinner.

Title: ChÃ¢teau La Garde Pessac-LÃ©ognan Blanc 2019, Graves
Description: "ChÃ¢teau La Garde has exceptional gravel soils. The winemaking team here claim that this is one of the finest areas for Bordeaux Blanc. Taste this and decide for yourself. This is a fresh, fruity and complex wine, with notes of citrus fruit, a mineral, chalky character and a long finish. At its best lightly chilled with asparagus risotto.  "

Title: ChÃ¢teau La Rame 2018/19, Ste-Croix-du-Mont 50cl
Description: ChÃ¢teau La Rame is one of the oldest properties in the Sainte Croix du Mont appellation, where the influence of the river encourages botrytis or noble rot. A blend of 75% SÃ©millon and 25% Sauvignon Blanc. Aged in one-third new oak barrels for two years. A golden hued wine exudes aromas of ripe stone fruits, candied summer fruits and honey. Luxurious sweetness and spicy vanillin characters layer and coat the palate before a clean and fresh finish. Sweet wines can age for as long as you can resist them, a perfect match for CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e or blue cheese.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Apricot, Honey, Stone Fruit

Title: ChÃ¢teau Lagrange St Julien 2010
Description: "The historic ChÃ¢teau Lagrange currently work with the renowned Eric Boissenot with the aim to produce what they call "the best wines in the world". They've certainly done well with this St Julien. It expresses ripe blueberry and blackcurrant flavours, with earthy aromas of leather and tobacco from ageing. It's smooth, yet intense on the palate with a great length. Decant for an hour before serving at room temperature with lamb. Drink before 2040. "
Characteristics: Tobacco, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Earth, Leather, Red Cherry, Smoke

Title: ChÃ¢teau Lynch-Moussas 2013, Pauillac
Description: ChÃ¢teau Lynch-Moussas dates back to 1850 and was given prestigious Cru status in the legendary 1855 Bordeaux classification. But things really picked up, in 1969, when it was bought by the owner of ChÃ¢teau Batailley. A state-of-the-art winery renovation and extensive replanting soon took place. In the years since, the estate has consistently produced fantastic claret. This is a bold and fruity Pauillac, with flavours of blackcurrant, blackberry, oak, tobacco and cedar. As it's now deliciously mature, it has well-integrated tannins which won't overpower lamb.
Characteristics: Tobacco, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Earth, Leather, Smoke

Title: ChÃ¢teau Meyney 2013/2017, Saint-EstÃ¨phe
Description: ChÃ¢teau Meyney's grand vin is made up predominantly of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with a dash of Petit Verdot. Its notes of blackberry, raspberry, graphite and sweet spices are framed by snappy tannins, and it's just hitting its prime now.

Title: ChÃ¢teau Minuty 'M de Minuty' RosÃ© 2021/22 Magnum, CÃ´tes de Provence
Description: ChÃ¢teau Minuty created the pale-pink hue of rosÃ© that you'll find all over the world. It's one of Provence's last vineyards to pluck grapes by hand, bringing every delicious stone-fruit, citrus and melon note to your palate. Many wineries imitate its style. But there really is no matching M de Minuty - and this is your chance to pick it up in a stylish magnum.

Title: Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22 Magnum, Marlborough
Description: Cloudy Bay is widely credited with introducing New Zealand wines to the world with their signature Sauvignon Blanc. The 2020 vintage saw near-perfect vineyard conditions, producing a bright and focused wine. Expect to find notes of ripe grapefruit, lime and passionfruit. Wonderful with salmon and asparagus.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: MartÃ­n CÃ³dax 'Cantigas' AlbariÃ±o 2020/21, RÃ­as Baixas
Description: MartÃ­n CÃ³dax are AlbariÃ±o experts, based in RÃ­as Baixas DO, the homeland of AlbariÃ±o. Itâ€™s led by ninth-generation winemaker Luciano Amoedo alongside ultra-talented Katia Ãlvarez, who's been celebrated as one of Spainâ€™s Top Women Winemakers by The Drinks Business. Using their vast experience, the grapes for this wine are picked from vines over 100 metres above sea level. This slows the grapes' maturation, meaning that once they reach ripeness, theyâ€™re filled with intense flavour. Expect mineral-lined flavours of plush stone fruit. Its gentle saline undertone will go beautifully with grilled white fish.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Apricot, Bread Dough, Lemon, Peach

Title: Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ© 'Les Grandes Terrasses' Cornas 2016/18
Description: Northern RhÃ´ne's Cornas is famous for its powerful, long-lived Syrah. Made by Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ©, one of France's most adored producers, this is a full-bodied expression, yet elegant and polished. Its hints of black fruits, cedar, pepper and smoke will taste even better over the next decade. Wine Advocate's Jeb Dunnuck gave the 2014 vintage 90 Parker Points.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry

Title: Nicolas Potel CÃ´te de Nuits-Villages 2017/18
Description: CÃ´te de Nuits-Villages is essentially the northern sister appellation of the better-known CÃ´te de Beaune-Villages in the south of Burgundy. Covering a range of respected village appellations with some excellent sites, the region produces very consistent quality. Offers the classic Pinot Noir nose of ripe red berries, with some darker hints of blackberry and liquorice. Ripe yet nicely taut on the palate, with a smooth texture lifted by a lipsmacking acidity. A great partner for poultry dishes, especially duck or turkey, but will also stand up to red meats and feathered game.

Title: Vidal-Fleury CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne Blanc 2020/21
Description: Established in 1781, Vidal Fleury is one of the most experienced producers in the northern RhÃ´ne. Its CÃ´tes-du-RhÃ´ne Blanc is rather unique, as it's made predominantly (88%) from Viognier. This creates a full-flavoured, rich style, with notes of apricot, melon and almond, that's perfect with rich food.

Title: CÃ´tes-du-RhÃ´ne Villages Laudun 2017 ChÃ¢teau Courac, France
Description: ChÃ¢teau Courac has been in winemaker Frederic Arnaud's family since 1641. He makes this blend of Syrah, Grenache, MourvÃ¨dre and rare Counoise from 45-year-old vines. The result is a rich red with notes of dark-red fruits, velvety tannins, hints of spice and a fresh finish. It tastes great now, but it'll continue to develop over the next decade.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: CVNE 'Contino ViÃ±a del Olivo' Rioja 2019/20
Description: If you like Rioja, you've almost certainly heard of CVNE (or Cune to some) before. This is their flagship red. To make it, they've shunned many of the more traditional approaches. It's made from 40-year-old vines, aged in French, American and Hungarian oak over 17 months and left in the bottle for over a year. As a result, it's complex, rich and truly indulgent. Expect notes of red and black fruit, vanilla and liquorice. Try it with Manchego. The 2017 vintage scored 94 Parker Points.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Liquorice, Red Fruit, Vanilla

Title: CVNE 'Maruxa' MencÃ­a 2019/21, Valdeorras
Description: If you like Rioja, you've almost certainly tried CVNE's excellent work before. This is one of their newest projects. And they're so proud of it, they named it after the founder's mother. It's MencÃ­a made in the Valdeorras zone of Galicia. This grape is rapidly rising in popularity in Spain. For good reason. It's widely celebrated for its wonderful aromatics. Think Pinot Noir with the florality turned right up. Expect rich notes of black fruits, fresh acidity and soft tannins. Try it with chorizo.

Title: Devil's Creek 'Gold Reserve' Pinot Noir 2019, Central Otago
Description: The Devil's Creek River used to be known for its gold. The precious metal has long dried up, but you can still discover delicious Pinot Noir in Central Otago. It's known as the home of New Zealand's finest Pinot Noir, and for good reason. This is bright, lively and bursting with fruit. The elegant tannins make it a great pairing for pork.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: De Forville Dolcetto d'Alba 2020/21
Description: One of the lesser-known grapes of Piedmont, Dolcetto usually produces soft, fruity and early maturing wines. The best come from around Alba, as does this one from De Forville, a family that has been making wine in Piedmont since the 1860's. A clear and bright ruby in colour, with an expressive nose of youthful fruits. Rich, dark cherries and liquorice on the palate and a fresh finish. Enjoy with cold cuts or cured meats, pizza, or on its own.

Title: Domaine Begude â€˜Espritâ€™ Organic Pinot Noir 2020/21, Limoux
Description: Even though itâ€™s located in the warm Languedoc, the cooler, high-altitude Limoux appellation can grow thin-skinned grapes that youâ€™d normally find in Burgundy. That includes the internationally popular red grape, Pinot Noir. This example is made using careful organic methods at Domaine Begude, a sustainably-minded estate. It's made from vines at 300m above sea level. As a result, it has fresh, fruity notes of cherry and raspberry, with gentle softness. Try it with a roasted or pan-fried duck breast.
Characteristics: Savoury, Black Cherry, Dried Herbs, Red Fruit

Title: Domaine Begude 'Arcturus' Organic Wild Ferment Chardonnay 2019/20, Limoux
Description: As this is made only in the best vintages, from a single organic plot, just 700 bottles are produced each year. Luckily, we bought the entire vintage just for you. If this had 'Puligny-Montrachet on the label, you'd be paying a three-figure sum. Its harmoniously integrated layers of cream, toasted oak, pineapple and mango won 91 Decanter points and was described as a ''golden pleasure'' by Jancis Robinson MW.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Cream, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Domaine Bernard Michaut 'Beauroy' Chablis Premier Cru 2021/22
Description: Beauroy is a Premier Cru that lies on the upper slopes of Chablis. This is a prime area for growing exceptional Chardonnay, which benefits from warming sunlight and exceptional soil quality. And it tastes even better when it's aged in oak. Expect golden hints of almond, vanilla and a long finish. If you can wait, this will taste even more complex in a decade. If you can't, drink a glass with moules frites.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Green Apple, Honeysuckle, Lemon, Smoke

Title: Domaine Hubert Bouzereau-GruÃ¨re et Filles Meursault 2020/21
Description: This estate was founded by Hubert Bouzereau, a Meursault native, and Marie-France GruÃ¨re, from the nearby Chassagne-Montrachet. Itâ€™s now in the expert hands of their daughters, Marie-Laure and Marie-Anne, who won the TrophÃ©e des Jeunes Talents (Young Talents Trophy) in 2002. And this is an exceptional Meursault. Old vines produce the tastiest grapes. And the average vine age on this vineyard is 35-40 years old. The result is long, structured and tastes even better with age. This is exactly why Meursault is one of Burgundyâ€™s most celebrated spots. Itâ€™s creamy and rich, with notes of toasted almond, honey, hazelnut and flint. At its best with cod.
Characteristics: Stone Fruit, Bread, Butter, Cream, Hazelnut, Honey, Smoke

Title: Domaine Joly Puligny-Montrachet 2019/20
Description: Domaine Joly have a strong historical presence in Burgundy. Their distinct style is clean and pure Puligny-Montrachet with a delicious edge. This has flavours of hazelnut and stone fruit, and a clean, pure finish. Its great structure shows potential ageing. Serve at 10-13 degrees with white fish or cellar for ten years.

Title: Domaine Jomain â€˜Les PerriÃ¨resâ€™ Puligny-Montrachet Premier Cru 2019/20
Description: The name â€˜Les PerriÃ¨resâ€™ means â€˜stonesâ€™ and itâ€™s fitting here: the grapes for this wine are grown on stony, chalky and clay soils. Theyâ€™re some of the most sought-after soils in Burgundy and were given prestigious Premier Cru status. Most importantly, they nourish deeply flavoursome Chardonnay grapes, which means you can expect great things from this bottle. Its structured and refined with aromas of white flowers and honey. Youâ€™ll find few better matches for a decadent fish or seafood feast.
Characteristics: Bread, Butter, Cream, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey, Stone Fruit

Title: Domaine Jomain Puligny-Montrachet 2020/21
Description: Puligny-Montrachet is one of Burgundyâ€™s essential buys for Chardonnay lovers. The small appellation produces some of the worldâ€™s finest, purest expressions of the grape. Domaine Jomain makes delicious wines from a small slice of the prestigious land, from old vines averaging 32 years old. The grapes are hand-harvested and sorted, then gently pressed before being aged for 11 months in oak. The resulting wine is elegant, deep and rounded, with aromas of honey and white flowers. Itâ€™ll stand up to creamy chicken or fish dishes with ease and can continue to age for another four to eight years.
Characteristics: Bread, Butter, Cream, Floral, Hazelnut, Honey, Stone Fruit

Title: Domaine la Couquihado CÃ´tes du RhÃ´ne 2020 Magnum
Description: Domaine Couquihado sits in the heart of the picturesque village of ViolÃ¨s in Southern RhÃ´ne. The estate has been owned by the Guigue family since the 18th century, and its winemaking history stretches back over 160 years. Today, the head winemaker is Armelle Barbanson, who has rich experience working for several renowned producers in the RhÃ´ne Valley. This is a perfectly balanced blend of Grenache, Syrah and Carignan. Expect classic notes of black cherry, plum and liquorice, and a subtle earthiness on the finish. Perfect with roast beef.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Blackberry, Liquorice

Title: Domaine Maire 'Heritage' Chardonnay 2018, CÃ´tes du Jura
Description: The Jura region stretches from Burgundy to the Swiss Alps. It's continental climate and clay rich soils are perfect for Chardonnay. Domaine Maire has produced wine since 1632, and adds a dash of oak-aged Savagnin to this typical CÃ´tes du Jura blend. Fine and elegant, with notes of white flowers, citrus and cedar, the Savagnin adds a subtle oxidative note that is a prized element of the Jura wines.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Ginger, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Lemon, Pear

Title: Domaine Pardon et Fils 'Ã€ Nous' Beaujolais Nouveau 2023
Description:
Every year, on the third Thursday of November, the freshest Beaujolais is released, just weeks after the harvest. 'Beaujolais Nouveau' day is celebrated throughout the region and in wine bars all over Europe. This year saw a small harvest, but we've secured another limited parcel from the fantastic Domaine Pardon et Fils, a seventh-generation family winery. Last year, it sold out within days. It's light, elegant, full of strawberry, blueberry and redcurrant and a real treat with a ham quiche.

Due to French law, we can't sell this wine until 00:01 on Thursday 16th November. If you include this in your Shop Local order before this date, we will have it ready on Thursday.

Title: Domaine Rolet Arbois Chardonnay 2016/17, Jura
Description: Arbois is the most important region in Jura. In the foothills of the Alps, the harsh winters may put off many winemakers, but not Domaine Rolet. This estate handpicks its grapes from 30-year-old vines and ages this Chardonnay in oak. Expect notes of rich citrus, white flowers and a hint of oak influence in the supple texture and delicate nuttiness.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Ginger, Green Apple, Lemon, Sweet Spice

Title: Doudet-Naudin Bourgogne CÃ´te dâ€™Or Chardonnay 2019
Description: Doudet-Naudin is one of the oldest maisons in Burgundy, but it wasn't until the Doudet family took the reins that the historic winery flourished. Today, they can be found in some of the region's most coveted areas. The vines behind this are mainly from Meursault. But Doudet-Naudin intentionally declassified it to allow for blending with grapes from other Burgundian villages. So the wine doesn't command the expected high price tag. It's real value for money. Expect fresh notes of flowers, vanilla and apple, which will become more ripe and rich with age. This is the perfect wine for fish, so serve it with buttery Dover sole.
Characteristics: Cream, Green Apple, Stone Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Duckhorn 'Decoy' Zinfandel 2019/21, Sonoma County
Description: Over the past 34 years, Duckhorn have become one of the greatest wineries in America. They made their name in Napa County and have ventured out to Sonoma. The best part? What they make there is still at a low price. Their expertise really shines in this Zinfandel. It has aromas of ripe blackberry, wild blueberry, plum and blackcurrant, along with hints of cedar and spice. Pair this with lamb stew.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Cherry, Blueberry, Chocolate, Red Cherry, Spice

Title: E. Guigal 'Brune et Blonde' CÃ´te-RÃ´tie  2019/20
Description: Guigal is one of the most respected producers in the RhÃ´ne Valley and arguably the very best on the famous dizzying slopes of CÃ´te-RÃ´tie. True to this prestigious region's form, this is a blend of Syrah with a dash of Viognier to dial up the aromatics. It's made from 35-year-old vines and aged for three years in oak barrels. As a result, it has concentrated aromas of red berries and sweet spices, flavours of ripe raspberry, blackberry and vanilla and soft tannins which are ideal with cheese.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Cedar

Title: E. Guigal Saint-Joseph 2018/19
Description: The Guigal family's meticulous approach has earned them a reputation in the RhÃ´ne Valley as world-class winemakers. They even make their own barrels to get the very best from each vintage. This is an exceptional 100% Syrah red from one of the northern RhÃ´ne's up-and-coming region, Saint-Joseph. It's made from vines that are up to 50-years-old. This maturity makes for a real concentration in its red-fruit flavours. Its elegant tannins go very well with red meats and cheese.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry

Title: Edouard Delaunay 'Charmont' Hautes-CÃ´tes de Nuits Rouge 2019/20
Description: The Edouard Delaunay estateâ€™s rich history dates back to 1893. Its wines were the choice of The Orient Express and the finest restaurants in France. A century later, it fell out of family hands. That was the year Laurent Delaunay bought back his great-grandfatherâ€™s estate and re-established his deep-rooted family connections with the best local grape-growers. This is made from grapes from Hautes-CÃ´te de Nuits, a few miles to the west of CÃ´te de Nuits Grand Cru vineyards. Expect aromas of bramble fruit, raspberry and cherry, with fragrant hints of wild herbs. Partner with brie.

Title: Edouard Delaunay Gevrey-Chambertin 2018/19
Description: The Eduoard Delauney estate fell out of family hands in the early '90s. But Laurent Delaunay bought it back a few years ago with the aim to restore it back to its former glory. The team have since won 39 medals in the past few years. This is a real comeback story. And this Gevrey-Chambertin is deep and powerful, with notes of cherry, liquorice and coffee. Decant this for at least an hour before serving at room temperature with duck.

Title: Elysium Black Muscat 2018/21 Half Bottle, California
Description:
Black Muscat, an under-appreciated Muscat variety, one of the very few black-skinned Muscats. Elysium is Greek for Heaven, a fitting association for this excellent wine made by Andrew Quady. Virtually black in colour, with a rose-like aroma, very intense on the palate and full of fantastic rich velvety fruit. One of the few wines that can stand up to chocolate puddings. Or try it poured over ice cream for the ultimate after-dinner treat!

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2018 vintage.

Title: Erath Pinot Noir 2019/20, Oregon
Description: Oregon offers the perfect conditions for growing the delicate Pinot Noir grape. And no one knew this better than Dick Erath, who was the first person to plant vines in the now famous Dundee Hills. Today, the same volcanic soils produce some of the state's best Pinot. And Erath consider this one of their best. Expect cherry, berry jam, raspberry and a hint of warm spice. Try this with your Sunday roast chicken.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: ViÃ±a ErrÃ¡zuriz â€˜Estate Seriesâ€™ Sauvignon Blanc 2021/22, Casablanca Valley
Description:
In 1870, Don Maximiano ErrÃ¡zuriz spent two days straight on horseback, travelling 100km north of Santiago on a quest to find a terroir he felt did justice to Chileâ€™s wild spirit. In the shadow of the mountains at Aconcagua Valley, he found it. Maximiano was the first to introduce French grapes to the valley, founding a family winery which is still flourishing nearly 150 years later. Itâ€™s grown just a few kilometres inland of the Pacific, and the sea has a big impact on flavour. So it's incredibly fresh. Itâ€™s crisp. Itâ€™s zingy. But itâ€™s also ripe with those delicious gooseberry and passion-fruit flavours we love in a Sauvignon. Itâ€™s incredible with ceviche â€“ or tangy, dairy-based dishes.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Escarpment 'Kiwa' Pinot Noir 2020, Martinborough
Description: Larry McKenna is one of New Zealand's leading winemakers. He was recently inducted into the New Zealand Wine Hall of Fame, and he specialises in Pinot Noir. He's long shunned the big-name spots in favour of Martinborough. He makes Kiwa on a tiny 2-hectare vineyard here, and it's famed for its signature depth and texture. Expect a savoury, complex and spicy wine, with notes of plum, cherry and dried herbs. Decant for at least two hours before serving or cellar for ten years.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Fitou by Mademoiselle Jones 2020, France
Description: Katie Jones is one of the UK's finest winemakers. She makes this smooth, succulent red from 100-year-old vines on a tiny vineyard in Fitou, and we buy what we can whenever it is available. This arrival is from the stellar 2018 vintage. It has plentiful notes of dark fruit, dried herbs and liquorice.

Title: Fonseca Reserve Ruby Port 50cl
Description: Fonseca's port has been enjoyed in the UK since 1840. They take great pride in their ruby port. It's aged for several years in wooden vats to encourage complexity and soften tannins while keeping fresh flavour. It's full-bodied with intense flavours of blackcurrant and cherry. Excellent with soft cheeses.

Title: G. D. Vajra â€˜Albeâ€™ Barolo DOCG 2017/18
Description: â€˜Sustainableâ€™ and â€˜organicâ€™ may be buzzwords today, but the Vajra family has been championing both in Piedmont ever since the 1970s. At their vineyards, biodiversity is encouraged, whether itâ€™s allowing grass to sprout in between rows of vineyards or birds to nest in the nearby forest. Huge amounts of manual work are put into producing each vintage of this excellent Barolo, which is made from 100% Nebbiolo grapes. It has aromas of redcurrant, strawberries and cherries and floral hints of rosebud and black fig. Try it with sausage tagliatelle.

Title: Gabb Family Vineyards Chardonnay 2020/21, South Africa
Description:
This is made on the Schapenberg Hills in South Africaâ€™s picturesque Stellenbosch. Here, the influence of the nearby ocean encourages the kind of cool-climate Chardonnay traditionally associated with top Old World regions. But the name behind it is more than this pretty location. Journey's End have just been named Ethical Company of the Year by The Drinks Business for the second year in a row. They've also been supporting the wider community by providing 10,000 free meals a week via nine local soup kitchens. Itâ€™s fresh yet full-bodied, with notes of citrus, peach and butterscotch on the finish. Enjoy with meaty fish, like baked halibut, or mushroom risotto sprinkled with pine nuts.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2021 vintage.

Title: Gabb Family Vineyards Malbec 2020/21, South Africa
Description: Think South Africa is all baking sunshine? Think again. Grown high in the Stellenbosch hills, the grapes for this wine are blessed by ocean breezes and a soaking morning sun. This prime location means robust and juicy flavour. Discover vibrant notes of violets, black berries and a hint of black pepper. Will complement any meat dishes, especially those prepared on coals.

Title: Gianni Brunelli Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2016/17
Description: In 1987, Gianni Brunelli returned home to Montalcino and bought back a property once owned by his father. This, along with a second 4.5 hectare plot of land, very soon became the source of some of the region's most celebrated Brunello. Both estates are now in the hands of his wife, Laura, who upholds the great reputation. This is a concentrated and slightly savoury expression of the Sangiovese grape, with flavours of cherry, wild strawberry, forest floor and tobacco. Decant for an hour before serving with a herby steak of cellar until 2040.
Characteristics: Earth, Leather, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: Girardin PÃ¨re et Fils â€˜Vieilles Vignesâ€™ Meursault 2017
Description: Meursault is one of the world's most prestigious wine regions and arguably the finest spot for Chardonnay in Burgundy. At Girardin PÃ¨re et Fils, extra care is taken to ensure that the wines are as special as can be. This is made from grapes that grow on old vines or â€˜vieilles vignesâ€™. These vines only nourish a small amount of grapes, but theyâ€™re concentrated with delicious flavour. Winemaker Eric Germain follows the lunar cycle, farms biodynamically and lets the quality of the vineyards do the talking. The result is a concentrated wine with mineral notes of citrus, green apple and freshly cut grass. Try it with a decadent cheese soufflÃ©.

Title: Girardin PÃ¨re et Fils Puligny-Montrachet Vieilles Vignes 2017
Description: This is Burgundy at its best. Labelled 'Vieilles Vignes', this wine comes from old vines that are more than 65 years old. In the cellar, there is minimal intervention to bring out the best of this great vintage. Expect mineral notes with a well-balanced acidity. Wonderful with creamy chicken.

Title: Girardin PÃ¨re et Fils Santenay 'Vieilles Vignes' Rouge 2018/19, Burgundy
Description: This Pinot Noir is made from 45-year-old vines in Santenay, the village in which the founder of the winery, Vincent Girardin, was born. Aged in oak for 14 months on character-building lees, the 'Vieilles Vignes' is exceptionally well structured, with notes of strawberry and plum chased by a long, smooth finish.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Earth, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Strawberry

Title: Goldwater Sauvignon Blanc 2022, Wairau Valley
Description: Founded in 1978, Goldwater is among the oldest wine producers in New Zealand. Chief winemaker Stu Marfell entered the wine trade when he took part in his first harvest aged only eight years old â€“ and today, heâ€™s known as a pioneer across the entire industry. This is an excellent demonstration of his skill and passion for Marlborough wines. Itâ€™s made with grapes from the Wairau Valley, an area famed for its intensely aromatic, lively Sauvignon. The grapes are harvested during the early morning hours to preserve their mouth-watering acidity, and five months of lees ageing adds fantastic texture and complexity. Expect notes of freshly squeezed lemon, grapefruit, guava and a hint of salty sea air. Partner its crisp flavours with fresh white-fish dishes.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Gooseberry, Grapefruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Stone Fruit

Title: Gonzalez Byass 'Tio Pepe' Fino Sherry
Description: Sherry has run through the veins of five generations of the Gonzalez family. The journey began in 1835 with Manuel Maria Gonzalez Angel. His legacy to Sherry? A bodega now packed with barrels in every corner. Tio Pepe was named in honour of Manuelâ€™s uncle, after he discovered barrels of a delicious pale, dry style of sherry that Pepe had made. It's now the worldâ€™s best-selling Fino â€“ and for very good reason. Itâ€™s deeply refreshing with notes of green apple and toasted almond and a hint of saltiness on the crisp, dry finish. Serve straight from the fridge with classic tapas nibbles, like Manchego cheese, olives and salted almonds.

Title: Grattamacco Organic Bolgheri Rosso DOC 2020/21
Description: The Grattamacco estate was founded in Bolgheri in 1977. It was part of the 'Super Tuscan' movement that experimented with blending non-indigenous grapes with Sangiovese. Today, Super Tuscans are some of the most in-demand wines in the world. The team at this estate have been continuously improving the Rosso over more than 38 years â€“ and their expertise really shows. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Sangiovese is remarkably drinkable in its youth. Itâ€™s a dense, powerful wine with ripe tannins, aromas of dark fruits and chocolate and an excellent structure. Pair it with a hearty Tuscan stew.

Title: Greywacke Pinot Gris 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: Kevin Judd was a founding member of the iconic Cloudy Bay winery. He played a large part in putting Marlborough on the wine world map. Today, Greywacke is his passion project. It's his opportunity to make something slightly different to what you might expect from the region. This is a ripe, opulent Pinot Gris made in the off-dry style. It has flavours of pear, honey, quince, almond and candied lemon that are best with lightly spiced Thai foods.

Title: Hamilton Russell Vineyards Chardonnay 2020/21, Hemel-en-Aarde
Description: Hamilton Russell Vineyards boasts a lot of superlatives. Theyâ€™re one of the most southerly vineyards in Africa. They were pioneers in now-celebrated Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, producing the first vintage back in 1981. And theyâ€™re one of South Africaâ€™s finest wineries, often compared to the finest of Burgundy. Thanks to their southerly spot, they have a cool climate that's perfect for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. They keep yields small on the vineyard, and intense demand keeps these elegant estate-grown wines in short supply. When you taste this Chardonnay, you'll see what the fuss is about. It has prominent pear and lime notes, bright natural acidity, a hint of oak and a refreshing minerality. It's textured, intense and certainly not lacking personality. Try it with a mushroom risotto or roasted chicken. Tim Atkin MW gave the 2020 vintage 96 points.

Title: Hanna Chardonnay 2018/19, Sonoma County
Description: In 1985 world-famous cardiac surgeon Dr. Elias Hanna founded the Hanna winery. He quickly became an iconic winemaker. And his daughter, Christine, today leads the way with this complex, elegant Chardonnay. Expect notes of tropical fruit, caramel and vanilla. Serve this at 10-13 degrees with roast chicken.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Apricot, Green Apple, Green Fruit, Peach, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

Title: Henri de Villamont 'Les Groseilles' Chambolle-Musigny Premier Cru 2014/18
Description: From their 18th century cellars to their long-serving team, tradition is everything at Henri de Villamont. They have fantastic relationships with local grape-growers. So their wines are made from some of the CÃ´te de Nuits' most coveted vineyards. This is made from grapes from the tiny Chambolle-Musigny appelation. It's full-bodied and smooth, with notes of raspberries, strawberries and violets. Drink now at room temperature with strong cheeses.

Title: Henriques and Henriques 3 Year Old Full Rich Madeira 50cl
Description: This classic Madeira undergoes the unique Estufa process where the wine is repeatedly warmed than cooled for 90 days making the wine stable before it three years of cask ageing. Lucious, rich, sweet and fragrant this is full of intense flavours of dried fruit and caramel. Try this on it own, or with a classic Madeira cake.

Title: J Vineyards 'J CuvÃ©e 20 Brut', Russian River Valley
Description: J Vineyards was founded in Sonoma's cool climate Russian River by Judy Jordan in 1994. It is today headed by talented winemaker Nicole Hitchcock, who continues to roll out world-class wines. Expect a rich mousse and complex palate of lemon meringue, ripe apple and ginger.
Characteristics: Red Apple, Almond, Cream, Ginger, Lemon

Title: Paul Jaboulet AÃ®nÃ© Syrah, 2019/21, France
Description: 100% Syrah from vineyards in the RhÃ´ne Valley and the Languedoc. Sourcing the grapes from across a range of terroirs allows Jaboulet to create a well-balanced wine with consistent quality. It is matured without oak to maintain a supple and fruit-driven style. Medium-bodied with a fresh, juicy feel, this wine offers the classic Syrah characters of blackcurrant and liquorice, with subtle aromas of wild shrubs and pepper. Perfect accompaniment for herb-rubbed lamb chops, preferably char grilled.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Smoke, Spice

Title: Jomain FrÃ¨res Bourgogne Blanc 2019/20
Description: The Jomain family is known for its delicious Puligny-Montrachet. But it also makes great value white Burgundy with vines owned by a family friend. Once the Chardonnay grapes are picked by hand and pampered by the same fine treatment, the wine is aged in both steel and oak for a total of 12 months. The result is soft, dry and emits smooth hints of lychee and pear that are lined by a refreshing acidity.

Title: Kangarilla Road Chardonnay 2020/21, Adelaide Hills
Description: Kangarilla Road is a Majestic classic. It's made by the acclaimed winemaker Kevin O'Brien, mainly from cool-climate Adelaide Hills vineyards. It's treated to a light use of oak, making it sleek and minerally-fresh. It truly showcases the best of modern Australian winemaking. It's elegant with notes of lemon sherbet, melon, pear and nectarine. Try it with a creamy chicken dish.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Kangarilla Road Shiraz 2020/21, McLaren Vale
Description: In 1997, the Oâ€™Brien family purchased an old vineyard in the heart of McLaren Vale. They soon discovered that its ancient geology was perfect for nurturing complex and full-bodied Shiraz. The critics agree: Australia's leading wine critic, James Halliday, gave the winery the top Five Red Star rating. After just a sip of this wine, you'll see why. Packed with black fruits, dark chocolate and a creamy texture, it's a perfect pairing for beef short ribs.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Raspberry, Tobacco

Title: Kanonkop â€˜Paul Sauerâ€™ 2018/19, Stellenbosch
Description: Kanonkop is named after a kopje (hillock) in the nearby Simonsberg mountains. But there is more than pretty landscapes to mark this Stellenbosch winery out as special. In the 1970s, Paul Sauer noted the siteâ€™s suitability for grape-growing and planted vineyards on the granite soils to great success. Now, Kanonkopâ€™s flagship bottling â€“ a Bordeaux-style blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc â€“ is one of South Africaâ€™s most prestigious wines. Expect complex notes of blackcurrant, wildflowers and cigar box. Enjoy it with prime rib.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cigar Box, Earth, Leather, Tobacco

Title: Katie Jones 'L'Histoire' 2019, Fitou
Description: Many years ago, Katie Jones moved from the UK to live and work in France's Languedoc region. But it wasn't until 2008 when she took the plunge and bought her first vineyard. Several vintages later, and Domaine Jones is producing exceptional wines, and racking up several awards along the way. L'Histoire has notes of wild berries, rosemary and thyme, and an elegant structure. Partner this characterful red with slow-roasted lamb rubbed with rosemary and garlic.

Title: Kraal Bay Pinotage 2018, Swartland
Description: An expressive style of Pinotage, the Kraal Bay has a bold fruit character and supple tannins. Pair its notes of red cherries, ripe plum and hints of spice with hearty red-meat dishes.
Characteristics: Smoke, Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Blackberry

Title: Kutch Sonoma Coast Chardonnay 2018
Description: Jamie Goode 94 Points 12.5% alcohol. Beautiful stuff, combining sweet ripe pear and apple fruit with some lively grapefruit freshness, and also a subtly smoky, mineral twist. There's good acidity here, and a slightly bitter twist that offsets the fruit nicely. Complex and beguiling with concentration, balance and finesse. The fruit profile hints at California, but the acid structure and poise is very European. I really like it, and it should age really well.Doesn't seem to be as overtly reductive as the two previous Kutch Chardonnays. 94/100
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Peach, Vanilla

Title: La Belle Angele Sauvignon Blanc Boxed Wine 2.25L, 2020, France
Description: This easy-drinking box is a demonstration of everything great about French Sauvignon, as well as being a fantastic party piece. Although Vin de France is the least regulated style of French wine, itâ€™s often overlooked. There are gems to be found in lesser-known areas such as Gascony or the Aude. This wine blends grapes from both regions. Crisp and refreshing, bursting with notes of citrus, apple and gooseberry. Delicious with creamy cheeses, like camembert.

Title: La MÃ gia Organic Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2016/17
Description: This Brunello has an excellent balance of power, structure and elegance. It was aged for three years in oak on the La MÃ gia estate, which was orginally a resting place for wayfarers on an old Roman road. Expect notes of red berries, mineral overtones, delicate hints of spice, a balancing acidity, smooth tannins and a long finish.

Title: La RÃ©serve de LÃ©oville-Barton St-Julien 2018/19
Description: From the gravelly dunes of LÃ©oville-Barton's vineyards, leading down to the bank of the Gironde, La RÃ©serve is the second wine of this famous property. As an earlier drinking version of the grand vin, this is real value for money. With a classic 'left bank' nose of smoky blackberry fruit and pencil lead, the palate is rich and rounded with assertive tannins, ample fruit and well integrated oak. Serve with shoulder of lamb braised in wine. Drinking well at the moment, but will keep for another 5 or so years.

Title: La Rioja Alta â€˜904â€™ Rioja Gran Reserva 2011/15
Description: Back in 1890, five Riojan and Basque families came together to form a collective winery. They grew further in the early 1900s, creating the landmark '904' Gran Reserva to celebrate the event. La Rioja Alta is now one of the most-respected names in Rioja. And theyâ€™re still making that wine today. It's crafted mostly from Tempranillo and aged for four years in barrel and even longer in the bottle. This patience, and the resulting high quality, makes it suitable for long ageing. It has complex aromas of blackberry jam, raspberries, cedar and cigar box, with liquorice and clove flavours. Thanks to its maturity, itâ€™s perfect for roasted meats.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Cigar Box, Red Fruit, Spice, Vanilla

Title: LÃ¢chez-Vous Grenache-Syrah 2019/20, France
Description: Cutting through the red tape of French wine laws, this is a modern blend of the very best parcels of Grenache and Syrah from across France. LÃ¢chez-Vous, or â€˜Cut Looseâ€™, is an homage to the rebellious free-spirited winemaking of the Languedoc. A wine for those not afraid to challenge the status quo. Itâ€™s full of ripe and juicy dark raspberry, strawberry and sweet spice. Try this with a hearty beef stew.

Title: Lanson Le Green Label Organic Brut
Description: Founded in 1760, Lanson is one of oldest and most respected houses in Champagne. This is its first ever entirely organic Champagne. Predominantly Pinot Noir, aged on lees for three years, it's pure and fresh with fine notes of citrus and berry fruits weaving through its complex mousse.

Title: Lanson Le Vintage 2009
Description: With a blend of 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay this wine has a nose of dried fig, apricot and pear mixed with biscuit undertones. The palate shows fullness and a lively finish.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: Lapostolle 'CuvÃ©e Alexandre' Chardonnay 2019, Casablanca Valley
Description: Lapostolle is one of Chile's finest wineries. They make this vibrant Chardonnay with grapes from Casablanca Valley â€“ a region famed for producing elegant and complex white wines. To dial up the flavour even more, they ferment and mature part of the wine in French oak barrels. Itâ€™s a meeting of New World fruit and Old World techniques â€“ and with a 93-point score from renowned critic James Suckling, itâ€™s not to be missed. Expect notes of apple, pear, citrus and tropical fruits, with hints of herbs and lush vanilla. Its rounded texture makes it a perfect match for fish and seafood dishes.
Characteristics: Bread, Butter, Green Apple, Honey, Peach, Vanilla

Title: Las Maletas Malbec 2022/23, Mendoza
Description: Love smooth, ripe, fruity reds? You canâ€™t miss this delicious Malbec â€“ weâ€™re lucky enough to have secured it as a Majestic exclusive. Itâ€™s from Mendoza, Malbecâ€™s heartland. Some of the vines are more than fifty years old â€“ itâ€™s the perfect microclimate for ripening really concentrated grapes. This is a really juicy and moreish wine, with a plush, velvety texture. Discover cherry, plum and blueberry notes with subtle vanilla spice. We think thereâ€™s nothing better with a juicy beef burger.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Laurent-Perrier La CuvÃ©e Champagne Magnum
Description: Laurent Perrier La Cuvee NV Champagne Magnum 150cl is Laurent-Perrier's signature champagne, so called as it is crafted using the purest grape juice obtained during the gentle first pressing. La CuvÃ©e defines the House style and serves as an ideal introduction to our wines with its characteristic lightness, freshness and elegance.
Characteristics: Green Apple, Biscuit, Bread, Citrus Fruit

Title: LB7 Red 2018/20 Magnum, Lisbon
Description: Portuguese red blends are rich, packed with juicy fruit flavours and great value. Not to mention, they're a bit out of the ordinary. None of your bog-standard red grapes here - we look for a blend of exotic Portuguese natives to give you something exciting. This one is made by one of Portugal's most awarded winemakers. Expect brambly fruit and a kick of spice. Put this magnum centrepiece when serving casserole.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry

Title: Le Cellier des Papes ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape 2020, Half Bottle
Description: Le Cellier de Papes used to be just 2 hectares of Grenache. But in 1963, Alain Grangeon saw the exceptional potential of the estate's soils and planted Syrah and MourvÃ¨dre vines. As a result, this blend has gone from strength to strength since. It's now made by his son, Baptiste Grangeon, who is widely celebrated as one of the finest winemakers in ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape. Expect intense notes of blackberries, leather, red fruit, liquorice, chocolate and spices. Try it with steak and blue cheese.
Characteristics: Blackberry, Chocolate, Leather, Liquorice, Red Fruit

Title: Le Difese Tenuta San Guido 2020/21
Description: "This 70-30 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese would indeed pair perfectly with game dishes such as fettuccine in rabbit sauce or wild boar sausage thanks to that extra touch of acidity that cuts through any fattiness. Dried cherry, blackberry, leather and tobacco enhance the wine's medium build and silky texture. There is a distant touch of overripe fruit at the very beginning. Le Difese is aged for 12 months in both French and American oak. Anticipated maturity: 2013-2018". 89 points. Monica Larner, The Wine Advocate.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Cedar, Earth, Tobacco

Title: LÃ©on Perdigal ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape 2020 Magnum
Description: LÃ©on Perdigal was the first cellarmaster at Ogier when it was founded in 1859. He was widely respected as a master in oak-ageing and was even nicknamed Le Pape des ClÃ©s, â€œThe Pope of the Keysâ€. This is a fitting tribute to the man. It's made by RhÃ´ne expert Armelle Barbanson predominantly from Grenache grapes. Expect intense notes of red fruits, liquorice, pepper and thyme. Try it with red meat or mature cheeses.
Characteristics: Black Plum, Dried Herbs, Red Fruit

Title: Les Grandes Serres 'La Pigna' ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape 2020
Description: In the early 1920s, ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape was awash with substandard wines. So, the region decided to introduce some controls â€“ specifying grape varieties and growing guidelines â€“ which would guarantee consistent quality. It worked so well it inspired the whole French appellation contrÃ´lÃ©e system â€“ proof that pushing the bounds of convention can give great rewards. Thatâ€™s Les Grandes Serresâ€™ ethos. They keep their yields even lower, and harvest even later than is standard in ChÃ¢teauneuf, determined to make their wines better and better. This wine is a case in point. Itâ€™s intensely concentrated, with a really plush texture. Rich aromas jump out of the glass. Black cherry. Plum. Black pepper. And supple tannins from oak ageing. And its woody-herb flavours make it sublime with lamb chops.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth, Raspberry

Title: Lopez de Haro RosÃ© 2020/21, Rioja
Description: The land that Lopez de Haro calls home has been used to make wine for 2,000 years. It's no wonder, as their vineyards are perfectly positioned to get the best out of the hot Riojan sun. This Rioja Rosado is a blend of Garnacha and Viura with a silky, moreish flavour. It's packed full of hints of red fruit, banana, and flowers. We can't think of a better wine to serve with lamb.

Title: Lopez de Heredia 'ViÃ±a Tondonia' Rioja Reserva 2010/11
Description: This is a blend of estate-grown grapes aged for six years in oak. It has aromas of vanilla and dried fruit, flavours of rich red fruit, fine tannins and a long finish. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with garlic-rubbed lamb or cellar for a decade.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Louis Jadot Bourgogne Pinot Noir 'Les Pierres Rouges' 2020/21
Description: Maison Louis Jadot has been making wine in Burgundy since before 1859. With an unwavering dedication to quality, winemaker Jacques LardiÃ¨re aims for excellence with all his wines. Displaying subtle hints of red fruit and violets on the nose, with a well rounded palate of cherry and raspberry fruit with a rounded texture. Gently tannic and with good length. Drinking superbly on its own, also try this with small game.

Title: Louis Jadot 'Clos du Cromin' Meursault 2018/20
Description: There's a reason that Louis Jadot wines are firm favourites among Majestic customers. Louis Jadot is one of the biggest names in Burgundy â€“ a name you can depend on for consistently well made, delicious wines. Winemaker FrÃ©dÃ©ric Barnier built a reputation for elegant white wines working at the prestigious ChÃ¢teau de Chassagne-Montrachet. You can taste his skill in this Meursault. All the grapes behind it are picked from the protected Clos du Cromin climat and spend a generous 16 months in oak barrels. The result is classically ripe, rich and toasty, with notes of stone fruits, cream, hazelnut and honey. Match the indulgent flavours with soft French cheeses.
Characteristics: Butter, Cream, Hazelnut, Honey, Stone Fruit

Title: Louis Latour 'Domaine Latour' Aloxe-Corton 2017
Description: Louis Latour is one of Burgundy's most respected names. This historical producer started off as vine growers in the village of Aloxe-Corton in the 1760s. This Pinot Noir hails from where it all began, and you can expect remarkable things. Itâ€™s made following long-established traditions to an exacting standard. Each grape is handpicked to make sure only the finest make it into production, and the wine is carefully oak-aged in home-made barrels for up to 12 months. It has vibrant flavours of strawberry, raspberry and red cherry, with hints of nutmeg and spice. Partner with a traditional Coq au Vin.
Characteristics: Nutmeg, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Spice, Strawberry

Title: Louis Latour MÃ¢con-Lugny 2020 Magnum
Description: Weâ€™ve sold the original Louis Latour MÃ¢con-Lugny for over 30 years â€“ and for that whole time itâ€™s been a bestseller. And now, weâ€™re proud to showcase it in Magnum form. Whyâ€™s it so popular? White Burgundy is a go-to for Chardonnay drinkers, and the MÃ¢connais in particular offers great value. Unlike the northern CÃ´tes, the southern part of Burgundy doesnâ€™t have a formalised vineyard hierarchy system, so the wines tend to be a bit more wallet-friendly. Not to mention, Lugny is one of the best regarded villages in the MÃ¢con, and Latour is one of the most famous houses. Honeyed. Peachy. Crisp. A dream with salty finger foods â€“ or a classic Sunday roast chicken. Itâ€™s proof that sometimes it pays to stick with the old favourites.

Title: Louis Martini Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18, Napa Valley
Description: Louis Martini left Italy for America with one vision: to create the world's greatest wines. He had a key idea that the best grapes made the best wines. So, naturally, he ended up in Napa Valley. His was one of the first five wineries built in Napa after the repeal of Prohibition. And today, it's the go-to for lovers of 'Napa Cab' in the know. This is a savoury and full-bodied wine, with flavours of black plum, blackcurrant and vanilla that are great with red meat and rosemary potatoes. Leading US wine critic James Suckling gave it a 92-point score.

Title: Louis Roederer 2013/14 Champagne
Description: Louis Roederer's 2013 vintage was one of the best on record. After a cool, late spring, the summer months truly dazzled, filling grapes with delicious juice. It was a no-brainer for them to make their signature vintage Champagne that year. It's a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, showing all of the elegant notes of citrus, flowers, pears and spice.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Almond, Bread, Caramel, Chocolate

Title: Louis Roederer 'Cristal' Champagne 2012
Description: Cristal Champagne was first designed upon request of Tsar Alexander II. Fearful of an assassination attempt, he requested that his Champagne was served in clear bottle. And an icon was born. This is made from low-yielding Pinot Noir and Chardonnay vines and aged for six years on texture-building lees. It's complex, lively and powerful, with a concentrated, long finish and great balance. Serve with buttery chicken. William Kelley gave it a 97+ Parker Point score.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Green Apple, Peach

Title: Louis Roederer Quartet, California
Description: From Champagne house Louis Roederer's excellent Californian operation in the Anderson Valley. Reserve vintage wines are added to the Quartet, making it a multi-vintage cuvÃ©e in the traditional Roederer style. Crisp and elegant with complex pear, spice and hazelnut flavours. Fresh and lightly fruity with great finesse and depth of flavour. A brilliant apÃ©ritif, or try alongside lobster.

Title: Louis Soufflot Chablis 2018
Description: Maison Louis Soufflot was founded in the 19th century. The winery has a reputation throughout France for producing elegant Burgundy wines. If you like Chablis with plenty of flavour, you're in luck. This is made from vines with an average age of 40 years old â€“ and old vines nourish the tastiest grapes.  The wine is also aged on its lees, which bring a delicious texture and complexity. Expect aromas of white flowers, ripe citrus flavours, refreshing minerality and a bright finish. Try it with shellfish or roast chicken.
Characteristics: Cream, Green Apple, Lemon, Wet Stones

Title: Louis Violland Mercurey 2020/21, Burgundy
Description: The CÃ´te Chalonnaise was once referred to as the 'RÃ©gion de Mercurey', which shows how important this famous village is. Aged for 8 months in oak barrels, this is a classical expression of Mercurey. A refined and luscious Pinot Noir, this has bright red berry flavours, hints of earthy minerality and fine-grained tannins.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Earth, Red Cherry, Strawberry

Title: Luis Felipe Edwards â€˜Maceraoâ€™ Orange Wine 2021, Itata
Description: Orange wines are white wines made like red ones â€“ with grape skins to give colour, flavour and tannin. This food-friendly style has become very popular, and certified sustainable winery Luis Felipe Edwards is producing one of Chileâ€™s great-value, must-try examples. To make it, Moscatel de Alexandria grapes are hand-harvested and vinified on their skins to create a textured, rich orange-hued wine. It has complex aromas of tea, quince, flowers and lychee and a slight sweetness that contrasts well with fresh acidity. Pair it with cheeses, fish cakes or creamy Indian dishes, such as red-lentil dahl.

Title: Luis Felipe Edwards 'Late Harvest' Viognier/Sauvignon Blanc 2018/19 Half Bottle, Colchagua Valley
Description: Luis Felipe Edwards is one of Chile's most awarded producers. They make this great-value dessert wine from grapes picked at the very end of the ripening season. It's complex and sweet with notes of peach, citrus, honey and oak. Pair this with blue cheese of custard.

Title: Lulu l'Alouette Organic Saumur-Champigny 2020/21
Description: This wine is proof that there are red-wine treasures to be found in the Loire. Cabernet Franc is the star grape of Chinon, one of the few red-dominated regions in the valley. This fragrant and light wine is very approachable in its youth. It has hints of raspberry and redcurrant and pairs well with grilled pork.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Earth, Green Bell Pepper, Raspberry

Title: M. Chapoutier Domaine des Granges de Mirabel Organic Viognier 2019/20, Coteaux de l'ArdÃ¨che
Description: This is an elegant, biodynamic Viognier made by iconic RhÃ´ne producer Chapoutier. At the foothills of the Coirons, in Mirabel, in the ArdÃ¨che, the volcanic soil is ideal for Viognier, and this expression is wonderfully balanced. Enjoy notes of pear and apricot, a ripe texture and crisp acidity.

Title: M.Chapoutier 'Les Moniers' Crozes-Hermitage Blanc 2019
Description: M. Chapoutier dates back to 1808 and is one of the oldest, most respected producers in the RhÃ´ne Valley. This classic white Marsanne is a fine testament to their winemaking legacy. Itâ€™s a great alternative for fans of luscious whites, like Viognier or white Rioja. It has aromas of white peach and apple and clean minerality. Superb with sea bass.
Characteristics: Citrus Fruit, Floral, Green Apple, Peach

Title: Maison Loron Beaujolais 2020/21
Description: Maison Loron have been making wine since 1711 and always produce wine of character.  The Beaujolais is stuffed with elegant red fruit flavours of raspberry and strawberry and possesses a fine refreshing acidity.

Title: Majestic Crisp & Zesty 2021/22, South Africa
Description: Each bottle in our Selected by Majestic range has been chosen by our award-winning team of buyers for its unmistakable value and instantly enjoyable taste. Expect bright tropical fruit flavours, hints of white flower and a vibrant citrus acidity on the finish. Serve with white fish or seasonal salads.

Title: Majestic Fresh & Juicy 2020/21, South Africa
Description: Each bottle in our Selected by Majestic range has been chosen by our award-winning team of buyers for its unmistakable value and instantly enjoyable taste. Expect ripe notes of plum with uplifting hints of spice. Serve with stonebaked pizza.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Majestic Loves Rose 2019
Description: Our mission was to find the best tasting wines at Â£5.99.  So we blind tasted 500 wines and chose the best irrespective of grape variety or country. Crisp and thirst quenching with exuberant red berry flavours that are best enjoyed ice cold.

Title: Majestic Ripe & Bold 2020/21, South Africa
Description: Each bottle in our Selected by Majestic range has been chosen by our award-winning team of buyers for its unmistakable value and instantly enjoyable taste. Expect rich notes of blackberry and blackcurrant with hints of spice. Serve with barbecued beef ribs.

Title: Majestic Vibrant & Fresh 2020/22, South Africa
Description: Each bottle in our Selected by Majestic range has been chosen by our award-winning team of buyers for its unmistakable value and instantly enjoyable taste. Expect flavours of apple and pear and a gentle acidity. Itâ€™s versatile and easy-drinking. Serve as an apÃ©ritif. Not available in Scottish stores.

Title: MAN Family Wines 'Outentiek' Syrah 2020, South Africa
Description: MAN Family Wines was founded by three friends who often stayed up too late talking about how to make a living from winemaking. Their approach is to keep things honest and straightforward. That's why this wine is named Outentiek, which is Afrikaans for 'authentic'. They deliberately avoided too much oak and the fruit-forward style of Shiraz you may expect from South Africa. It's a medium-bodied, peppery Syrah with bright red-fruit notes and polished tannins. Try it with crispy pork belly.

Title: Marisco Pride & Glory Sauvignon Blanc 2018/20, Marlborough
Description: Brent Marris and the team at Marisco have created a series of exceptional wines from plots that have proven themselves over time to produce outstanding grapes. Aromas of passion fruit, guava and citrus are followed by a lingering floral note.  The flavours are citrus and tropical fruits underpinned by a soft acidity and a clean, refreshing finish. A perfect match for all seafood but especially anything with a herby butter sauce.

Title: MarquÃªs de Borba â€˜Vinhas Velhasâ€™ 2020, Alentejo
Description: MarquÃªs de Borba is leading the way in sustainable wine farming in Portugalâ€™s Alentejo. Here, JoÃ£o Maria Ramos, the son of JoÃ£o Portugal, one of the country's most-famous winemakers, is a champion of lesser-known indigenous varieties and artisan techniques. He produces great wines from old vines (vinhas velhas) in Estremoz. Here a blend of red grapes is foot-trodden in traditional lagares tanks then aged in oak barrels. The result? A full-bodied and velvety wine that packs intense sunshine flavours into every sip. Think black fruit, eucalyptus and spice. Pair it with roasted meats such as lamb, venison or duck, or richly flavoured vegetarian casseroles. James Suckling gave the 2019 vintage 92 points.

Title: MarquÃ©s de Riscal Rioja Gran Reserva 2016/17
Description: MarquÃ©s de Riscal were the first bodega to apply Bordeaux methods in Rioja. And this changed Spanish winemaking forever. Today, they make this Rioja from 80-year-old vines and age it for 32 months in oak and three years in the bottle. The result is intense and indulgent, with flavours of black fruit and toasted oak, smooth tannins and a long finish. Serve this at room temperature with a roast dinner or cellar until 2030.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: MarquÃ©s de Riscal Rioja Reserva 2017/18 Half Bottle
Description: MarquÃ©s de Riscal made Rioja what it is today. Up until the 1850s the locals had made only light, young wines. Then, in 1858, Riscal introduced the â€˜Bordeaux methodâ€™, barrel ageing. From that moment on, the practice became integral to Rioja. Today, Riscal Reserva is one of the most famous wines in Spain. Each grape is selected from vines that are at least 50 years old. Mature vines make the tastiest grapes. So the wine is incredibly rich and concentrated. Itâ€™s full of summer-berry flavours and notes of liquorice and vanilla spice. Perfect with JamÃ³n.

Title: MartÃ­n CÃ³dax 'Caixas' AlbariÃ±o 2020, RÃ­as Baixas
Description: Before MartÃ­n CÃ³dax, RÃ­as Baixas DO, the homeland of AlbariÃ±o, didn't exist. The 50 founding families who saw its potential fought for the region to become a DenominaciÃ³n de Origen. It's down to them that AlbariÃ±o is so popular today. This wine was voted our customers' favourite wine of 2019. So you can expect something great. Expect a bright, peachy white wine with charming notes of white flowers. Itâ€™s intensely refreshing with a citrusy zing. Perfect for seafood.

Title: Mas Querido Field Blend 2019
Description: A field blend is a rich tapestry of grape varieties plucked from one spot. So we expected something very special from MÃ¡s Querido. But even we were blown away by the praise of top wine critics last year. This follow-up vintage is a punchy cocktail of orange peel, lime and passionfruit.

Title: Mayacamas Chardonnay 2015, California
Description: James Suckling called this 2015 vintage ''a wonderful, linear and bright white'' when he gave it 94 points. Decanter gave it the same score. Grown at lofty heights, the Mayacamas Chardonnay bursts with roasted cashews and hazelnuts, waxy lemon and lime zest. The finish is clean and long.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Blossom, Green Apple, Hazelnut, Peach

Title: MoÃ«t & Chandon Grand Vintage RosÃ© 2012/15
Description: This is only made during exceptional years. And 2012 marks MoÃ«t & Chandon's 43rd Grand Vintage RosÃ©. The 2012 vintage was marked excellent. Pinot Meunier, which stands out in notes of blood orange, cherry and grapefruit. Extraordinary on its own or with dessert.

Title: Mon Plaisir du Sud RosÃ© 2019
Description: One of the most awarded producers in France made this exclusive pink just for Majestic customers. The result...A joyful burst of soft red-berry flavours and moreish crisp acidity the Mon Plaisir is  the perfect accompaniment to sun-dappled patios.

Title: Montes â€˜Alphaâ€™ Cabernet 2018, Colchagua Valley
Description: Montes was founded in 1987 by winemaker Aurelio Montes and Douglas Murray. Their vision was to produce Chilean wines of premium quality. They've continued to raise the bar for the country ever since. And the name is now one of the most celebrated in South American wine. This is rich and layered Cabernet, with notes of ripe black fruit, sweet tobacco and spice. Serve at 17-19 degrees with beef ribs or cellar for up to a decade.

Title: Montes 'Reserva' Malbec 2021/22, Colchagua Valley
Description: In 1987, Aurelio Montes and Douglas Murray had a vision: to create the finest Chilean wine. They have since played a huge part in transforming the country's reputation. And today, Montes is one of the most well-respected winemaking names in South America. This wine is made from some of Chile's oldest Malbec vines. As older vines nourish the tastiest grapes, you can expect something truly special. It's smooth and silky, with flavours of strawberry, cherry, plum jam and vanilla. It has a balanced acidity that works excellently with cheese.
