Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Chocolate, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Morellino di Scansano Organic Poggioargentiera 2020
Description: In Scansano, in the southern part of Tuscany, Morellino is the local name for Sangiovese. In this case blended with 15% Ciliegiolo, another indigenous local grape, this is a slim and youthful style of red, with only a third of the blend spending 6-8 months in new oak. Ripe cherry and strawberry fruit forms the backbone of this wine, which is medium-bodied and approachable, and fresh in feel. A subtly rustic streak gives a touch of complexity and food friendliness. Partner with anything from lamb chops to game, either immediately or within the next 5 years.

Title: Most Wanted Lodi Zinfandel 2017, California
Description: The Most Wanted Zinfandel is grown in Lodi, in California's Central Valley, which is renowned for Zinfandel wines. Uncork a heady marriage of ripe blackberry, dark cherry and plum powered by a coating mouthfeel and plush tannins.

Title: Mud House 'Claim 431' Pinot Noir 2017/20, Central Otago
Description: Mud House are no one-trick pony. Their reputation for producing fantastic wine stretches far beyond Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. This is made in New Zealandâ€™s Central Otago region, where the fussy Pinot Noir grape has found a perfect home in the mountainous, cool-climate terrain. Itâ€™s made from a single-vineyard in the prestigious sub-region of Bendigo. The Claim 431 Vineyard sits within an old gold-mining hillside, where ancient soils and cooling breezes benefit the vines. The resulting wine has an elegant structure, with pristine flavours and freshness. Vibrant. Fresh. Supple. Discover dark plum and ripe cherry flavours, with subtle hints of earthiness and woodspice. The lively aromas and acidity makes it a great match for a big bowl of fresh pesto pasta.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Black Cherry, Blackberry, Red Fruit

Title: Mud House RosÃ© 2020/21, Marlborough
Description: You may know Mud House best for their Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. But it's clear the estate is no one-trick pony, as this rosÃ© really rewards the adventurous drinker. Itâ€™s made of 95% Sauvignon Blanc and 5% Pinot Noir â€“ sip this blind and you'll be surprised it's a rosÃ©. If you like Kiwi Sauvignon, it's the perfect pink. Itâ€™s lively and tropical, with aromas of fresh red berries, and a long finish. Try it with fresh salads or sushi.

Title: Muga Rioja Prado Enea Gran Reserva 2015
Description: Muga's legendary Prado Enea scored 99 points when James Suckling listed it as number #3 of his 'Top Wines in the World'. It also bagged 96 Parker Points and 97 from Tim Atkin MW. You'll struggle to find a more decorated Rioja, and you'll taste the brilliance of three years of ageing in a silky palate that's full of blackcurrant, forest-floor, tobacco and vanilla notes.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Cocoa, Prune, Red Fruit

Title: Muga 'SelecciÃ³n Especial' Rioja Reserva 2018
Description: Muga is arguably the most traditional bodega in Rioja. The estate even has its own cooperage â€“ a reflection of the care and precision that goes into their winemaking. â€˜Special Selectionâ€™ is only made in the very best years. It's a powerful, complex wine. Youâ€™ll find intense aromas of ripe red and black berries, coffee, and subtle hints of mint and smoky oak. Itâ€™s silky smooth in texture with well-structured tannins and spice. The fresh acidity and smokiness will complement a rich game dish like bacon-wrapped roast partridge.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: Nautilus Chardonnay 2019, Marlborough
Description: At Nautilus, everything is done with sustainability in mind. The winery is part of the Sustainable Winegrowers New Zealand programme and has been owned by the same dedicated family for 25 years. In this Chardonnay, expect classic notes of nectarine and almond, with a creamy finish to come as it matures. Match this luxurious white with an equally creamy pasta.

Title: Nero Oro Appassimento 2019/20 Magnum, Sicily
Description: James Martin called Nero Oro "absolutely fantastic". Made in the appassimento method, where grapes are dried in the sun so richness is turbocharged, by a winemaker who once scored a perfect 100 Parker Points, it's a spicy, rich assemblage of black fruits.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Sweet Spice

Title: Nicosia Etna Rosso DOC
Description: Have you tried a wine made on a volcano before? This is made on Europe's most active one, Mount Etna. The fifth-generation winemaker behind it creates it from Nerello Mascalese and Nerello Cappuccio grapes. And these varieties really excel in these volcanic soils at this high altitude. As a result, this is an elegant, light red wine, with notes of cherry and redcurrant. Think Nebbiolo meets Pinot Noir. Fantastic with pasta and Parmigiano Reggiano.

Title: Gonzalez Byass 'Noe' 30-Year-Old Pedro Ximenez Sherry Half Bottle
Description:
Made from partially sun-and-air-dried grapes, which are then pressed, fermented, fortified, then aged in Gonzales-Byass's Nectar solera. A proportion is transferred to the Noe solera, where a blend of vintages of at least 30 years-of-age create this unique sherry. Thick, sticky, luscious and viscous, this sherry is super-sweet yet hugely complex and involving. Flavours of dates, cinnamon, clove, treacle and caramel combine like a silky, liquid pudding. Drink with Christmas pudding, or drizzle over quality vanilla ice cream for an indulgent treat.

In 2023, this wine won an IWSC gold award.
Characteristics: Toffee, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Coffee, Fig, Raisin

Title: Nos Terroirs Bios Vacqueyras Blanc 2019
Description: This is an organic white RhÃ´ne blend of Roussanne, Marsanne, Grenache Blanc, Viognier and Clairette. The winemaker picks each grape from a specifically selected site, intervenes as little as possible in the process and ages the wine on texture-building lees. The result is a rich, complex white with notes of tropical fruit and white flowers. Pair with roast chicken.

Title: Olivier Tricon â€˜LÃ©on Valleretâ€™ Chablis 2020
Description: Chablis is where you'll find some of the world's most celebrated Chardonnays. Wines here are crisp and citrusy â€“ a far cry from the richer styles that you'll find in much of Burgundy and California. Vines draw water from deep limestone soils, adding lively minerality. This is made in stainless steel tanks adding to its vibrant and fresh character. It has notes of crisp green apple, lemon, acacia honey and wet-stone minerality. Perfect with a seafood platter.

Title: Orin Swift Palermo 2019/21, California
Description: Unashamedly powerful and fruity this is resplendent with cherry and raspberry flavours followed buy notes of sweet spice and star anise.
Characteristics: Sweet Spice, Blackcurrant, Liquorice, Raspberry, Red Cherry

Title: Our 1000 Pledge Malbec 2017, Mendoza
Description: Winemakers in Mendoza know that high-altitude vineyards are the secret to high-quality wines. For this wine, a pledge was made to only use grapes grown 1000 metres and higher in an effort to produce the best expression of Malbec. Itâ€™s an adventurous collaboration of six different winemakers with parcels from five vineyards all planted at over 1200 metres. These lofty sites allow the grapes to ripen perfectly in the warm sunlight and also retain fresh aromatic flavours during the cool nights. Itâ€™s fresh and juicy with bright flavours of plum, blackberry and hints of violets and black pepper. Enjoy its bright acidity with the richness of red-meat dishes or mature cheddar.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Plum, Floral, Spice

Title: Oyster Bay Merlot 2020/21, Hawke's Bay
Description:
Oyster Bay has been producing wine of international acclaim since winning the 'Best International Sauvignon' at the 1991 IWSC. A leading example of the 'New Zealand Style', fashioned from fruit grown in Hawkes Bay's Bordeaux-esque climate. Plumy, jammy and ripe berry fruits augmented by hints of spice, toasted oak and chocolate aromas are followed by a rich, rounded and fruity palate with subtle oak and spices and an intense finish. Enjoy over the next three years with everything from pizza to spaghetti bolognese and from roast turkey to pork chops.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Chocolate

Title: Paolo Leo 'RenÃ¨e Bianco Organic' 2020/21, Puglia
Description: The family behind Paolo Leo winery have been making wine since the 18th century. So they know a thing or two about getting the best out of the Puglian soil. Their passion for Italy is reflected in the fact they choose to farm organically. We think the fruit really stands out as a result. In certainly shows in this blend of Chardonnay, Fiano and Sauvignon Blanc, with its rich notes of tropical fruit and citrus acidity. Pair with delicate white fish.

Title: Parcel Series Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir 2020
Description: Our Parcel Series collection is for when top-class wineries need to make space in their cellars quickly and discreetly. So we pick up their wines at a fraction of the usual price and pass the savings onto you. The catch? We can't tell you who makes it. This is the very exciting 50th entry to the Parcel Series range. It's one of our best savings yet, as it usually sells for three times the price. It's a Sonoma Pinot that takes on the finest red Burgundy. It's even aged for 30 months in Burgundy barrels. This brings a delicious oak spice to its notes of wild strawberries. Try it with duck pancakes.
Characteristics: Cream, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Vanilla

Title: Pasqua â€˜Mater Annaâ€™ RosÃ© 2021/22, Delle Venezie DOC
Description: The Mater Anna is a single-vineyard rosÃ© wine made from a strict selection of Pinot Grigio grapes in the beautiful Matteranetta vineyard in Verona. The result is a fresh and well- balanced wine that stands out with its floral notes, which meld with hints of peach and apricot.

Title: Pasqua Bardolino Chiaretto DOC 2020/21
Description: With Pinot Grigio rosÃ© in huge demand, quality can be patchy as some producers try to keep up. Bardolino Chiaretto offers a top quality alternative from a region already recognised for its fantastic reds. Made by customer favourite producer Pasqua on the shores of Lake Garda, this is the perfect rosÃ© for summer. At just 12%, it's fresh and elegant, with youthful notes of cherry, raspberry and strawberry.

Title: Paul Cluver Sauvignon Blanc 2020, Elgin
Description: Paul Cluver is a family-owned winery based in Elgin, South Africa. After noticing the region's potential for cool-climate winemaking, they ripped our the apple trees and planted vines in the mid 19th century. Today, they're fondly recognised by wine critics for their great value. This is a fresh and expressive Sauvignon Blanc, with notes of grapefruit and gooseberries. Try it with pesto pasta.

Title: Pedro's Almacenista Selection Amontillado Sherry
Description: Pedro's "Almacenista Selection" Amontillado is selected from the family Almacenista Garcia Jarana, who has dedicated his time to ageing and treasuring over 400 butts of old Sherry. This Amontillado is one of the true wines of Jerez. The subtle and delicate bouquet, suggests notes of hazelnut on the nose, yet with light reminders of yeast but smooth on the palate giving a fresh finish. This is an excellent match for soups and consommÃ©s, Tuna, wild mushrooms, hard cheeses like Manchego or Cheddar and as Japanese/Asian influenced dishes.

Title: Pedro's Almacenista Selection Fino
Description: This Fino is selected from 2 different Bodegas in the centre of Jerez; the first, provides fresh youthful stock. The second, Almacenista (stock holder)provides the older wine which ensures the wines complexity and secondary characters. Bone dry, the Intense flor character is complemented by almond and fresh apple notes giving a fresh finish. An excellent match for all types of tapas, especially olives, nuts, smoked hams and shellfish, as well as Asian or Indian cuisine. Serve at 6-8oc and consume within 2 weeks of opening.

Title: Pedro's Almacenista Selection Oloroso Sherry
Description: Selected by Pedro Dauthieu, the wine has an average age of 20 years. The must selected for an Oloroso is always more fragrant but also more robust or as they say in Jerez; basto. It is a highly pure Oloroso, as it has not been blended with anything other than the same style of Oloroso's from near identical butts. Exquisite and fully of complexity, with intense aromas of toasted walnuts and autumn leaves. Warm and expansive on the palate - an excellent match for red meats, casseroles and chicken and Vegetable paellas. Consume within 1 month of opening.

Title: Pedro's Almacenista Selection Palo Cortado Sherry
Description: Very rare style of sherry that falls between the elegance of Amontillado and the richness and complexity of Oloroso. From the cellar of Cayetano del Pino, this is a truly magnificent example of the style.

Title: Penfolds 'Bin 389' Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz 2019/21, Australia
Description: Penfolds is unquestionably one of Australia's finest producers. Its most famous wine, Grange, today costs over Â£500. This is affectionately referred to as 'Baby Grange' by the winery, as it's   partly aged in barrels that the year before held its much-desired sibling. It's a blend of almost equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz that has flavours of liquorice, stewed plum, blackcurrant, dark chocolate and coffee. Drink now with slow-cooked lamb or age until 2040.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Black Pepper, Mint

Title: Penfolds Bin A Chardonnay 2019
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Smoke

Title: Penfolds 'St Henri' Shiraz 2018, South Australia
Description: Penfolds began in 1844 and is arguably Australia's finest winery. Today, chief winemaker is Newcastle-born Peter Gago. He makes St Henri with the same methods that have been applied since it began in the 1950s. It stands out amongst many of the other very best red wines in the country, as it doesn't rely on the use on new oak. It's concentrated and rich, with flavours of black cherry, blackberry, damson, chocolate, coffee, pepper and vanilla. Drink now with lamb or cellar until 2055.
Characteristics: Black Cherry, Black Pepper, Blackberry, Chocolate, Coffee, Vanilla

Title: Petaluma Chardonnay 2019/21, Piccadilly Valley
Description: Taken from the cool Piccadilly Valley of the Adelaide Hills, Petaluma Chardonnay's creamy, turbocharged palate of cashews, butter and grapefruit won a huge 95 points and a Gold medal at the 2019 Decanter World Wine Awards. That's yet another trophy for the former 'Decanter Man of the Year' Brian Croser, who changed the wine world forever at Hardy's.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Smoke

Title: Petaluma 'Hanlin Hill' Riesling 2020/21, Clare Valley
Description: Clare Valley is one of Australia's oldest wine regions. To this day, it's most famed for its remarkable Riesling. And Petaluma is one of its best wineries. They carefully choose their vineyards to make the most of the region's amazing grape-growing conditions. The result is a Riesling that's bursting with beautiful citrus peel, orange blossom and tropical fruit notes. This is the perfect match for equally aromatic Thai food.
Characteristics: Lime, Blossom, Citrus Fruit, Coconut, Cream, Floral, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Honey, Lemon

Title: Peter Lehmann '8 Songs' Shiraz 2016
Description: This release is part of Peter Lehmann's Masters range, and each wine is named after a person or event that has played a role in the Peter Lehmann story. This bottle is a tribute to 'Eight Songs for a Mad King' â€“ one of Lehmann's favourite musical ensembles. The aim was to replicate the soft melodies in fine wine form. The result? An opulent, complex Shiraz that's been praised by numerous critics. The 2016 vintage was given a 93 point score by Australia's leading wine critic, James Halliday. Expect aromas of plum, cocoa and sweet spice. Partner with braised beef.

Title: Peter Lehmann Masters 'Margaret' Semillon 2013, Barossa Valley
Description: Peter Lehmann rewrote the rulebook on Barossa Semillon in the early 90s, eschewing oak and opting for an early-picked style that lent itself to ageing. The result is the Margaret Semillon. Containing only the best of the vintage, and released after five years of cellaring, it has aromas of citrus and some waxy, honeyed development that's typical of aged Semillon. On the palate you'll find notes of lemon, lanolin and beeswax.
Characteristics: Peach, Butter, Floral, Grass, Honeysuckle, Lime, Passionfruit

Title: Peter Lehmann 'Mentor' Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: This release is part of Peter Lehmann's Masters range, and each wine is named after a person or event that has played a key role in the Lehmann story. Peter mentored countless people over his career, and this wine is a fitting tribute to his legacy â€“ so you know you're in for something excellent. Itâ€™s smooth and velvety with lush blackcurrant, cedar and cocoa notes. Fantastic with braised lamb shanks.

Title: Peter Lehmann 'The Barossan' Shiraz 2019 Magnum, Barossa
Description: With rolling hills, hot, dry summers and some of the world's oldest vines, Barossa is arguably the finest spot in the New World for full-bodied, juicy reds. And this shows the very best of the region. Peter Lehmann Wines, one of the biggest names in Australian winemaking, went all over Barossa to capture its best elements. It's rich and heady with notes of raspberry, dark plum, strawberry, mocha and liquorice. Whatâ€™s more, it's in celebration-perfect magnum form. Drink this with a steak.
Characteristics: Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Coffee, Leather, Smoke

Title: Peter Lehmann 'VSV' Shiraz 2016, Barossa
Description: Peter Lehmann only make their coveted VSV range on the Barossa Valley's most exceptional vintages. When a 'Very Special Vineyard' delivers a great balance between the land and the fruit. This Shiraz shows notes of blackberry, dark chocolate and spice. Serve with braised beef.
Characteristics: Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Vanilla

Title: Peter Lehmann 'Wigan' Riesling 2014, Barossa Valley
Description: Taking its name from Peter Lehmann's ex-Chief Winemaker, this Riesling is truly world-class. It has been named the best in the world six times and has won more than 80 trophies since its first vintage. Discover crisp notes of lime and flowers. Serve with oysters.

Title: Peyrassol 'Le Clos' RosÃ©, Provence 2020
Description: The Commanderie de Peyrassol estate was founded by the Knights Templar in the 12th century. Today, it's the home of some of Provence's most-popular rosÃ©. This one is the estate's magnum opus. It's created only in the very best vintages with grapes hand-picked from their finest vineyard â€“ and just 10,000 bottles are produced each vintage. It has complex aromas of red fruits, peach and sweet spices. Try it with grilled sea bream.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Floral, Grapefruit, Herbaceous, Peach, Raspberry

Title: Philippe le Hardi 'Les Platanes d'Henri IV' 2019/20, Santenay
Description: This is made on a magnificent 9th century estate that's named after the first Duke of Burgundy, Philippe le Hardi. He, interestingly, became famous when he banned Gamay from the region in 1395. Today, this is the hub of environmentally friendly, excellently produced wines, like this Santenay. It's rich, ripe and complex, with notes of stone fruits, vanilla and honey. Serve lightly chilled with Camembert.

Title: Pieropan â€˜Calvarinoâ€™ Organic Soave Classico DOC 2020
Description: If you like Soave, that fresh northern Italian white wine, you're in for a treat with Pieropan. Theyâ€™re practically synonymous. Pieropan have been producing great wines in Veneto since the 1890s and were the first to use the Soave name on their bottles. Calvarino, their first single-vineyard Soave, debuted in 1971, and its delicious, mineral character is part of what has cemented Pieropan to world-renowned status today. 30-to-60-year-old Garganega and Trebbiano vines produce a well-balanced, elegant wine with aromas of honey, almond, citrus and white flowers. With such a long finish, it can pair brilliantly with all kinds of dishes, including seafood, light pastas and roast chicken.

Title: Pieropan â€˜La Roccaâ€™ Soave Classico Organic 2020
Description: Pieropan are the biggest name in fantastic Soave. They were the first producer to label wines with the Soave name back in the 1930s and continue to fly the flag for the region today. Their organic wines have a signature richness and zest. This one is from a single vineyard, La Rocca, where limestone soils produce distinctly rich and opulent wines. It has aromas of almond and honey and flavours of ripe apricot and exotic fruit. Try it with seafood linguine.

Title: Pierre Gaillard Domaine Madeloc 'CuvÃ©e Serral' 2017, Collioure
Description: One of the most prestigious family names in the RhÃ´ne Valley has taken to the CÃ´te RÃ´tie-like soils close to the Spanish border. When you taste this, you'll be glad they made the journey. It's full-bodied, velvety and has ripe black-fruit flavours and a lingering finish. Try this with sausage and mash.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Dried Herbs, Spice

Title: Pio Cesare Nebbiolo 2016/17, Langhe
Description: Barolo may hog the limelight, but the larger region of Langhe in which it sits is home to some equally impressive Nebbiolo wines. Pio Cesareâ€™s Barolo is world-renowned â€“ and they pay just as much care and attention to this wine as their most sought-after bottles. Grapes are carefully hand-picked â€“ including some from their highly-regarded Barolo and Barbaresco vineyards. The wine is then aged in oak for 24 months, creating a full-bodied, savoury red. Itâ€™s remarkably fresh, with intense notes of ripe and juicy red fruits. Rich roast lamb will balance its firm tannins perfectly.

Title: Domaine Figeat 'Melody XXL' Pouilly-FumÃ© 2020
Description: If youâ€™re a lover of mineral, flinty and uniquely smoky Sauvignon Blanc, look to the region of Pouilly-FumÃ©. Itâ€™s one of the Loire Valleyâ€™s most iconic whites, rivalled only by the revered wines of its neighbour, Sancerre. And the Figeat family are experts in the field, with ten generations of winemaking heritage. This complex example is crafted by AndrÃ© Figeat and his daughter, Anne-Sophie, who honed her skills at the legendary Marlborough producer Cloudy Bay. The Figeat family apply a no-expense-spared winemaking philosophy: strict pruning measures, rigorous attention to detail and plenty of patience â€“ all bringing the ripest flavours to your glass. Expect clean aromas of gooseberry, lemon and white flowers, and a long, citrusy finish. Its fresh acidity and trademark smoky character make it a perfect complement for smoked salmon.

Title: Pratuccio Chianti 2019/20
Description: Dry and possessing a velvety softness this is an ideal food wine. Pair the cherry flavours with herb infused pasta and lamb dishes.

Title: Puligny-Montrachet 1er Cru 'La Garenne' 2015 Duc de Magenta, Jadot
Description: A superb Puligny boasting perfumed aromas of lemon, apple, peach, Seville oranges, roasted almonds, minerals and just a touch of oak. Rich and textured in the mouth, there is a seamless transition between the aromas and the flavours on the palate. A magnificent racy acidity that helps to give the wine real grip and focus, and provides a wonderfully dry finish. Delicious in its youth, but will drink for 10+ years.
Characteristics: Butter, Cream, Hazelnut, Honey, Stone Fruit

Title: Quinta do Casal Branco 'Reserva Branco' 2020, Tejo
Description: Like rich white Burgundy, but not the high price it commands? You're in for a treat with this discovery from Tejo, Portugal, which is crafted by two of the region's very best winemakers on a 17th century estate. It's made from the indigenous FernÃ£o Pires grape variety, which grows on old vines, and aged in oak. Expect flavours of citrus, tropical fruits and toasty cedar. It's a truly indulgent white wine that will stand up to plenty of foods, particularly a rich casserole.

Title: Radford Dale 'Freedom' Pinot Noir 2019/21, Elgin
Description: Alex Dale left Burgundy for winemaking liberty just weeks after Nelson Mandela was elected president of South Africa - and that's when the 'Freedom' Pinot Noir began. This is fresh, perfumed and complex, with notes of strawberry, bramble fruit, oak and spice.  Serve at room temperature with a hearty stew.

Title: Ramey 'Rochioli Vineyard' Chardonnay 2015, Russian River Valley
Description: After working for two decades at world-famous wineries, such as Dominius, David Ramey went his own way with Ramey Wine Cellars. It's safe to say he's excelled with this single-vineyard Chardonnay. Aged for 20 months in vanilla-imparting oak, the alluring hints of sweet spice, creamy stone fruits grapefruit and citrus in this full-bodied white scored 94 Parker Points.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Cream, Green Apple, Peach, Sweet Spice

Title: Remi Seguin Gevrey-Chambertin Premier Cru 2016/17
Description: This is a complex, harmonious Pinot Noir made from premier cru vineyards in Gevrey-Chambertin. It's full-bodied and structured, with flavours of ripe black fruit, prune and cinnamon, refeshing acidity and ripe tannins. Serve at 16-17 degrees with lamb. Drink now or cellar for 5-10 years.

Title: RÃ©mi Seguin Morey-Saint-Denis 2018/19
Description: What Morey-Saint-Denis lacks in size, it more than makes up for in character. This village is known for its complex red wines. And this intriguing, perfumed red Burgundy is among the best we've found. Expect notes of raspberry and kirsch, with a hint of aniseed. A delicious alternative to Gevry-Chambertin at great value. Try it with pork.

Title: Reyneke 'Vinehugger' Organic Red 2019/20, Western Cape
Description: Reyneke believe thereâ€™s a lot to be said about the way wine used to be made. Back when the farm started over 150 years ago, there were no chemicals involved in keeping vines healthy. So thatâ€™s why, in 2000, they switched to fully organic, biodynamic practices. Their wines have since won countless awards, and in 2020 they were described as one of South Africaâ€™s â€˜First Growthâ€™ wineries by top critic Tim Atkin MW. This juicy red is a brilliant demonstration of their skill. Part of the wine spends eight months in oak, making it smooth and approachable. Youâ€™ll find notes of plum, blackcurrant and peppery spice that are perfect with lamb dishes.
Characteristics: Red Fruit, Black Fruit, Black Pepper

Title: Ridge East Bench Zinfandel 2019/20, Sonoma County
Description: Ridge has made the East Bench as a single-site zinfandel since 2006. One of only two Ridge zinfandels that is entirely from the single varietal. The vineyard sits high atop the bench land that overlooks Dry Creek Valley from the east. A nose of rich raspberry and pepper accompanied by floral and mineral notes. The palate is layered with dark cherry and black currant fruit, mineral, and cocoa. Balanced acidity with fine tannins on the finish.
Characteristics: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Cocoa

Title: Ridge Geyserville Zinfandel 2019/20, Alexander Valley
Description: Ridge Vineyards have been the darlings of critical praise for decades. They were some of the first to champion old-vine Zinfandel, making it since 1964. And some of the vines behind this Zinfandel-dominated blend are over 130-years-old. Expect intense notes of black cherry, oak spice, cola, mint and blackcurrant. It's excellent with turkey and pulled pork.
Characteristics: Red Fruit, Black Fruit, Blueberry, Raisin

Title: Rijckaert - F. Rouve â€˜Sur le Marnesâ€™ Chardonnay 2020, CÃ´tes du Jura
Description: Youâ€™d think that itâ€™s seriously tough to impress Jean Rijckaert, who was the first person to make wine in both Burgundy and Jura. But Florent Rouve has done it, to say the least. Rijckaert is synonymous with great Chardonnay. And he put the young, talented winemaker in charge of his winery when retiring in 2013. Rouve continues to work using his mentorâ€™s principles: restricted yields, hand-picked grapes, a lot of patience and very little meddling â€“ and the winery has gone from strength to strength since. This is made in CÃ´tes du Jura, which is in the foothills of the French Alps. Florent ages it in small oak barrels and makes it Burgundy-style. It's fresh, creamy and mineral, with citrus and floral aromas. Enjoy with indulgent chicken dishes.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Ginger, Green Apple, Lemon, Sweet Spice

Title: Rioja Crianza Boyante 2016
Description: Crianza is Rioja at its fruit-forward best. The Boyante is aged for a year in American oak to smooth tannins and unleash the plentiful red fruit notes. Violets, bramble fruits and perfumed jasmine aromas entwine with hints of pepper and sweet spice.

Title: Rioja Reserva Marques de Riscal 2016/18 Magnum
Description: In 1858, Don Guillermo Hurtado de AmÃ©zaga, the MarquÃ©s de Riscal brought groundbreaking winemaking techniques from Bordeaux and transformed the face of Rioja. The Reserva is one of their iconic wines, widely regarded as one of the top examples of traditional Rioja. A classic Rioja Reserva. Full bodied and muscular, yet smoothly polished and embellished with complex aromas of vanilla and toasted oak, combined with summer fruit flavours. This wine goes well with ham, cheeses, and spicy casseroles. Will age for a further 5+ years.

Title: Rioja Reserva ViÃ±a Ardanza 2015/16 Magnum, La Rioja Alta
Description: One of the very best of Rioja's produced from fruit exclusively grown in the bodega's 360 hectare vineyard holdings in the Rioja Alta region, and named after one of the Region's founding families. Remaining under family ownership, this is of the most sought-after bodegas. Complex and perfumed primary and secondary aromas of earth, spice and red fruits with a long, elegantly structured medium weight body of spicy tannins and layers of flavour. Enjoy over the next decade as the richness and power will soften to spice and earth, augmenting game casserole or wild duck.
Characteristics: Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice, Vanilla

Title: Romeo & Juliet Sparkling RosÃ©, Veneto
Description: Although located around 100km west of Treviso, the romantically inspiring city of Verona is where Pasqua was founded in 1925, as well as having provided the backdrop for Shakespeare's Romeo & Juliet. Pale salmon in colour, fresh on the nose with notes of pear and red fruits. On the palate it is dry with hints of red fruits and refreshing acidity.

Title: Ropiteau FrÃ¨res Chassagne-Montrachet 2020/21
Description: In 1848, Jean Ropiteau saw opportunity. The arrival of Meursault's first railway meant that he could make his white Burgundy successful all over the world. So he bought his own winery and began making oak barrels. Today, this estate makes some of Burgundy's most respected wines. It really shows in this Chassagne-Montrachet. It's bold, rich and ripe, with flavours of stone fruit, honeysuckle and buttery almond. Serve at 12-13 degrees and pair with East Asian food.

Title: RosÃ© d'Anjou 'Feu!' 2020/21 Les Caves de la Loire
Description: The Loire Valley is famed for its fresh rosÃ© and Anjou produces some of the best. A blend of Grolleau, and a dash of Gamay, Feu! is a moreish pink with refreshing acidity and a touch of sweetness typical for the region. The result is a thirst-quenching rosÃ© with bright notes of redcurrant, rosehip and strawberry.

Title: Routes Catalanes Blanc 2019/20, CÃ´tes Catalanes
Description: Catalanes is nestled between the the Mediterranean sea, the PyrÃ©nÃ©es and Corbieres mountains. This region is a melting pot of French and Spanish cultures, and this reflects in this zesty, aromatic white. It's a blend of Grenache Blanc, Muscat, Chardonnay that has flavours of citrus, orange and lemon. Excellent with fish.
Characteristics: Red Apple, Floral, Honeysuckle, Lemon, Peach

Title: Routes Catalanes Rouge 2019/20, CÃ´tes Catalanes
Description: Catalanes is nestled between the the Mediterranean sea, the PyrÃ©nÃ©es and Corbieres mountains. This region is a melting pot of French and Spanish cultures, and this reflects in this plump, juicy red. It's a blend of predominantly Syrah and Grenache that has flavours of blackberry and dark cherry and a smooth, easy-going palate. An excellent match for pizza or tomato-based pasta.

Title: Rustenberg â€˜Five Soldiersâ€™ Chardonnay 2021, Stellenbosch
Description: The Rustenberg winery dates back to 1682, when German Roelof Pasman recognised the farmâ€™s grape-growing potential. Itâ€™s been operated by the Barlow family for the past 80 years, and theyâ€™ve created some exceptional bottles. Today, head winemaker is Murray Barlow, the only person to win Diners Club's Young Winemaker of the Year award twice. This is his finest Chardonnay, and it comes highly sought after. The grapes behind it are hand-harvested, and the wine aged for 16 months in oak to give a creamy finish. Itâ€™s complex and full-bodied, with plenty of ripe citrus, melon and peach flavours. Try it with rich chicken or pork dishes or age it for a decade. In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.

Title: Rutherglen Shelley's Block Marsanne, Viognier, Rousanne 2018
Description: Rutherglen has long been known for its fortified whites. But if you scratch the surface, you'll find sublime dry whites too. This Marsanne, Viogner and Roussanne blend is reminiscent of top ChÃ¢teauneuf-du-Pape Blanc. That's why it won a gold medal and a 95-point score at this year's International Wine Challenge. It's fermented in French oak and aged on character-building lees for seven months, resulting in a zesty palate of apricot, ginger and hazelnut.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Apricot, Butter, Honey, Melon, Peach

Title: Sacha Lichine Sauvignon Blanc
Description: You might recognise the name Sacha Lichine. He's the man behind the iconic Whispering Angel. But his expertise expands beyond Provence pink. For his Sauvignon, he enlisted the help of none other than Patrick LÃ©on, the previous director of ChÃ¢teau Mouton Rothschild. Together, they created something truly special that lives on today through Patrick's son, Bertrand. It's made from a selection of vines from Languedoc and Gascogne. The sun-drenched growing conditions bring flavours of lemon, gooseberry, pear and grass. Match its rich flavours with trout.

Title: Saint Clair â€˜Pioneer Block 5 Bull Blockâ€™ Pinot Gris 2020, Marlborough
Description: Husband and wife team Judy and Neal Ibbotson are Marlborough pioneers. In in the 1970s. Judy helped plant the region's first vineyard with the help of three pre-school children and local women. Over the years their profile grew, as they were named New Zealand Winery of the Year and received widespread respect for their fantastic white wines. This Pinot Gris is made from a vineyard, in Omaka Valley, which was originally a stud block for Jersey bulls. It has notes of fresh-cut pear, honeydew melon and spice with a hint of sweetness and a fresh natural acidity. Sip it with crayfish or a soft, ripe cheese, like Brie.

Title: Saint Clair â€˜Pioneer Blockâ€™ Viognier 2020, Hawkeâ€™s Bay
Description: Despite being self-taught winemakers, Neal and Judy Ibbotson's first vintage saw every wine win medals, including gold. They're now one of New Zealand's most accomplished producers. This is a Condrieu-esque Viognier with a Kiwi twist. It's rich and complex with intense notes of white peach, nectarine, almond and nutmeg. Try this with pork or Thai green curry.
Characteristics: Peach, Almond, Apricot, Floral, Nectarine, Nutmeg

Title: Saint Clair 'Pioneer Block' Chardonnay 2019/20, Marlborough
Description: St. Clair have gone for maximum impact and expression with this Chardonnay, fermenting 100% of the grapes in a mixture of new and old French oak, before ageing the wine on for 9 months, with regular stirring to draw full character from the lees. The New Zealand trademarks of fresh and snappy peach and tropical fruits are finished with a wonderfully soft, generous texture and a biscuity edge. Rich, with plentiful amounts of pure, tropical fruit, this wine is fantastic with grilled asparagus or fish with parsley sauce.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Biscuit, Peach, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

Title: Saintsbury Pinot Noir 2017/18, Carneros
Description: In Carneros, the cool-climate spot of California that pampers the fussy Pinot Noir grape, the Saintsbury winery picks grapes at night and squeezes them within an hour. This brings a delightful freshness to a perfumed bouquet of rose petal, dark cherry, rhubarb and white pepper.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Rose

Title: San Leonino 'Al Limite' Chianti Classico DOCG 2018, Half Bottle
Description: San Leonino are serious about Sangiovese. They've focused almost solely on the grape for the past decade. As a result, this 100% Sangiovese half bottle contains all of the characteristic restraint and elegance that you'd expect from only the very best Chianti Classico. It's deep and aromatic with silky flavours of ripe cherries, violets, tobacco and menthol. It's rich enough now to stand up mature cheeses. But it'll continue to improve over the next ten years.
Characteristics: Earth, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Spice

Title: San Polo Brunello di Montalcino 2017
Description: San Polo is one of the rising-star estates in Italyâ€™s iconic Montalcino region. It has high-altitude vineyards â€“ making for its signature elegant, fresh wines. Its owned by Marilisa Allegrini, who is highly regarded for Amarone, and has been certified by the CasaClima organisation as sustainable since 2013. This is a excellent style of modern-day Brunello. It's rich and cedary, with aromas of violets and red berries and flavours of vanilla and coffee. It has been aged for 30 months in oak and six months in the bottle. This makes for indulgently smooth tannins which are fantastic with roast leg of lamb.
Characteristics: Earth, Leather, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: Sancerre Rouge "Les Bonnes Bouches" 2018/19, Henri Bourgeois
Description: Sancerre Rouge may be lesser known than its white counterpart, but it's some finest Pinot Noir produced in France. This is made by one of the region's most respected names and 11th generation winemakers, Henri Bourgeois. It's made from 40-year-old vines and aged in oak for up to eight months. The result is a refined Pinot with notes of morello cherry, violet and oak spice. This is sure to please adventurous red Burgundy fans. Serve with a hearty meat casserole.

Title: Sassicaia 2019/20, Bolgheri
Description: Sassicaia is widely acknowledged as one of the world's finest Cabernet-based wines. It made history as the first single wine to be granted it's own DOC. A true Super Tuscan. Expect aromas of exotic spice, baked plum, cherry, tobacco and liquorice. Drink 2022-2032, decant for at least two hours before serving and pair with cold-cut meats.

Title: Schloss Vollrads Riesling Kabinett Trocken 2018, Rheingau
Description: Schloss Vollrads' wines have historically been the choice of Europe's noble families. And they continue to create excellent wine today, like this delicious dry Riesling. It has flavours of Schloss apple, peach and apricot, and a long, dry finish. Excellent with Thai green curry.

Title: Selborne Classic CuvÃ©e Brut, England
Description: English fizz is making a real emergence on the sparkling-wine world map. In fact, some of Champagne's top houses are buying vineyard plots on the other side of the Channel. Ours epitomises why home-grown fizz is enjoying its moment in the spotlight. It's an elegant, creamy sparkling wine with all the fruits of a Hampshire summertime. That's why we named it in tribute the naturalist who inspired Charles Darwin.
Characteristics: Pastry, Citrus Fruit, Cream, Green Apple

Title: Shaw + Smith Shiraz 2019, Australia
Description:
Shaw & Smith was founded in 1990 by Martin Shaw and Michael Hill-Smith, Australiaâ€™s first ever Australian Master of Wine. Thirty years later itâ€™s one of most in demand names in Australian fine wine. In the cool-climate Adelaide Hills, the duo is committed to the finest soil and vine health, using grazing sheep to farm sustainably and picking every grape by hand. Thatâ€™s a series of costly practices. But the result is some of the most elegant Shiraz youâ€™ll discover in the New World. This is a restrained and sophisticated wine, with notes of blackberry, black pepper and well-integrated oak. It has ripe tannins that are fantastic with protein-rich meats, like sirloin steak.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Earth, Liquorice, Vanilla

Title: Silver Ghost Cabernet Sauvignon 2021/22, Central Valley
Description: Quality and cost arenâ€™t necessarily linked. This wine is made for us by one of the most prestigious winemaking families in Chile, the Arestis. Their winery is 100% female owned, and they have and instinctive understanding of how to get the very best out of their grapes, while still keeping prices wallet-friendly. Chilean wine is always incredible value â€“ but itâ€™s the Arestisâ€™ skill which makes this particular wine such great quality at such a great price. Itâ€™s from the Central Valley which is cool but has loads of sunshine â€“ perfect conditions for fresh, juicy Cabernet Sauvignon like this. Itâ€™s really black-fruity â€“ bursting with blackberry and plum flavours. With a lovely silky texture, itâ€™s seriously drinkable red which makes it the ideal party wine. Itâ€™s great alone â€“ or with burgers.

Title: Son of a Bull Riesling 2019, Tasmania
Description: Tasmania's island location means it's gaining serious acclaim for fresh and exciting wines that offer serious thirst-quenching enjoyment. Made from the cooler region of Piper Hills, and picked at optimum ripeness, this is your chance to see what all the fuss is about. A fresh and racy Riesling, Son of a Bull has notes of crunchy green apple, citrus and spice. Like its name suggests, it's best enjoyed young and would work wonders alongside vibrant and spicy Thai flavours.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Green Apple, Lemon, Lime

Title: Springfield Estate 'Wild Yeast' Chardonnay 2020/21, Robertson
Description: This is an unoaked Chardonnay, made in the time-honoured method of wild yeast fermentation. This allows the natural yeasts present on the grapes to bring about fermentation, which takes a lengthy 60 days, but promotes greater richness and complexity of flavour. Immensely complex aromas of pineapple and pear mingling with nutty, yeasty cookie dough notes from extended lees ageing. The palate structure is firm, crisp and grippy. Drink with roasted or barbecued sea bass, trout or tuna.

Title: St Cosme 'Micro Cosme' Sauvignon-Viognier 2019/20, France
Description: Micro Cosme is a creation of one of the RhÃ´ne's most respected winemakers, Louis Barruol. A rare blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, it's aromatic and refreshing, with notes of apricot, lychee, grapefruit and mango.

Title: St Hallett 'Old Block' Shiraz 2016, Barossa Valley
Description: Led by winemaker Helen McCarthy, St Hallett draws inspiration from the climatic diversity in the Barossa Valley. To qualify for their coveted Old Block wine, vines must be 40 years or older. Expect intense flavours of dark fruit. Divine with lamb ribs.
Characteristics: Liquorice, Black Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Earth

Title: Stag's Leap 'Hands of Time' Red Blend 2018/19, Napa Valley
Description: Stagâ€™s Leap shocked the world and beat the finest Bordeaux in the legendary Judgment of Paris in 1976. Ever since, theirs have become some of the most collected wines in the world. This Bordeaux blend really shows why they demanded the respect of those wine critics 34 years ago. Expect notes of dark fruit and chocolate truffle. Try this with pork tacos.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot
Characteristics: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Tobacco

Title: Stone Arka Merlot 2017, Bulgaria
Description: From the award winning winery, Yamantievs, located in the Thracian Valley, which is the perfect location for grape growing in Bulgaria. This Merlot has ripe black fruit & spice aromas with hints of plum. The palate is silky smooth, with an elegant black fruit & plum-skin tone. The acid & tannin balance is perfect - a silky scaffold holding a dark-fruit heart.  It will enhance any meal with lamb or venison, but is equally at home alongside a spicy mushroom cassoulet.

Title: Stonier Pinot Noir 2020/21, Mornington Peninsula
Description: Mornington Peninsula has long been Australia's best spot for top-shelf Pinot Noir - and it's tough to secure the best for less than Â£25. Not now! Taste the cool-climate excellence in structured notes of red fruits and spice and a luscious finish.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Caramel, Coffee, Earth, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Smoke, Strawberry

Title: Stonier Reserve Chardonnay 2016, Mornington Peninsula
Description: With access to some of Australia's oldest cool-climate vineyards, Stonier has scooped buckets of awards with its Reserve Chardonnay. This 2017 vintage won 97 Decanter points and 95 points at the International Wine Challenge. Made with just a dash of new-oak ageing, it's a fruity cocktail of melon, apple and grapefruit that's lined by sweet spices and a balancing flintiness.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach

Title: Taittinger Comtes de Champagne 2008
Description: Only made in Taittinger's best vintages, the 2008 vintage of this prestigious Taittinger collection is elegant and irresistible. Budding collectors, take note. This is also an excellent cellaring wine. In this remarkable champagne, you'll find notes of honeysuckle and nuts. Enjoy on its own or with dessert.
Characteristics: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Green Fruit, Honey, Honeysuckle, Walnut

Title: Taittinger Comtes de Champagne 2011/12
Description:
Produced exclusively from top quality Chardonnay grapes grown in 'Grand Cru' rated vineyards. One of the greatest Blanc de Blancs champagnes, Comtes was first produced in 1952. A Champagne with the potential to age for decades and reward the more patient hedonist.

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2011 vintage.

Title: Tasca 'Regaleali' Bianco Di Sicilia 2020/21
Description: Made from local grape varieties on an estate owned by the noble Tasca family since the 1830s. Delicate but not bland, fruit flavours of apple, peach and pink grapefruit are to the fore of the crisp and refreshing wine. Best with shellfish, fish or vegetarian dishes.
Characteristics: Peach, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple

Title: Taylor's 'Historical Collection Reserve' Tawny Port
Description: This is a special edition that celebrates the year when Taylor's discovered fantastic new Douro vineyards. It's made from specially selected ports from the house's extensive stocks and is exceptionally rich. It has aromas of plum, fig and sultana and flavours of fruit cake. Excellent with a cheese board.
Secondary Grape Varieties: Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca, Tinta Cao, Tinta Roriz

Title: Taylor's Port 2007, Portugal
Secondary Grape Varieties: Touriga Nacional, Tinta Amarela, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca

Title: Te Mata Estate 'Awatea' Cabernets/Merlot 2017, Hawke's Bay
Description: First made in 1982, the Awatea is still the benchmark for great-value Hawke's Bay Cabernet/Merlot blends. Its intense hints of red and black fruit, plum and espresso, all chased by a heady finish and framed by fine tannins, scored 92 Wine Enthusiast points.
Characteristics: Smoke, Black Fruit, Blackcurrant, Coffee, Earth, Red Plum

Title: Ten Minutes by Tractor 'Down the Hill' Estate Pinot Noir 2017, Mornington Peninsula
Description: Mornington Peninsula is a sub-region of Victoria which, in recent years, has been identified as arguably the best area in Australia for cultivating the classic Burgundian varieties. The new 'Down the Hill' Estate Pinot Noir from Ten Minutes by Tractor is taken from warmer vineyards and matured for 11 months in French oak. The result is an approachable style, flush with red fruit and cranberry notes with dry tannins.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Black Fruit, Blackberry, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Savoury, Smoke

Title: Ten Minutes By Tractor Estate Chardonnay 2019/20, Mornington Peninsula
Description: Mornington Peninsula is a sub-region of Victoria which, in recent years, has been identified as arguably the best area in Australia for cultivating the classic Burgundian varieties. From the estate's Main Ridge vineyard, this Chardonnay is whole-bunch pressed and fermented with wild yeasts in French oak barriques.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Smoke, Sweet Spice

Title: Terredora Falanghina 2020/21
Description: One of Italy's great unsung white wines. Three months' lees ageing before bottling imbues the wine with added depth and texture, but no oak is used, so the wine retains a light and fruit-driven character. A brilliant all-rounder, with plenty of citrussy fruit and faint notes of apple and quince, with the merest hint of nutty complexity. The balance of crispness and texture means this accompanies a huge range of foods, from roasted vegetables to fish and poultry.

Title: The Bolney Estate Pinor Noir 2021/22, West Sussex
Description: Cool-climate Pinot Noir has long been celebrated the world over. But have you tried it from West Sussex? This is made by the family-owned Bolney Estate in the quintessentially English town of Bolney. It's vibrant and bright, with flavours of ripe strawberries, plums, red cherry, toasted almonds and leather. Great with asparagus, pork and game birds.

Title: The Guv'nor Magnum, Spain
Description: The Guv'nor, made from Tempranillo grapes by some of our favourite winemakers with no limits, was a huge, full-bodied result - and it just got bigger! Expect punchy notes of blackcurrant and vanilla aplenty in this magnum.

Title: The Hunting Lodge 'Home Block' Sauvignon Blanc 2019, Waimauku
Description: Older vines nourish the tastiest grapes. And The Hunting Lodge is home to some of the first commercial Sauvignon Blanc vines ever planted in New Zealand. Its history dates back to the 1860s. Today, winemaker Pete Turner makes Sauvignon Blanc with a real difference. This is aged in French oak, resulting in an rich, complex and textured wine with notes of pineapple and mango. Pete thinks this is his best vintage yet. Try it with pork chops.
Characteristics: Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Tropical Fruit

Title: The Hunting Lodge Seasonal Sauvignon Blanc 2020
Description: Older vines nourish the tastiest grapes. And The Hunting Lodge is home to some of the first commercial Sauvignon Blanc vines ever planted in New Zealand. Its history dates back to the 1860s. This bottle captures a modern, fresh expression of Sauvignon Blanc for their boutique range. Complex, aromatic and bright with pink grapefruit and herbal notes. Partner with fresh white fish dishes.
Characteristics: Grass, Green Apple, Lemon, Tropical Fruit

Title: The King's Desire RosÃ© 2020, Marlborough
Description: This is made by the man behind our bestselling white wine, Brent Marris. It turns out that the Southern Valleys of Marlborough can create rosÃ© with a nod to Provence when the right winemaker's on board. To make it, he hand-picks Pinot Noir grapes when they're at their ripest and handles the vast majority of them to preserve their fresh fruit flavour. Interestingly, he ferments the rest some of them in old oak and stirs them on their texture-building lees. As a result, this has some serious character. Expect notes of candied pear, mango, stone fruit and honeycomb. Try it with chargrilled Mediterranean vegetables.

Title: The Long Coast Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/20, Maipo Valley
Description: Maipo Valley is often referred to as 'the Bordeaux of South America'. And if you like claret, this is the Chilean red you'll love. It's rich and full-bodied, with notes of black fruits, spice and cedar. It has soft tannins which won't overpower the subtle flavours of grilled lamb.
Characteristics: Green Bell Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar

Title: The Ned Noble Sauvignon Blanc 2019/21 Half Bottle, Marlborough
Description: Botrytised grapes have been specially selected from amongst the vines of the Waihopai River vineyard to make this wine. The fermentation process takes a lengthy 6 months and extracts huge flavours from the shrivelled berries. Intensely sweet, yet balanced with a mixture of crisp citrus and fresh melon flavours, and as such, never cloys. Lingers long on the palate. An amazing match for gorgonzola or rich pÃ¢tÃ©s.

Title: Tinto Pesquera Reserva 2017/18, Ribera del Duero
Description: This is a sought-after Ribera del Duero from one of the region's finest estates. It's made from 100% Tempranillo and will age well for the next two decaders. Expect complex aromas of blueberry jam, white pepper, cinnamon and toast. Decant this for at least an hour before serving at room temperature with roast lamb.

Title: Tio Pepe â€˜Fino En Ramaâ€™, Jerez
Description: The Gonzalez familyâ€™s sherry journey began in 1835 with Manuel Maria Gonzalez Angel. Five generations later, theyâ€™re renowned the world over as masters of sherry. Tio Pepe was named in honour of Manuelâ€™s uncle, after he discovered barrels of a delicious pale, dry style of sherry that Pepe had made. This fino is a special limited bottling. Itâ€™s drawn from cask in spring, when the presence of yeast in the wine is at its highest. The wine is briefly settled before being bottled without any fining â€“ giving complex flavours and its naturally cloudy appearance. Discover complex aromas and flavours of toasted almonds, soda bread and citrus with a crisp finish. Itâ€™s best enjoyed with a selection of savoury tapas, inculding olives and roasted nuts.

Title: Torbreck Descendant Shiraz 2012
Description: Torbreck is one of Australia's leading wineries, crafting deluxe reds that stand toe-to-toe with the most expensive in the RhÃ´ne Valley. Wine Advocate said "the 2012 Descendent offers gorgeously pure notes of violets, vanilla and cinnamon stick over a core of black cherry, blackberry and wild blueberry notes plus and hints of cloves" when it gave it 97+ Parker Points.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Cocoa, Cream, Liquorice, Nutmeg, Vanilla

Title: Torbreck 'Runrig' Shiraz 2012/2014, Barossa Valley
Description: Torbreck's Runrig Shiraz is blended with a dash of Viognier. So it's reminiscent of a structured, fragrant CÃ´te RÃ´tie with some added Australian power. It has subtle tannins, lean acidity and a very long finish. Wine Spectator's Joe Czerwinski gave this 2012 vintage 97 points.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Chocolate, Coffee, Liquorice, Raspberry, Spice

Title: Torre Muga Reserva Rioja 2019
Description: This is Muga's top wine and one of the finest examples of the modern Reserva. From the best sites and some of the oldest vines in this historic estate, it spends 3 months in large wood vats then 18 months in new French oak. The result is a polished and complex wine with layers of black fruit, graphite and dried flowers. With an unctuous texture akin to great Pomerol it has fantastic balance and real ageing potential. Drink it over the next 10-12 years.

Title: Touraine Gamay 2020 Domaine Roc de ChÃ¢teauvieux, Loire
Description: It's not just Beaujolais that can lay claim to terrific Gamay. This juicy red is made in Touraine by Domaine Roc de ChÃ¢teauvieux. Light and fragrant, with hints of licorice, red cherry fruit and a supple texture, it'd be delightful sipped slightly chilled.

Title: Trizanne Signature Wines 'TSW' Marsanne-Roussanne 2020, South Africa
Description: Trizanne Barnard cut her teeth at the world-famous Klein Constantia winery. But now she's making her own path in the wine world with Trizanne Signature Wines. She grows all of her grapes on the sun-drenched slopes of Noordhoek in the southern Peninsula. You can taste just how well they ripen in these conditions in this blend of Marsanne and Roussanne. It's intense and silky, with notes of citrus, stone fruit, and a delicious mineral edge. Pair this with a delicious fatty fish, like poached salmon.

Title: Trizanne 'TSW' Cinsault 2020, South Africa
Description: Trizanne Barnard earned her stripes at the iconic Klein Constantia winery. In 2008, she went her own way. This Cinsault is punchy and floral, with flayers of fruit and spice and a crisp acidity.

Title: Two Birds One Stone White 2018, France
Description: A light, crisp and easy drinking blend, with ripe fruits and a fresh citrussy finish.

Title: Two Hands 'Samantha's Garden' Shiraz 2018, Clare Valley
Description: Two Hands' 'Garden' range are examples of Shiraz wines that exmplify the particular area in which they are grown. This wine comes from a Clare Valley vineyard site, and the wine displays the typical eucalyptus notes and fineness of tannic structure that characterise Clare Valley Shiraz, enhanced by maturation for 18 months in second-fill French oak. Drink now - 2025.
Characteristics: White Pepper, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Liquorice, Smoke, Tobacco, Vanilla

Title: Tyrrell's Vat 1 SÃ©millon 2014, Hunter Valley
Description: Tyrrell's Vat 1 SÃ©millon was first produced in 1963, and is the most awarded and recognised SÃ©millon from the Hunter Valley. It's sourced from two of the best blocks of SÃ©millon which have vines dating back to 1923. This prime location combined with old vines produces a wine with juicy lime fruit alongside notes of honey, lanolin and a nutty complexity. Built to last, this is a fixture in many prestigious wine collections and will drink well for another decade at least.
Characteristics: Lemon, Bread, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Honey

Title: Vandenberg 'Six Brothers' Pinot Noir 2018, Tasmania
Description: You might think that Australia's too warm for the demanding Pinot Noir grape. But it has a long, luxurious ripening season on the cool-climate island of Tasmania. Taste the benefit in these notes of mulberry, cranberry, raspberry, dried herbs and toasty oak. This is at its best with duck breast.
Characteristics: Red Fruit, Dried Herbs, Earth, Raspberry, Red Cherry

Title: Varzea Vinho Verde 2021/22, Portugal
Description: Vinho Verde is the star white wine of Portugal. If you like yours refreshing, easy-drinking, lower in alcohol and perfect to enjoy in the sun, you're in for a treat. This one is made by a family-owned winery, now in the hands of the third generation, that has over 100 years of experience in the art. You can taste the Atlantic influence in these crisp flavours of lemon, lime and white melon.  It also has a light spritz that's fantastic with crab.

Title: Veuve Clicquot Extra Brut Extra Old Champagne
Description: Made from fruit souced entirely from Grand Cru and Premier Cru vineyards, this is an exceptionally high-quality Champagne, which has undergone extended cellarage. Supremely refined and complex, with notes of flowers,  dried fruit and toasted brioche.
Characteristics: Peach, Apricot, Biscuit, Bread, Candied Fruit, Citrus Fruit

Title: Veuve Clicquot 'La Grande Dame RosÃ©' 2008
Description: This is the showcase of Veuve Clicquot's excellence. A fitting tribute to the woman who made Veuve Clicquot what t is today. Pinot Noir grapes sourced from the Champagne house's most historic plots make a beautiful pink gold colour. Expect notes of raspberry, strawberry and citrus. Drink on its own or with stuffed tomatoes.
Characteristics: Strawberry, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Red Cherry, Spice

Title: Veuve Monnay Brut Champagne NV
Description: We used our extensive contacts in Champagne to find this fantastic producer. This has everything you would expect from a Grand Marque house except the price tag - zingy citrusflavours with a touch of biscuity toastiness.

Title: Vignali Aglianico del Vulture 2018/19
Description: The looming Monte Vulture may look like an intimidating place to make wine, but it hasnt erupted for thousands of years, and and it's now where you'll find some of Italy's most impressive soils. Here, the late-ripening Aglianico grape thrives on volcanic vineyards, and this resulting wine is one of Italy's hidden gems. It's very well structured, with notes of dark fruits and black pepper. It will develop excellently over time and pairs fantastically with Mediterranean dishes.

Title: Vigneti del Salento â€˜Zollaâ€™ Primitivo di Manduria DOC Riserva 2017
Description: The Farnese Group was founded in 1994 with the aim to be leaders of a renaissance in Italy's wine scene. 200 gold medals and countless accolades later, and they've been named Italian Producer of the Year four times. It's safe to say they've achieved their goal. This wine is sourced from their vineyards, where low-yielding vines ripen intensely flavoured grapes. The naturally dark-skinned Primitivo grapes give this wine a deep, inky colour, and ageing for 12 months in French oak has given it a rounded structure. If you like our Surani Primitivo, this is a great next step. Expect notes of violets, blackberries and cherries in each sip. This will pair well with mature cheeses, like Pecorino Toscano.

Title: Villa Belinda 2018/19, UclÃ©s DO
Description: UclÃ©s is the Spanish DO youâ€™ve probably never heard of. But we canâ€™t keep a juicy insider-secret to ourselves â€“ so take this wine as our introduction to this up-and-coming denominaciÃ³n de origen. UclÃ©s is in Castile, Spainâ€™s central plateau which is most famous as the setting for Don Quioxte. Grapes are chosen from old vines which only yield a tiny number of grapes. But what they do yield has incredibly concentrated flavours. And because UclÃ©s is at high-altitude, those rich fruit flavours are married with real freshness, so the wineâ€™s velvety rather than jammy. Full-bodied. Juicy. Plush. Itâ€™s full of blackcurrant and plum aromas, with a delicious savoury kick of black pepper and woody herbs. Such richness makes it ideal with roasted or char-grilled meats.

Title: Villa Maria 'Taylors Pass' Sauvignon Blanc 2020/21, Awatere Valley
Description:
If you're after the finest Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, this is a very credible contender. A previous vintage was the only Sauvignon Blanc to win 'Best in Show' at 2019's Decanter World Wine Awards. And it's made by New Zealand's most-awarded winery on a single vineyard, Taylors Pass, which has the perfect conditions for tropical Sauvignon Blanc. It's mouth-wateringly ripe, with flavours of passionfruit, gooseberry, lemongrass, lime and garden pea. It has a zippy acidity that's great with goat's cheese.  

In 2022, this wine won an IWC award for the 2020 vintage.
Characteristics: Tropical Fruit, Grass, Green Apple, Lemon

Title: Villa Tuccia Rosso, Italy
Description: Chieti in Abruzzo is one of the largest wine-producing provinces in Italy. Codice Citra was established in the 1970s with quality, not quantity in mind. Grapes are estate-grown and bottled from a collection of just 9 family-owned vineyards. Vines thrive in this area thanks to the unique climate. Warm winds blow in from the Adriatic sea, meeting the cooler air flowing down from the Majela mountains. The locals refer to the resulting valley breeze as â€˜brezza di terraâ€™ â€“ and itâ€™s this that encourages perfect grape ripening. This blend of local grape varieties is bold and juicy. Thereâ€™s a delicate note of violet alongside ripe cherry, and soft tannins on the finish. Itâ€™s fantastic with roast lamb.

Title: Klein Constantia Vin de Constance 2019, Constantia
Description: Described as one of the worldâ€™s most picturesque wine estates, Klein Constantia is renowned for much more than its beauty. Aside from a fine collection of still wines, there's one bottling in particular that put this 17th-century estate on the world stage. Vin de Constance was admired by legendary writers, leaders and aristocracy throughout 18th-century Europe, and its stellar reputation remains to this day. The cool foothills of Constantiaberg are the perfect location for growing its Muscat de Frontignan grapes. Ahead of bottling, itâ€™s aged for three years in oak, acacia and foudres barrels, adding to its complex character. In your glass, youâ€™ll find this luscious wine expresses the regionâ€™s cool climate; expect elegance, balance and freshness. Discover intense and aromatic notes of honeysuckle, creamy lemon tart, exotic fruits, ginger and a hint of saffron. If you only try one dessert wine this year, the one-of-kind iconic Vin de Constance should be top of your list. Critics James Suckling and Tim Atkin both awarded this vintage 96+ points in their South Africa Report 2022. Hold it for up to a decade - if you can resist opening it.

Title: ViÃ±alba Malbec-Bonarda 2019/20/21, Mendoza
Description: When HervÃ© J Fabre came to the Uco Valley, he found vineyards where Malbec flourished and became the first person to make single-variety Malbecs in Argentina. This time, this award-winning winemaker has blended it with Bonarda, the second-most planted grape in the country. He's left it unoaked to allow the fruity aromas of the variety to shine in harmony with the Malbec. Expect flavours of plum, blackcurrant and violets and delicate floral aromas. Try it with risotto.
Characteristics: Violet, Black Fruit, Floral, Red Fruit, Ripe Fruit

Title: Vouvray Sec 'Expresion de Silex' 2020/21, Loire
Description: Although Denis Meunier is only in his late 20s, his small domain is one of the most old-school in Vouvray. In 2012, he took over his father's 13 hectares of Chenin Blanc (with vines up to 65 years old) and has never looked back. This expression is taken from his younger vines (still an average of 25 years old) on chalk soils and is crafted without any oak. Expect classic notes of yellow apple, pear and a flinty minerality.

Title: Waimea Estates Pinot Noir RosÃ© 2021, Nelson
Description: Waimeaâ€™s vineyards are less than 1km from the Tasman sea on the sundrenched Waimea Plains of Nelson. Itâ€™s one of New Zealandâ€™s lesser-known wine regions and widely credited as New Zealandâ€™s sunniest spot with an average of over 2400 hours of sunshine annually. This means perfectly-ripe grapes with plenty of freshness. 100% sustainably-farmed Pinot Noir grapes are gently pressed to release the premium free-run juice and spend only a short while on their skins. The result? A delicate platinum pink colour and vibrant fruit flavours. Expect ripe flavours of raspberry, strawberries, cherry and notes of jasmine. Perfect as an apÃ©ritif, with nibbles and, of course, strawberries and cream.

Title: Wakefield 'Visionary' Cabernet Sauvignon 2010
Description: Made from the very best fruit nourished by 40-year-old vines on the estate's finest vineyards, aged in oak for two years and two in the bottle, the 'Visionary' is the top Cabernet Wakefield makes under Â£500. It's a structured bouquet of black fruits, olive, vanilla, cedar and mint that's framed by silky tannins and chased by a seemingly endless finish. Decanter gave it 95 points.
Characteristics: Vanilla, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Eucalyptus, Forest Floor, Leather, Mint

Title: Yalumba 'The Menzies' Cabernet Sauvignon 2015/16, Coonawarra
Description: In 1961, Sir Robert Menzies said that Yalumba's Galway Vintage was the best Australian red he'd ever tasted. So they decided to make one even better and name it after this former Australian Prime Minister. They've done the name proud. This is structured and complex, with intense notes of red berries and a hint of oak influence. It's truly Coonawarra Cabernet at its best. Drink with tender beef short ribs.

Title: Yalumba 'Virgilius' Viognier 2017, Eden Valley
Description: Yalumba's Virgilius is often regarded as Australia's benchmark Viognier. And it's no wonder when you taste this intensely aromatic wine. Discover notes of apricot, ginger and cardamom. Enjoy with a creamy curry.
